original: yon tan mchog ldan mkhas rnams kyis //

original: le'u gnyis pa tshad ma yang dag ces bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa phyed kyis ni tshad ma grub pa //
analyzed: le'u gnyis pa tshad ma yang dag ces bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa phyed kyis ni tshad ma grub pa //
translated: The second chapter, which is called ‚ÄúThe Establishment of Valid Cognition,‚Äù explains valid cognition in half a verse.üîΩThe third chapter explains perception.

original: gsum pa ni mngon sum 'chad pa yin no zhes 'chad pa po dang nyan pa po sbyong bar byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gsum pa ni mngon sum 'chad pa yin no zhes 'chad pa po dang nyan pa po sbyong bar byed pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not a method of training the teacher and the student,

original: don mngon par ma brjod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i dgongs pas /
analyzed: don mngon par ma brjod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i dgongs pas /
translated: because the meaning is not expressed.

original: de ltar spyi'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de ltar spyi'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba smos so //
translated: With this in mind, he says, ‚ÄúThe general definition . . .‚Äù

original: gal te yang 'di ni slob dpon gyi gzhung 'chad pa de lta na yang le'u dang po bshad pa'i zhar la tshad ma dag gi spyi'i mtshan nyid dang / de'i rjes su gzhung gzhan bkod pa'i khyad par gyis so zhes ston par rigs so //
analyzed: gal te yang 'di ni slob dpon gyi gzhung 'chad pa de lta na yang le'u dang po bshad pa'i zhar la tshad ma dag gi spyi'i mtshan nyid dang / de'i rjes su gzhung gzhan bkod pa'i khyad par gyis so zhes ston par rigs so //
translated: Even though this is a commentary on the treatise of the master DignƒÅga, it is appropriate to teach the general definition of the valid means of knowledge as a digression in the first chapter, and then the specific definitions of the other treatises.

original: de ltar yang /
analyzed: de ltar yang /
translated: Thus:

original: tshad ma mi slu can shes pa //
analyzed: tshad ma mi slu can shes pa //
translated: A valid means of knowledge is a non-deceptive consciousness.

original: zhes bya bas ni spyi'i mtshan nyid bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni spyi'i mtshan nyid bstan pa yin la /
translated: By this, the general definition is taught.

original: de dag gi khyad par gyi mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: de dag gi khyad par gyi mtshan nyid ni /
translated: The specific definitions are:

original: mngon sum @2a * //
analyzed: mngon sum @2a * //
translated: Direct perception, inference,

original: dang ni rjes dpag dang // ces bya ba la sogs pa so sor snang ba'i dbye ba brjod pas gsal ba nyid du byas pa yin no //
analyzed: dang ni rjes dpag dang // ces bya ba la sogs pa so sor snang ba'i dbye ba brjod pas gsal ba nyid du byas pa yin no //
translated: and so on, are individually distinguished, thus clarifying the specific definitions.

original: grangs kyi nges pa 'di ni mtshan nyid kyi yan lag yin pa'i phyir dang po byas pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: grangs kyi nges pa 'di ni mtshan nyid kyi yan lag yin pa'i phyir dang po byas pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn't the number definitely two because it is a part of the definition, and therefore made first?

original: gang gi phyir gsal ba'i dbye ba rnam par gzhag pa la gsal ba so so'i nges pa'i mtshan nyid brjod par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gsal ba'i dbye ba rnam par gzhag pa la gsal ba so so'i nges pa'i mtshan nyid brjod par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: Because it is not possible to state the specific definitions of the individual valid means of knowledge in the context of establishing their distinctions.

original: de na gsal ba'i dbye ba rnam par gzhag pa gtso bo nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo'i dbye ba'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan gyi ngo bo las gzhan yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir de dag nyid kyis de gnyis rtogs pa yin la /
analyzed: de na gsal ba'i dbye ba rnam par gzhag pa gtso bo nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo'i dbye ba'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan gyi ngo bo las gzhan yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir de dag nyid kyis de gnyis rtogs pa yin la /
translated: Because the classification of the manifestation is not different from the nature of the essence of the principal itself, the two are understood by those two.

original: tshad ma gzhan ni de dag tsam gyi gzhal bya yin pas bya ba rdzogs pa'i las su bsgrub pa ni sgrub par byed pa'i rigs pa las 'das pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshad ma gzhan ni de dag tsam gyi gzhal bya yin pas bya ba rdzogs pa'i las su bsgrub pa ni sgrub par byed pa'i rigs pa las 'das pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Since the other valid cognitions have as their objects just those two, it is illogical to establish them as having a function that is completed, because they are beyond the reasoning that establishes them.

original: tshad ma ni rigs pa yin la gnyis ni gzhal bya ste /
analyzed: tshad ma ni rigs pa yin la gnyis ni gzhal bya ste /
translated: Valid cognition is reasoning, and the two are the objects of comprehension.

original: rigs par byed pa'i yul te gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'i so sor snang ba nyid kyis gnyis yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs par byed pa'i yul te gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'i so sor snang ba nyid kyis gnyis yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The object of reasoning is the two, because of the appearance of the individual manifestation and non-manifestation.

original: gsal ba'i so sor snang ba 'di nyid ni don gyis dngos su bskyed bya yin pa nyid la don du sgro 'dogs pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir nus pa yin no //
analyzed: gsal ba'i so sor snang ba 'di nyid ni don gyis dngos su bskyed bya yin pa nyid la don du sgro 'dogs pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir nus pa yin no //
translated: This very appearance of the manifestation is the object that is directly produced by the object, because it is the object of superimposition on the object. Therefore it is capable.

original: mi gsal ba'i yul so sor snang ba ni don gyis brgyud nas skyed par sgro 'dogs pa'i yul yin @2b pa'i phyir mi nus pa yin te rnam pa gnyis po 'di las gzhan pa'i rnam pa ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mi gsal ba'i yul so sor snang ba ni don gyis brgyud nas skyed par sgro 'dogs pa'i yul yin @2b pa'i phyir mi nus pa yin te rnam pa gnyis po 'di las gzhan pa'i rnam pa ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is no other mode of appearance than these two.

original: gang gis tshad ma gzhan du 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩgsal ba so sor snang ba nyid don nyid yin pa'i phyir nus pa yin na ni rab rib can gyis skra shad du so sor snang ba la yang 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa la rab rib can gyis dmigs par zhes bya ba smos te /

original: gal te khyad par so sor snang ba ji ltar dngos su khyad par gyi bskyed bya yin pa de bzhin du spyi'i so sor snang ba yang spyi'i dngos su bskyed bya nyid du 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: gal te khyad par so sor snang ba ji ltar dngos su khyad par gyi bskyed bya yin pa de bzhin du spyi'i so sor snang ba yang spyi'i dngos su bskyed bya nyid du 'gyur grang na /
translated: If the individual appearances of the particulars are the direct effects of the particulars, then the individual appearances of the universals would also be the direct effects of the universals.üîΩWhy do you say that the individual appearances of the particulars are the indirect effects of the universals?üîΩThe response to that is ‚Äúbecause the object itself is one,‚Äù because the capacity of the object is not understood from the positive and negative concomitance that is different from the particulars.

original: rtogs pa'i dbye ba zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩgsal ba dang mi gsal ba'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i dbye ba zhes bya ba smos te / gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'i ngo bo'o //

original: de'i khyad par nyams su myong ba yang tha mi dad pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i khyad par nyams su myong ba yang tha mi dad pa yin no zhe na /
translated: The response is ‚Äúbecause of the difference in the understanding.‚ÄùüîΩThe response is ‚Äú

original: rtogs pa'i dbye ba yang zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i dbye ba yang zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The distinction of the realization is mentioned by the word ‚Äúalso‚Äù.

original: so sor snang ba dang de dang ldan pa dag la bye brag med do zhe na /
analyzed: so sor snang ba dang de dang ldan pa dag la bye brag med do zhe na /
translated: If it is asked whether there is no difference between the individual appearances and that which possesses them,

original: de nyid ni zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de nyid ni zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: the reply is ‚Äúthat itself‚Äù.

original: tha dad pa nyid yin na nyams su myong ba tha dad kyang so sor snang ba tha dad par mi 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: tha dad pa nyid yin na nyams su myong ba tha dad kyang so sor snang ba tha dad par mi 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: If it is thought that if there is a difference, the individual experiences would be different, but the individual appearances would not be different,

original: gal te rtogs pa'i bye brag ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te rtogs pa'i bye brag ces bya ba'o //
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúIf there is a distinction in the realization‚Äù.

original: dbye ba yin yang shes pa'i dbang gis gnas pa'i shes bya ni shes pa'i bya ba'i dbye ba ji lta bas phye ba yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: dbye ba yin yang shes pa'i dbang gis gnas pa'i shes bya ni shes pa'i bya ba'i dbye ba ji lta bas phye ba yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: Even though there is a distinction, the object of knowledge that exists by the power of consciousness is distinguished by the distinction of the activity of consciousness.

original: shes pa dang / shes bya dag ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: shes pa dang / shes bya dag ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is taught by ‚Äúconsciousness and the object of knowledge‚Äù.

original: gal te brgyud pas nus pa nyid spyi'i mtshan nyid yin na mi nus pa zhes ji ltar brjod ce na /
analyzed: gal te brgyud pas nus pa nyid spyi'i mtshan nyid yin na mi nus pa zhes ji ltar brjod ce na /
translated: If the capacity of the continuum is the general characteristic, how can it be said to be incapable?

original: brgyud pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: brgyud pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The reply is ‚Äúthe continuum‚Äù.

original: dngos su skyed par byed pa'i nus pa las gzhan pa'i nus pa med pa yin no zhes bya ba ma yin pa dgag pa'o //
analyzed: dngos su skyed par byed pa'i nus pa las gzhan pa'i nus pa med pa yin no zhes bya ba ma yin pa dgag pa'o //
translated: It is not the case that there is no potency other than the potency that actually generates.

original: dngos sam zhes bya ba ni skra shad la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dngos sam zhes bya ba ni skra shad la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Directly‚Äù refers to such things as floating hairs.

original: brgyud pas zhes bya ba ni sgra'o //
analyzed: brgyud pas zhes bya ba ni sgra'o //
translated: ‚Äú Indirectly‚Äù refers to sound.

original: gnod par byed pa'i tshad @3a * //
analyzed: gnod par byed pa'i tshad @3a * //
translated: The valid cognition that contradicts

original: ma ni mi slu ba'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: ma ni mi slu ba'i shes pa'o //
translated: is non-deceptive consciousness.

original: yang na gnyi ga yang dngos kho na yin te /
analyzed: yang na gnyi ga yang dngos kho na yin te /
translated: Or, both are direct.

original: 'di ltar shes pa kha cig ni sreg pa dang 'tshod pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi don byed pa la nus pa can du dngos su snang ba yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar shes pa kha cig ni sreg pa dang 'tshod pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi don byed pa la nus pa can du dngos su snang ba yin la /
translated: Thus, some consciousnesses appear directly as having the capacity to perform the function characterized by burning, cooking, and so on.

original: gzhan la ni dngos kho na'i nus pa yod pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: gzhan la ni dngos kho na'i nus pa yod pa ma yin pas /
translated: In others, the capacity is not actually present.

original: nus pa nyid kyang mi nus par so sor snang bzhin pa'i ngo bos so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nus pa nyid kyang mi nus par so sor snang bzhin pa'i ngo bos so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, the meaning is that the capacity itself is not capable, appearing as it does in its own nature.

original: de nyid kyis na phyi rol gyi don gyi bya ba nus pa med pa'i phyir skra shad la sogs med pa'i zhes smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na phyi rol gyi don gyi bya ba nus pa med pa'i phyir skra shad la sogs med pa'i zhes smos so //
translated: For that very reason, because external objects are incapable of function, it is said that ‚Äúfloating hairs and so on do not exist.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du cung cad ni de pa dang thun mong ba'i ngo bos rtogs pa yin la gzhan ni thun mong ma yin pas so zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du cung cad ni de pa dang thun mong ba'i ngo bos rtogs pa yin la gzhan ni thun mong ma yin pas so zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: Likewise, some are understood by means of a nature common to both, and others by means of a nature not common to both.üîΩThe verse says,

original: 'dra dang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'dra dang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚Äúsimilar‚Äù and ‚Äúdissimilar.‚Äù

original: shes pa'i ngo bo'i don byed pa la nus pa dang mi nus pa'i so sor snang ba'i dbye bas gcig nyid so sor snang ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shes pa'i ngo bo'i don byed pa la nus pa dang mi nus pa'i so sor snang ba'i dbye bas gcig nyid so sor snang ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the one is perceived as distinct by virtue of the distinction in the appearance of the capacity or incapacity to perform a function that is the nature of consciousness.

original: de nyid kho na mngon sum du sgra'i yul ma yin pa nyid kyis snang ba yin la /
analyzed: de nyid kho na mngon sum du sgra'i yul ma yin pa nyid kyis snang ba yin la /
translated: That itself is the object of perception, since it is not the object of words.

original: rjes su dpag pa ni yul nyid kyis yin no zhes bya ba ni dbye ba yin no zhes bstan pa ni yul dang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni yul nyid kyis yin no zhes bya ba ni dbye ba yin no zhes bstan pa ni yul dang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Inference is the object of words. This is the distinction. The verse says, ‚Äúthe object.‚Äù

original: sgra las byung ba'i shes pa la snang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sgra las byung ba'i shes pa la snang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don ni ma yin te /
translated: The meaning is not that it appears to a cognition that arises from words.

original: nges par byed pa med pas skra shad la sogs pa bzhin du don med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges par byed pa med pas skra shad la sogs pa bzhin du don med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no ascertainment, it is meaningless, like a falling hair.

original: yul gang yod na dbang po la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan gzhan yod pa na blo ste rtogs pa ni mngon sum du mngon du byed pa gang 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: yul gang yod na dbang po la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan gzhan yod pa na blo ste rtogs pa ni mngon sum du mngon du byed pa gang 'byung ba yin no //
translated: When there is an object, there is a cognition, i.e., an understanding, which is manifested in the presence of other causal conditions, such as the sense faculty.

original: rjes su dpag pa la ni de yod kyang mngon du byed pa mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa la ni de yod kyang mngon du byed pa mi 'byung ngo //
translated: But even when there is an object, there is no manifestation in inference.

original: du ba la dbang po'i bya ba yod kyang rjes su dpag par bya ba mngon du byed pa mi 'byung ba yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: du ba la dbang po'i bya ba yod kyang rjes su dpag par bya ba mngon du byed pa mi 'byung ba yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: Even though there is the activity of the sense faculty with regard to smoke, there is no manifestation of the object to be inferred.

original: rgyu mtshan gzhan ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan gzhan ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The other causal condition is the sign.

original: de nyid rnam pa ci zhig ltar zhes bya ba mngon du bya ba med na'o //
analyzed: de nyid rnam pa ci zhig ltar zhes bya ba mngon du bya ba med na'o //
translated: In what way is there no manifestation?

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni 'dra ba nyid tsam spyi'i mtshan nyid yin na ni thal ches so //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni 'dra ba nyid tsam spyi'i mtshan nyid yin na ni thal ches so //
translated: If mere similarity were the universal characteristic, there would be an overextension.

analyzed: rang gi ngo bo ni mngon sum yin la don byed pa dang 'brel pa nyid ni rjes su dpag par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The nature is direct perception, and the connection with the performance of a function is what is to be inferred. This is the meaning.

original: spyi'i rnam pas zhes bya ba ni don byed pa dang 'brel pa nyid kyis 'dra ba'i don byed pa dang 'brel pa nyid kyi ngo bo 'dzin pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: spyi'i rnam pas zhes bya ba ni don byed pa dang 'brel pa nyid kyis 'dra ba'i don byed pa dang 'brel pa nyid kyi ngo bo 'dzin pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The general aspect means the aspect that apprehends the nature of the connection with the performance of a similar function by the connection with the performance of a function.

original: gal te gang zhig yul der ni //
analyzed: gal te gang zhig yul der ni //
translated: If something is in that place,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas dang por zhugs pas rjes su dpag pa'i dbang nyid kyis goms pa'i yul la yang mngon sum 'jug par byed pa nyid yin par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas dang por zhugs pas rjes su dpag pa'i dbang nyid kyis goms pa'i yul la yang mngon sum 'jug par byed pa nyid yin par bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, since it is first engaged by inference, it is taught that direct perception is also engaged with respect to the object of meditation by the power of inference itself.

original: 'on te goms pa las byung ba'i mngon sum 'jug pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on te goms pa las byung ba'i mngon sum 'jug pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
translated: But if it is the cause of the engagement of direct perception that arises from meditation,

original: rjes su dpag pa gtso bo ma yin gyi blo ni tshad ma nyid /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa gtso bo ma yin gyi blo ni tshad ma nyid /
translated: then inference is not the principal cognition, but rather the mind is the valid cognition.

original: blang dang dor ba'i dngos po yi //
analyzed: blang dang dor ba'i dngos po yi //
translated: Because the engagement of the thing to be adopted or rejectedüîΩis principal.

original: 'jug pa de gtso nyid phyir dang // zhes bstan pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'jug pa de gtso nyid phyir dang // zhes bstan pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If this is taught,

original: mngon sum med par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mngon sum med par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then it is said, ‚ÄúWithout direct perception . . .‚Äù

original: du ba mthong ba las me rjes su dpog pa na rjes su dpag pa 'jug par byed pa nyid la sogs pa la @5a * //
analyzed: du ba mthong ba las me rjes su dpog pa na rjes su dpag pa 'jug par byed pa nyid la sogs pa la @5a * //
translated: When fire is inferred from seeing smoke, direct perception is not principal with respect to the engagement of inference and so on.

original: mngon sum gtso bo ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: mngon sum gtso bo ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is said that direct perception is not principal,

original: gang zhig tu sogs zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang zhig tu sogs zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then it is said, ‚ÄúWhat is . . . and so on?‚Äù

original: 'bras bu'i rtags la sogs pa'i yul can zhes bya ba ni goms pa las me med na me 'byung ba'i du ba mthong na mngon sum nyid me rnam par 'jog par byed pa yin no zhes zer ba ni /üîΩ'on te yang de la 'jug par byed pa ni mngon sum nyid du zhes bya ba'o //üîΩme tsam gyis 'bras bu nyid du goms pa'i du ba ni nye ba na gnas pa'i me'i 'bras bu nyid du rjes su dpag pa yin par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rtags la sogs pa'i yul can zhes bya ba ni goms pa las me med na me 'byung ba'i du ba mthong na mngon sum nyid me rnam par 'jog par byed pa yin no zhes zer ba ni / 'on te yang de la 'jug par byed pa ni mngon sum nyid du zhes bya ba'o // me tsam gyis 'bras bu nyid du goms pa'i du ba ni nye ba na gnas pa'i me'i 'bras bu nyid du rjes su dpag pa yin par bstan pa'o //
translated: The cognition of the effect, etc. is invariably concomitant with the cognition of the cause, etc. because it is produced from the cognition of the cause, etc.üîΩThe cognition of the effect, etc. is produced from the cognition of the cause, etc. because it is invariably concomitant with the cognition of the cause, etc.üîΩThe cognition of the effect, etc. is invariably concomitant with the cognition of the cause, etc. because it is produced from the cognition of the cause, etc.üîΩThe cognition of the effect, etc. is produced from the cognition of the cause, etc. because it is invariably concomitant with the cognition of the cause, etc.

original: de ltar rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ltar rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The cognition of the effect, etc. is invariably concomitant with the cognition of the cause, etc. because it is produced from the cognition of the cause, etc.

original: rtags mthong ba nyid rtags can mthong ba yin no zhes khas len na ni pha rol po mi 'dod pa thob par 'gyur ba bstan pa ni /üîΩ'dir yang rtags kyi sgrub byed kyi //
analyzed: rtags mthong ba nyid rtags can mthong ba yin no zhes khas len na ni pha rol po mi 'dod pa thob par 'gyur ba bstan pa ni / 'dir yang rtags kyi sgrub byed kyi //
translated: The cognition of the effect, etc. is produced from the cognition of the cause, etc. because it is invariably concomitant with the cognition of the cause, etc.

original: mngon sum nyid kyis 'jig rten gzhan //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mngon sum nyid kyis 'jig rten gzhan // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The cognition of the effect, etc. is invariably concomitant with the cognition of the cause, etc. because it is produced from the cognition of the cause, etc.üîΩThe cognition of the effect, etc. is produced from the cognition of the cause, etc. because it is invariably concomitant with the cognition of the cause, etc.

original: thabs khas len pa ni thabs las byung ba la ltos pa yin gyi /
analyzed: thabs khas len pa ni thabs las byung ba la ltos pa yin gyi /
translated: The cognition of the effect, etc. is invariably concomitant with the cognition of the cause, etc.

original: rang dbang ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rang dbang ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching that it is not independent is:üîΩIf inference is not a valid cognition,

original: rjes dpag tshad ma nyid min na //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rjes dpag tshad ma nyid min na // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then

original: rjes su dpag pa ni dngos su mngon du byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i chos mngon sum pa bzhin du nam yang thabs las byung ba la de lta ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni dngos su mngon du byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i chos mngon sum pa bzhin du nam yang thabs las byung ba la de lta ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching that inference is not a means of acquiring knowledge, like the direct perception of such phenomena as suffering, is:

original: gal te rjes su dpag pas zhes bya ba'o //üîΩgal te rtags kyis mngon sum goms pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te rjes su dpag pas zhes bya ba'o // gal te rtags kyis mngon sum goms pa yin na /
translated: If inference is not a means of acquiring knowledge,üîΩthenüîΩIf inference is the cultivation of direct perception,üîΩis it a means of acquiring knowledge in regard to the imperceptible, like direct perception, or is it a means of acquiring knowledge in regard to the imperceptible, unlike direct perception?

original: ci mngon sum bzhin du lkog tu gyur pa mi 'dzin pa la yul du byed pa'am 'dzin pa las yin /
analyzed: ci mngon sum bzhin du lkog tu gyur pa mi 'dzin pa la yul du byed pa'am 'dzin pa las yin /
translated: If it is a means of acquiring knowledge in regard to the imperceptible,üîΩthen what is the use of establishing inference as a means of acquiring knowledge?üîΩIf it is a means of acquiring knowledge in regard to the perceptible,üîΩthen what is the use of establishing inference as a means of acquiring knowledge?

original: gal te mi 'dzin pa la yin na /
analyzed: gal te mi 'dzin pa la yin na /
translated: If it is a means of acquiring knowledge in regard to the imperceptible,üîΩthen what is the use of establishing inference as a means of acquiring knowledge?üîΩIf it is a means of acquiring knowledge in regard to the perceptible,üîΩthen what is the use of establishing inference as a means of acquiring knowledge?üîΩIf it is a means of acquiring knowledge in regard to the imperceptible,üîΩthen what is the use of establishing inference as a means of acquiring knowledge?üîΩIf it is a means of acquiring knowledge in regard to the imperceptible,

analyzed: 'dir yang rtags kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas rjes su dpag pa tshad mar bsgrubs pas kho bo cag la ci zhig bya zhes bya ba'i bar gyis bstan zin to //
translated: then what is the use of establishing inference as a means of acquiring knowledge?

original: 'dzin pa la yin na yang //
analyzed: 'dzin pa la yin na yang //
translated: If it is a means of acquiring knowledge in regard to the perceptible,üîΩthen what is the use of establishing inference as a means of acquiring knowledge?

original: 'di la gal te lkog gyur kyang //
analyzed: 'di la gal te lkog gyur kyang //
translated: If it is a means of acquiring knowledge in regard to the imperceptible,üîΩthen what is the use of establishing inference as a means of acquiring knowledge?üîΩIf it is a means of acquiring knowledge in regard to the perceptible,üîΩthen what is the use of establishing inference as a means of acquiring knowledge?

original: mngon sum las zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum las zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is taught that it is from direct perception.

original: 'dra ba'i ngo bor zhes bya ba la ni dpe la mthong ba'i ngo bo ste /
analyzed: 'dra ba'i ngo bor zhes bya ba la ni dpe la mthong ba'i ngo bo ste /
translated: In the phrase ‚Äúin the form of a likeness,‚Äù the example is the form that is seen.

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /
translated: This is stated in the following:

analyzed: 'dra bdag nyid las lkog gyur pa // zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The hidden is from the likeness.

original: de snang ba'i shes pa tsam 'byung ba de'i yul nyid ni 'di'i khyab byed 'dis rtogs par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de snang ba'i shes pa tsam 'byung ba de'i yul nyid ni 'di'i khyab byed 'dis rtogs par bstan pa ni /
translated: The appearance of that is merely the arising of consciousness. The object of that is the pervasion of this. The teaching of the realization of that is:

analyzed: sgra yi shes pa de nyid kyang // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The consciousness of sound itself.

original: 'di nyid rigs pa can rnams kyis nye bar 'jal ba yin no zhes zer ba la /üîΩnye bar 'jal bas zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'di nyid rigs pa can rnams kyis nye bar 'jal ba yin no zhes zer ba la / nye bar 'jal bas zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The Mƒ´mƒÅ·πÉsakas say that this is the inference of the logicians.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúby the inference‚Äù refers to the following. The Mƒ´mƒÅ·πÉsakas say that the word ‚Äúox‚Äù is the name of the word ‚Äúox.‚Äù The one who possesses the understanding of the word ‚Äúox‚Äù does not cause the understanding of the ox.

original: ba men @5b gyis 'di byos zhes 'dzud pa ni ba men gyi sgra ma rtogs par ba man gyi sgra'i ming can rtogs pa dang ldan pa yang ba men rtogs par mi byed pa de la dgon pa pa na re ba lang ji lta bu yin pa ba
analyzed: ba men @5b gyis 'di byos zhes 'dzud pa ni ba men gyi sgra ma rtogs par ba man gyi sgra'i ming can rtogs pa dang ldan pa yang ba men rtogs par mi byed pa de la dgon pa pa na re ba lang ji lta bu yin pa ba
translated: The Mƒ´mƒÅ·πÉsakas say that the word ‚Äúox‚Äù is the name of the word ‚Äúox.‚Äù The one who possesses the understanding of the word ‚Äúox‚Äù does not cause the understanding of the ox.

original: men de lta bu yin zhes ba men ba lang dang 'dra'o zhes smras pa de thos pa dang ldan bas kyang ril po mthong nas sngar bstan pa'i ngag dran nas ba lang dang 'dra bar nges par byed pa de'i des pa ni nye bar 'jal ba'i 'bras bu
analyzed: men de lta bu yin zhes ba men ba lang dang 'dra'o zhes smras pa de thos pa dang ldan bas kyang ril po mthong nas sngar bstan pa'i ngag dran nas ba lang dang 'dra bar nges par byed pa de'i des pa ni nye bar 'jal ba'i 'bras bu
translated: that the one who possesses the knowledge of the statement It is like a cow sees the whole, recalls the statement taught earlier, and ascertains that it is like a cow.

original: yin gyi / ming dang ming can 'brel pa'i nges pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yin gyi / ming dang ming can 'brel pa'i nges pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not the ascertainment of the relation between the name and the bearer of the name,

original: de la 'dzud pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas rang nyid kyis mngon sum gyi dngos po la dran pa'i bdag nyid 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la 'dzud pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas rang nyid kyis mngon sum gyi dngos po la dran pa'i bdag nyid 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the memory of the object that is directly perceived arises by itself, following the insertion of the analogy.

original: rjes su dpag pa ni mngon sum tsam gyi yul la ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni mngon sum tsam gyi yul la ma yin te /
translated: Inference is not about the object of mere direct perception,

original: lkog tu gyur pa yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the object is hidden.

original: 'dir ni ming can nyid dam cig shos kyang rung mngon sum pa nyid dran pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir ni ming can nyid dam cig shos kyang rung mngon sum pa nyid dran pa yin no //
translated: Here, the direct perception of the name-bearer or the other is the memory.

original: 'di la mngon sum pa khyad par yin gyi rjes su dpag pa la ni lkog tu gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di la mngon sum pa khyad par yin gyi rjes su dpag pa la ni lkog tu gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that direct perception is the qualifier here, but in inference the object is hidden.

original: 'dra ba nyid ni mngon sum gyi yul ma yin pa nye zhing mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba ma yin pa'i yul de la snang ba rnam par rtog pa tsam las byung ba ni de'i yul nyid yin pa des rtogs pa des na rang gi ngo bos 'dra bar
analyzed: 'dra ba nyid ni mngon sum gyi yul ma yin pa nye zhing mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba ma yin pa'i yul de la snang ba rnam par rtog pa tsam las byung ba ni de'i yul nyid yin pa des rtogs pa des na rang gi ngo bos 'dra bar
translated: Similarity is not the object of direct perception. The object that is not dissimilar in characteristics appears to that object as merely arising from conception. Since that is its object, it is realized by that. Therefore, similarity by nature is not the object of direct perception.üîΩ

original: snang ba'i rnam par rtog pas 'dra ba'i yul nyid rtogs pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin gyi tshad ma gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: snang ba'i rnam par rtog pas 'dra ba'i yul nyid rtogs pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin gyi tshad ma gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: Similarity is not the object of direct perception. The object that is not dissimilar is the object that appears from mere conception. It is understood by that. Therefore, by the conception that appears similar by nature, the object of similarity is understood. Therefore, it is a natural reason, not another valid cognition.

original: rgyal dpog pa ni ba lang ril po mthong bas ba men mthong ba na ba lang nye ba ma yin na 'di ni ba lang dang 'dra'o zhes shes pa ni mngon sum yin la /
analyzed: rgyal dpog pa ni ba lang ril po mthong bas ba men mthong ba na ba lang nye ba ma yin na 'di ni ba lang dang 'dra'o zhes shes pa ni mngon sum yin la /
translated: The Vai≈õe·π£ika say: When one sees a cow, if one sees a cow that is not near, the knowledge that it is similar to a cow is direct perception.

original: 'di dang 'dra ba ni ba lang ngo zhes bya ba ni nye bar 'jal ba yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'di dang 'dra ba ni ba lang ngo zhes bya ba ni nye bar 'jal ba yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThis is similar to a cow‚Äù is inference.

original: 'di la yang sngar dang phyis dngos po mthong ba'i mngon sum yin la /
analyzed: 'di la yang sngar dang phyis dngos po mthong ba'i mngon sum yin la /
translated: Here, the prior and subsequent seeing of the thing is direct perception.

original: rnam par rtog pa ni 'dra ba nyid kyi yul can yin pas rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kho na yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni 'dra ba nyid kyi yul can yin pas rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kho na yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: Since conceptual thought has a similar object, it is only a natural inference.

original: de'i ngo bo mngon sum gyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo mngon sum gyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is taught by ‚ÄúIts nature is direct perception.‚Äù

original: rnam par rtog pa mngon sum yin par 'dod pa la ni mngon sum nyid 'di yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa mngon sum yin par 'dod pa la ni mngon sum nyid 'di yin te /
translated: For one who asserts that conceptual thought is direct perception, this is direct perception.

original: 'di ltar de dang 'dra ba ni 'di yin no zhes ma shes pas ni de dang 'dra ba 'di yin no zhes rtogs pa des na /
analyzed: 'di ltar de dang 'dra ba ni 'di yin no zhes ma shes pas ni de dang 'dra ba 'di yin no zhes rtogs pa des na /
translated: Thus, since one does not know ‚ÄúThis is similar to that,‚Äù one understands ‚ÄúThis is similar to that.‚Äù

original: 'di'i 'dra ba nyid 'di de'i 'dra ba nyid do zhes de'i 'dra ba nyid rtogs pa kho na 'di'i 'dra ba rtogs pa 'dra ba yin no zhes bya ba la dbye pa med par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'di'i 'dra ba nyid 'di de'i 'dra ba nyid do zhes de'i 'dra ba nyid rtogs pa kho na 'di'i 'dra ba rtogs pa 'dra ba yin no zhes bya ba la dbye pa med par bstan pa ni /
translated: Therefore, ‚ÄúThis similarity is the similarity of that‚Äù is the understanding of the similarity of that, and ‚ÄúThe similarity of this is the similarity‚Äù is taught without distinction.
This is

original: ltar 'di de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ltar 'di de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThis is similar to that.‚Äù

original: mngon sum rtogs pa med par smra ba la ni bdag gi rjes su byed pa ni 'dra ba yin la /
analyzed: mngon sum rtogs pa med par smra ba la ni bdag gi rjes su byed pa ni 'dra ba yin la /
translated: For one who asserts that direct perception is nonconceptual, similarity is the conformity to that.

original: de'i tha snyad rnam rtog yin pa ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin no zhes bstan pa ni de'i rjes su byed pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i tha snyad rnam rtog yin pa ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin no zhes bstan pa ni de'i rjes su byed pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The fact that its terms are conceptual is the natural reasoning.

original: 'dra ba nyid du snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni de'i snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa de'i snang ba tsam las byung ba'i de'i yul nyid la ste /
analyzed: 'dra ba nyid du snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni de'i snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa de'i snang ba tsam las byung ba'i de'i yul nyid la ste /
translated: The conceptualization that appears as similar is the conceptualization of its appearance. It is the object of that, which arises from that mere appearance.

original: lkog shal la sogs par snang ba'i ba lang gi rnam par rtog pa yang der snang ba tsam las byung ba'i lkog shal la sogs pa'i yul nyid la rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'o //
analyzed: lkog shal la sogs par snang ba'i ba lang gi rnam par rtog pa yang der snang ba tsam las byung ba'i lkog shal la sogs pa'i yul nyid la rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'o //
translated: The conceptualization of an ox that appears as a dewlap, etc. is the natural reasoning with respect to its object, the dewlap, etc., which arises from that mere appearance.

original: rang gi rtogs pa gzhan la go bar byed pa na 'di ni 'di dang 'dra'o zhes de lta bu'i rnam par rtog pa'i yul nyid kho na ba ba lang 'di yin te /
analyzed: rang gi rtogs pa gzhan la go bar byed pa na 'di ni 'di dang 'dra'o zhes de lta bu'i rnam par rtog pa'i yul nyid kho na ba ba lang 'di yin te /
translated: When one makes known to others one's own understanding, one says, This is like that. The object of such a conceptualization is the object of the inference for the sake of another.

original: lkog shal dang ldan pa'i phyir ba lang gi shes pa'i lkog shal la sogs pa'i yul nyid bzhin no zhes tha snyad du byed par brjod do zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: lkog shal dang ldan pa'i phyir ba lang gi shes pa'i lkog shal la sogs pa'i yul nyid bzhin no zhes tha snyad du byed par brjod do zhes bshad pa ni /
translated: Because it possesses a dewlap, it is like the object of a cow‚Äôs consciousness, a dewlap, and so on.

original: de ni 'di dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de ni 'di dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This is like the statement, ‚ÄúThis is like that.‚Äù

analyzed: 'dir yang de dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa ma yin pa dngos po de'i ngo bo ni /
translated: Here, the object that is understood as ‚ÄúThe nature of that non-similar thing

analyzed: de ni 'di dang 'dra'o zhes rtogs pa'i yul rtogs pa nyid kyi shes pa yin te ba lang gi shes pa'i lkog shal la sogs pa bzhin du rnam par rtog pa'i yul ni 'dra ba nyid yin te ;
translated: is like this‚Äù is the consciousness that understands the object. The object of a conceptual consciousness is similarity, just like the dewlap of a cow and so on.

analyzed: de yang mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba'i dngos po'i ngo bo ni rtog pa de kho nas shes so snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: The nature of a thing that is dissimilar to that is understood by that conceptual consciousness alone.
