analyzed: dngos po gang dag gi ngo bo brtag bya dang 'dra ba nyid de ni snga ma dang phyi ma'i mngon sum dag nyid kyis rtogs pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The statement that the nature of things that are similar to the object of investigation is understood by prior and subsequent direct perception teaches thatüîΩthe nature of things that are similar to the object of investigation is understood by prior and subsequent direct perception.

original: rnam pa gnyis ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The two kinds of objects are

original: der ni gnyis kho na yin gyi gcig ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: der ni gnyis kho na yin gyi gcig ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that there are only two kinds of objects, not one.

original: yul las gzhan pa dbang po dang gsal ba la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan gzhan rnams med na blo yod pa ma yin pa ni rkyen gzhan tshang bar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: yul las gzhan pa dbang po dang gsal ba la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan gzhan rnams med na blo yod pa ma yin pa ni rkyen gzhan tshang bar bstan pa yin no //
translated: If there are no other causes, such as the sense faculties and illumination, which are different from the object, then there is no cognition. This shows that the other conditions are complete.

original: blo ni 'byung dang zhes bya bas rang bzhin brjod pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: blo ni 'byung dang zhes bya bas rang bzhin brjod pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThe cognition arises from the elements‚Äù shows that the nature of the cognition is stated.

original: gang la rgyu mtshan gzhan yod pa na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang la rgyu mtshan gzhan yod pa na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning is that when there is another cause,

original: dmigs pa'i mi dmigs pa ni dmigs pa med pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mi dmigs pa ni dmigs pa med pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt the nonapprehension of an object the absence of an object?

original: de yang mi rigs na med pa'i tha snyad byed pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang mi rigs na med pa'i tha snyad byed pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: And that is not tenable, because it is not the case that the term ‚Äúnonexistent‚Äù is used.

original: shin tu myos pa dang / brgyal ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na mi mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: shin tu myos pa dang / brgyal ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na mi mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: This is because it is not seen in the case of being extremely intoxicated or fainting.

original: de'i tshe na snang ba mi @6b dmigs pa med pa yang ma yin la gzhan mthong ba dang so sor 'brel pa dran pa dag kyang med pa'i shes pa la dgongs pa dang ldan pa ma yin te tshad ma med pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe na snang ba mi @6b dmigs pa med pa yang ma yin la gzhan mthong ba dang so sor 'brel pa dran pa dag kyang med pa'i shes pa la dgongs pa dang ldan pa ma yin te tshad ma med pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: At that time, the cognition that is not the non-apprehension of appearances and is not the memory of the connection with the seeing of another is not associated with intention, because it is the reason for the absence of valid cognition.

original: des na gzhan mthong ba nyid de las gzhan pa dmigs pas dben pa ni de med par go bar byed pas dngos po'i med pa rtogs par byed pa'i phyir ltos pa yin te /
analyzed: des na gzhan mthong ba nyid de las gzhan pa dmigs pas dben pa ni de med par go bar byed pas dngos po'i med pa rtogs par byed pa'i phyir ltos pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, the seeing of another is the very thing that is isolated from that which is other than it, and it is the cause of understanding its non-existence, because it causes the understanding of the non-existence of a thing.

original: gzhan du na de la phan par mtshon pa med par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan du na de la phan par mtshon pa med par bstan pa ni /
translated: Otherwise, the teaching that it is not the cause of the indication of benefit in that case is:

original: de la 'ga' zhig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la 'ga' zhig ces bya ba'o //
translated: In that case, some refers to the cognition of another.

original: rtogs pa ni shes pa ste snang ba'i ngo bo gcig nyid du nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtogs pa ni shes pa ste snang ba'i ngo bo gcig nyid du nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Realization is knowledge, because it is ascertained as the single nature of appearance.

original: shes bya ni snang ba dang mi snang ba'i dbye bas ma nges pa yin pa'i phyir rtogs pa ma yin par bstan pa ni rtogs pa'i rnam pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: shes bya ni snang ba dang mi snang ba'i dbye bas ma nges pa yin pa'i phyir rtogs pa ma yin par bstan pa ni rtogs pa'i rnam pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The object of knowledge is not ascertained by the division of appearance and non-appearance, because it is taught that it is not realization, as in the aspect of realization.

original: rtogs pa ni shes pa'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa ni shes pa'o //
translated: Realization is cognition.

original: lkog tu gyur pa dang cig shos kyang yin la /
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa dang cig shos kyang yin la /
translated: It is both hidden and not hidden,

original: shes pa yang yin pas lkog tu gyur pa dang cig shos kyi shes pa de dag gang gi yul yin pa de ni de bzhin no //
analyzed: shes pa yang yin pas lkog tu gyur pa dang cig shos kyi shes pa de dag gang gi yul yin pa de ni de bzhin no //
translated: and it is also cognition. That which is the object of those cognitions of the hidden and the not hidden is just as it is.

original: 'di yang phyis zhes bya ba ni don dang don med nus pa gang zhes bya ba 'di la'o //
analyzed: 'di yang phyis zhes bya ba ni don dang don med nus pa gang zhes bya ba 'di la'o //
translated: This is also later, in the passage that begins, ‚ÄúWhat is the capacity of the meaningful and the meaningless?‚Äù

original: gcig la 'jug pa'i mngon sum la gzhan mi snang ba la bdag mi 'jug go zhes bdag rig pa lkog tu gyur pa la mi 'jug pa'i rig pa yang /
analyzed: gcig la 'jug pa'i mngon sum la gzhan mi snang ba la bdag mi 'jug go zhes bdag rig pa lkog tu gyur pa la mi 'jug pa'i rig pa yang /
translated: In the case of a single cognition, it does not engage other things that do not appear, and it does not engage the hidden self.

original: mngon sum gyi rig pa lta bu yin pa'i phyir lkog tu gyur pa dang lkog tu ma gyur pa'i rig pa gcig nyid yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi rig pa lta bu yin pa'i phyir lkog tu gyur pa dang lkog tu ma gyur pa'i rig pa gcig nyid yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The cognition that does not engage is like the cognition of direct perception. Therefore, it is shown that the cognition of the hidden and the cognition of the not hidden are the same.

original: gang la nga ni med pa de zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang la nga ni med pa de zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is the passage that begins, ‚ÄúThat which does not exist for me . . .‚Äù

original: ci las shes she na nges pa nyid du rtogs pa nyid ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci las shes she na nges pa nyid du rtogs pa nyid ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: How is this known? It is known because of the passage that begins, ‚ÄúThe realization of the hidden . . .‚Äù

original: rjes su dpag par bya ba la 'brel pa 'dzin pa'i dus su mngon sum 'jug pa kho na ma yin nam snyam sems pa la mngon sum gyis rtogs kyang zhes smos so //
analyzed: rjes su dpag par bya ba la 'brel pa 'dzin pa'i dus su mngon sum 'jug pa kho na ma yin nam snyam sems pa la mngon sum gyis rtogs kyang zhes smos so //
translated: But when the object to be inferred is apprehended, is it not the case that perception is operating? To this he says, Even though it is understood by perception.

original: lkog gyur nyid ces bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa 'jug pa'i dus su'o //
analyzed: lkog gyur nyid ces bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa 'jug pa'i dus su'o //
translated: The phrase it is hidden refers to the time when inference is operating.

original: de'i tshe yang chos can mngon sum pa ma yin pa'i phyir chos kyang mngon sum pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe yang chos can mngon sum pa ma yin pa'i phyir chos kyang mngon sum pa ma yin no //
translated: At that time, since the subject is not perceived, the property also is not perceived.

original: sems pa ni don shes zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sems pa ni don shes zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase the cognition of the object refers to the mind.

original: mngon sum las zhes bya ba ni de dang de ma yin par rig pa dang / rig pa ma yin pa'i rtags 'dzin pa las so //
analyzed: mngon sum las zhes bya ba ni de dang de ma yin par rig pa dang / rig pa ma yin pa'i rtags 'dzin pa las so //
translated: The phrase from perception refers to the apprehension of the sign that is either known to be present or absent.

original: rang rig pa'i mngon sum zhes bya ba ni phyi rol rig pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: rang rig pa'i mngon sum zhes bya ba ni phyi rol rig pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: The phrase perception of self-awareness refers to the nature of the cognition of the external object.

original: dbang po'i shes pa zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa 'dzin pa'i dus su 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa 'dzin pa'i dus su 'byung ba'o //
translated: The phrase sense perception refers to the cognition that arises at the time of apprehending the relation.

original: 'brel pa rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni rtags 'dzin pa'i mngon sum @7a * //
analyzed: 'brel pa rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni rtags 'dzin pa'i mngon sum @7a * //
translated: The phrase the understanding of the relation refers to the perception that apprehends the sign.

original: gyis chos dang chos can gyi'o //
analyzed: gyis chos dang chos can gyi'o //
translated: The object of the cognition of non-apprehension is the subject and the predicate.

original: ji ltar yang mngon sum 'jug pas don mngon sum pa yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar yang mngon sum 'jug pas don mngon sum pa yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the object of direct perception is the object that is directly perceived,

original: de log pas mngon sum par ma yin par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de log pas mngon sum par ma yin par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: so the object of non-apprehension is the object that is not apprehended.

original: mngon sum dang de log pa dang ldan pa'i chos kyang chos can la mngon sum pa dang lkog tu gyur pa yin no zhes bstan pa ni tha dad med par gnas pa'i sgrub pa'i ngo bo zhes bya ba'o //üîΩgang gi phyir mngon sum pa'i sa phyogs ni chos can la bum pa med pa ni chos yin te med pa'i sa phyogs ni mngon sum pa ma yin pa'i med pa'i shes pa'i khongs su gtogs pa'i shes pa can ni mngon sum pa ma yin pa'i chos can
analyzed: mngon sum dang de log pa dang ldan pa'i chos kyang chos can la mngon sum pa dang lkog tu gyur pa yin no zhes bstan pa ni tha dad med par gnas pa'i sgrub pa'i ngo bo zhes bya ba'o // gang gi phyir mngon sum pa'i sa phyogs ni chos can la bum pa med pa ni chos yin te med pa'i sa phyogs ni mngon sum pa ma yin pa'i med pa'i shes pa'i khongs su gtogs pa'i shes pa can ni mngon sum pa ma yin pa'i chos can
translated: Thus, the subject and the predicate are directly perceived or not directly perceived, depending on whether the direct perception or its absence is present. This is the meaning of the phrase ‚Äúthe nature of the proof that is not different from the object.‚ÄùüîΩThe example is as follows: The subject is the place that is directly perceived, and the predicate is the absence of a pot on that place. The place where the pot is absent is not directly perceived, but the cognition of the absence of a pot, which is included in the cognition of the place that is not directly perceived, is directly perceived.

original: la yang mngon sum yin no zhes bya ba ni dpe yin no //
analyzed: la yang mngon sum yin no zhes bya ba ni dpe yin no //
translated: Thus, the subject that is not directly perceived is also directly perceived.

original: dngos po mi 'dzin kyang chos 'dzin pa yin na /
analyzed: dngos po mi 'dzin kyang chos 'dzin pa yin na /
translated: Even though the thing is not apprehended, the property is apprehended.

original: chos rig pa yin yang rig par mi 'gyur ro zhes ldog pa'i shugs kyis chos can rig na thams cad rig par bsgrub par 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa la dmigs kyis bsal bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: chos rig pa yin yang rig par mi 'gyur ro zhes ldog pa'i shugs kyis chos can rig na thams cad rig par bsgrub par 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa la dmigs kyis bsal bar bstan pa ni /
translated: The meaning is that if the object is different from the subject, it is not the object of that subject.

original: dngos po dang tha mi dad pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dngos po dang tha mi dad pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The meaning of not different from the thing is as follows:

original: gzhan gyis sgro btags pa'i ngo bo ni me dang ldan pa'i phyogs bzhin du chos can mngon sum nyid yin yang mngon sum ma yin la /
analyzed: gzhan gyis sgro btags pa'i ngo bo ni me dang ldan pa'i phyogs bzhin du chos can mngon sum nyid yin yang mngon sum ma yin la /
translated: The nature superimposed by others, like a place possessing fire, is not a direct perception even though the subject is a direct perception.

original: gzhan gyis sgro ma btags pa'i dngos po'i chos ni skad cig pa nyid bzhin du chos can dang lhan cig mngon sum gcig gi yul yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan gyis sgro ma btags pa'i dngos po'i chos ni skad cig pa nyid bzhin du chos can dang lhan cig mngon sum gcig gi yul yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the property of a thing not superimposed by others, like momentariness, is the object of a single direct perception together with the subject.

original: chos gtso ba'i rgol ba la bstan pa ni /
analyzed: chos gtso ba'i rgol ba la bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching to the opponent for whom the property is primary is:

original: rjes su dpag pas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: By inference.

original: chos can gtso bo la bstan pa ni mngon sum nyid du gyur na yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: chos can gtso bo la bstan pa ni mngon sum nyid du gyur na yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The teaching to the opponent for whom the subject is primary is: Even if it is a direct perception.

original: mthong ba'i ngo bo zhes bya ba ni chos can gyi 'brel pa 'dzin pa'i dus su'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i ngo bo zhes bya ba ni chos can gyi 'brel pa 'dzin pa'i dus su'o //
translated: The so-called ‚Äúnature of perception‚Äù is the time of apprehending the connection with the subject.

original: chos can bzhin du chos kyang 'brel pa 'dzin pa'i dus su mngon sum pa yin no snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: chos can bzhin du chos kyang 'brel pa 'dzin pa'i dus su mngon sum pa yin no snyam du sems pa la /
translated: Thinking that just as the subject is perceived, the property is also perceived at the time of apprehending the connection,

original: rjes su dpag pas zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says ‚Äúby inference.‚Äù

original: mi 'dod kyang zhes bya ba ni ltos pa med kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi 'dod kyang zhes bya ba ni ltos pa med kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúEven though one does not accept‚Äù means even though there is no dependence.

original: de zhes bya ba ni lkog tu gyur pa nyid do //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni lkog tu gyur pa nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the hidden state.

original: lkog tu gyur pa'i dngos po'i nges pa nyid ni rjes su dpag pa'i dngos po dang 'brel pa'i ngo bo tshad ma nyid du nges pa yin bar bstan pa ni 'dis ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa'i dngos po'i nges pa nyid ni rjes su dpag pa'i dngos po dang 'brel pa'i ngo bo tshad ma nyid du nges pa yin bar bstan pa ni 'dis ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The very ascertainment of a hidden thing is the nature of the connection with the thing inferred, which is ascertained as valid cognition. ‚ÄúThis‚Äù indicates that.

original: rtogs par byed pa nyid ni tshad ma nyid ma yin te tshad med pa yin pa la yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtogs par byed pa nyid ni tshad ma nyid ma yin te tshad med pa yin pa la yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mere cause of understanding is not valid cognition, because it exists even in non-valid cognition.

original: rtogs pa'i khyad par ni dngos po dang 'brel @7b ba nyid du bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rtogs pa'i khyad par ni dngos po dang 'brel @7b ba nyid du bstan pa ni /
translated: The special understanding is taught as the connection with the thing.

original: dngos dang 'brel pa tsam gyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dngos dang 'brel pa tsam gyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBy the mere connection with the thing‚Äù indicates that.

original: gang zhig rgyu'i tshogs pa las zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rigs pa'i rgyu'i tshogs pa yang 'bras bu'i rtogs par byed pa nyid du bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gang zhig rgyu'i tshogs pa las zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rigs pa'i rgyu'i tshogs pa yang 'bras bu'i rtogs par byed pa nyid du bstan pa ni /
translated: The reason that the collection of causes is taught to be the cause of the effect is stated in the line ‚Äúbecause the collection exists.‚ÄùüîΩThe reason that consciousness is taught to be the effect of the collection of causes is stated in the line ‚Äúbecause the effect exists.‚Äù

original: gang phyir tshogs pa yod gyur la //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang phyir tshogs pa yod gyur la // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The reason that the collection of causes is taught to be the cause of the effect is stated in the line ‚Äúbecause the collection exists.‚ÄùüîΩThe reason that consciousness is taught to be the effect of the collection of causes is stated in the line ‚Äúbecause the effect exists.‚ÄùüîΩThe reason that the collection of causes is taught to be the cause of the effect is stated in the line ‚Äúbecause the collection exists.‚ÄùüîΩThe reason that consciousness is taught to be the effect of the collection of causes is stated in the line ‚Äúbecause the effect exists.‚ÄùüîΩThe reason that the collection of causes is taught to be the cause of the effect is stated in the line ‚Äúbecause the collection exists.‚Äù

original: gzhal bya gnyis las zhes bya ba ni de'i shes pa yin la 'dir shes pa yang 'dzin pa kho na ste shes par byed pa po'i dbang du byas pa gang yin pa las zhes bya ba'i rigs pa las bstan pa'i dbye bas rang gi rgyu mtshan rtogs par
analyzed: gzhal bya gnyis las zhes bya ba ni de'i shes pa yin la 'dir shes pa yang 'dzin pa kho na ste shes par byed pa po'i dbang du byas pa gang yin pa las zhes bya ba'i rigs pa las bstan pa'i dbye bas rang gi rgyu mtshan rtogs par
translated: The reason that consciousness is taught to be the effect of the collection of causes is stated in the line ‚Äúbecause the effect exists.‚ÄùüîΩThe reason that the collection of causes is taught to be the cause of the effect is stated in the line ‚Äúbecause the collection exists.‚Äù

original: byed do // de'i phyir 'di 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs yin par bstan pa ni gal te yang gdon mi za bar zhes bya ba'o //üîΩgzhal bya dang ldan pa nyid kyis tshad ma nyid la khyab pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: byed do // de'i phyir 'di 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs yin par bstan pa ni gal te yang gdon mi za bar zhes bya ba'o // gzhal bya dang ldan pa nyid kyis tshad ma nyid la khyab pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The reason that consciousness is taught to be the effect of the collection of causes is stated in the line ‚Äúbecause the effect exists.‚ÄùüîΩThe reason that the collection of causes is taught to be the cause of the effect is stated in the line ‚Äúbecause the collection exists.‚ÄùüîΩThe reason that consciousness is taught to be the effect of the collection of causes is stated in the line ‚Äúbecause the effect exists.‚ÄùüîΩThe reason that the collection of causes is taught to be the cause of the effect is stated in the line ‚Äúbecause the collection exists.‚Äù

original: gzhal bya gnyis las zhes bya ba'o //üîΩbdag ni tshad ma yin la de yang rtag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhal bya gnyis las zhes bya ba'o //üîΩbdag ni tshad ma yin la de yang rtag pa'i phyir /
translated: The reason that consciousness is taught to be the effect of the collection of causes is stated in the line ‚Äúbecause the effect exists.‚Äù

original: gzhal bya med kyang yod na ji ltar khyab pa yin snyam du sems pas bdag yod do zhe na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhal bya med kyang yod na ji ltar khyab pa yin snyam du sems pas bdag yod do zhe na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If the object of comprehension does not exist, how can there be pervasion?

original: bdag tsam ni tshad ma ma yin gyi 'on kyang de'i rnam par 'gyur ba yin la /
analyzed: bdag tsam ni tshad ma ma yin gyi 'on kyang de'i rnam par 'gyur ba yin la /
translated: The self is not a valid cognition, but rather a transformation of that.üîΩAnd that exists when the object of comprehension exists, and does not exist when that does not exist.

original: de yang gzhal bya yod na yod la de med na ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni de yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de yang gzhal bya yod na yod la de med na ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni de yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúthat‚Äù indicates this.

original: gcig ces bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: gcig ces bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The word ‚Äúone‚Äù is the specific characteristic.

original: gzhan zhes bya ba ni spyi'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba ni spyi'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The word ‚Äúother‚Äù is the general characteristic.

original: rtogs bzhin pa thams cad ni rang gi ngo bo kho nas yin gyi /
analyzed: rtogs bzhin pa thams cad ni rang gi ngo bo kho nas yin gyi /
translated: Isn‚Äôt all that is being cognized cognized by its own nature alone,

original: gzhan gyi ngo bos ma yin pa ma yin nam de'i phyir ji ltar de las gzhan pa zhes ji ltar brjod snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: gzhan gyi ngo bos ma yin pa ma yin nam de'i phyir ji ltar de las gzhan pa zhes ji ltar brjod snyam du sems pa la /
translated: and not by the nature of another? Therefore, how can it be said that it is other than that?

original: gzhan gyi ngo bo rtogs pa nyid sgrub par byed pa ni don byed nus pa ni rang gi ngo bo dmigs pa la'o gzhan ni rang gi ngo bo dmigs pa med na dmigs bzhin pa kun rdzob pa'i yang dag pa'i rtogs pas rtogs bzhin pa'i gzhan gyi ngoüîΩbos dmigs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan gyi ngo bo rtogs pa nyid sgrub par byed pa ni don byed nus pa ni rang gi ngo bo dmigs pa la'o gzhan ni rang gi ngo bo dmigs pa med na dmigs bzhin pa kun rdzob pa'i yang dag pa'i rtogs pas rtogs bzhin pa'i gzhan gyi ngo bos dmigs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The proof of the realization of the nature of another is that the object that is able to perform a function is perceived in its nature. The other, if it is not perceived in its nature, is perceived as a superficial reality. The realization of the nature of another is perceived by the realization of the superficial reality.üîΩThe meaning is that the object that is perceived in the nature of another is perceived in its nature.

original: de dag de ltar rtogs pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid dang cig shos nyid du sngon gyi slob dpon rnams kyis gsungs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dag de ltar rtogs pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid dang cig shos nyid du sngon gyi slob dpon rnams kyis gsungs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The former masters have stated that the realization of those is in terms of their own characteristics and in terms of the other.

original: bar skabs kyi rgol ba la bstan pa ni bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa'o //
analyzed: bar skabs kyi rgol ba la bstan pa ni bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa'o //
translated: The verse in the middle is a statement to the opponent in the middle.

original: 'bras bu dang / rgyu dang / de'i nus pa yang tshad mas rtogs pa kho na yin yang sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin du med pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang / rgyu dang / de'i nus pa yang tshad mas rtogs pa kho na yin yang sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin du med pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The effect, the cause, and its potency are only realized by valid cognition, but like an illusion, etc., they do not exist.

original: phyogs snga ma pa'i bsam pa ni @8a * //
analyzed: phyogs snga ma pa'i bsam pa ni @8a * //
translated: The intention of the opponent is as follows.

original: gnod par byed pa med na mi rigs so snyam pas tshad ma can ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gnod par byed pa med na mi rigs so snyam pas tshad ma can ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: If there were no harm-doer, it would not be right. Thus, because it is not a valid cognition, it is not so. This is taught:

original: gal te don nus pa 'gal yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gal te don nus pa 'gal yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: If the object is capable, even if there is contradiction...

original: byed pa med pa zhes bya ba ni de'i rang gi ngo bo nyams pa ma yin yang de la gzhan med na 'bras bu mthong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: byed pa med pa zhes bya ba ni de'i rang gi ngo bo nyams pa ma yin yang de la gzhan med na 'bras bu mthong ba ma yin no //
translated: The non-existence of activity means that even if its own nature is not impaired, if there is nothing else there, the effect is not seen.

original: yul nyung zad la khyab pa nyid kho na khyab pa ma yin pa nyid yin la de yang mngon sum gyi yul ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: yul nyung zad la khyab pa nyid kho na khyab pa ma yin pa nyid yin la de yang mngon sum gyi yul ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: Only the pervasiveness of a small object is not pervasion, and that is not the object of direct perception. This is taught:

original: de yul khyab min zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de yul khyab min zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That is not the object of pervasion.

original: rtag pa nyid de dus gzhan du gnas nyid kyi ngo bo ni mngon sum gyi yul ma yin no //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid de dus gzhan du gnas nyid kyi ngo bo ni mngon sum gyi yul ma yin no //
translated: That permanence is not the object of direct perception, because it is the nature of abiding at another time.

original: rtag pa med ces bya ba ni skad cig pa las te byed pa ste bya ba de'i dus na med par bstan pa ni skad cig pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtag pa med ces bya ba ni skad cig pa las te byed pa ste bya ba de'i dus na med par bstan pa ni skad cig pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The non-existence of permanence is from momentariness, and the teaching that the activity of that is not at that time is of the momentary.

original: yod pa ni skyes pa'o //
analyzed: yod pa ni skyes pa'o //
translated: Existence is arising.

original: rang gi ngo bo las byed pa gzhan pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni /üîΩde'i de ma thag ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo las byed pa gzhan pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni / de'i de ma thag ces bya ba'o //
translated: The verse ‚ÄúThe effect does not exist in the conditions either collectively or individually‚Äù teaches that the effect does not exist in the conditions either collectively or individually.üîΩThe verse ‚ÄúNor is it produced from something other than the conditions‚Äù teaches that the effect is not produced from something other than the conditions.

original: 'bras bu de gzhan yang ste rgyu ma yin par 'dod pa yang snga ma'i de ma thag pa zhes 'khrul pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu de gzhan yang ste rgyu ma yin par 'dod pa yang snga ma'i de ma thag pa zhes 'khrul pa'o //
translated: The verse ‚ÄúNor is it produced from both‚Äù teaches that the effect is not produced from both the conditions and something other than the conditions.üîΩThe verse ‚ÄúIf the effect were nonexistent, how could conditions be?‚Äù teaches that if the effect were nonexistent, the conditions would not be conditions.üîΩThe verse ‚ÄúIf the effect were existent, what would conditions do?‚Äù teaches that if the effect were existent, the conditions would not be conditions.

original: thams cad ltos pa zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu du ba nyid bod bu la ltos par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad ltos pa zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu du ba nyid bod bu la ltos par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: The verse ‚ÄúIf the effect were both existent and nonexistent, what would conditions do?‚Äù teaches that if the effect were both existent and nonexistent, the conditions would not be conditions.üîΩThe verse ‚ÄúIf the effect were neither existent nor nonexistent, what would conditions do?‚Äù teaches that if the effect were neither existent nor nonexistent, the conditions would not be conditions.

original: de dang 'brel pa ni skang cig dang 'brel pa ste rgyun dang ngo //
analyzed: de dang 'brel pa ni skang cig dang 'brel pa ste rgyun dang ngo //
translated: The verse ‚ÄúThe effect does not exist in the conditions either collectively or individually‚Äù teaches that the effect does not exist in the conditions either collectively or individually.

original: tha dad pa la ni zhes bya ba ni rgyun dang rgyun can dag gi'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa la ni zhes bya ba ni rgyun dang rgyun can dag gi'o //
translated: The verse ‚ÄúNor is it produced from something other than the conditions‚Äù teaches that the effect is not produced from something other than the conditions.

original: rgyun de'i yang smras pa dang / ma smras pa yang sdud pa ni /
analyzed: rgyun de'i yang smras pa dang / ma smras pa yang sdud pa ni /
translated: The verse ‚ÄúNor is it produced from both‚Äù teaches that the effect is not produced from both the conditions and something other than the conditions.üîΩThe verse ‚ÄúIf the effect were nonexistent, how could conditions be?‚Äù teaches that if the effect were nonexistent, the conditions would not be conditions.

original: rgyun nyid de las zhes bya ba'o //üîΩbrtags pa zhes bya ba ni rgyun du'o //üîΩde dang 'brel pas zhes bya ba ni rgyun dang ngo //
analyzed: rgyun nyid de las zhes bya ba'o // brtags pa zhes bya ba ni rgyun du'o // de dang 'brel pas zhes bya ba ni rgyun dang ngo //
translated: The verse ‚ÄúIf the effect were existent, what would conditions do?‚Äù teaches that if the effect were existent, the conditions would not be conditions.üîΩThe verse ‚ÄúIf the effect were both existent and nonexistent, what would conditions do?‚Äù teaches that if the effect were both existent and nonexistent, the conditions would not be conditions.üîΩThe verse ‚ÄúIf the effect were neither existent nor nonexistent, what would conditions do?‚Äù teaches that if the effect were neither existent nor nonexistent, the conditions would not be conditions.üîΩThe verse ‚ÄúThe effect does not exist in the conditions either collectively or individually‚Äù teaches that the effect does not exist in the conditions either collectively or individually.

original: rgyun gyi byed pa po yin pa'i phyir skad cig ma rnams yod pa gtso bo yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: rgyun gyi byed pa po yin pa'i phyir skad cig ma rnams yod pa gtso bo yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: The verse ‚ÄúNor is it produced from something other than the conditions‚Äù teaches that the effect is not produced from something other than the conditions.üîΩThe verse ‚ÄúNor is it produced

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu 'brel pa zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba tsam gyi rgyu nyid ni rgyu dang cig shos dag la yang mtshungs pa yod par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu 'brel pa zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba tsam gyi rgyu nyid ni rgyu dang cig shos dag la yang mtshungs pa yod par bstan pa ni /
translated: The so-called relation of cause and effect is merely a matter of invariable concomitance. The cause is the same in both the cause and the other.

original: khams gsum gyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khams gsum gyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The three realms, etc.

original: rtag dang cig shos phyogs dag ni //
analyzed: rtag dang cig shos phyogs dag ni //
translated: The eternal and the other, etc.

original: zhes bya ba ni rtag pa ni ldog pa med pa skad cig pa yin na rjes su 'gro ba'i khyad par med do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rtag pa ni ldog pa med pa skad cig pa yin na rjes su 'gro ba'i khyad par med do //
translated: The eternal is not subject to cessation. If it were momentary, there would be no difference in its invariable concomitance.

original: skad cig pa ni rgyun gyis byed //üîΩces pa la rgyun gzhan la ltos na thug pa med par 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: skad cig pa ni rgyun gyis byed // ces pa la rgyun gzhan la ltos na thug pa med par 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
translated: The momentary is the effect of a continuum.üîΩIn the position that the continuum is the cause, the effect is the continuum.üîΩIf the continuum is dependent on another continuum, there is an infinite regress.

original: gal te rgyun gzhan dag tu ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te rgyun gzhan dag tu ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is shown in the line, ‚ÄúIf the continuum is dependent on another continuum. . . . ‚Äù

original: 'bras bu nyid med pa ni rjes su 'gro ba nyid kyis so //
analyzed: 'bras bu nyid med pa ni rjes su 'gro ba nyid kyis so //
translated: The effect itself does not exist by invariable concomitance.

original: skad cig pa'i rgyun yang rgyun gyi 'bras bu yin zhes bya ba'i phyogs la de yang skad cig pa yin pa'i phyir rgyun gzhan la @8b ltos pa ni thug pa med par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: skad cig pa'i rgyun yang rgyun gyi 'bras bu yin zhes bya ba'i phyogs la de yang skad cig pa yin pa'i phyir rgyun gzhan la @8b ltos pa ni thug pa med par bstan pa ni /
translated: In the position that the continuum of the momentary is the effect of the continuum, that also is momentary. Therefore, if the continuum is dependent on another continuum, there is an infinite regress.üîΩThis is shown in the line, ‚ÄúIf the continuum is dependent on another continuum. . . . ‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir 'dir yang rgyun gyis zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dir yang rgyun gyis zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Because here also it is said ‚Äúby a continuum.‚Äù

original: 'bras bu nyid la byed pa po ni rgyu mtshan yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu nyid la byed pa po ni rgyu mtshan yin te /
translated: The effect itself is the reason,

original: sbyor bar byed pa po yin te de'i stobs kyis 'bras bu nyid du gsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyor bar byed pa po yin te de'i stobs kyis 'bras bu nyid du gsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the agent of the connection, since it is the manifestation of the effect by its power.

original: gzhan pa'i 'bras bu yis zhes bya ba ni mi shes pa'i ngo bo'i 'tshed pa dang / 'tshed pa la sogs pas so //
analyzed: gzhan pa'i 'bras bu yis zhes bya ba ni mi shes pa'i ngo bo'i 'tshed pa dang / 'tshed pa la sogs pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy another effect‚Äù means by the state of non-cognition, cooking, etc.

original: rtsa ba'i zhes bya ba ni me dang sngon po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i zhes bya ba ni me dang sngon po la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe basic‚Äù means fire, blue, etc.

original: de ltar mi srid pa'i mtshan nyid bstan nas khyab ches pa bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar mi srid pa'i mtshan nyid bstan nas khyab ches pa bstan pa ni /
translated: Having thus taught the characteristic of impossibility, he teaches the over-pervasion:

original: shes pa'i 'bras bus zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: shes pa'i 'bras bus zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúBy the effect of cognition.‚Äù

original: rmi lam du mthong ba ni med kyang shes pa la gnod pa med pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rmi lam du mthong ba ni med kyang shes pa la gnod pa med pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that even though what is seen in a dream does not exist, cognition is not impaired.

original: shes pa shes bya'i 'bras bu nyid shes pa la mngon sum med par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: shes pa shes bya'i 'bras bu nyid shes pa la mngon sum med par bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching that cognition is not directly perceived as the effect of the object of cognition is:

original: 'di la'ang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la'ang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn this case also.‚Äù

original: des sam ni 'bras bu'i ngo bos so //
analyzed: des sam ni 'bras bu'i ngo bos so //
translated: By that or by the nature of the effect.

original: mngon sum de nyid las min te //
analyzed: mngon sum de nyid las min te //
translated: Not from that very perception,

original: zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu ste de zhes bya ba ni mngon sum ste 'bras bu'o//
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu ste de zhes bya ba ni mngon sum ste 'bras bu'o//
translated: The effect is stated. That is perception, the effect.

original: sngar ni shes bya'i ngo bo rgyu yin pa'i dus su'o //
analyzed: sngar ni shes bya'i ngo bo rgyu yin pa'i dus su'o //
translated: Previously, the nature of the object of knowledge is the cause.

original: 'jug pa min pa ni 'bras bu dang rgyu dag ma skyes pa na dus mtshungs pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'jug pa min pa ni 'bras bu dang rgyu dag ma skyes pa na dus mtshungs pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Not engaging means that the effect and cause are not simultaneous when not arisen.

original: 'jug pa'i snga rol du zhes bya bar 'brel to //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i snga rol du zhes bya bar 'brel to //
translated: It is connected as ‚Äúprior to engaging.‚Äù

original: de ste khyod la 'bras nyid min te dus mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ste khyod la 'bras nyid min te dus mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is not the effect for you, it is simultaneous.

original: 'on te de'i dus na 'bras bu dmigs nas rgyu ni dus snga ma par nges par byed do snyam du sems pa sel bar byed pa ni de yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te de'i dus na 'bras bu dmigs nas rgyu ni dus snga ma par nges par byed do snyam du sems pa sel bar byed pa ni de yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But if you think that when the effect is observed at that time, the cause is ascertained as prior, the refutation is ‚Äúthat also.‚Äù

original: gzhan gyi phyogs rjes su brjod nas sun 'byin pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyi phyogs rjes su brjod nas sun 'byin pa ni /
translated: After stating the opponent‚Äôs position, the refutation is:

original: de ltar mthar thug nyid med par //üîΩzhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar mthar thug nyid med par // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Thus, there is no finality.

original: 'bras bu de shes pa'i dus na med pas de nyid kyis shes pa ma yin la /
analyzed: 'bras bu de shes pa'i dus na med pas de nyid kyis shes pa ma yin la /
translated: The effect does not exist at the time of the knowledge of that, so it is not known by that.

original: yin na yang dus mtshungs pa'i phyir 'bras bu nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i mthar thug pa med par rjes su 'jug go zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yin na yang dus mtshungs pa'i phyir 'bras bu nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i mthar thug pa med par rjes su 'jug go zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that there is no end to the regress.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid ni byed pa dang bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid ni byed pa dang bya ba nyid do //
translated: The relation of cause and effect is the relation of maker and made.

original: ka ba gcig nyid bum pa dang lhan cig gam /
analyzed: ka ba gcig nyid bum pa dang lhan cig gam /
translated: Is the very same pillar seen together with the pot,

original: lhan cig ma yin par sngar mthong ba ngo shes pas gal te dmigs na skad cig par 'dod pa nyams par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: lhan cig ma yin par sngar mthong ba ngo shes pas gal te dmigs na skad cig par 'dod pa nyams par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: or not seen together with it? If it is perceived, then the thesis that it is momentary is undermined.

original: de ltar brtag par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar brtag par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is being said.

original: so sor zhes bya ba ni snga ma'i ngo bo phyi ma la ma yin zhing de la phyi ma yang ma yin no //
analyzed: so sor zhes bya ba ni snga ma'i ngo bo phyi ma la ma yin zhing de la phyi ma yang ma yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúrespectively‚Äù means that the former entity is not the latter, and the latter is not the former.

original: dran pa ni rnam par rtog pa ste thog ma med pa'i bag chags kyi bskyed bya @9a * //
analyzed: dran pa ni rnam par rtog pa ste thog ma med pa'i bag chags kyi bskyed bya @9a * //
translated: Memory is a conceptual cognition, and it is produced by beginningless latent propensities.

original: yin la / nyams su myong ba'i bag chags kyi bskyed bya'i dran pa ni ji ltar nyams su myong ba kho na la 'jug gi / gcig nyid la ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: yin la / nyams su myong ba'i bag chags kyi bskyed bya'i dran pa ni ji ltar nyams su myong ba kho na la 'jug gi / gcig nyid la ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The demonstration that it does not occur in regard to a single thing is:

original: snga ma dang phyi ma'i rtogs pa yis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma'i rtogs pa yis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: by the understanding of the former and the latter.

original: nyams su myang ba 'am nyams su myong ba'i bag chags med na phyi rol rnams la bdag rig par byed pa po nyid yin na /
analyzed: nyams su myang ba 'am nyams su myong ba'i bag chags med na phyi rol rnams la bdag rig par byed pa po nyid yin na /
translated: If there were no experience or latent impressions of experience, then external things would be the very things that make the self known.

original: thams cad thams cad mthong bar 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: thams cad thams cad mthong bar 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
translated: The demonstration that everything would see everything is:

original: gal te bdag gcig nyid yod kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te bdag gcig nyid yod kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: even if the self were one.

original: ji ltar phyi rol gyi sgrub pa la tshad ma dgos pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar phyi rol gyi sgrub pa la tshad ma dgos pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as external proofs require valid cognitions,

original: bdag kyang ngo snyam du sems pa 'khrul pa yin par bstan pa ni bdag la brten pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bdag kyang ngo snyam du sems pa 'khrul pa yin par bstan pa ni bdag la brten pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the thought that the self is also like that is mistaken. The demonstration of this is:üîΩthe self is not based on the self.

original: tshad ma ni bdag med kyang 'khrul pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: tshad ma ni bdag med kyang 'khrul pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: Valid cognitions are not mistaken even though there is no self. The demonstration of this is:

original: bdag la brten pa ma yin yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bdag la brten pa ma yin yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: even though the self is not based on the self.

original: thob par byed pa'i shes pa'i thob pa ni tshad ma nyid yin te /
analyzed: thob par byed pa'i shes pa'i thob pa ni tshad ma nyid yin te /
translated: The obtainment of the cognition that causes obtainment is a valid cognition.

original: de ni bdag med kyang 'bras nyid la sogs pa bzhin du rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pas rtogs pa nyid du bstan pa ni /üîΩmthong ba'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ni bdag med kyang 'bras nyid la sogs pa bzhin du rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pas rtogs pa nyid du bstan pa ni / mthong ba'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Even though it is not the self, it is taught that it is a valid cognition because it is the cause of the conception that follows and turns away from the result, like the result itself.

original: bdag yod na yang zhes bya ba ni tsam gyis zhes bya ba de'i bshad pa'o //
analyzed: bdag yod na yang zhes bya ba ni tsam gyis zhes bya ba de'i bshad pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin seeing‚Äù is the explanation of the phrase ‚Äúmerely.‚Äù

original: gang rung ni zhes bya ba ni shes pa'i'o //
analyzed: gang rung ni zhes bya ba ni shes pa'i'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúany one of them‚Äù refers to cognition.

original: de lta yin na bdag yod kyang gang zhig tshad ma yin zhe na ;
analyzed: de lta yin na bdag yod kyang gang zhig tshad ma yin zhe na ;
translated: If that is so, then even if the self exists, what is a valid cognition?

original: mngon sum dang ni rjes dpag dag / kho na zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: mngon sum dang ni rjes dpag dag / kho na zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúonly perception and inference‚Äù is stated.

original: de lta yin na de dag kho nas bdag gam phyi rol gyi mi rtag pa nyid rtogs par byed do snyam du sems pa la snga ma dang phyi ma'i zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de lta yin na de dag kho nas bdag gam phyi rol gyi mi rtag pa nyid rtogs par byed do snyam du sems pa la snga ma dang phyi ma'i zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: If that is so, then one thinks that one understands the impermanence of the self or external things by means of only those two. Therefore, the phrase ‚Äúthe former and the latter‚Äù is stated.

original: de'i phyir de dag tsam ni de kho na nyid yin par bstan pa ni shes pas mi myong ba'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag tsam ni de kho na nyid yin par bstan pa ni shes pas mi myong ba'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it is taught that just those are reality: ‚Äúbecause consciousness does not experience.‚Äù

original: 'bras bu la sogs pa nyid grub na rgyu'i don la rjes su dpag pa 'bras bu mthong ba yin gyi /
analyzed: 'bras bu la sogs pa nyid grub na rgyu'i don la rjes su dpag pa 'bras bu mthong ba yin gyi /
translated: If the existence of effect and so on is established, then the meaning of cause is inferred from seeing the effect.

original: ma grub na ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni rjes su dpag pa de yang zhes bya ba ste /üîΩdngos la ni 'bras bur gyur pa'am /
analyzed: ma grub na ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni rjes su dpag pa de yang zhes bya ba ste / dngos la ni 'bras bur gyur pa'am /
translated: But if it is not established, it is not, is the teaching.üîΩ‚Äú That inference‚Äù is connected to ‚Äúif the existence of effect and so on is not established, then the meaning of cause is not inferred from seeing the effect.‚ÄùüîΩIf the existence of effect and so on is not established, then the meaning of cause is not inferred from seeing the effect.üîΩIf the existence of effect and so on is established, then the meaning of cause is inferred from seeing the effect.

original: rgyur gyur pa la mngon sum gyis rig pa med na mi 'byung ba 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa 'jug pa med do zhes bya bar 'brel to //
analyzed: rgyur gyur pa la mngon sum gyis rig pa med na mi 'byung ba 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa 'jug pa med do zhes bya bar 'brel to //
translated: If the existence of effect and so on is not established, then the meaning of cause is not inferred from seeing the effect.üîΩIf the existence of effect and so on is established, then the meaning of cause is inferred from seeing the effect.üîΩIf the existence of effect and so on is not established, then the meaning of cause is not inferred from seeing the effect.

original: rjes su dpag pa kho nas med na mi 'byung ba rigs pa yin thug pa med par bstan pa ni /üîΩsngon rol mngon su zhes bya ba'o //üîΩ'bras bu nyid la sogs pa 'ba' zhig ma yin pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa kho nas med na mi 'byung ba rigs pa yin thug pa med par bstan pa ni / sngon rol mngon su zhes bya ba'o // 'bras bu nyid la sogs pa 'ba' zhig ma yin pa ma yin zhing /

analyzed: @9b gzung ba nyid la sogs pa yang ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: If the existence of effect and so on is not established, then the meaning of cause is not

original: 'bras sogs gzhal bya re zhig zhog / ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'bras sogs gzhal bya re zhig zhog / ces bya ba'o //
translated: Put aside for the moment the object of knowledge such as rice, etc.

original: de ltar yang de don med par nus pa ma yin par bstan pa ni gzhi med ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar yang de don med par nus pa ma yin par bstan pa ni gzhi med ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is shown that it is not possible that it is without an object.

original: gal te 'di ni sngon po'o zhes bya ba'i rnam par shes pa la phyi rol gyi sngon po la rtog pa na ji ltar dmigs pa med pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'di ni sngon po'o zhes bya ba'i rnam par shes pa la phyi rol gyi sngon po la rtog pa na ji ltar dmigs pa med pa yin zhe na /
translated: If one thinks that the external blue is the object of the consciousness that thinks, ‚ÄúThis is blue,‚Äù how can it be that there is no object?üîΩHe says:

original: shes pa dmigs dang bcas 'gyur na //üîΩzhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: shes pa dmigs dang bcas 'gyur na // zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: If consciousness were to have an object,

original: rnam par rtog pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa nyid du mthong ba la dbye ba byed pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa nyid du mthong ba la dbye ba byed pa yin te /
translated: Imagination is divided into the seen object and the seeing subject.

original: de ma yin pa'i ngo bor rig pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni 'gro 'dir rgyu nyid ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: de ma yin pa'i ngo bor rig pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni 'gro 'dir rgyu nyid ces bya ba ste /
translated: It is shown that it is not known to have a nature that is not that, because it is not known to have a nature that is not that.üîΩHe says:üîΩIf it were the cause of this,

original: gal te yang mthong ba'i rjes su dpag pa'i rnam par rtog pa sngon po dang de mthong ba dag gi rgyu dang / rgyu dang ldan pa nyid kho na rjes su 'brang bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: gal te yang mthong ba'i rjes su dpag pa'i rnam par rtog pa sngon po dang de mthong ba dag gi rgyu dang / rgyu dang ldan pa nyid kho na rjes su 'brang bar byed pa ste /
translated: If the imagination that infers after seeing were to follow only the cause and causal nature of the blue and its seeing, then it would not be the imagination of what is unreal.

original: mthong ba la dbye ba med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mthong ba la dbye ba med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that there is no division of seeing.

original: gnod pa med pa'i so sor snang ba'i rgyu mtshan gyis dmigs pa dang bcas pa yin na rab rib can gyi shes pa la yang der snang ba'i gnod pa med pa'i phyir der 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnod pa med pa'i so sor snang ba'i rgyu mtshan gyis dmigs pa dang bcas pa yin na rab rib can gyi shes pa la yang der snang ba'i gnod pa med pa'i phyir der 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is that which has an objective referent because of the non-deceptive appearance of each, then that would be the case for the cognition of one with myodesopsia, because there is no non-deceptive appearance of that.

original: don med kyang 'byung pa'i phyir der mi 'gyur ro zhe na yang /
analyzed: don med kyang 'byung pa'i phyir der mi 'gyur ro zhe na yang /
translated: If you say that it is not so because it arises even without an object,

original: don rgyu nyid kho nas dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid du bstan pa ni /
analyzed: don rgyu nyid kho nas dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid du bstan pa ni /
translated: then it is taught that it is that which has an objective referent only because of being the cause of the object.

original: snang ba tsam gyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: snang ba tsam gyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The mere appearance is the cause.

original: 'on te rgyu nyid kyang ma nges pa'i snang ba tsam gyis mi 'grub po zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te rgyu nyid kyang ma nges pa'i snang ba tsam gyis mi 'grub po zhe na /
translated: But if you say that it is not established by the mere appearance because even the cause is not ascertained,

original: gang zhig gang gi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang zhig gang gi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then it is that which is the cause of that.

original: don rgyu nyid mi 'dzin pa'i phyir mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir gzhan gyi 'dod pa nyid kyi 'bras bu dang rgyu nyid rjes su rjod par byed pa ni 'di ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: don rgyu nyid mi 'dzin pa'i phyir mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir gzhan gyi 'dod pa nyid kyi 'bras bu dang rgyu nyid rjes su rjod par byed pa ni 'di ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In order to teach that it is not so because of not apprehending the cause of the object, he restates the result and cause of the opponent, saying, ‚ÄúThis is the result of that.‚Äù

original: sngon po gzung bar bya ba nyid kyis gsal bar snang bzhin pa ni rgyu nyid kyis dmigs pa ma yin par brjod pa yin na /
analyzed: sngon po gzung bar bya ba nyid kyis gsal bar snang bzhin pa ni rgyu nyid kyis dmigs pa ma yin par brjod pa yin na /
translated: If it is said that blue appears as the object of apprehension, and yet is not the object of perception because of being the cause,

original: rgyu gang gis rab rib can gyi shes par thal bar 'gyur snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: rgyu gang gis rab rib can gyi shes par thal bar 'gyur snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: then what is the cause that is thought to be the consequence of the consciousness of one with eye disease?

original: rgyu nyid kyis ni dmigs pa ma yin gyi zhes bya ba ste rgyu nyid tsam gyis ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu nyid kyis ni dmigs pa ma yin gyi zhes bya ba ste rgyu nyid tsam gyis ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is said that it is not the object of perception because of being the cause, but not because of being the cause alone.

original: rgyu nyid bzhin du gzung bya nyid kyang mi 'grub po //
analyzed: rgyu nyid bzhin du gzung bya nyid kyang mi 'grub po //
translated: Just as it is not established as the cause, it is not established as the object of apprehension.üîΩTherefore, it is shown that it is absurd:

original: de'i phyir thal ches pa kho na yin par bstan pa ni sngon po la sogs pa ma gtogs pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir thal ches pa kho na yin par bstan pa ni sngon po la sogs pa ma gtogs pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Apart from blue, etc., there is no object of apprehension.üîΩThe object of apprehension is the object of the action of the sense faculty, and the other is the object of the action of the mental consciousness.üîΩThe object of apprehension is the object of the action of the sense faculty, and the other is the object of the action of the mental consciousness.üîΩThe object of apprehension is the object of the action of the sense faculty, and the other is the object of the action of the mental consciousness.
