translated: The object of apprehension is the object of the action of the sense faculty, and the other is the object of the action of the mental consciousness.üîΩThe object of apprehension is the object of the action of the sense faculty, and the other is the object of the action of the mental consciousness.üîΩThe object of apprehension is the object of the action of the sense faculty, and the other is the object of the action of the mental consciousness.üîΩThe object of apprehension is the object of the action of the sense faculty, and the other is the object of the action of the mental consciousness.üîΩThe object of apprehension is the object of the action of the sense faculty, and the other is the object of the action of the mental consciousness.üîΩThe object of apprehension is the object of the action of the sense faculty, and the other is the object of the action of the mental consciousness.üîΩThe object of apprehension is the object of the action of the sense faculty, and the other is the object of the action of the mental consciousness.üîΩThe object of apprehension is the object of the action of the sense faculty, and the other is the object of the action of the mental consciousness.üîΩThe object of apprehension is the object of the action of the sense faculty, and the other is the object of the action of the mental consciousness.üîΩThe object of apprehension is the object of the action of the sense faculty, and the other is the object of the action of the mental consciousness.

original: don byed nus pa'i shes pa ni ngo bo nyid kyis rtogs par byed pa ni don bya myong ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: don byed nus pa'i shes pa ni ngo bo nyid kyis rtogs par byed pa ni don bya myong ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The cognition that is able to perform a function is the experiencer of the object that is to be experienced, by virtue of its own nature.

original: so sor snang bzhin pa de nyid myang bya myong byed gang yin ba de ni de myong ba ste /
analyzed: so sor snang bzhin pa de nyid myang bya myong byed gang yin ba de ni de myong ba ste /
translated: That very thing which appears individually as the object to be experienced and the experiencer is the experience of that.

original: de'i 'dzin byed las gzhan gyi shes pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to ;
analyzed: de'i 'dzin byed las gzhan gyi shes pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to ;
translated: The meaning is: it is a cognition that is different from the apprehender of that.

original: / de nyid dam shes pa zhes bya ba brtag pa gsum pa yin par bstan pa ni 'on te de yang myong zhes bya ba'am /üîΩgzhan zhes bya ba'i don gyi bdag nyid yin nam ci zhes bya ba ni de'i 'og tu yang mtha' gsal bar byed pa'i phyir don bya ba ste don sgrub par byed pa ni tha dad ba yin pa'am /
analyzed: / de nyid dam shes pa zhes bya ba brtag pa gsum pa yin par bstan pa ni 'on te de yang myong zhes bya ba'am / gzhan zhes bya ba'i don gyi bdag nyid yin nam ci zhes bya ba ni de'i 'og tu yang mtha' gsal bar byed pa'i phyir don bya ba ste don sgrub par byed pa ni tha dad ba yin pa'am /
translated: The third chapter is called ‚ÄúExamination of Reality‚Äù or ‚ÄúExamination of Cognition.‚ÄùüîΩThe meaning of ‚Äúor‚Äù is ‚Äúor else.‚Äù The meaning of ‚Äúwhat‚Äù is ‚Äúwhat is the nature of that?‚Äù

original: don gyi ngo bo 'am de'i shes pa gzhan gyi ngo bo yin par yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don gyi ngo bo 'am de'i shes pa gzhan gyi ngo bo yin par yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: the performance of an object, the accomplishment of an object, is different, or else the nature of the object or the nature of the cognition of that is different.

original: rgyu rnams ni gdon mi za bar 'bras bu dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i rigs pas 'khrul par mngon par 'dod pa'i shes pa la yang don byed pa med pa tsam gyis /
analyzed: rgyu rnams ni gdon mi za bar 'bras bu dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i rigs pas 'khrul par mngon par 'dod pa'i shes pa la yang don byed pa med pa tsam gyis /
translated: The reason is that it is not the case that a cognition that is accepted as mistaken is ascertained as only untrue by the mere nonperformance of a function.

original: mi bden pa kho nar nges par byed pa ma yin par bstan pa ni de'i bya ba don gzhan la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi bden pa kho nar nges par byed pa ma yin par bstan pa ni de'i bya ba don gzhan la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement that the function of that is for another object is as follows.

original: gal te gzhan zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi'o //
analyzed: gal te gzhan zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAnother‚Äù is the form.

original: rang myang ba la yang zhes bya ba ni gzugs rig pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: rang myang ba la yang zhes bya ba ni gzugs rig pa la yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúAlso in self-tasting‚Äù is also in the cognition of form.

original: de ni myong yang ni reg bya rig pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: de ni myong yang ni reg bya rig pa la yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù is also in the cognition of touch.

original: 'khrul pa la yang ste rig pa'i shes pa la yang yongs su tshim par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pa la yang ste rig pa'i shes pa la yang yongs su tshim par 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúAlso in error‚Äù is also in the cognition of awareness.

original: dgun smad kyi dus su mkhris pa'i rims kyis grang ba'i reg pa yang dro ba yin par snang bar bstan pa ni grang ba'i dus su zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dgun smad kyi dus su mkhris pa'i rims kyis grang ba'i reg pa yang dro ba yin par snang bar bstan pa ni grang ba'i dus su zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The statement that in the winter season, the cold touch of bile fever appears as warm is ‚ÄúIn the cold season.‚Äù

original: dgun smad la ni grang ba'i reg pas gzhan la gnod par mthong gi rims nad can la yang dro bar tshor bar yod pas yongs su tshim par byed par brjod pa yin no ;
analyzed: dgun smad la ni grang ba'i reg pas gzhan la gnod par mthong gi rims nad can la yang dro bar tshor bar yod pas yongs su tshim par byed par brjod pa yin no ;
translated: In the late winter, one sees that the cold touch harms others, but it is also felt as warm by one who has a fever, so it is said to satisfy.

original: ; tshad mar gyur pa nyid kyi myong ba ni yongs su tshim par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: ; tshad mar gyur pa nyid kyi myong ba ni yongs su tshim par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: If the experience of a valid cognition satisfies,üîΩit is not independent.

original: rang dbang ni ma yin no zhe na myong ba tshad ma yin na ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang dbang ni ma yin no zhe na myong ba tshad ma yin na ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If the experience is valid,üîΩthen the experience of one with an eye disease would also be valid.

original: de la yang skyon can zhes bya ba ni rab rib can gyi blo yang dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la yang skyon can zhes bya ba ni rab rib can gyi blo yang dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The fault is that the cognition of one with an eye disease would also have an object.

original: yongs su tshim pa bzhin du lhag par smos pa yang de la myong par 'gyur bar bstan pa ni don du mi smos pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su tshim pa bzhin du lhag par smos pa yang de la myong par 'gyur bar bstan pa ni don du mi smos pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The additional point is like satisfaction. The statement that it is taught that one will experience the result is ‚Äúnot mentioned as the meaning.‚Äù

original: kun sgrub byed ces bya ba ni rab rib can gyi myong ba yang ngo //
analyzed: kun sgrub byed ces bya ba ni rab rib can gyi myong ba yang ngo //
translated: The proof is that the experience of one with an eye disease is also like that.

original: bshad pa yin no zhes bya ba ni myong ba la gzhan dbang yin gyi rang dbang ma yin par ro //
analyzed: bshad pa yin no zhes bya ba ni myong ba la gzhan dbang yin gyi rang dbang ma yin par ro //
translated: The statement ‚Äúit is explained‚Äù means that experience is dependent on another, not independent.

original: de nyid bstan pa ni gzhan yang nyams su myong ba zhes bya ba @10b la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa ni gzhan yang nyams su myong ba zhes bya ba @10b la sogs pa'o //
translated: That itself is taught: ‚ÄúMoreover, experience . . .‚Äù and so on.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni thun mong dang thun mong ma yin pa dag go //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni thun mong dang thun mong ma yin pa dag go //
translated: ‚ÄúThose‚Äù refers to the common and uncommon.

original: ci'i phyir nyams su myod ba med ce na /üîΩgang phyir mngon sum rjes dpag gis //
analyzed: ci'i phyir nyams su myod ba med ce na / gang phyir mngon sum rjes dpag gis //
translated: Why is there no experience?

original: zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúBecause of direct perception and inference . . .‚Äù

original: gal te rang gi mthong ba la rjes su dpag pa yin pa de lta na gang la yin zhe na spyi'i yul can ni 'dra ba'i yul can no //
analyzed: gal te rang gi mthong ba la rjes su dpag pa yin pa de lta na gang la yin zhe na spyi'i yul can ni 'dra ba'i yul can no //
translated: If it is an inference from one‚Äôs own seeing, then what is it? It is an object of a universal, an object of a similar object.

original: khyad par rig pa min pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid rig pa min pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par rig pa min pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid rig pa min pa'o //
translated: It is not a cognition of a particular, it is not a cognition of an individual characteristic.

original: rig bcas zhes bya ba la rig pa ste /
analyzed: rig bcas zhes bya ba la rig pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúAlong with cognition‚Äù means

original: tshad ma dang lhan cig 'jug pa tshad ma dang lhan cig pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshad ma dang lhan cig 'jug pa tshad ma dang lhan cig pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: that it operates together with a valid cognition, it has a valid cognition, is the meaning.

original: gang gis rig ce na rab rib can gyis so //
analyzed: gang gis rig ce na rab rib can gyis so //
translated: By whom is it cognized? By one with cataracts.

original: rab rib can ma yin pas rig pa ni thams cad kyis rig par byed do zhes pa mi rigs par bstan pa ni rab rib can gyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rab rib can ma yin pas rig pa ni thams cad kyis rig par byed do zhes pa mi rigs par bstan pa ni rab rib can gyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúIt is not reasonable to say that the awareness of the absence of floaters is produced by all‚Äù is explained in the following.

original: ka ba 'dzin pa ni rab rib can gyi dmigs bya ma yin pa'i mtshon pa'o //üîΩcung zad kyang dmigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i 'og tu gzhan gyi dmigs bya zhes rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: ka ba 'dzin pa ni rab rib can gyi dmigs bya ma yin pa'i mtshon pa'o // cung zad kyang dmigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i 'og tu gzhan gyi dmigs bya zhes rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe awareness of the absence of floaters‚Äù is a reference to something that is not perceived by someone with an eye disease.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúis not perceived at all‚Äù is followed by the phrase ‚Äúthe object of the awareness of someone else,‚Äù which is understood.

original: mngon sum nyid kyis gzhan gyi dmigs bya nyid dgag pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: mngon sum nyid kyis gzhan gyi dmigs bya nyid dgag pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúby the awareness of the absence of floaters‚Äù is to be supplied.

original: ji lta bu zhig ce na gzhan gyis dmigs par bya ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ji lta bu zhig ce na gzhan gyis dmigs par bya ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: What is that? The phrase ‚Äúthe object of the awareness of someone else‚Äù and so on.

original: yul ma yin pa'i phyir ni mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul ma yin pa'i phyir ni mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause it is not an object‚Äù means because it does not appear.

original: de'i ni gzhan gyi dmigs par bya ba nyid kyi'o //
analyzed: de'i ni gzhan gyi dmigs par bya ba nyid kyi'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause it is the object of the awareness of someone else‚Äù is to be supplied.

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dmigs bya yin pa'i phyir dngos po gzhan gyi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dmigs bya yin pa'i phyir dngos po gzhan gyi ngo bo'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat‚Äù refers to the nature of another thing, because it is the object of the awareness of someone else.

original: gal te nges dngos po'i ngo bo mi dmigs pa de lta na ci zhig dmigs par byed ce na dmigs bzhin pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te nges dngos po'i ngo bo mi dmigs pa de lta na ci zhig dmigs par byed ce na dmigs bzhin pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: If non-apprehension of the nature of an entity is like that, then what is apprehended? It is what is being apprehended.

original: dmigs bzhin pa nyid ma dmigs na dngos po dmigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dmigs bzhin pa nyid ma dmigs na dngos po dmigs pa ma yin no //
translated: If what is being apprehended is not apprehended, then an entity is not apprehended.

original: de gal te dmigs na de kho na dmigs pa yin gyi dngos po ni ma yin no zhe na gang zhig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de gal te dmigs na de kho na dmigs pa yin gyi dngos po ni ma yin no zhe na gang zhig ces bya ba'o //
translated: If it is apprehended, then it is that which is apprehended, not an entity.

original: rang rang gi dmigs bya nyid ma gtogs pa ma dmigs pa'i phyir dang / de kho na dngos po yin gyi gzhan ma yin par bstan pa ni dmigs pa las tha dad pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang rang gi dmigs bya nyid ma gtogs pa ma dmigs pa'i phyir dang / de kho na dngos po yin gyi gzhan ma yin par bstan pa ni dmigs pa las tha dad pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because of non-apprehension except for each object of apprehension, and because it is taught that that is an entity and not something else, it is said, ‚Äúapart from the object of apprehension.‚Äù

original: phyi rol gyi don mi byed pa ni bde na mod kyi cung zad nyams su myong ba kho na sngon po la sogs pa'i snad ba dang / chags pa la sogs pa myong pa'i ngo bo'i don gyi bya ba byed kyi cung zad ni mi byed do zhes nus pa dang /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don mi byed pa ni bde na mod kyi cung zad nyams su myong ba kho na sngon po la sogs pa'i snad ba dang / chags pa la sogs pa myong pa'i ngo bo'i don gyi bya ba byed kyi cung zad ni mi byed do zhes nus pa dang /
translated: The non-performance of external objects is indeed pleasant, but only a little experience, the performance of the function of an object with the nature of experience of the aspect of blue, etc., and attachment, etc., performs a little, but not all.

original: cig shos dag gis yod pa dang med pa'i rnam par gzhag pa'o snyam du sems pa ni ci ste myong ba rnams zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: cig shos dag gis yod pa dang med pa'i rnam par gzhag pa'o snyam du sems pa ni ci ste myong ba rnams zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The other think that it is a matter of existence and non-existence.

original: phyogs 'di la rang rig pa'i shes pa @11a * //
analyzed: phyogs 'di la rang rig pa'i shes pa @11a * //
translated: In this case, there is no obscurity for the consciousness that is self-knowing.

original: la lkog tu gyur pa med pas yul de la rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir gnyis nyid nyams pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: la lkog tu gyur pa med pas yul de la rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir gnyis nyid nyams pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: Since there is no inference in regard to that object, the two are lost. This is what is taught by the words:

original: rang rig tsam gyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang rig tsam gyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn the case of mere self-knowing . . .‚Äù

original: rgyud gzhan gyi shes pa lkog tu gyur pa'i yul de la rjes su dpag par 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa la shes gnyis rgyu 'bras bor yang zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: rgyud gzhan gyi shes pa lkog tu gyur pa'i yul de la rjes su dpag par 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa la shes gnyis rgyu 'bras bor yang zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: One may think that the consciousness of another person is an object that is obscure, and that it is inferred. The words: ‚ÄúEven if the two cognitions are cause and effect‚Äù refer to this.

original: 'bras bu mthong ba las rgyud gzhan gyi shes pa rjes su dpog par byed la 'bras bu nyid kyang 'ga' zhig gis rang gi rgyud la gzung bar bya ba de yang rang rig pa tsam gyis 'dzin par mi byed cing gzhan rig pa'i shes pa ni ma yin
analyzed: 'bras bu mthong ba las rgyud gzhan gyi shes pa rjes su dpog par byed la 'bras bu nyid kyang 'ga' zhig gis rang gi rgyud la gzung bar bya ba de yang rang rig pa tsam gyis 'dzin par mi byed cing gzhan rig pa'i shes pa ni ma yin
translated: From the seeing of the effect, one infers the consciousness of another person. But the effect itself is not apprehended by anyone in his own stream of consciousness. And that which is to be apprehended is not apprehended by mere self-knowing; it is not a consciousness that knows another.

original: te / gang gi phyir de nyid gzhan du 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: te / gang gi phyir de nyid gzhan du 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: because it does not change into something else.

original: 'bras bu rig par byed pa'i dus na rgyu snga rol du mngon sum gyis shes pa dran pa las nyams su myong ba'i bag chags las 'byung ngo snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: 'bras bu rig par byed pa'i dus na rgyu snga rol du mngon sum gyis shes pa dran pa las nyams su myong ba'i bag chags las 'byung ngo snyam du sems pa la /
translated: When the effect is known, the cause is known from the memory of the experience that arises from the latent impressions.

original: gal te rgyu nyid rjes dpag gis //
analyzed: gal te rgyu nyid rjes dpag gis //
translated: If the cause is inferred,

original: zhes bya ba las so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba las so //
translated: as stated.

original: ji ltar nyams su myong ba dran pa las te /üîΩdran pa yang de'i dus nyid la //
analyzed: ji ltar nyams su myong ba dran pa las te / dran pa yang de'i dus nyid la //
translated: How is it known from the memory of the experience?

original: zhes bya ba'i rigs pas dran pa snga rol du byung ba ma yin zhing /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i rigs pas dran pa snga rol du byung ba ma yin zhing /
translated: And memory is not prior to that.üîΩBy the reasoning that memory is not prior to that, it is shown that the cause of consciousness does not exist at the time of the effect.

original: shes pa'i rgyu 'bras bu'i dus na ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni de tshe zhes bya ba ni de'i dus te da lta ni ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shes pa'i rgyu 'bras bu'i dus na ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni de tshe zhes bya ba ni de'i dus te da lta ni ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúAt that time‚Äù means at that time, not now.

original: de'i dran pa da ltar ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: de'i dran pa da ltar ba ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt its memory present?üîΩTherefore, it too is reality.

original: de'i phyir de yang de kho na nyid yin no snyam du sems pa la sngar ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de yang de kho na nyid yin no snyam du sems pa la sngar ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúPreviously‚Äù is in response to that.

original: de'i shes pa dang ldan pa yin yang de de'i ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i shes pa dang ldan pa yin yang de de'i ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the cognition of that.

original: gang gi phyir shes pa yod pa nyid kyi phyir shes bya yang thams cad du yod pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gang gi phyir shes pa yod pa nyid kyi phyir shes bya yang thams cad du yod pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: And because cognition exists, it is shown that the object of cognition does not exist at all:

original: de'i shes da ltar yod min na //
analyzed: de'i shes da ltar yod min na //
translated: Its cognition does not exist now.

original: zhes bya ba ste de'i shes pa ni rgyu'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste de'i shes pa ni rgyu'i shes pa'o //
translated: The cognition of that is the cognition of the cause.

original: gang gi tshe na yod pa de'i tshe rjes su dpog par byed pa yin no snyam du sems pa la snga ma nyid du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe na yod pa de'i tshe rjes su dpog par byed pa yin no snyam du sems pa la snga ma nyid du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: When it exists, then it is inferred.

original: snga rol du mngon sum gyis rig na rjes su dpag pa don med par bstan pa ni /üîΩmin te mngon sum gyis rig phyir //
analyzed: snga rol du mngon sum gyis rig na rjes su dpag pa don med par bstan pa ni / min te mngon sum gyis rig phyir //
translated: If it is known by direct perception prior to that, it is shown that inference is pointless:

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Not, because it is known by direct perception.

original: mngon sum gyis rig pa la yang snga rol nyid ni mngon sum gyis mi rig ste /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis rig pa la yang snga rol nyid ni mngon sum gyis mi rig ste /
translated: If it is known by direct perception, then prior to that it is not known by direct perception.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i yul yin no snyam du sems pa la /üîΩde la rjes su dpag pa yis //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i yul yin no snyam du sems pa la / de la rjes su dpag pa yis //
translated: It is thought that it is the object of inference.üîΩIn that case, it is said:

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: By inference.

original: rang rig pa tsam gyi ngo bo'i drin pa des sngar gyi 'bras bu nyid du shes par mi byed par bstan pa ni des de zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang rig pa tsam gyi ngo bo'i drin pa des sngar gyi 'bras bu nyid du shes par mi byed par bstan pa ni des de zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúby that‚Äù indicates that one should not understand the result to be the entity of mere self-awareness.

original: da ni da ltar ba'i rtog ge ba rnams dga' ba'i @11b ched du gzhal bya'i rnam rtog bstan pa ni /
analyzed: da ni da ltar ba'i rtog ge ba rnams dga' ba'i @11b ched du gzhal bya'i rnam rtog bstan pa ni /
translated: Now, in order to delight the logicians of the present day, the author teaches the concept of the object of comprehension:

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po 'di //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po 'di //
translated: This entity of cause and effect

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: is not tenable.

original: med pa'i skye ba rtogs na rta'i rva yang rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: med pa'i skye ba rtogs na rta'i rva yang rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: If one understands the arising of what is nonexistent, one will understand the horn of a rabbit.

original: snga na med pa zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i kho na'i khyad par la khyad par ma rtogs na /
analyzed: snga na med pa zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i kho na'i khyad par la khyad par ma rtogs na /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúprior nonexistence‚Äù is a qualifier of ‚Äúarising.‚Äù If one does not understand the qualifier,üîΩhow could one understand the qualified?

original: med pa ci ltar khyad par du ma byas kyang snga na med pa ma yin par bstan pa ni mthong ba blo la gnas pa'i skye ba yin na /
analyzed: med pa ci ltar khyad par du ma byas kyang snga na med pa ma yin par bstan pa ni mthong ba blo la gnas pa'i skye ba yin na /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúprior nonexistence‚Äù is taught to indicate that if arising is present to the mind,

original: snga na med pa shes par mi rigs te skye ba la khyad par du /üîΩgtan med pa las ldog pa'i phyir //
analyzed: snga na med pa shes par mi rigs te skye ba la khyad par du / gtan med pa las ldog pa'i phyir //
translated: it is not tenable to understand prior nonexistence.üîΩThis is because it is a qualifier of arising.

original: zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúit is not tenable‚Äù is as follows.

original: de bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de bstan pa ni /
translated: This is taught:

original: ji srid skye ba ma yin ba //
analyzed: ji srid skye ba ma yin ba //
translated: As long as there is no arising,

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus.

original: 'jim pa'i gong bu dang / dbyibs la sogs pa rgyur mngon par 'dod par khyad par du ma byas pa nyid kyi med pa 'bras bus stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo ni rgyu rtogs pa nyid kyi rtogs pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: 'jim pa'i gong bu dang / dbyibs la sogs pa rgyur mngon par 'dod par khyad par du ma byas pa nyid kyi med pa 'bras bus stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo ni rgyu rtogs pa nyid kyi rtogs pa de'i phyir /
translated: Since the clay lump and shape, etc. are not distinguished as causes, the nature of the non-existence of the effect is empty, and since the nature of the effect is empty, the cause is not established.

original: phan tshun brten pa ma yin no snyam du sems pa ni gal te 'bras bus stong pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phan tshun brten pa ma yin no snyam du sems pa ni gal te 'bras bus stong pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, they are not mutually dependent.

original: lan btab zin to zhes bya ba ni skad cig pa dang / cig shos kyi phyogs dag la rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa med par ro //
analyzed: lan btab zin to zhes bya ba ni skad cig pa dang / cig shos kyi phyogs dag la rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa med par ro //
translated: The response has already been given, that is, in the case of the momentary and non-momentary positions, there is no positive or negative concomitance.

original: gal te yang 'bras bu stong pa'i ngo bo snga na med pa la 'bras bu ni thal ches pa yin yang gtan med pa la ni thal ches pa ma yin no snyam du sems pa la ni snga na med pa zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: gal te yang 'bras bu stong pa'i ngo bo snga na med pa la 'bras bu ni thal ches pa yin yang gtan med pa la ni thal ches pa ma yin no snyam du sems pa la ni snga na med pa zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: If you think that the effect is empty of an essence that is not previously existent, then the effect is an overextension, but if it is completely non-existent, then it is not an overextension.

original: 'bras bu nyid la sogs pa med na thams cad med par thal bar 'gyur bas rtogs pa la 'gal ba yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu nyid la sogs pa med na thams cad med par thal bar 'gyur bas rtogs pa la 'gal ba yod pa ma yin te /
translated: If the effect and so on do not exist, then everything would be nonexistent. Therefore, there is no contradiction in the cognition.

original: rtogs pa ni sngon po la sogs pa nyid tsam gyi yul yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa la de'i phyir tshad yod ces bya ba smos so //
analyzed: rtogs pa ni sngon po la sogs pa nyid tsam gyi yul yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa la de'i phyir tshad yod ces bya ba smos so //
translated: Because the object of cognition is just blue and so on.

original: med pa skye na thams cad las skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: med pa skye na thams cad las skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: If the nonexistent were to arise, then everything would arise,

original: nye ba dang ring ba dag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye ba dang ring ba dag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there would be no difference between the near and the far.üîΩIf it exists, then it is the effect of the existent because it is the effect of that.

original: yod na yang de nyid 'bras bu nyid yin pa'i phyir yod pa'i 'bras bu yin no snyam du sems pa ni ji ste yang yod pa nyid 'bras bu yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yod na yang de nyid 'bras bu nyid yin pa'i phyir yod pa'i 'bras bu yin no snyam du sems pa ni ji ste yang yod pa nyid 'bras bu yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If the existent were the effect,

original: kha cig tu yod pa dang med pa dag kho na nye ba dang ring ba dag yin gyi /
analyzed: kha cig tu yod pa dang med pa dag kho na nye ba dang ring ba dag yin gyi /
translated: then sometimes the existent and the nonexistent alone would be the near and the far,üîΩbut others would not.

original: gzhan dag ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni bltas mnyan zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni bltas mnyan zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is taught by ‚Äúlooking and listening.‚Äù

original: dbang phyug rgyu yin pa'i phyogs la ltos nas byed pa ni med pa la mi srid pa ma yin nam zhes bstan pa ni gal te dbang phyug ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: dbang phyug rgyu yin pa'i phyogs la ltos nas byed pa ni med pa la mi srid pa ma yin nam zhes bstan pa ni gal te dbang phyug ces bya ba'o //
translated: In response to the position that ƒ™≈õvara is the cause, it is taught that ‚Äúit is impossible for an effect to exist when its cause does not exist.‚Äù

original: dbang po las 'das blo zhes bya ba de'i tshe 'bras bu med kyang dbang po las 'das pa mthong bas bzung ba ni rgyu nges pa'i sbyor bas byed pa kho na'o @12a * //
analyzed: dbang po las 'das blo zhes bya ba de'i tshe 'bras bu med kyang dbang po las 'das pa mthong bas bzung ba ni rgyu nges pa'i sbyor bas byed pa kho na'o @12a * //
translated: If ƒ™≈õvara is the cause of the effect, then at that time, even though the effect does not exist, it is apprehended by seeing that which is beyond the senses.

original: zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of this is that it is only ƒ™≈õvara who is the cause.

original: de lta yin yang med pa la yang byed pa yod na yod pa'i 'bras bu zhes smras pa dang dbang phyug dang bcas pa dang / dbang phyug med pas ci zhig bya //
analyzed: de lta yin yang med pa la yang byed pa yod na yod pa'i 'bras bu zhes smras pa dang dbang phyug dang bcas pa dang / dbang phyug med pas ci zhig bya //
translated: Even if that is so, if it is said that ‚Äúthe effect exists when the cause does not exist,‚Äù then what is the point of positing ƒ™≈õvara and the absence of ƒ™≈õvara?

original: zhes gsal bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: zhes gsal bar bstan pa ni /
translated: This is clearly taught.

original: 'dir yang 'bras zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang 'bras zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Here also, ‚Äúthe effect‚Äù is what is referred to.

original: gsal ba kho nar bshad pa ni ci thams cad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: gsal ba kho nar bshad pa ni ci thams cad ces bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation that is clearly stated is ‚Äúwhat?‚Äù

original: dbang phyug med pa dang / dbang phyug dang bcas pa gsal bar byed pa cig med pa nyid la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dbang phyug med pa dang / dbang phyug dang bcas pa gsal bar byed pa cig med pa nyid la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe absence of ƒ™≈õvara‚Äù and ‚Äúthe presence of ƒ™≈õvara‚Äù are clearly stated as ‚Äúthe absence of a cause.‚Äù

original: thams cad yod na ni zhes bya ba ni dbang phyug dang bcas pa dang / cig shos dag la mtshungs so //
analyzed: thams cad yod na ni zhes bya ba ni dbang phyug dang bcas pa dang / cig shos dag la mtshungs so //
translated: If everything exists, then the same is true of the other, i.e., the non-omniscient.

original: lan du phyogs gnyis la mtshungs par bstan pa ni thams cad kyi tshe zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan du phyogs gnyis la mtshungs par bstan pa ni thams cad kyi tshe zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The reply is that the same is true of both positions, i.e., the omniscient and the non-omniscient.

original: 'bras bu'i yod pa dang med pa nyid brtag par byas nas rgyu'i brtag pa byed pa ni med pa'i rgyu las te zhig pa las so //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i yod pa dang med pa nyid brtag par byas nas rgyu'i brtag pa byed pa ni med pa'i rgyu las te zhig pa las so //
translated: Having examined the existence and non-existence of the effect, he examines the cause: ‚ÄúFrom a non-existent cause, i.e., from a destroyed cause.

original: snga na med pa zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'i snga rol du zhig pa'i phyir snga na med pa ni rgyu'i'o //
analyzed: snga na med pa zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'i snga rol du zhig pa'i phyir snga na med pa ni rgyu'i'o //
translated: ‚Äù ‚ÄúPrior non-existence‚Äù is the prior non-existence of the effect.

original: 'di rnams ni sngar ma byung pa rgyur 'dod pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams ni sngar ma byung pa rgyur 'dod pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: These are the views of those who maintain that the cause is something that did not exist previously.

original: yod pa ni rang gi dus bzhin du phyis kyang rgyu ma yin la /üîΩmed pa ni sngar byung ba bzhin du rgyu rnams su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yod pa ni rang gi dus bzhin du phyis kyang rgyu ma yin la / med pa ni sngar byung ba bzhin du rgyu rnams su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúAn existent cause does not produce an effect, just as it does not at a later time.

original: gang byung 'di rnams de byed pa //
analyzed: gang byung 'di rnams de byed pa //
translated: A non-existent cause does not produce an effect, just as a cause that has arisen does not.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba'i rigs pa bstan pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i rigs pa bstan pa ni /
translated: The argument is stated:üîΩ‚ÄúIf it is the nature of these that they produce,

original: de ste rang bzhin byed yin na //
analyzed: de ste rang bzhin byed yin na //
translated: If it is the nature of these that they produce,

original: 'bras bu 'byung ba'i dus su yin gyi /
analyzed: 'bras bu 'byung ba'i dus su yin gyi /
translated: The effect exists at the time of the arising of the effect,

original: rgyu'i ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu'i ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i rim pa'o //
translated: but not at the time of the cause.

original: de'i phyir 'di la dus mtshungs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i skyon med pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di la dus mtshungs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i skyon med pa ste /
translated: Therefore, there is no fault in saying that the effect exists at the time of the cause,

original: 'bras bu'i dus ni med pa ni rgyu nyid du ma rig gis pa yin la /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i dus ni med pa ni rgyu nyid du ma rig gis pa yin la /
translated: because the effect that does not exist at the time of the cause is not a cause.

original: de'i dus su yod pa yang rgyu nyid ji ltar yin /
analyzed: de'i dus su yod pa yang rgyu nyid ji ltar yin /
translated: And how can that which exists at that time be a cause?

original: rgyu bzhin du re ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu bzhin du re ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: The meaning is that it is not a cause because it is not required, as is the case with the cause.üîΩIs it not the case that the consciousness that appears prior to the effect sometimes is the cause of the effect, since it is the cause of the effect that is similar to it?

original: sngon rol snang ba'i shes pa res 'ga' ba ni dbang po la sogs pa la med pa'i rgyu rang dang rjes su mthun pa rtogs par byed pa ma yin nam zhes the tshom za ba ni ji ste yang shes pa'i zhes bya ba ni snga mar zhes byaüîΩba ni snga rol tu byung ba ste /
analyzed: sngon rol snang ba'i shes pa res 'ga' ba ni dbang po la sogs pa la med pa'i rgyu rang dang rjes su mthun pa rtogs par byed pa ma yin nam zhes the tshom za ba ni ji ste yang shes pa'i zhes bya ba ni snga mar zhes bya ba ni snga rol tu byung ba ste /
translated: The doubt is resolved by saying, ‚ÄúIf the effect existed prior to the cause, it would not be the effect of that cause.‚ÄùüîΩThe effect that exists prior to the cause is not the effect of that cause.

original: 'bras bu de nyid ni rjes su dpag pas rtogs pa'i don gyis yod pa'i 'bras bu ni de'i ngo bo ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu de nyid ni rjes su dpag pas rtogs pa'i don gyis yod pa'i 'bras bu ni de'i ngo bo ste /
translated: The effect that exists prior to the cause is not the effect of that cause.üîΩThe effect that exists prior to the cause is not the effect of that cause.

original: rjes su dpag pas ni 'di rtogs par mi byed de mngon sum gyi yul yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas ni 'di rtogs par mi byed de mngon sum gyi yul yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is not understood by inference, because it is the object of direct perception.

original: rtogs bzhin pa'i mngon sum gyi 'bras bu 'di ni de med na mi 'byung ngo zhes ldog pa las don grub pa yin te /
analyzed: rtogs bzhin pa'i mngon sum gyi 'bras bu 'di ni de med na mi 'byung ngo zhes ldog pa las don grub pa yin te /
translated: The result of direct perception, which is in the process of being understood, is established by the object, from the exclusion of that which is not the cause of it.

original: 'di rjes su dpag pa @12b par bya ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di rjes su dpag pa @12b par bya ba ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not to be inferred,

original: mngon sum pa yin pa'i phyir mngon sum gyi yang ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum pa yin pa'i phyir mngon sum gyi yang ma yin te /
translated: nor is it to be directly perceived, because it is direct perception.

original: de med na zhes rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de med na zhes rtogs pa yin te /
translated: It is understood from the exclusion of that which is not the cause of it.

original: lkog tu gyur pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs kyi don to //
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs kyi don to //
translated: The meaning of the word ‚Äúconcealed‚Äù is the meaning of the word ‚Äústate.‚Äù

original: rjes su dpag pas kyang rang gi ngo bo rtogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas kyang rang gi ngo bo rtogs pa ma yin te /
translated: Inference does not understand its own nature,

original: mngon par zhen pa tsam yin te zhes bstan pa ni rtogs par gyur pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa tsam yin te zhes bstan pa ni rtogs par gyur pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: because it is merely an adherence to the object.

original: dngos po'i ngo bo gnyis la gsal ba ni mngon sum gyi yul yin la /
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bo gnyis la gsal ba ni mngon sum gyi yul yin la /
translated: The object of direct perception is the two natures of an entity.

original: mi gsal ba ni rjes su dpag pa'i yul yin no snyam du sems pa ni rnam pa mi gsal ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi gsal ba ni rjes su dpag pa'i yul yin no snyam du sems pa ni rnam pa mi gsal ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The thought that the unclear is the object of inference is called the unclear aspect.

original: mngon sum gyi ngo bo'i bdag nyid kho na cig shos kyang ngo zhes mngon sum la ngo bo gnyis su snang bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ni mngon sum de zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi ngo bo'i bdag nyid kho na cig shos kyang ngo zhes mngon sum la ngo bo gnyis su snang bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ni mngon sum de zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The other, which is the nature of direct perception, is also just that. Thus, there would be two natures in direct perception. This is taught by ‚Äúthat direct perception.‚Äù

original: gal te yang gnyi ga lan cig snang ba ma yin te tshu rol dang pha rol gyi cha bzhin du rim gyis rtogs kyang mngon sum kho na yin par bstan pa ni rang bzhin gnyis ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gal te yang gnyi ga lan cig snang ba ma yin te tshu rol dang pha rol gyi cha bzhin du rim gyis rtogs kyang mngon sum kho na yin par bstan pa ni rang bzhin gnyis ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Moreover, if both are not perceived at once, but are understood sequentially, like the parts of the near and far sides, it is still direct perception. This is taught by ‚Äúthe two natures.‚Äù

original: rjes su dpag pa yang mi gsal ba'i dngos po'i ngo bo la reg pas mngon sum nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yang mi gsal ba'i dngos po'i ngo bo la reg pas mngon sum nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Inference would also become direct perception, because it touches the nature of an unclear thing. This is the meaning.

original: khyad par gyi dbang gis ni thag ring ba dang nye ba dag gi'o //
analyzed: khyad par gyi dbang gis ni thag ring ba dang nye ba dag gi'o //
translated: The difference is due to the power of distance and proximity.

original: ngo bo gnyis las lhag pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo nyid rtogs pa ma yin par bstan pa ni gal te khyad par tha dad pas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ngo bo gnyis las lhag pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo nyid rtogs pa ma yin par bstan pa ni gal te khyad par tha dad pas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement that the nature of a thing is not realized as something that is more than the two natures is ‚ÄúIf it is different because of a distinction.‚Äù

original: rjes su dpag pas zhes bya ba ni mngon sum bzhin du dngos po'i ngo bo snang ba'i phyir shes pa dbang po las skyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas zhes bya ba ni mngon sum bzhin du dngos po'i ngo bo snang ba'i phyir shes pa dbang po las skyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBy inference‚Äù means that because the nature of a thing appears as if it were perceived, the cognition would arise from the sense faculty.

original: dbang po la sogs pa rtag tu rjes su dpag par bya ba /
analyzed: dbang po la sogs pa rtag tu rjes su dpag par bya ba /
translated: The sense faculty and so on are always inferred.üîΩWhen one infers, one infers that it is not connected to the sense faculty. Just as one infers in that way, one does not infer in this case, the domain of engagement.

original: rjes su dpog bzhin pa na dbang po dang 'brel pa ma yin par rjes su dpog par byed pa ji lta ba de kho na bzhin du 'jug pa'i yul 'di la yang rjes su dpog par byed pa ma yin no snyam du sems pa ni ji ste dbangüîΩpo dang 'brel pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpog bzhin pa na dbang po dang 'brel pa ma yin par rjes su dpog par byed pa ji lta ba de kho na bzhin du 'jug pa'i yul 'di la yang rjes su dpog par byed pa ma yin no snyam du sems pa ni ji ste dbang po dang 'brel pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If one thinks, ‚ÄúHow is it connected to the sense faculty?‚Äù

original: rtag tu rjes su dpog pa bzhin du rjes su dpag pa'i yul gzhan yang 'jug pa'i yul ma yin par 'gyur ba de'i phyir /
analyzed: rtag tu rjes su dpog pa bzhin du rjes su dpag pa'i yul gzhan yang 'jug pa'i yul ma yin par 'gyur ba de'i phyir /
translated: Because it is always inferred, the domain of engagement is not the domain of inference.

original: 'jug par byed pa ma yin pa'i rjes su dpag pa tshad mar 'gyur ba ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'jug par byed pa ma yin pa'i rjes su dpag pa tshad mar 'gyur ba ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The following verse shows that an inference which does not engage in the object is not a valid cognition.

original: de la 'jug pa don med yin //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la 'jug pa don med yin // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is useless to engage in it.

original: rtag pa'i rjes su dpag pa ni 'jug par byed pa'i rjes su dpag pa la mkho ba nyid du 'dod pa yin la de min na der yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩgal te sangs rgyas pa'i yang mngon sum ni rang gi yul @13a * //
analyzed: rtag pa'i rjes su dpag pa ni 'jug par byed pa'i rjes su dpag pa la mkho ba nyid du 'dod pa yin la de min na der yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to // gal te sangs rgyas pa'i yang mngon sum ni rang gi yul @13a * //
translated: A permanent inference is accepted as being necessary for an inference which engages in the object. If it were not so, it would not be so.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa rig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa rig pa ma yin te /
translated: If you say that a Buddhist's perception does not cognize its object when it is past or future,üîΩbecause it has an object of its own time,

original: rang gi dus kyi yul can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi dus kyi yul can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then if you say that,

original: gal te 'di ni khyed la yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te 'di ni khyed la yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: it is also so for you.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni 'das pa la sogs par snang ba'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni 'das pa la sogs par snang ba'i shes pa'o //
translated: Thus means the consciousness appearing as past, etc.

original: de'i ni sangs rgyas pa'i'o //
analyzed: de'i ni sangs rgyas pa'i'o //
translated: That means the Buddhist's.

original: gzhan las kyang zhes bya ba ni bag chags la sogs pa las kyang ngo //
analyzed: gzhan las kyang zhes bya ba ni bag chags la sogs pa las kyang ngo //
translated: Also from others means also from imprints, etc.

original: mthong ba'i zhes bya ba ni da ltar ba'i rtags te /
analyzed: mthong ba'i zhes bya ba ni da ltar ba'i rtags te /
translated: ‚ÄúSeen‚Äù is the present tense of the verb ‚Äúto see.‚Äù

original: dus gzhan gyi rtags can gyis khyab par byed ces bya ba'i shugs kyis de'i dus na bsgrub par bya ba yod pa yin no //
analyzed: dus gzhan gyi rtags can gyis khyab par byed ces bya ba'i shugs kyis de'i dus na bsgrub par bya ba yod pa yin no //
translated: The meaning is that the present tense of the verb ‚Äúto pervade‚Äù is implied.

original: gal te shes pa zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'o //
analyzed: gal te shes pa zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúKnowledge‚Äù is inference.

original: ji ltar rnam par 'jog pa zhes bya ba ni de shes na me'i shes pa skyed par byed pa'i gzhan du ni ma yin zhes bya ba ni du ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rnam par 'jog pa zhes bya ba ni de shes na me'i shes pa skyed par byed pa'i gzhan du ni ma yin zhes bya ba ni du ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHow is it posited?‚Äù means that when it is known, it produces the knowledge of fire, not otherwise.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa la'o //üîΩsnga ma'i ngo bo nyid kyis rtogs bzhin pa //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa la'o // snga ma'i ngo bo nyid kyis rtogs bzhin pa //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that case‚Äù means in the case of the knowledge of inference.

original: zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is known by the nature of the prior‚Äù means by inference.

original: de ni mi mthong ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pas mngon par zhen pa'i bya ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni mi mthong ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pas mngon par zhen pa'i bya ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not seen‚Äù means that the object of inference is not seen, because the activity of the object of inference is to be conceived.

original: rtogs pa med pa nyid ces bya ba ni rang gi ngo bor ro //
analyzed: rtogs pa med pa nyid ces bya ba ni rang gi ngo bor ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not known‚Äù means that it is not known by itself.

original: lkog tu gyur pa nyid du zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bor ma rtogs pa kho na don lkog tu gyur pa ni the tshom mo //
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa nyid du zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bor ma rtogs pa kho na don lkog tu gyur pa ni the tshom mo //
translated: ‚ÄúConcealed‚Äù means that the nature of the object is not directly perceived.

original: de ni mngon sum nyid ces bya ba ni don gyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro ;üîΩ; the tshom 'brel pa'ang yod ma yin //
analyzed: de ni mngon sum nyid ces bya ba ni don gyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro ; ; the tshom 'brel pa'ang yod ma yin //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is direct perception‚Äù means that it is the nature of the object.üîΩ‚ÄúThere is no connection with doubt‚Äù means that it is not reasonable to doubt all the aspects of something that is being inferred, because it is direct perception.

original: zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bor rjes su dpag pas bdag nyid thams cad nges pa la the tshom za ba ni mi rigs la mngon sum gyis mthong ba la ni nges pa'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir the tshom za'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bor rjes su dpag pas bdag nyid thams cad nges pa la the tshom za ba ni mi rigs la mngon sum gyis mthong ba la ni nges pa'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir the tshom za'o //
translated: But it is reasonable to doubt the nature of something that is seen, because it is direct perception.

original: skad cig pa la sogs pa la ni thal ba las me rjes su dpog pa na zhig pa kho na yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skad cig pa la sogs pa la ni thal ba las me rjes su dpog pa na zhig pa kho na yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the case of inferring fire from smoke, it is only the destruction of the fire that is inferred.

original: mngon sum nyid yin na lkog tu gyur pa nyid ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: mngon sum nyid yin na lkog tu gyur pa nyid ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: ‚ÄúIf it were direct perception, it would not be concealed‚Äù means that it is not reasonable to say that direct perception is concealed.

original: des na lkog tu gyur pa'i don gyi yul can zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na lkog tu gyur pa'i don gyi yul can zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the object of doubt is a concealed object.

original: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni nus pa nyid kho nar dmigs kyis bsal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni nus pa nyid kho nar dmigs kyis bsal bar byed pa'o //
translated: Therefore, only the capacity is ascertained.

original: nus med na zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nus med na zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If there is no capacity, then there is no intrinsic reality.

original: 'bad pas du ba las ldang 'dod pa'i //üîΩsnyan dang gas mkhan po rnams kyi gtso //
analyzed: 'bad pas du ba las ldang 'dod pa'i // snyan dang gas mkhan po rnams kyi gtso //
translated: The one who is desirous of rising from smoke through effortüîΩis the chief of the teachers.

original: rtsod dang skyon dngos las ni rgyal ba'o //
analyzed: rtsod dang skyon dngos las ni rgyal ba'o //
translated: He is victorious over the disputants and the realists.

original: rgyal ba can dag go bar 'gyur //
analyzed: rgyal ba can dag go bar 'gyur //
translated: The victors understand.

original: nus mthong zhes bya ba'i lan bstan pa'i phyir snga ma'i phyogs kyang mthong ba'i yul kho na la ma yin nam /
analyzed: nus mthong zhes bya ba'i lan bstan pa'i phyir snga ma'i phyogs kyang mthong ba'i yul kho na la ma yin nam /
translated: In order to demonstrate the response, ‚ÄúIf the capacity is seen,‚Äù the opponent thinks, ‚ÄúIs the prior position not just the object of seeing?üîΩTherefore, it is appropriate to say that there is no seeing of the nature of direct perception.‚Äù

original: de'i @13b phyir mngon sum gyi ngo bo'i mthong ba med ces bya ba kho na rigs par 'os pa yin no snyam du sems pa la 'di ltar sa bon las zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i @13b phyir mngon sum gyi ngo bo'i mthong ba med ces bya ba kho na rigs par 'os pa yin no snyam du sems pa la 'di ltar sa bon las zhes bya ba ste /
translated: In response to that, ‚ÄúIt is like a seed‚Äù is stated.

original: mthong ba zhes bya ba rang gi ngo bo'i yul can ma yin mod kyi 'on kyang nus pa'i yul can yin la de ni mngon sum ma yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba zhes bya ba rang gi ngo bo'i yul can ma yin mod kyi 'on kyang nus pa'i yul can yin la de ni mngon sum ma yin no //
translated: Although seeing does not have an intrinsic reality as its object, it does have a capacity as its object, and that is not direct perception.

original: des na 'di mthong pa ni rtogs pa'i tshig yin par ji skad bstan pa ste /
analyzed: des na 'di mthong pa ni rtogs pa'i tshig yin par ji skad bstan pa ste /
translated: Therefore, this seeing is a word for realization, as has been taught.

original: rgyu la sogs pa la 'jig rten pa'i rtogs pa yod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgyu la sogs pa la 'jig rten pa'i rtogs pa yod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that there is mundane realization of cause, etc.

original: rnam par dbye ba med par zhes bya ba ni mthong ba dang 'dra bar mthong ba zhes nye bar btags pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par dbye ba med par zhes bya ba ni mthong ba dang 'dra bar mthong ba zhes nye bar btags pa'o //
translated: Without distinction means that, like seeing, it is figuratively designated as seeing.

original: lhag par mos pa ni bstan pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: lhag par mos pa ni bstan pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: Imagining is the conception of the teaching.

original: rnam par rtog pa nyid ni phal cher 'jig rten pa tha snyad du byed pa yin par bstan pa ni dngos 'di bdag gis dran pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa nyid ni phal cher 'jig rten pa tha snyad du byed pa yin par bstan pa ni dngos 'di bdag gis dran pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The nature of conception is mostly mundane conventional activity. This is taught by the phrase, ‚ÄúI remember this thing.‚Äù

original: khyim nas byung nas slar khyim du 'ong ba ni /
analyzed: khyim nas byung nas slar khyim du 'ong ba ni /
translated: Going forth from home and returning to home again

original: dran pa'i ngo bo'i lhag par mos pa'i dbang gis so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dran pa'i ngo bo'i lhag par mos pa'i dbang gis so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: is due to the power of imagining that has the nature of memory. This is the meaning.

original: rnam par gzhag pa thams cad kyi //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa thams cad kyi //
translated: Of all the classifications

original: zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu dang rgyu dang gzung bya dang 'dzin byed kyi ngo bo la sogs pa rnams kyi ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu dang rgyu dang gzung bya dang 'dzin byed kyi ngo bo la sogs pa rnams kyi ste /
translated: means of effect, cause, object apprehended, subject apprehender, etc.

original: mngon sum ni rang gi ngo bo rig pa tsam gyi mthar thug pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum ni rang gi ngo bo rig pa tsam gyi mthar thug pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because direct perception is the ultimate of mere awareness of one's own nature.üîΩThe explanation that the conventional is just the realization by direct perception, which is delightful when not examined, as being like an illusion,

original: sgyu ma lta bur ma brtags na nyams dga' ba'i mngon sum gyis rtogs pa nyid kun rdzob ces 'chad pa ni /
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bur ma brtags na nyams dga' ba'i mngon sum gyis rtogs pa nyid kun rdzob ces 'chad pa ni /
translated: is taught to be contradictory to the definition of the conventional, which is taught as:

original: gang gis rang gi ngo bo yis //
analyzed: gang gis rang gi ngo bo yis //
translated: That which by its own nature

original: gzhan gyi ngo bo sgrib byed pa //üîΩzhes bstan pa'i kun rdzob kyi mtshan nyid dang 'gal ba can yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyi ngo bo sgrib byed pa // zhes bstan pa'i kun rdzob kyi mtshan nyid dang 'gal ba can yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: conceals the nature of another.

original: bsam pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bsam pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The thought is what is called.

original: ma brtags na zhes bya ba ni tshad ma can ma yin pa'i rtogs pa'i don zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ma brtags na zhes bya ba ni tshad ma can ma yin pa'i rtogs pa'i don zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Not examined means not realized by valid knowledge. This is the meaning of the phrase the object.

original: me ma dmigs na mi dmigs pa'i du ba mi dmigs pa ni me dmigs na dmigs so zhes bya ba'i mngon sum dang / mi dmigs pa lnga po 'bras bu dang rgyu nyid kyi dngos po rnams dang mthun pa'i rnam par rtog pa skyed pa'i rnam par gzhag par byed pa ma yin nam snyam du sems pa la 'di ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rtags ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: me ma dmigs na mi dmigs pa'i du ba mi dmigs pa ni me dmigs na dmigs so zhes bya ba'i mngon sum dang / mi dmigs pa lnga po 'bras bu dang rgyu nyid kyi dngos po rnams dang mthun pa'i rnam par rtog pa skyed pa'i rnam par gzhag par byed pa ma yin nam snyam du sems pa la 'di ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rtags ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: And is it not the case that the five non-perceptions are posited as generating the conception of the existence of things that are effects and causes?

original: re zhig mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa rnams mngon sum gyi ngo bo ste /
analyzed: re zhig mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa rnams mngon sum gyi ngo bo ste /
translated: Direct perception and non-perception are the nature of direct perception.

original: rang gi yul rnams la 'bras bu dang cig shos nyid kyis sbyor par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi yul rnams la 'bras bu dang cig shos nyid kyis sbyor par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: They do not connect their objects with being effects and being other.

original: sbyor bar byed pa'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyor bar byed pa'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not of the nature of connecting.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i ngo bo yang rjes su dpag pa la 'brel pa 'dzin par byed pa ma yin par bstan pa ni de bzhin rjes dpag gi @14a * //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i ngo bo yang rjes su dpag pa la 'brel pa 'dzin par byed pa ma yin par bstan pa ni de bzhin rjes dpag gi @14a * //
translated: Inference is also not taught to grasp the connection of inference.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus, inference is not a means of knowledge.

original: gnyi ga 'dzin pa tsam gyi bya ba can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sbyor bar mi byed pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga 'dzin pa tsam gyi bya ba can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sbyor bar mi byed pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has the function of merely apprehending both.üîΩThe objection that arises from the conception that occurs subsequent to the perception is stated as follows:üîΩThe response to that is as follows:üîΩThe response to that is as follows:üîΩThe response to that is as follows:

original: 'di'i de ma thag tu zhes bya ba ni mngon sum nyams su myong ba las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i bsam pa rgol ba'o //
analyzed: 'di'i de ma thag tu zhes bya ba ni mngon sum nyams su myong ba las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i bsam pa rgol ba'o //
translated: The response to that is as follows:üîΩThe response to that is as follows:

original: 'di ltar 'di nyid las byung ba'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di nyid las byung ba'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: The response to that is as follows:üîΩThe response to that is as follows:üîΩThe response to that is as follows:üîΩThe response to that is as follows:üîΩThe response to that is as follows:üîΩThe response to that is as follows:üîΩThe response to that is as follows:üîΩThe response to that is as follows:üîΩThe response to that is as follows:üîΩThe response to that is as follows:üîΩThe response to that is as follows:

original: gzhan dang 'brel pa dang ma 'brel pa dang / shin tu ma 'brel pa rnam par gcod pa la rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ngo //üîΩmngon sum gyi rjes las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni mngon sum gyis mthong ba'i cha tsam gyi rjes su 'brangs par byed pa yin gyi khyab pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan dang 'brel pa dang ma 'brel pa dang / shin tu ma 'brel pa rnam par gcod pa la rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ngo // mngon sum gyi rjes las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni mngon sum gyis mthong ba'i cha tsam gyi rjes su 'brangs par byed pa yin gyi khyab pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
