original: da ltar yang zhes bya ba'o //üîΩnges pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni khyab pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: da ltar yang zhes bya ba'o //üîΩnges pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni khyab pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The response to that is as follows:üîΩThe response to that

original: 'di las byung ba nyid do zhes nges par bzung ba yang ma yin te zhes bya ba 'di ni ma 'brel pa rnam par gcod pa bstan cing shin tu ma 'brel pa rnam par gcod par bstan pa yang ;
analyzed: 'di las byung ba nyid do zhes nges par bzung ba yang ma yin te zhes bya ba 'di ni ma 'brel pa rnam par gcod pa bstan cing shin tu ma 'brel pa rnam par gcod par bstan pa yang ;
translated: Nor is it ascertained that it arises from this. This is the teaching of the exclusion of non-connection and the teaching of the exclusion of very non-connection.

original: 'di las zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: 'di las zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: By from this and so on.

original: mi dmigs pa las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i bsam pas zer ba ni ji ltar de med na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i bsam pas zer ba ni ji ltar de med na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The thought of conceptualization arising from non-apprehension is stated as if it were non-existent.

original: mi dmigs pa ni mngon sum las gzhan pa yang yin la /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa ni mngon sum las gzhan pa yang yin la /
translated: Non-apprehension is also different from perception,

original: rjes su dpag pa yang yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs la bstan pa ni de lta bur gyur na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yang yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs la bstan pa ni de lta bur gyur na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: and it is also inference. The teaching in the position that it is so is if it were like that.

original: gzhan ma yin zhes bya ba ni gzhan pa ma yin ba ste mngon sum nyis yin te /
analyzed: gzhan ma yin zhes bya ba ni gzhan pa ma yin ba ste mngon sum nyis yin te /
translated: Not different means not different, it is perception.

original: gzhan dmigs pa ni mi dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan dmigs pa ni mi dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the apprehension of another is non-apprehension.

original: mngon sum la brjod pa'i zhes bya ba ni mngon sum las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa brjod pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum la brjod pa'i zhes bya ba ni mngon sum las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa brjod pa'o //
translated: What is expressed by perception means what is expressed by conceptualization arising from perception.

original: gal te rjes su dpag pa yin no zhes bya ba de dag tsam ni rgol ba yin te /
analyzed: gal te rjes su dpag pa yin no zhes bya ba de dag tsam ni rgol ba yin te /
translated: If you say that it is inference, then that alone is the opponent‚Äôs position.

original: rjes su dpag pas gzhan tshol na thug pa med par bstan pa ni rjes su dpag pa thug pa med par yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas gzhan tshol na thug pa med par bstan pa ni rjes su dpag pa thug pa med par yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If you seek another inference, there would be an infinite regress of inferences.

original: yul dang dus nges pa'i mngon sum las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni yul nges pa la sogs par mngon par zhen par mi byed la /
analyzed: yul dang dus nges pa'i mngon sum las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni yul nges pa la sogs par mngon par zhen par mi byed la /
translated: Conceptual thoughts that arise from direct perception, which is restricted to a particular time and place, do not conceive of a particular place, etc.

original: med pa las kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: med pa las kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor do they arise from a nonexistent object,üîΩbecause there is no restriction of the object, etc.üîΩIf you think this,

original: yul la sogs pa nges pa med pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pas zer ba ni /
analyzed: yul la sogs pa nges pa med pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pas zer ba ni /
translated: then what about the statement, ‚ÄúThe conceptual thought that arises from direct perception, which is restricted to a particular time and place, does not conceive of a particular place, etc.üîΩbut it does not arise from a nonexistent object, because there is no restriction of the object, etc.‚ÄùüîΩThe conceptual thought that arises from direct perception, which is restricted to a particular time and place, does not conceive of a particular place, etc.

original: 'on te dngos po med pa'i zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'on te dngos po med pa'i zhes bya ba ste /
translated: but it does not arise from a nonexistent object, because there is no restriction of the object, etc.üîΩThe conceptual thought that arises from direct perception, which is restricted to a particular time and place, does not conceive of a particular place, etc.

original: yod pa'i dngos po bzung nas ni //üîΩmi mthun phyogs dag dran byas kyang //
analyzed: yod pa'i dngos po bzung nas ni // mi mthun phyogs dag dran byas kyang //
translated: but it does not arise from a nonexistent object, because there is no restriction of the object, etc.

original: yid kyi med pa'i shes pa ni //
analyzed: yid kyi med pa'i shes pa ni //
translated: The conceptual thought that arises from direct perception, which is restricted to a particular time and place, does not conceive of a particular place, etc.

original: dbang po la ltos med par @14b 'byung //
analyzed: dbang po la ltos med par @14b 'byung //
translated: but it does not arise from a nonexistent object, because there is no restriction of the object, etc.üîΩThe conceptual thought that arises from direct perception, which is restricted to a particular time and place, does not conceive of a particular place, etc.

original: zhes bya ba'i rigs pas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i rigs pas /
translated: but it does not arise from a nonexistent object, because there is no restriction of the object, etc.üîΩThe conceptual thought that arises from direct perception, which is restricted to a particular time and place, does not conceive of a particular place, etc.üîΩbut it does not arise from a nonexistent object, because there is no restriction of the object, etc.üîΩThe conceptual thought that arises from direct perception, which is restricted to a particular time and place, does not conceive of a particular place, etc.üîΩbut it does not arise from a nonexistent object, because there is no restriction of the object, etc.üîΩThe conceptual thought that arises from direct perception, which is restricted to a particular time and place, does not conceive of a particular place, etc.üîΩbut it does not arise from a nonexistent object, because there is no restriction of the object,

original: yul la nges pa nyid kyi dngos po nges pa la dngos po med pa'i tshad mas bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yul la nges pa nyid kyi dngos po nges pa la dngos po med pa'i tshad mas bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The object is ascertained by the valid cognition of non-existence with regard to the ascertained entity.

original: de yod na yod pa'i rtags yin la de las kyang rtags gzhan la de'i 'bras bu nyid du shes pa ni /
analyzed: de yod na yod pa'i rtags yin la de las kyang rtags gzhan la de'i 'bras bu nyid du shes pa ni /
translated: When that exists, it is a reason for the existence of that, and from that, the knowledge of being its effect with regard to another reason

original: 'brel pa 'dzin pa la ltos pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ni ma yin la gnod pa can med pa'i phyir tshad ma ni yin no //
analyzed: 'brel pa 'dzin pa la ltos pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ni ma yin la gnod pa can med pa'i phyir tshad ma ni yin no //
translated: is not inference because it depends on grasping the relation, and it is valid cognition because there is no contradiction.

original: dpyod pa zhes bya ba'i tshad ma yin pa ni yul dang dus la sogs pa nges pa can du 'jog par byed do snyam du sems pa ni dpyod pa'i tshad mas rtogs par bya ba'o //
analyzed: dpyod pa zhes bya ba'i tshad ma yin pa ni yul dang dus la sogs pa nges pa can du 'jog par byed do snyam du sems pa ni dpyod pa'i tshad mas rtogs par bya ba'o //
translated: The valid cognition called analysis is thought to establish the object, time, etc. as having a definite nature. That is to be understood by the valid cognition of analysis.

original: nges pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni de yod na yod pa'i rtags las rtags can gyi dbye ba gsal ba ni de'i 'bras bu rtogs pa zhes nges par rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: nges pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni de yod na yod pa'i rtags las rtags can gyi dbye ba gsal ba ni de'i 'bras bu rtogs pa zhes nges par rtogs pa yin no //
translated: The definition called ascertainment is the clear distinction of the characterized from the reason of existence when that exists. The understanding of that effect is the ascertainment.

original: gang gi phyir du ba ni me nyid las byung bar lan cig ma yin par dmigs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir du ba ni me nyid las byung bar lan cig ma yin par dmigs pa yin gyi /
translated: Because smoke is observed to arise from fire, not from anything else.

original: gzhan las ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i gzhan du mi 'thad pa 'dis me la nges so zhes nges pa'i shes pa ni don gyis go ba las zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan las ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i gzhan du mi 'thad pa 'dis me la nges so zhes nges pa'i shes pa ni don gyis go ba las zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: By this, the impossibility of anything else, the cognition of fire is understood by implication.

original: de yod pa nyid na yod pa zhes bya ba'i khongs su gtogs pa'i nges pa can ni rtags yin la /
analyzed: de yod pa nyid na yod pa zhes bya ba'i khongs su gtogs pa'i nges pa can ni rtags yin la /
translated: When it exists, the existence is the evidence, which is included in the certainty.

original: de tsam ni ma yin te 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de tsam ni ma yin te 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not just that, because of error.

original: gal te de 'grub ba na gzhan rtags can ma yin zhing tshad ma gzhan po dpyod pa'am don gyis go ba yang ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gal te de 'grub ba na gzhan rtags can ma yin zhing tshad ma gzhan po dpyod pa'am don gyis go ba yang ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: If it is established, it is not the evidence of anything else, nor is it the examination of another valid cognition, nor is it understood by implication. This is taught:

original: gal te rgyu dang 'bras bu yi //
analyzed: gal te rgyu dang 'bras bu yi //
translated: If there is a cause and effect,

original: zhes bya ba'o //üîΩde las 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni de kho na las nges pa can khongs su gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o // de las 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni de kho na las nges pa can khongs su gtogs pa'o //
translated: it is said.üîΩArising from that is included in the certainty of just that.

original: de la skyon ni zhes bya ba ni de kho na las zhes bya ba'i nges pas khyab po //
analyzed: de la skyon ni zhes bya ba ni de kho na las zhes bya ba'i nges pas khyab po //
translated: The fault there is that it is pervaded by the certainty of just that.

original: mngon sum gyis ma yin zhing de las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pas kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis ma yin zhing de las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pas kyang ma yin te /
translated: It is not by direct perception, nor by a conception arising from that,

original: yul dang dus nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul dang dus nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the object and time are fixed.

original: de kho na las byung ba'i phyir gzhan gyi 'bras bu nyid ma yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: de kho na las byung ba'i phyir gzhan gyi 'bras bu nyid ma yin du zin kyang /
translated: Even though it is not the effect of another, because it arises from that reality,

original: de nyid ni gzhan no snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: de nyid ni gzhan no snyam du sems pa la /
translated: one thinks that it is another.

original: de yang yul nges pa la sog pa'i sbyor ba mi byed pa'i mngon sum gyis ma rtogs pa nyid du bstan pa ni nges pa can zhes bya ba ste khyab pas so //
analyzed: de yang yul nges pa la sog pa'i sbyor ba mi byed pa'i mngon sum gyis ma rtogs pa nyid du bstan pa ni nges pa can zhes bya ba ste khyab pas so //
translated: That also is shown to be not understood by direct perception, which does not engage in the connection of fixed objects, etc., by the word ‚Äúcertain,‚Äù because of the pervasion.

original: 'on te de yod na 'byung ba tsam ni rtags yin la /
analyzed: 'on te de yod na 'byung ba tsam ni rtags yin la /
translated: But if one thinks that the mere occurrence when it exists is the reason,

original: de yod na yod pa kho na ni rtags can no snyam du sems pa ni gal ge nges pa ni dpyod pa'am zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de yod na yod pa kho na ni rtags can no snyam du sems pa ni gal ge nges pa ni dpyod pa'am zhes bya ba'o //
translated: and that only when it exists is there the possession of the reason, then the doubt is analyzed, or so it is thought.

original: de tsam gyi nges pa can khyab pa'i mngon sum gyis khyab pa ma yin par bstan pa ni gal te da ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de tsam gyi nges pa can khyab pa'i mngon sum gyis khyab pa ma yin par bstan pa ni gal te da ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That which is certain to that extent is not pervaded by direct perception of the pervasion, as is shown by ‚Äúif it exists now.‚Äù

original: ma khyab pa las @15a * //
analyzed: ma khyab pa las @15a * //
translated: From the non-pervasion,

original: rtogs pa ni nges pa can ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni 'o na bum pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa ni nges pa can ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni 'o na bum pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to this is that the realization is not certain.

original: lan cig ma yin par lhan cig tu dmigs pa rnams kyang 'khrul par mthong ba'i phyir ma mthong ba la yang yid ches pa med do //
analyzed: lan cig ma yin par lhan cig tu dmigs pa rnams kyang 'khrul par mthong ba'i phyir ma mthong ba la yang yid ches pa med do //
translated: And since it is seen that things that are observed together are mistaken, there is no confidence in what is not seen.

original: ma mthong ba la ni yul dang dus la sogs pa bskal pa rnams kyi med pa nyid du sgrub par byed pa ma yin par bstan pa ni 'o na ni 'di nyid kyis zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ma mthong ba la ni yul dang dus la sogs pa bskal pa rnams kyi med pa nyid du sgrub par byed pa ma yin par bstan pa ni 'o na ni 'di nyid kyis zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The response to this is that the non-observation of something that is possible does not prove that it does not exist.üîΩAnd even in the case of an unreliable object, confidence is based on the perception of a distant object.üîΩThe response to this is that the object is not established as a valid object of knowledge.üîΩThe response to this is that the object is not established as a valid object of knowledge.

original: yid brtan du med pa'i yul la yang yid ches pa ni ring po mthong ba ma yin pa rnams kyi kun rdzob pa nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: yid brtan du med pa'i yul la yang yid ches pa ni ring po mthong ba ma yin pa rnams kyi kun rdzob pa nyid yin gyi /
translated: The response to this is that the object is not established as a valid object of knowledge.

original: tshad ma can ma yin par bstan pa ni nus pa rtogs pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: tshad ma can ma yin par bstan pa ni nus pa rtogs pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The response to this is that the object is not established as a valid object of knowledge.üîΩThe response to this is that the object is not established as a valid object of knowledge.üîΩThe response to this is that the object is not established as a valid object of knowledge.üîΩThe response to this is that the object is not established as a valid object of knowledge.üîΩThe response to this is that the object is not established as a valid object of knowledge.üîΩThe response to this is that the object is not established as a valid object of knowledge.üîΩThe response to this is that the object is not established as a valid object of knowledge.üîΩThe response to this is that the object is not established as a valid object of knowledge.üîΩThe response to this is that the object is not established as a valid object of knowledge.üîΩThe response to this is that the object is not established as a valid object of knowledge.üîΩThe response to this is that the object is not established as a valid object of knowledge.üîΩThe response to this is that the object is not established as a valid object of knowledge.üîΩThe response to this is that the object is not established as a valid object of knowledge.üîΩThe response to this is that the object is not established as a valid object of knowledge.üîΩThe response to this is that the object is not established as a valid object of knowledge.üîΩThe response to this is that the object is not established as a valid object of knowledge.üîΩThe response to this is that the object is not established as a valid object of knowledge.üîΩThe response to this is that the object is not established as a valid object of knowledge.

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba gnod par byed pa med pa ni gnod pa can ma 'ongs pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba gnod par byed pa med pa ni gnod pa can ma 'ongs pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The response to this is that the object is not established as a valid object of knowledge.

original: de'i yul la the tshom za ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i yul la the tshom za ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The response to this is that the object is

original: yid mi ches pa dang yid ches pa'i rtogs pa de nyid la brten nas sngar mthong ba ngo shes pa'am dran pa 'byung ba tshad ma ma yin pa'i rtogs pa 'phen pa yin par bstan ba ni /
analyzed: yid mi ches pa dang yid ches pa'i rtogs pa de nyid la brten nas sngar mthong ba ngo shes pa'am dran pa 'byung ba tshad ma ma yin pa'i rtogs pa 'phen pa yin par bstan ba ni /
translated: The cognition of what is not believed and what is believed, based on that, is the projection of a cognition that is not a valid cognition, which is the recognition or recollection of what was seen before.

original: ngo shes sngar gyi mthong ba dang // zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ngo shes sngar gyi mthong ba dang // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is stated in the line ‚ÄúRecognition is the recollection of what was seen before.‚Äù

original: de ltar zhes bya ba nas kun rdzob ces bya ba'i bar gyis dgos pa bstan nas gsungs so zhes bya ba ni 'dod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba nas kun rdzob ces bya ba'i bar gyis dgos pa bstan nas gsungs so zhes bya ba ni 'dod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Having taught the purpose with the passage beginning ‚ÄúThus‚Äù and ending ‚Äúconventional,‚Äù he says ‚Äúit is taught.‚Äù The passage beginning ‚ÄúIf one wishes‚Äù and so on.

original: ji ltar de ltar zhes bya ba 'dis ni gang yang rung ba'am de zhes bya ba bzhin du ma gus pa'i tshig ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar de ltar zhes bya ba 'dis ni gang yang rung ba'am de zhes bya ba bzhin du ma gus pa'i tshig ni ma yin te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äújust like that‚Äù and so on is not a disrespectful statement like ‚Äúwhatever‚Äù or ‚Äúthat.‚Äù

original: 'on te kun rdzob ji lta ba de bzhin du gzhag gi tshad ma'i 'jug pas dkrugs par ma byed cig ces rnam par dbye ba'i tshig go //
analyzed: 'on te kun rdzob ji lta ba de bzhin du gzhag gi tshad ma'i 'jug pas dkrugs par ma byed cig ces rnam par dbye ba'i tshig go //
translated: Rather, it is a statement of distinction, saying ‚ÄúJust as the conventional is posited, do not disturb it by the engagement of valid cognition.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir tshad ma 'jug par byed na kun rdzob kyi 'bras bu nyid la sogs pa 'jig par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir tshad ma 'jug par byed na kun rdzob kyi 'bras bu nyid la sogs pa 'jig par 'gyur te /
translated: Because if one engages in valid cognition, the conventional effect and so on will be destroyed.

original: rnam par dbye ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par dbye ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad ces bya ba'o //
translated: Because there is no distinction.

original: de lta yin na skad cig pa ma yin pa nyid la sogs pa yang rtogs pas grub pa /
analyzed: de lta yin na skad cig pa ma yin pa nyid la sogs pa yang rtogs pas grub pa /
translated: If that is so, then non-momentariness, etc. are also established by understanding.

original: tha snyad pa kho na yin no snyam sems pa la /
analyzed: tha snyad pa kho na yin no snyam sems pa la /
translated: They are only conventional.

original: gnod pa nyid kyi phyir ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni smos pa'i rnam par dbye ba tsam gyis zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gnod pa nyid kyi phyir ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni smos pa'i rnam par dbye ba tsam gyis zhes bya ba ste /
translated: To show that this is not so, because they are harmful, it says, ‚Äúmerely by the distinction of mentioning,‚Äù etc.

original: mi smod pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni mos pa yin gyi /
analyzed: mi smod pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni mos pa yin gyi /
translated: Faith is the non-reprehensible conception.

original: skad cig pa yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni 'bras bu nyid la sogs rnam rtog pa bzhin du mi smod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: skad cig pa yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni 'bras bu nyid la sogs rnam rtog pa bzhin du mi smod pa ma yin na /
translated: The conception of momentariness is not non-reprehensible, like the conception of effect, etc.

original: skad cig pa nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa ni ma smad pa yin yang tshad mas ma dpyad pas bsgom par bya ba kho na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: skad cig pa nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa ni ma smad pa yin yang tshad mas ma dpyad pas bsgom par bya ba kho na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The conception of momentariness is non-reprehensible, but it is only to be cultivated without analysis by validating cognition. This is the meaning.

original: tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa @15b dang ; 'bras bu dang cig shos nyid la sogs pa'i dbye ba'i rnam par rtog pa nyams su myong ba med na /
analyzed: tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa @15b dang ; 'bras bu dang cig shos nyid la sogs pa'i dbye ba'i rnam par rtog pa nyams su myong ba med na /
translated: If there is no experience of the conceptual differentiation of valid cognition and invalid cognition, effect and cause, etc.,

original: sgom pa po med pa'i phyir sgom pa la sogs pa med de /
analyzed: sgom pa po med pa'i phyir sgom pa la sogs pa med de /
translated: then, because there would be no experiencer, there would be no meditation, etc.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags las byung ba nyid kyi phyi ma zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags las byung ba nyid kyi phyi ma zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: The subsequent statement, ‚Äúarising from the latent potentialities of conceptualization,‚Äù

original: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi rgyur zhes bya ba'o //üîΩsngon po la sogs pa med pa'i phyir de las tha mi dad pa'i shes pa med pa ni kun rdzob yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi rgyur zhes bya ba'o // sngon po la sogs pa med pa'i phyir de las tha mi dad pa'i shes pa med pa ni kun rdzob yin te /
translated: is for the purpose of demonstrating the cause of mundane convention.

original: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyis yongs su tshim par byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyis yongs su tshim par byed pa'i phyir /
translated: The non-existence of consciousness, which is not different from that, is the superficial, because it is satisfied by mundane convention.

original: de'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal du yod pa yin pa'i phyir 'ga' ba med do zhes dbu ma pa'i 'dod pa bstan pa ni sngon po la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal du yod pa yin pa'i phyir 'ga' ba med do zhes dbu ma pa'i 'dod pa bstan pa ni sngon po la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Since it is the object of the pride of that, it is not non-existent, as the Madhyamikas believe. This is demonstrated by the statement, ‚Äúblue, etc.‚Äù

original: gzhan la yang zhes bya ba ni sad pa'i gnas skabs na yang bag chags tsam las byung ba'i shes pa ni bya ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan la yang zhes bya ba ni sad pa'i gnas skabs na yang bag chags tsam las byung ba'i shes pa ni bya ba med pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúAlso in other cases‚Äù means that even in the waking state, consciousness that arises from mere habitual tendencies is inactive.

original: rang rig pa'i mngon sum las bden pa'i shes pa las tha mi dad pa'i sngon po la sogs pa ni de'i bdag nyid du yod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rang rig pa'i mngon sum las bden pa'i shes pa las tha mi dad pa'i sngon po la sogs pa ni de'i bdag nyid du yod pa yin gyi /
translated: Blue, etc., which are not different from the consciousness that is truly existent, exist in the nature of reflexive awareness, which is direct perception.

original: skye ba la sogs pa ni de lta ma yin pa'i phyir mi bden pa'i kun rdzob yin te /
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa ni de lta ma yin pa'i phyir mi bden pa'i kun rdzob yin te /
translated: But arising, etc., are not like that, and so are false conventionalities.üîΩThe statement ‚ÄúThey exist because they are understood by conceptual consciousnesses that arise from prior and subsequent direct perceptions‚Äù is the YogƒÅcƒÅra position.

original: snga ma dang phyi ma'i mngon sum las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pas rtogs pa'i phyir yod do zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor spyod pa pa'i lta bu bstan pa ni yang na skye ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma'i mngon sum las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pas rtogs pa'i phyir yod do zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor spyod pa pa'i lta bu bstan pa ni yang na skye ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúOr arising, etc.‚Äù is the presentation of that position.

original: de 'di ltar tshad ma dang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad la ltos nas /
analyzed: de 'di ltar tshad ma dang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad la ltos nas /
translated: In this way, in dependence on valid knowledge and worldly conventions,

original: yod pa dang med pa dag la 'gal ba med pa la /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa dag la 'gal ba med pa la /
translated: existence and nonexistence are not contradictory.üîΩThe author of the commentary, who speaks of contradiction,

original: 'grel pa byed pa po'i 'gal bar smra ba ni /
analyzed: 'grel pa byed pa po'i 'gal bar smra ba ni /
translated: says,

original: ma nges pa nyid yin par bstan pa ni ji ste kun rdzob ces bya ba ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ma nges pa nyid yin par bstan pa ni ji ste kun rdzob ces bya ba ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement that it is not definite is ‚ÄúIf it is said that the conventional is . . . ‚Äù

original: skye ba yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni skye ba med pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni skye ba med pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThere is no arising‚Äù means that there is no arising.

original: de ma thag pa'i rgyu ni 'bras bu las snga rol na yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ma thag pa'i rgyu ni 'bras bu las snga rol na yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The antecedent condition does not exist prior to the effect.

original: 'das nas yun ring su don pa yin la med pa yin yang gang kho na de med pa'i dus na yod pa de kho na rgyu yin te /
analyzed: 'das nas yun ring su don pa yin la med pa yin yang gang kho na de med pa'i dus na yod pa de kho na rgyu yin te /
translated: Even though it is long past and does not exist, that which exists at the time when it does not exist is the cause,

original: de ma thag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ma thag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the antecedent condition.

original: snga ma ni ma yin te /
analyzed: snga ma ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the prior one,üîΩbecause it is too remote.

original: yun ring ba'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa la skad cig gi dngos po zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yun ring ba'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa la skad cig gi dngos po zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The idea that it is the momentary entity is stated.

original: dri la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyang gzugs kyi 'bras bu la gzugs kyi skad cig pa bzhin du de ma thag pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dri la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyang gzugs kyi 'bras bu la gzugs kyi skad cig pa bzhin du de ma thag pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The characteristics of smell, etc., are also causes of the effect of form, just like the momentary entity of form, because they are antecedent conditions.

original: rgyur 'gyur pa zhig na rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag med pa'i phyir ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di yang /
analyzed: rgyur 'gyur pa zhig na rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag med pa'i phyir ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di yang /
translated: But this is not so, because there is neither concomitance nor nonobservation.

original: 'das nas yun ring du lon pa par du chod pa la yang mtshungs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'das nas yun ring du lon pa par du chod pa la yang mtshungs pa yin te /
translated: It is the same for those that are distant in terms of time.

original: don gyis nus pa med pa rnams la de ma thag pa rnam la dogs pa med do zhes bya ba'i rigs pas de ma thag pa nyid @16a * //
analyzed: don gyis nus pa med pa rnams la de ma thag pa rnam la dogs pa med do zhes bya ba'i rigs pas de ma thag pa nyid @16a * //
translated: There is no doubt that those that are not capable of being objects are not immediately preceding conditions.

original: kyi rgyu yin na /
analyzed: kyi rgyu yin na /
translated: If it is the cause of the immediately preceding condition,

original: dri la sogs pa rgyu ma yin pa nyid kyis tha dad pa nyid ma grub po zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: dri la sogs pa rgyu ma yin pa nyid kyis tha dad pa nyid ma grub po zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: it is established that smell and so on are different because they are not causes.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is explained by ‚Äúthis.‚Äù

original: rnam par rtog pa'i rtogs pa la de med pa'i phyir rtogs pa med pa can gyi shes pa yin la /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i rtogs pa la de med pa'i phyir rtogs pa med pa can gyi shes pa yin la /
translated: Since it does not exist in the conceptual thought that is understood, it is consciousness that is without understanding.

original: des grub pa ni ma brtags pas grub pa yin na tshad mas grub pa nyid ji ltar kun rdzob yin zhes bstan pa ni brtag pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: des grub pa ni ma brtags pas grub pa yin na tshad mas grub pa nyid ji ltar kun rdzob yin zhes bstan pa ni brtag pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: If it is established by that, it is established without analysis. How can that which is established by valid knowledge be conventional? This is explained by ‚Äúanalysis.‚Äù

original: tshad ma can ma yin pa'i rtogs pa ni kun rdzob ste /
analyzed: tshad ma can ma yin pa'i rtogs pa ni kun rdzob ste /
translated: The understanding that is not valid knowledge is conventional.

original: sgyu ma la sogs pas bstan pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sgyu ma la sogs pas bstan pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúdemonstrated by illusion and so on‚Äù is that.

original: rtogs pa gang la tshad ma rjes su 'jug pa de ni kun rdzob ma yin zhes bstan pa ni bstan bcos byed pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa gang la tshad ma rjes su 'jug pa de ni kun rdzob ma yin zhes bstan pa ni bstan bcos byed pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement that whatever is the object of valid cognition is not conventional is ‚Äúbecause of the treatise author‚Äôs statement.‚Äù

original: rang rig pa las phyi rol gyi tshad ma dang / cig shos kyi rnam par dbye ba ni kun rdzob kho na yin te /
analyzed: rang rig pa las phyi rol gyi tshad ma dang / cig shos kyi rnam par dbye ba ni kun rdzob kho na yin te /
translated: The distinction between external valid cognitions and reflexive awareness is only conventional,

original: phyi rol gyi don la ltos pa yin no zhes bstan pa ni tshad ma dang chad ma ma yin pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don la ltos pa yin no zhes bstan pa ni tshad ma dang chad ma ma yin pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: because it depends on external objects. The statement of this is ‚Äúbecause of the statement of valid and invalid cognitions.‚Äù

original: thob pa zhes bya ba ni skye ba skye bzhin pa las tha mi dad pa'i phyir thob pa ste /
analyzed: thob pa zhes bya ba ni skye ba skye bzhin pa las tha mi dad pa'i phyir thob pa ste /
translated: Obtainment is the non-difference of the arising of arising.

original: phrad pa'i mthar thug pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: phrad pa'i mthar thug pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: It is the essence of the final limit of contact.

original: gang la ltos nas sgrub byed kyi shes pa tshad ma yin pa de shes pa gzhan yin par bstan pa ni thob pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gang la ltos nas sgrub byed kyi shes pa tshad ma yin pa de shes pa gzhan yin par bstan pa ni thob pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The statement that whatever is the object of the valid cognition of the probandum is another cognition is ‚Äúbecause of the statement of obtainment.‚Äù

original: gal te shes pa snga mas don rig pa yin na shes pa phyi ma don med pa yin la /
analyzed: gal te shes pa snga mas don rig pa yin na shes pa phyi ma don med pa yin la /
translated: If the former cognition is the awareness of the object, the latter cognition is pointless.

original: de dag tsam rtogs par byed pa yin pas ci'i phyir ltos pa yin /üîΩlhag par rtogs par byed pa nyid yin pas snga ma pa ni yul gzhan pa mi slu pa dang / cig shos kyi shes pa gzhan 'jug pa ni /
analyzed: de dag tsam rtogs par byed pa yin pas ci'i phyir ltos pa yin / lhag par rtogs par byed pa nyid yin pas snga ma pa ni yul gzhan pa mi slu pa dang / cig shos kyi shes pa gzhan 'jug pa ni /
translated: Because it is the cause of the ascertainment of the object.

original: rang gi don shes pa'i tshad ma nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi don shes pa'i tshad ma nyid ma yin no //
translated: The ascertainment of the object is not the valid knowledge that knows the object, because the ascertainment of the object is not the cause of the ascertainment of the object.

original: de lta mod kyi rang gi yul rnam par 'jog pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta mod kyi rang gi yul rnam par 'jog pa ni ma yin no //
translated: However, it is not the case that the object is not ascertained.

original: rtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis ni yul rnam par 'jog par byed pa yin gyi rtogs pa gzhan rang gi yul rnam par gzhag pa byed pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis ni yul rnam par 'jog par byed pa yin gyi rtogs pa gzhan rang gi yul rnam par gzhag pa byed pas ni ma yin no //
translated: The object is ascertained by the nature of the ascertainment itself, not by another ascertainment that ascertains its own object.

original: gal te de lta yin na rtogs pa gzhan yang de las gzhan pa'i rnam par gzhag pa'i yul la yin zhing /
analyzed: gal te de lta yin na rtogs pa gzhan yang de las gzhan pa'i rnam par gzhag pa'i yul la yin zhing /
translated: If that were the case, then another ascertainment would be the object that is ascertained by that,

original: de yang de bzhin no zhes mthar thug pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang de bzhin no zhes mthar thug pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and that would also be so, resulting in an infinite regress.

original: gang du yang rang gi yul rnam par gzhag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang du yang rang gi yul rnam par gzhag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there would be no object that is ascertained by itself.

original: shes pa ma lus pa tshad ma ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes pa ma lus pa tshad ma ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then it follows that no cognition whatsoever is a valid cognition.

original: ci'i phyir thob pa don du gnyer bar 'gyur //
analyzed: ci'i phyir thob pa don du gnyer bar 'gyur //
translated: Why would one strive for attainment?

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This isüîΩthe purpose of the statement that valid cognition is pointless because of the

original: de lta bu nyid dmigs pa nyid kyis yang tshad ma ni don med do zhes bya ba'i dgos pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu nyid dmigs pa nyid kyis yang tshad ma ni don med do zhes bya ba'i dgos pa'o //
translated: observation of just that.

original: blo thams cad tshad ma yin par ni mi rigs pa @16b pa yin nam /
analyzed: blo thams cad tshad ma yin par ni mi rigs pa @16b pa yin nam /
translated: Is it not the case that it is not tenable that all cognitions are valid cognitions?

original: gzhan nyid du grub pa'i phyir yang /
analyzed: gzhan nyid du grub pa'i phyir yang /
translated: Since they are established as different,üîΩit is not tenable that all cognitions are valid cognitions.

original: tshad ma'i skabs dang zhes pa yod do zhes bya ba'i rigs pa dang / gnod pa can nyid tshad ma yin pa'i phyir dang / gnod pa can yang rang gi ngo bo la gnod par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: tshad ma'i skabs dang zhes pa yod do zhes bya ba'i rigs pa dang / gnod pa can nyid tshad ma yin pa'i phyir dang / gnod pa can yang rang gi ngo bo la gnod par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Since that which is contradictory is a valid cognition, and that which is contradictory does not contradict its own nature,

original: rtogs bzhin pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtogs bzhin pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is being cognized.

original: thob bya la ni gnod pa yin te ;
analyzed: thob bya la ni gnod pa yin te ;
translated: It is the object of attainment that is contradicted,üîΩbecause it is not the object of that [contradictory cognition], how could it be

original: de'i tshad med pa'i phyir de'i yul ma yin pa snga ma de'i gnod pas gnod byar ci ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i tshad med pa'i phyir de'i yul ma yin pa snga ma de'i gnod pas gnod byar ci ltar 'gyur /
translated: contradicted by the contradiction of that [contradictory cognition]?

original: phrad pa'i mthar thug pa thob pa'i tshad ma nyid ni /
analyzed: phrad pa'i mthar thug pa thob pa'i tshad ma nyid ni /
translated: The valid cognition that attains the final limit of contact

original: gnod bya gnod byed kyi yul mtshungs pa nyid de yang bkag pa yin te /
analyzed: gnod bya gnod byed kyi yul mtshungs pa nyid de yang bkag pa yin te /
translated: The object of the object of harm and the object of the agent of harm are the same, and that is also refuted,

original: rang gi dus tsam yul yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi dus tsam yul yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: because the object is merely one's own time.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni gzhan no //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni gzhan no //
translated: This is another.

original: des zhes bya ba ni snga ma'i shes pas so //
analyzed: des zhes bya ba ni snga ma'i shes pas so //
translated: By that is by the previous cognition.

original: de ltar na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan yin te /
translated: Even so, etc. is the reply.

original: thams cad la yang gzhan 'ga' zhig thob pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad la yang gzhan 'ga' zhig thob pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is the attainment of some other in everything.

original: de lta na yang tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa'i rnam par dbye ba med do zhes bstan pa ni de'i phyir don dam pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta na yang tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa'i rnam par dbye ba med do zhes bstan pa ni de'i phyir don dam pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Even so, there is no distinction of valid cognition and invalid cognition, is taught by therefore, ultimately.

original: gzhan pa tsam ni yul ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: gzhan pa tsam ni yul ma yin mod kyi /
translated: Although mere otherness is not the object,

original: 'on kyang mngon par 'dod pa'i phrad pa'i mthar thug pa thob pa ni tshad ma yin no zhes 'jig rten pa 'dod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang mngon par 'dod pa'i phrad pa'i mthar thug pa thob pa ni tshad ma yin no zhes 'jig rten pa 'dod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: nevertheless, the attainment of the desired ultimate end is valid cognition, is the assertion of worldly people.

original: de lta yin na de kun rdzob pa nyid yin par bstan pa ni kun rdzob tu ci lta ba de lta yin du zad do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta yin na de kun rdzob pa nyid yin par bstan pa ni kun rdzob tu ci lta ba de lta yin du zad do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If that is so, the statement ‚ÄúThat is just the superficial‚Äù is the same as saying ‚ÄúThat is just as it is in the superficial.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir mngon par 'dod pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mngon par 'dod pa yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it accepted?

original: des na dngos po'i de kho na nyid ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: des na dngos po'i de kho na nyid ces bya ba ste /
translated: Therefore, it is called ‚Äúthe reality of things.‚ÄùüîΩThat which is as it is, that is reality, and that is the superficial.

original: gang zhig ji lta ba yin pa de de nyid yin par ni kun rdzob yin zhes rnam par dbye ba yin pa de ltar de de nyid yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig ji lta ba yin pa de de nyid yin par ni kun rdzob yin zhes rnam par dbye ba yin pa de ltar de de nyid yin no //
translated: The classification is just that.

original: spyi la yang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: spyi la yang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Also, in general,

original: dpyid kyi dus su bram ze me rnams bsten pa dang / bram ze la sbyin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don byed pa ni spyi la sogs pa thams cad la yang yod pa'i phyi rol gyi don byed pa yod pa ma yin zhes bsam par bya'i /
analyzed: dpyid kyi dus su bram ze me rnams bsten pa dang / bram ze la sbyin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don byed pa ni spyi la sogs pa thams cad la yang yod pa'i phyi rol gyi don byed pa yod pa ma yin zhes bsam par bya'i /
translated: the meaning of ‚Äúin the spring, the Brahmins worship the fires, and give to the Brahmins‚Äù and so on, is that all generalities and so on do not have external objects that are their referents.

original: med pa la ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni blo la zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: med pa la ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni blo la zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúIt is not nonexistent‚Äù is taught by ‚Äúin the mind.‚Äù

original: 'di la blo'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa nyid yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di la blo'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa nyid yod pa ma yin te /
translated: This does not have the characteristic of a mind.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa'i blo ni yod pa yin te /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa'i blo ni yod pa yin te /
translated: The cognition that follows the presence or absence of the object is present,

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i blo bzhin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i blo bzhin no //
translated: like the cognition of form, etc.

original: 'bad pa la sogs pa tsam las byung ba spyi'i blo ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bad pa la sogs pa tsam las byung ba spyi'i blo ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not a general cognition that arises from mere effort, etc.

original: mig la sogs pa tsam las byung ba rab rib can gyi shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa tsam las byung ba rab rib can gyi shes pa bzhin no //
translated: Like the cognition of one with cataracts that arises from mere eye, etc.üîΩLike the cognition of eye, etc.

original: mig dang gzugs sogs blo bzhin no //
analyzed: mig dang gzugs sogs blo bzhin no //
translated: Like the cognition of form, etc.

original: zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa'i blo bzhin @17a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa'i blo bzhin @17a * //
translated: The cognition of eye, etc.

original: dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i blo bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i blo bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Like the cognition of form, etc.

original: go rims bzhin du med pa nyid dang yod pa nyid kyi dpe yin no //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du med pa nyid dang yod pa nyid kyi dpe yin no //
translated: These are, respectively, the examples of nonexistence and existence.

original: dmigs pa dang bdag po'i rkyen gyi yul la zhes bya ba la dmigs pa'i yul ni gzugs la sogs pa'i blo rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bdag po'i rkyen gyi yul la zhes bya ba la dmigs pa'i yul ni gzugs la sogs pa'i blo rnams kyi'o //
translated: The object of the objective condition and the dominant condition. The object of the objective condition is the object of the cognition of form, etc.

original: bdag po'i rkyen gyi yul ni rab rib la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: bdag po'i rkyen gyi yul ni rab rib la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: The object of the dominant condition is the object of cataracts, etc.

original: de lta yang mig la sogs pa med par ni nang gi zhes ston pa'o //
analyzed: de lta yang mig la sogs pa med par ni nang gi zhes ston pa'o //
translated: Even so, the internal is not without eye, etc.

original: de lta bu'i the tshom la de nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: de lta bu'i the tshom la de nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is that doubt?

original: rta de ni ba lang nyid kyi bag chags zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rta de ni ba lang nyid kyi bag chags zhes bya'o //
translated: The horse is the latent impression of the cow.

original: rta de mi byed pa ci'i phyir zhe na ba lang zhes bya ba'i brda ni de nyid la zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rta de mi byed pa ci'i phyir zhe na ba lang zhes bya ba'i brda ni de nyid la zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Why does the horse not do that? The convention ‚Äúcow‚Äù is in regard to that.

original: lkog shal la sogs pa dang ldan pa la yin gyi /
analyzed: lkog shal la sogs pa dang ldan pa la yin gyi /
translated: It is in regard to that which has a dewlap, etc.

original: ba lang nyid med pa la sogs pa 'di ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ba lang nyid med pa la sogs pa 'di ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not in regard to that which does not have the nature of a cow, etc.

original: ba lang gi tshogs pa pa yang rta la sogs pa mtshan nyid mi mthun pa ril po bzhin du /
analyzed: ba lang gi tshogs pa pa yang rta la sogs pa mtshan nyid mi mthun pa ril po bzhin du /
translated: The collection of cows is like the totality of horses, etc., which are dissimilar in characteristics.

original: rjes su 'jug pa'i ngo bo ni mthong ba la mi snang ba yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rjes su 'jug pa'i ngo bo ni mthong ba la mi snang ba yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The nature of the engagement is not seen.

original: gsal ba las tha dad pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gsal ba las tha dad pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement that it is different from the manifestation is:

original: ma tshol ba'i be'u ni rta la sogs pa las log pa ba lang gi tshogs la rjes su 'jug pa ni /
analyzed: ma tshol ba'i be'u ni rta la sogs pa las log pa ba lang gi tshogs la rjes su 'jug pa ni /
translated: The calf that is not sought engages in the collection of cows, but not in horses, etc.

original: ma ma yin pa la yang 'jug pa'i phyir rtogs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: ma ma yin pa la yang 'jug pa'i phyir rtogs pa ma yin nam /
translated: Is it not the case that it is not understood because it engages in the non-mother as well?

original: 'dra bar rtogs pa ni bden mod kyi 'dra ba nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo las tha dad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dra bar rtogs pa ni bden mod kyi 'dra ba nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo las tha dad pa ma yin no //
translated: It is true that the cognition is similar to the object, but it is not different from the nature of the similarity itself.

original: rang gi ngo bo kho na de de dang 'dra ba'am de dang mi 'dra ba yang rung ba la log par rtogs par mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo kho na de de dang 'dra ba'am de dang mi 'dra ba yang rung ba la log par rtogs par mi bya ba'o //
translated: One should not imagine that the nature itself is either similar to or dissimilar from that.

original: don dam par ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: don dam par ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: The author now shows that this is not so ultimately:

original: dngos po ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not a real entity.

original: blo ni rtogs bya las ldog pa ma yin pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: blo ni rtogs bya las ldog pa ma yin pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt the cognition the opposite of the object of cognition?

original: bden te rtogs bya'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa yin na yin gyi /
analyzed: bden te rtogs bya'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa yin na yin gyi /
translated: It is true that it is the opposite of the object of cognition, but it is not the opposite of the object of cognition in all ways.

original: gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: The author now shows that it is not the other:

original: gal te gsal ba med kyang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gal te gsal ba med kyang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Even if there is no manifestation,

original: gsal bar byed pa'i phyir gsal ba ni spyi yin la de med na med cing de yod na yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsal bar byed pa'i phyir gsal ba ni spyi yin la de med na med cing de yod na yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: the manifestation is the universal because it manifests. If it does not exist, it does not exist, and if it exists, it exists.

original: thams cad du blo yod na rtogs bya yang yod par 'gyur ba ma yin nam snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: thams cad du blo yod na rtogs bya yang yod par 'gyur ba ma yin nam snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: But doesn‚Äôt the cognition exist everywhere when the object of cognition exists?

original: spyi ni khyab par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: spyi ni khyab par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúUniversal‚Äù means ‚Äúpervading.‚Äù

original: de yod na ni 'bad pa la sogs pa yod na'o //
analyzed: de yod na ni 'bad pa la sogs pa yod na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf it exists‚Äù means ‚Äúif it exists in the effort, etc.‚Äù

original: sug par byed pa ni gal te spyi mi ldog pa nyid ces bya ba ni thams cad na gnas pa nyid do //üîΩshes pa tsam la nus pa med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: sug par byed pa ni gal te spyi mi ldog pa nyid ces bya ba ni thams cad na gnas pa nyid do // shes pa tsam la nus pa med pa'i phyir //
translated: ‚ÄúThe universal is not a cause‚Äù means that it is not a cause of the cognition.

original: zhes bya ba ni blo'i mtshan nyid kyi yod pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni blo'i mtshan nyid kyi yod pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause the mere cognition is not capable‚Äù means that the universal does not exist as the characteristic of the cognition.

original: des zhes bya ba ni de'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i @17b mtshan nyid spyi la brjod pa'i rigs pas so //
analyzed: des zhes bya ba ni de'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i @17b mtshan nyid spyi la brjod pa'i rigs pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy that‚Äù means by the reasoning that expresses the universal as having the characteristic of positive and negative concomitance.

original: de ltar yin na gang las de dag 'byung bar 'gyur zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: de ltar yin na gang las de dag 'byung bar 'gyur zhes zer ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúIf that is so, then from what do those arise?‚Äù

original: brda zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: brda zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúConvention‚Äù and so on.

original: bum pa ni yan lag can yin la /
analyzed: bum pa ni yan lag can yin la /
translated: A pot is a whole,

original: de nyid kho na yan lag du ma'i thun mong yin pa'i phyir spyi yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kho na yan lag du ma'i thun mong yin pa'i phyir spyi yin no //
translated: and it is a universal because it is common to many parts.

original: de bzhin du 'degs pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'degs pa ni /
translated: Similarly, lifting is an action,

original: las yin la de nyid rdzas du ma'i thun mong yin pa'i phyir spyi yin no //
analyzed: las yin la de nyid rdzas du ma'i thun mong yin pa'i phyir spyi yin no //
translated: and it is a universal because it is common to many substances.

original: bar gyi gsal bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir grangs la sogs pa rnams la yang spyi zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bar gyi gsal bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir grangs la sogs pa rnams la yang spyi zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and because they clarify the particulars, number and so on would also be universals.

original: bum pa la sogs spyi ma yin pa de ni /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs spyi ma yin pa de ni /
translated: But a pot and so on is not a universal,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kho na yin pa'i phyir 'gal ba cung zad kyang med de /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kho na yin pa'i phyir 'gal ba cung zad kyang med de /
translated: because it is just a particular. There is not the slightest contradiction.

original: de'i phyir spyi 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir spyi 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is a universal.

original: 'degs pa nyid kyang spyi yin te /
analyzed: 'degs pa nyid kyang spyi yin te /
translated: The act of lifting is also a universal,

original: dus mang po'i gsal ba dus gcig las 'byung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus mang po'i gsal ba dus gcig las 'byung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because many temporal instances of the act of lifting do not occur at one time.

original: bskor ba dang 'degs pa la sogs pa ni bum pa la sogs pa bzhin du dus gcig na yod pa ma yin no bya ba'i yan lag rim gyis dus mang por byung ba rnams kyis bskor ba gcig tu gsal bar byed pa 'di yang gtam tsam yin te
analyzed: bskor ba dang 'degs pa la sogs pa ni bum pa la sogs pa bzhin du dus gcig na yod pa ma yin no bya ba'i yan lag rim gyis dus mang por byung ba rnams kyis bskor ba gcig tu gsal bar byed pa 'di yang gtam tsam yin te
translated: The act of turning and the act of lifting and so on do not exist at one time, like a pot and so on. The statement that one act of turning is clarified by many temporal instances of the act of turning that occur in sequence is mere words.

original: mtha'i gsal byed tsam gyis gsal bar bya ba nyid la thun mong ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis bskor ba ma yin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: mtha'i gsal byed tsam gyis gsal bar bya ba nyid la thun mong ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis bskor ba ma yin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: It follows that the act of turning is not clarified by the mere temporal instances of the act of turning because it is not a universal that has a unique nature.

original: de'i dus na med pa gsal byed ma yin pa'i phyir dang / rang gi shes pas gzhan gyi blo'i rgyu gsal bar byed pa'i phyir te gsal byed lta bu'o //
analyzed: de'i dus na med pa gsal byed ma yin pa'i phyir dang / rang gi shes pas gzhan gyi blo'i rgyu gsal bar byed pa'i phyir te gsal byed lta bu'o //
translated: because at that time, it is not a clarifier of the non-existent, and because it is the clarifier of the cause of the other‚Äôs mind by one‚Äôs own consciousness, it is like a clarifier.

original: dbye ba med pa bum pa gcig tu snang ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: dbye ba med pa bum pa gcig tu snang ba ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt the undifferentiated one, the appearance of a single pot?

original: thag ring ba las du ma gcig bzhin du snang ba ma yin pas /
analyzed: thag ring ba las du ma gcig bzhin du snang ba ma yin pas /
translated: It is not like the appearance of many as one from a distance.

original: de yang de ltar 'gyur ba ni rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang de ltar 'gyur ba ni rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And that is so because there is no reason for it.

original: phra ba nyid rgyu mtshan yin pa ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: phra ba nyid rgyu mtshan yin pa ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not reasonable that subtlety itself is the reason.

original: rdul phra rab phra ba ni mngon sum yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdul phra rab phra ba ni mngon sum yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the subtle atom is a direct perception.

original: gang gi phyir mngon sum ni thag ring ba la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis rnam par dbye ba ma bzung bar snang bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mngon sum ni thag ring ba la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis rnam par dbye ba ma bzung bar snang bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: Because direct perception appears without apprehending the differentiation by the reason of distance, etc.

original: rdul phra rab ni du ma yin yang snang ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rdul phra rab ni du ma yin yang snang ba ma yin te /
translated: And although the atom is multiple, it does not appear.

original: dbang po las 'das pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po las 'das pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is beyond the senses.

original: gang gi phyir dbang po las 'das pa ni dbang po'i yul du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dbang po las 'das pa ni dbang po'i yul du mi 'gyur te /
translated: Because what is beyond the senses is not an object of the senses,

original: 'gal ba'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: 'gal ba'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa la /
translated: because they are incompatible.

original: rab rib can la skra nyag gcig mngon sum ma yin yang /
analyzed: rab rib can la skra nyag gcig mngon sum ma yin yang /
translated: In response to that, although a single hair is not directly perceptible to one with myodesopsia,

original: tshogs pa rnams phan tshun phan 'dogs pas mngon sum yin pa de bzhin du /üîΩrdul phra rab kyang yin na gang gi phyir gzhan gyi mngon @18a * //
analyzed: tshogs pa rnams phan tshun phan 'dogs pas mngon sum yin pa de bzhin du / rdul phra rab kyang yin na gang gi phyir gzhan gyi mngon @18a * //
translated: since the collection of those is mutually beneficial, it is directly perceptible.

original: sum rab rib can la dgos par 'gyur /
analyzed: sum rab rib can la dgos par 'gyur /
translated: In the same way, if the subtle particles are also directly perceptible, then why would the direct perception of another, one with myodesopsia, be necessary?

original: rnal 'byor gyi mngon sum nyid ni rdul phra rab rnams la yang kho bo cag la sogs pa la dgos pa yin par bstan pa ni /üîΩgzugs la sogs las tha dad par //
analyzed: rnal 'byor gyi mngon sum nyid ni rdul phra rab rnams la yang kho bo cag la sogs pa la dgos pa yin par bstan pa ni / gzugs la sogs las tha dad par //
translated: The response to that is that the direct perception of a yogi is necessary for us and others with regard to subtle particles.

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The response is that the subtle particles are not different from form and so on.

original: mig la snang ba la gzugs kyi rdul phra rab rnams re res dbang po las 'das pa yin yang phan tshun phan 'dogs pas 'dus pa ni mngon sum yin te /
analyzed: mig la snang ba la gzugs kyi rdul phra rab rnams re res dbang po las 'das pa yin yang phan tshun phan 'dogs pas 'dus pa ni mngon sum yin te /
translated: The subtle particles of form that appear to the eye are beyond the senses when they are individually present to the eye sense faculty. However, since they are mutually beneficial when they are assembled, they are directly perceptible.

original: rab rib can gyi skra la sogs pa yin pa'i phyir 'gal ba cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: rab rib can gyi skra la sogs pa yin pa'i phyir 'gal ba cung zad kyang med do //
translated: Therefore, there is not the slightest contradiction.

original: de bzhin du ro la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab rnams kyang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du ro la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab rnams kyang ngo //
translated: In the same way, the atoms of taste, etc., are also.

original: gal te gzugs la sogs pa rnams su khyad par med pa'i phyir de dag tsam gyis bum pa ni snam bu la sogs pa rnams las khyad par du mi 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: gal te gzugs la sogs pa rnams su khyad par med pa'i phyir de dag tsam gyis bum pa ni snam bu la sogs pa rnams las khyad par du mi 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa la /
translated: If you think that the pot is not distinguished from the cloth, etc., because there is no distinction in the atoms of form, etc.,

original: dbyibs kyi bye brag gi khyad par du byas pas mtshan nyid mi mthun zhing brda'i bye brag gi yul du mthong ba rnams ni de'i bag chags sad pa'i rgyu rnams la de'i sgra rnams kyis brjod pa yin no zhes don du bstan pa ni /
analyzed: dbyibs kyi bye brag gi khyad par du byas pas mtshan nyid mi mthun zhing brda'i bye brag gi yul du mthong ba rnams ni de'i bag chags sad pa'i rgyu rnams la de'i sgra rnams kyis brjod pa yin no zhes don du bstan pa ni /
translated: then the pot is distinguished by the particular arrangement of the atoms, and is seen as the object of a particular conventional symbol. The expression of that by the word pot is the cause of the activation of the latent impressions of that. This is the meaning of the statement:

original: des na de tsam zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na de tsam zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said to be just that much.

original: gzugs la sogs pa tsam gyi bum pa la ni /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa tsam gyi bum pa la ni /
translated: The pot is just the form, etc.,

original: mig la sogs pa rnams rnam par gzhag pa yin gyi /üîΩ'tshol ba ni ma yin pa la /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa rnams rnam par gzhag pa yin gyi / 'tshol ba ni ma yin pa la /
translated: and the eye, etc., are established in that.

original: 'tshol bar mthong ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'tshol bar mthong ba ma yin nam /
translated: But it is not seen that the pot is sought in the form, etc.,üîΩand that the form, etc., are sought in the pot.

original: de bzhin du bdag gis reg go zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag gis reg go zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Likewise, ‚ÄúI touch‚Äù is the thought.

original: de'i phyir de yul gzhan yin no snyam du sems pa ni gal te rdzas ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de yul gzhan yin no snyam du sems pa ni gal te rdzas ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the thought that it is a different object is ‚ÄúIf it is a substance‚Äù and so on.

original: mthong ba la bdag gis reg go zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni mthong ba las byung ba yin gyi /üîΩrang dbang du na mi yin la mthon ba yang gzugs tha dad pa'am /
analyzed: mthong ba la bdag gis reg go zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni mthong ba las byung ba yin gyi / rang dbang du na mi yin la mthon ba yang gzugs tha dad pa'am /
translated: The conceptual thought ‚ÄúI touch what is seen‚Äù arises from seeing.üîΩIt is not independent.

original: tha mi dad pa'i rdzas la ma yin te /
analyzed: tha mi dad pa'i rdzas la ma yin te /
translated: It is not a substance that is different or not different from form.

original: de med kyang 'byung ba ni bag chags tsam las byung ba yin par rtogs so //
analyzed: de med kyang 'byung ba ni bag chags tsam las byung ba yin par rtogs so //
translated: Even though it does not exist, it is understood to arise from mere latent impressions.

original: de nyid bstan pa ni rdzas de gzugs las gzhan yin pa'am zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa ni rdzas de gzugs las gzhan yin pa'am zhes bya ba ste /
translated: That itself is taught: ‚ÄúThat substance is different from form‚Äù and so on.

original: tha mi dad pas so //
analyzed: tha mi dad pas so //
translated: It is not different.

original: de las bzlog pa ni tha dad pas so //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni tha dad pas so //
translated: The opposite of that is different.

original: 'di la gzugs yod pa'i phyir gzugs dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la gzugs yod pa'i phyir gzugs dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Here, it is endowed with form because it has form.

original: de las bzlog pa las zhes bya ba 'di la bstan pa ni gzhan du rigs pa yin na blo zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa las zhes bya ba 'di la bstan pa ni gzhan du rigs pa yin na blo zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The opposite of that is ‚Äúfrom that‚Äù and so on. The teaching here is that it is reasonable to say that the mind is different from form.

original: bag chags cam las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa yang phyi rol rnam par 'jog pa byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di la yang dbye ba dang dbye ba ma yin par rig pa kho na snang ba'i med pa rig pa lan yin par @18b yang rtogs
analyzed: bag chags cam las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa yang phyi rol rnam par 'jog pa byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di la yang dbye ba dang dbye ba ma yin par rig pa kho na snang ba'i med pa rig pa lan yin par @18b yang rtogs
translated: Also, the conceptual thought that arises from mere latent impressions would posit external objects.üîΩIn response to this, the opponent‚Äôs position is that the distinction between the two is not tenable, and that the response is based on the mere appearance of cognition.

original: so // snang ba bzhin du rnam par rtog pa yang phyi rol rtogs na gnod par byed pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: so // snang ba bzhin du rnam par rtog pa yang phyi rol rtogs na gnod par byed pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: If conceptual thought cognizes external objects just as sensory perception does, then there is no need for a response.

original: rang dbang kho na ma yin nam /üîΩrgyu ni de bzhin du mi 'thad pas bag chags kyi ngo bo'am /
analyzed: rang dbang kho na ma yin nam / rgyu ni de bzhin du mi 'thad pas bag chags kyi ngo bo'am /
translated: Isn‚Äôt it the case that conceptual thought is autonomous?üîΩSince it is not tenable that the cause is like that, it must be some other cause, such as latent impressions.

original: gzhan yang rung ba 'ga' zhig tu yang 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa ni ci ste bum pa'i blo ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang rung ba 'ga' zhig tu yang 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa ni ci ste bum pa'i blo ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what the opponent thinks.

original: 'khrul pa med pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'khrul pa med pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúwithout error‚Äù means

original: gnod pa med pa ste gzugs la sogs pa las tha dad pas bum pa'o //
analyzed: gnod pa med pa ste gzugs la sogs pa las tha dad pas bum pa'o //
translated: without impairment. Since it is different from form and so on, it is a pot.

original: bum pa dmar po'o zhes rtogs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bum pa dmar po'o zhes rtogs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is a red pot. This is the meaning of the passage.

original: brdas thun mong dang thun mong ma yin par byas pa dag ji lta ba bzhin pa'i brdas pa brjod pa dang rtogs pa yin gyi de dag las dngos po'i dbye bas grub pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: brdas thun mong dang thun mong ma yin par byas pa dag ji lta ba bzhin pa'i brdas pa brjod pa dang rtogs pa yin gyi de dag las dngos po'i dbye bas grub pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: The words ‚Äúin reality‚Äù indicate that the distinction between the common and uncommon is made by way of conventional expressions, and that it is by way of conventional expressions that there is the expression and understanding of the common and uncommon, and that it is not established by way of a distinction of real entities.

original: dmar po dang ni mi dmar ba //
analyzed: dmar po dang ni mi dmar ba //
translated: ‚Äú Red‚Äù and ‚Äúnon-red‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: are the words of the root text.

original: gang kho nar gzugs yin pa de kho nar reg pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gang kho nar gzugs yin pa de kho nar reg pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt it the case that whatever is form is also contact?

original: brda las ni ma yin te /
analyzed: brda las ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not by way of conventional expressions.üîΩThe real entities are like this.

original: dngos po ni de lta bu yin no zhes zer ba ni ci ste gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po ni de lta bu yin no zhes zer ba ni ci ste gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúWhat is it?‚Äù

original: gzugs dang reg pa la sogs pa'i tshogs pa gcig las byung ba'i 'dus pa ni bum par tha snyad gdags pa'i yul yin la /
analyzed: gzugs dang reg pa la sogs pa'i tshogs pa gcig las byung ba'i 'dus pa ni bum par tha snyad gdags pa'i yul yin la /
translated: The collection of form, contact, and so on that arises from a single cause is the object designated as a pot.

original: de lta bur btags pa'i 'dus pa gang de la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de lta bur btags pa'i 'dus pa gang de la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The collection that is designated in that way is the object designated as a pot.

original: dmag la glang po che bzhin du tha snyad 'dogs pa'i yul yin no zhes bstan pa ni tshogs pa gcig la rag las zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dmag la glang po che bzhin du tha snyad 'dogs pa'i yul yin no zhes bstan pa ni tshogs pa gcig la rag las zhes bya ba ste /

analyzed: 'bras bu'i sgo nas don gyi khyad par yin par bstan pa ni spyi kho na sgra'i yul yin no zhes bya ba ni ma yin zhes bya ba'o // de ltar sgra'i yul kho na yin gyi zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The particular is the object of the word, but it is not a characteristic.üîΩThe particular is the object of the word, but it is not a characteristic.üîΩThe particular is the object of the word, but it is not a characteristic.üîΩThe particular is the object of the word, but it is not a characteristic.üîΩThe particular is the object of the word, but it is not a characteristic.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi mtshan nyid la yang khyab ches ba gsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi mtshan nyid la yang khyab ches ba gsal ba'i phyir /
translated: The particular is the object of the word, but it is not a characteristic.üîΩThe particular is the object

original: don gyi khyad par du 'gyur bar bstan pa ni de bzhin du yul ma yin pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: don gyi khyad par du 'gyur bar bstan pa ni de bzhin du yul ma yin pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement that there is a difference in meaning is ‚Äúnot an object in that way.‚Äù

original: 'dir yang zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'i sgo nas don gyi khyad par la'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'i sgo nas don gyi khyad par la'o //
translated: Here, ‚Äúin that way‚Äù refers to the difference in meaning in terms of the effect.

original: 'di ni don gyi mtshan nyid ma yin gyi dbye ba'i mtshan nyid yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'di ni don gyi mtshan nyid ma yin gyi dbye ba'i mtshan nyid yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The statement that this is not the definition of the meaning but the definition of the division is

original: tshad ma ni slu ba med pa can gyi shes pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshad ma ni slu ba med pa can gyi shes pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúValid knowledge is a nondeceptive consciousness.‚Äù

original: gal te skra la sogs pa yang gang dag gi bya ba la ltos nas de dag gi bya ba dang zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: gal te skra la sogs pa yang gang dag gi bya ba la ltos nas de dag gi bya ba dang zhes sbyar ro //
translated: If even such things as a double moon are posited as objects in terms of the activity that depends on them, then they are objects in terms of the activity of consciousness.

original: de'i tshe de la yang zhes bya ba ni don byed par nus pa nyid kyi don nyid de /
analyzed: de'i tshe de la yang zhes bya ba ni don byed par nus pa nyid kyi don nyid de /
translated: At that time, ‚Äúeven that‚Äù refers to the meaning of being able to perform a function.

original: tshad ma'i yul yin par rtogs pa'i phyir don yin zhes sgrub pas so //
analyzed: tshad ma'i yul yin par rtogs pa'i phyir don yin zhes sgrub pas so //
translated: Because it is understood to be the object of valid knowledge, it is established as the meaning.

original: rgol ba de'i de ma thag tu de dag kyang ste /
analyzed: rgol ba de'i de ma thag tu de dag kyang ste /
translated: Immediately after the opponent‚Äôs statement, ‚ÄúEven those‚Äù

original: skra shad la sogs pa rnams kyi yang ngo de lta bu'i dngos por med pa nyid du yongs su gcod pa yin no //
analyzed: skra shad la sogs pa rnams kyi yang ngo de lta bu'i dngos por med pa nyid du yongs su gcod pa yin no //
translated: such things as floating hairs ‚Äúare ascertained as not existing as real things.‚Äù

original: spyi'i ngo bo nyid dgag pa med par bstan pa ni ji ste de ltar zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: spyi'i ngo bo nyid dgag pa med par bstan pa ni ji ste de ltar zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The teaching that the general nature is not refuted is ‚ÄúIf it is like that. . . .‚Äù

original: gal te yang yod pa'i sgra la sogs pa ni spyi'i sgo nas shes pa'i yul yin na /
analyzed: gal te yang yod pa'i sgra la sogs pa ni spyi'i sgo nas shes pa'i yul yin na /
translated: If the words ‚Äúexistent‚Äù and so on are the objects of cognition in a general way,

original: ji ltar gsal bar snang ba'i khyad par gyi ngo bo yin /
analyzed: ji ltar gsal bar snang ba'i khyad par gyi ngo bo yin /
translated: how are they the nature of a specific appearance of a clear image?

original: gang gi phyir sngon po la sogs pa gsal ba nyid du snang bzhin pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sngon po la sogs pa gsal ba nyid du snang bzhin pa /
translated: Because blue and so on appear as a clear image,üîΩit is not nonexistent and also not a universal.

original: med pa dang spyi yang ma yin no snyam du sems pa ni de lta na ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: med pa dang spyi yang ma yin no snyam du sems pa ni de lta na ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is ‚ÄúIf it is like that. . . .‚Äù

original: lan du gsal snang @20b nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan du gsal snang @20b nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: The response is ‚ÄúThe clear image. . . .‚Äù

original: da ni med pa'i yul can gyi spyi gang yin snyam sems pa la /
analyzed: da ni med pa'i yul can gyi spyi gang yin snyam sems pa la /
translated: Now, thinking that a universal is the object of a nonexistent cognition,

original: skra sogs zhes bya'i blo dag ni //
analyzed: skra sogs zhes bya'i blo dag ni //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe cognitions of hair and so on. . . .‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba'i 'di la skra la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i de ma thag tu med do zhes bya ba 'thob pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i 'di la skra la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i de ma thag tu med do zhes bya ba 'thob pa yin te /
translated: Here, immediately after ‚Äúhair and so on,‚Äù the word ‚Äúnonexistent‚Äù is supplied.

original: de dag gi yang de lta'i dngos zhes bya ba'i gnas skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi yang de lta'i dngos zhes bya ba'i gnas skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they also have that state of affairs.

original: med do zhes bya ba'i spyi'i yul can gyi blo ni 'gal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: med do zhes bya ba'i spyi'i yul can gyi blo ni 'gal ba'i phyir /
translated: The cognition that has a universal as its object, i.e., the cognition that has the concept ‚Äúnonexistent‚Äù as its object, is contradictory.

original: gsal bar snang ba ma yin pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gsal bar snang ba ma yin pa ma yin nam /
translated: But is it not the case that the appearance of something manifest is not nonexistent?

original: gzhan du snang ba la ni ma yin la /
analyzed: gzhan du snang ba la ni ma yin la /
translated: It is not the case that there is an appearance of something else.

original: snang bzhin pa ni brjod bya yin par bstan pa ni skra snang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: snang bzhin pa ni brjod bya yin par bstan pa ni skra snang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The statement that what is appearing is the object of expression is ‚Äúthe appearance of hair.‚Äù

original: phyi rol gyi don gyis don med pa can gyi skra shad kyi ngo bo'i snang ba shes pa gang yin pa de ni phyi rol gyi yul can nyid du khas blangs pa med do zhes gnod pa can gyi yul yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don gyis don med pa can gyi skra shad kyi ngo bo'i snang ba shes pa gang yin pa de ni phyi rol gyi yul can nyid du khas blangs pa med do zhes gnod pa can gyi yul yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The cognition that is the appearance of the nature of hair, which is devoid of external objects, is not accepted as having an external object. The meaning is that it is an object that is contradictory.

original: rang gi ngo bos skra shad kyi snang ba ni /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos skra shad kyi snang ba ni /
translated: The appearance of hair by virtue of its own nature

original: rang gi ngo bos dgag pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /üîΩgal te rab rib can gyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos dgag pa ma yin par bstan pa ni / gal te rab rib can gyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: is not a negation by virtue of its own nature.üîΩThe statement that it is not a negation by virtue of its own nature is ‚ÄúThe cognition of hair, etc.‚Äù

original: skra shad la sogs pa dang 'dra bar zhes bya ba ste /üîΩyod pa dang med pa dag gis med par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: skra shad la sogs pa dang 'dra bar zhes bya ba ste / yod pa dang med pa dag gis med par bstan pa ni /
translated: The statement that it is similar to hair, etc.,üîΩis the statement that it is nonexistent by virtue of its own nature.

original: skra las sogs bden min zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skra las sogs bden min zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement that it is nonexistent by virtue of both existence and nonexistence is ‚ÄúThe hair, etc., are not real.‚Äù

original: yod par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: yod par bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching of existence is:

original: yang na tshul mthun phyir 'dra yin //
analyzed: yang na tshul mthun phyir 'dra yin //
translated: Or, it is similar because of the conformity of method.

original: zhes bya ba'o //üîΩgal te yod pa gsal bar snang ba yin pa de lta na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o // gal te yod pa gsal bar snang ba yin pa de lta na /
translated: Thus it is.

original: med pa gang zhig yin zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: med pa gang zhig yin zhes zer ba ni /
translated: If it is the case that existence is the appearance of clarity, then what is non-existence?üîΩIt is said:

original: 'o na don med pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'o na don med pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Well then, it is meaningless.

original: dbang po'i rnam par shes pa ni phyi rol gyi yul la zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dbang po'i rnam par shes pa ni phyi rol gyi yul la zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The sense consciousness is what is meant by the external object.

original: de ltar yang /
analyzed: de ltar yang /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: don la de ni dbang shes yin //
analyzed: don la de ni dbang shes yin //
translated: That is the sense consciousness in regard to the object.

original: zhes smos pa'o //
analyzed: zhes smos pa'o //
translated: Thus it is.

original: phyi rol la ltos nas mi gsal bar snang ba dang cig shos nyid ces bya ba'i rnam par dbye ba rang rig pa ma yin par bstan pa ni de'i phyir mi gsal ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyi rol la ltos nas mi gsal bar snang ba dang cig shos nyid ces bya ba'i rnam par dbye ba rang rig pa ma yin par bstan pa ni de'i phyir mi gsal ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In dependence on the external, the appearance of non-clarity and the other are taught to be the differentiation of the non-self-awareness. Therefore, it is said: non-clarity.

original: gsal bar snang ba nyid kyis dbang po'i shes ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gsal bar snang ba nyid kyis dbang po'i shes ba ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not the sense consciousness by virtue of the appearance of clarity.

original: 'on kyang don gyi yul can nyid kyis ma 'khrul ba dang 'khrul pa la sogs zhes bstan pa ni des na dbang po ni zhes bya ba'o //
