analyzed: 'on kyang don gyi yul can nyid kyis ma 'khrul ba dang 'khrul pa la sogs zhes bstan pa ni des na dbang po ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: However, in terms of the object, it is taught that it is non-mistaken and mistaken, etc. Therefore, it is said: the sense faculty.

original: nus pa med pa'am sgra'i yul ni spyi'i mtshan nyid yin zhes bya ba 'di la khyab ches pa gsal ba'i don du don yod do zhes khyad par du mi byed pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: nus pa med pa'am sgra'i yul ni spyi'i mtshan nyid yin zhes bya ba 'di la khyab ches pa gsal ba'i don du don yod do zhes khyad par du mi byed pa ma yin nam /
translated: But is it not the case that the object of a word is a universal, and that the word exists is not used to distinguish a particular from that?

original: shes pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis sgra'i yul thams cad skra shad bzhin du don dang don ma yin pa'i rnam par dbye ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba ni gal te shes pa'i rang bzhin gyis shes pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis sgra'i yul thams cad skra shad bzhin du don dang don ma yin pa'i rnam par dbye ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba ni gal te shes pa'i rang bzhin gyis shes pa'o //
translated: Because all objects of words are like a sky-flower, in that they are not divided into the categories of existent and non-existent by the nature of consciousness itself.

original: 'gal lo zhes bya ba ni nus pa can dang nus pa can ma yin @21a * //üîΩno zhes rnam pa gnyi ga yin par ro //
analyzed: 'gal lo zhes bya ba ni nus pa can dang nus pa can ma yin @21a * // no zhes rnam pa gnyi ga yin par ro //
translated: The word contradictory means that it is both potent and non-potent.

original: ji ltar 'dod phyir zhes bya ba ni gsal ba'i shes pa'i ngo bo ni rang rig pa'i yul yin gyi spyi ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod phyir zhes bya ba ni gsal ba'i shes pa'i ngo bo ni rang rig pa'i yul yin gyi spyi ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: How is it that it is so because of the desire? The nature of a manifest consciousness is the object of reflexive awareness, but a universal is not like that.

original: gang gi phyir don rnams kyis mtshungs pa'i ngo bo ni mtshungs pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir don rnams kyis mtshungs pa'i ngo bo ni mtshungs pa nyid yin te /
translated: Because the nature of similarity of objects is similarity itself.

original: don gyi mthar thug pa nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir de ltar gsal ba ma yin pa des na /
analyzed: don gyi mthar thug pa nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir de ltar gsal ba ma yin pa des na /
translated: Because it is realized as the ultimate meaning, it is not clear in that way.

original: shes pa'i ngo bo kho na phyi rol gyi don bzhin du dngos po'i don du cis mi 'dod ces gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: shes pa'i ngo bo kho na phyi rol gyi don bzhin du dngos po'i don du cis mi 'dod ces gsal ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, why not accept the nature of consciousness itself as the meaning of an entity, just like an external object?

original: don ni zhes bya ba ni spyi'i shes pa la'o //
analyzed: don ni zhes bya ba ni spyi'i shes pa la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúMeaning‚Äù refers to a general cognition.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni spyi'i shes pa la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni spyi'i shes pa la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that‚Äù refers to a general cognition.

original: shes pa shes pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis don nyid du zhen bzhin pa yang ji spyi yin snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: shes pa shes pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis don nyid du zhen bzhin pa yang ji spyi yin snyam du sems pa la /
translated: While clinging to the nature of consciousness itself as the meaning of an object, one thinks, ‚ÄúWhat is a generality?‚Äù

original: kun la zhes bya ba smos te shing gi sgra'i shes pa yang /
analyzed: kun la zhes bya ba smos te shing gi sgra'i shes pa yang /
translated: ‚ÄúIn all‚Äù refers to the cognition of the word ‚Äútree.‚Äù

original: rno ba ni gsal ba ste ches rno ba dang / dman pa dang / ches dman pa dang / drag pa dang / ches drag pa yang gang gi dang po tsan dan yin pa de ni seng sdeng la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rno ba ni gsal ba ste ches rno ba dang / dman pa dang / ches dman pa dang / drag pa dang / ches drag pa yang gang gi dang po tsan dan yin pa de ni seng sdeng la sogs pa ste /
translated: Sharp means clear, very sharp, inferior, very inferior, strong, and very strong. Sandalwood is the first, and so on.

original: der mtshungs pa de'i shes pa'i ngo bo la gcig tu byas pa ni rtogs pa'o zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: der mtshungs pa de'i shes pa'i ngo bo la gcig tu byas pa ni rtogs pa'o zhes sbyar ro //
translated: The cognition of that is made one in the nature of consciousness. This is the realization.

original: gzhan gyis khas blangs pa'i spyi'i chos de nyid la yod par bstan pa ni 'di ltar mtshungs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis khas blangs pa'i spyi'i chos de nyid la yod par bstan pa ni 'di ltar mtshungs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The general property that is accepted by others is shown to exist in that very way by ‚Äúin the same way.‚Äù

original: kun rdzob tu zhes bya ba ni tshad ma'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu zhes bya ba ni tshad ma'o //
translated: ‚ÄúConventionally‚Äù is the valid cognition.

original: de las zhes bya ba ni don las so //
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ni don las so //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom that‚Äù is from the object.

original: don las skye ba yin na rtogs pa med par 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: don las skye ba yin na rtogs pa med par 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa la /
translated: If it arises from the object, it would be without realization.

original: bag chags kyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bag chags kyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thinking that, it says ‚Äúfrom latent impressions.‚Äù

original: de ltar sgrub pa'i ngo bo snang ba dang / brtag bya dag gcig tu byas pas spyi bstan nas ldog pa'i ngo bo spyi bstan pa ni de ni ldog pa la bstan nas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar sgrub pa'i ngo bo snang ba dang / brtag bya dag gcig tu byas pas spyi bstan nas ldog pa'i ngo bo spyi bstan pa ni de ni ldog pa la bstan nas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus, having taught the general property by making the appearance that is the nature of the proof and the object of investigation one, the general property of the nature of the negation is taught by ‚Äúhaving taught that in terms of the negation.‚Äù

original: brtan pa ni ngo bo gnyis te de la skye ba dang / der 'jug pa'i shes pa ste /
analyzed: brtan pa ni ngo bo gnyis te de la skye ba dang / der 'jug pa'i shes pa ste /
translated: The nature of the negation is twofold: the arising of that and the consciousness that engages it.

original: de bstan pa ni de'i rgyud nas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bstan pa ni de'i rgyud nas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Teaching that is ‚Äúfrom its continuum.‚Äù

original: 'jug par byed pa yin zhes bya ba ni de la zhen pas zhes byar bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'jug par byed pa yin zhes bya ba ni de la zhen pas zhes byar bar sbyar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúEngaging‚Äù is to be supplied as ‚Äúby adhering to that.‚Äù

original: ldog pa dang 'brel pas zhes bya ba ni gnyis kyi ngo bo ste /
analyzed: ldog pa dang 'brel pas zhes bya ba ni gnyis kyi ngo bo ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause of the relation of the exclusion‚Äù means the nature of the two.

original: gang gi phyir ldog pa las skyes pa'i rnam pa ni ldog pa nyid du zhen par byed de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ldog pa las skyes pa'i rnam pa ni ldog pa nyid du zhen par byed de /
translated: Because the aspect that arises from the exclusion causes the exclusion itself to be conceived,

original: de'i phyir ldog pa'i rang bzhin ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir ldog pa'i rang bzhin ni /
translated: the nature of the exclusion

original: gal te shes pa'i ngo bo gsal ba las skyes pa yin na /üîΩgsal ba'i ngo bo zhen pa'am /
analyzed: gal te shes pa'i ngo bo gsal ba las skyes pa yin na / gsal ba'i ngo bo zhen pa'am /
translated: If the nature of consciousness arises from the manifest,üîΩthen the manifest nature would be conceived,

original: gsal ba nyid du khyad par mi mtshon par 'gyur ba yin gyi /
analyzed: gsal ba nyid du khyad par mi mtshon par 'gyur ba yin gyi /
translated: or the manifest would not be represented as a particular.

original: gzhan shes pa'i ngo bo'am spyi yang ma yin zhes zer ba ni ji ltar rnam pa spyi yin zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan shes pa'i ngo bo'am spyi yang ma yin zhes zer ba ni ji ltar rnam pa spyi yin zhes bya ba ste /
translated: But it is not the nature of another consciousness or a universal.

original: de'i phyir shes pa'i rang bzhin gyi dngos po ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir shes pa'i rang bzhin gyi dngos po ni /
translated: Therefore, the nature of consciousness

original: don byed par nus pa ma yin te don dang dbang po la @21b sogs pa med kyang sgra las byung ba'i shes pa la snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don byed par nus pa ma yin te don dang dbang po la @21b sogs pa med kyang sgra las byung ba'i shes pa la snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: is not capable of performing a function, because it appears in the consciousness that arises from words, even though there is no object, sense faculty, and so on.

original: dbang po med kyang sgra las byung ba la snang bzhin pa ni /
analyzed: dbang po med kyang sgra las byung ba la snang bzhin pa ni /
translated: Even though there is no sense faculty, the appearance in the consciousness that arises from wordsüîΩis a real entity.

original: dngos po kho na yin no zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po kho na yin no zhe na ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.

original: dbang sogs 'bras bcas nyid phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang sogs 'bras bcas nyid phyir ro //
translated: because of the sense faculties, etc., and because of the result.

original: tshogs smos pa ni gcig kyang 'bras bu dang bcas pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: tshogs smos pa ni gcig kyang 'bras bu dang bcas pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: The collection is mentioned because the result is not just one.

original: thams cad na sgra yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad na sgra yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù is used because sound exists in all of them.

original: de med na ji ltar sgra thos par 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: de med na ji ltar sgra thos par 'gyur zhing //
translated: If it does not exist, how can sound be heard?

original: ma bzung ba'i don la brdar yang ji ltar byed /
analyzed: ma bzung ba'i don la brdar yang ji ltar byed /
translated: And how can a convention be made about an object that is not apprehended?

original: dbang po ma gtogs par yang thog ma med pa'i bag chags las blo la gnas pa'i sgra ni /
analyzed: dbang po ma gtogs par yang thog ma med pa'i bag chags las blo la gnas pa'i sgra ni /
translated: The sound that exists in the mind, which is produced from beginningless imprints without the sense faculty,

original: brda 'dzin pa la rgyu mtshan sad par byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: brda 'dzin pa la rgyu mtshan sad par byed pa'i phyir /
translated: is the cause for arousing the understanding of the convention.

original: dbang po tshogs pa'i rtogs pa ni //
analyzed: dbang po tshogs pa'i rtogs pa ni //
translated: The understanding of the collection of sense faculties

original: 'di bas yang ba'i rtog pa yin //
analyzed: 'di bas yang ba'i rtog pa yin //
translated: is a more difficult understanding than this.

original: zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: yang na tshogs pa don med pa yin gyi /
analyzed: yang na tshogs pa don med pa yin gyi /
translated: Or else, the collection is meaningless,

original: gcig ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gcig ni ma yin te /
translated: but not the individual sense faculty,

original: gang gi phyir thos pa'i sgra ni rang bzhin kho nas don rtogs par byed kyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir thos pa'i sgra ni rang bzhin kho nas don rtogs par byed kyi /
translated: because the sound that is heard causes the understanding of the object by its own nature,

original: brda byas pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni yang ba'i rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: brda byas pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni yang ba'i rtog pa yin no //
translated: not by the convention. This is a more difficult understanding.

original: ngag ni ming la 'jug la ming ni don la 'jug ces bya ba'i kha cig gi lta ba de sel bar byed pa ni shes pa'i rnam pa de ni ming ma yin te /
analyzed: ngag ni ming la 'jug la ming ni don la 'jug ces bya ba'i kha cig gi lta ba de sel bar byed pa ni shes pa'i rnam pa de ni ming ma yin te /
translated: The statement ‚Äúspeech engages names and names engage objects‚Äù is a view held by some.

original: rang rig pa'i shes pa'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang rig pa'i shes pa'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The aspect of consciousness is not a name because it is the aspect of a consciousness that is aware of itself.

original: rang rig pa'i bdag nyid ma yin na rang rig pa ma yin pa de'i ngo bo ma yin te rtogs pa ma yin pas med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang rig pa'i bdag nyid ma yin na rang rig pa ma yin pa de'i ngo bo ma yin te rtogs pa ma yin pas med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were not of the nature of reflexive awareness, it would not be reflexive awareness because it would not be cognition and would not exist.

original: khas blangs nas bstan pa ni ming sogs brjod na zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: khas blangs nas bstan pa ni ming sogs brjod na zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The statement ‚Äúwhen names and so on are expressed‚Äù teaches this by implication.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni don gyi gzugs brnyan te /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni don gyi gzugs brnyan te /
translated: The term ‚Äúand so on‚Äù refers to the reflection of an object.

original: rgyu mtshan bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the reason.

original: zad par sgom pa la sogs pa la 'di gsal ba yin no //üîΩ'brel ba med pa can zhes bya ba ni gsum ka dang 'brel pa can ma yin te /
analyzed: zad par sgom pa la sogs pa la 'di gsal ba yin no // 'brel ba med pa can zhes bya ba ni gsum ka dang 'brel pa can ma yin te /
translated: This is clear in the context of the complete training in all aspects and so on.

original: shes pa yin yang brjod bya'i don ma rtogs pa'i phyir 'jug pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shes pa yin yang brjod bya'i don ma rtogs pa'i phyir 'jug pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The statement ‚Äúit is not related to any of the three‚Äù means that it is not related to any of the three because it is a consciousness but it does not engage in the object to be expressed since it does not realize the object.

original: sgra las mi rtogs na don gyi gzugs brnyan gyi ngo bo nyid yin pas /
analyzed: sgra las mi rtogs na don gyi gzugs brnyan gyi ngo bo nyid yin pas /
translated: If one does not understand from the sound, then it is a form of the meaning, and

original: don la 'khrul pa yin la /
analyzed: don la 'khrul pa yin la /
translated: it is a mistake about the meaning.

original: de las 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: de las 'jug pa yin no //
translated: From that, there is engagement.

original: de bzhin du zad par sa bsgom pa la sogs pa la rgyu mtshan rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du zad par sa bsgom pa la sogs pa la rgyu mtshan rtogs pa yin te /
translated: Similarly, in the cultivation of the earth-limit and so forth, there is the realization of the reason,

original: sar mngon par zhen pa'i phyir 'jug pa yin par bstan pa ni //
analyzed: sar mngon par zhen pa'i phyir 'jug pa yin par bstan pa ni //
translated: but it is taught that engagement is due to clinging to the earth.

original: gal te don las tshul 'dra las zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gal te don las tshul 'dra las zhes bya ba ste /
translated: If it is similar to the meaning, it is said that

original: gzugs brnyan gyi 'dra ba nyid las ni /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan gyi 'dra ba nyid las ni /
translated: from the mere similarity to the reflection,

original: dus thams cad du 'khrul pas 'jug pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dus thams cad du 'khrul pas 'jug pa ma yin te /
translated: there is no engagement due to error at all times.

original: ngag ming la 'jug par mthong ba po'i 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ngag ming la 'jug par mthong ba po'i 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: For one who sees the engagement of speech in the name, there is no engagement.

original: mthong ba po ma yin pa 'jug par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: mthong ba po ma yin pa 'jug par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: For one who is not a seer, there is engagement.

original: mthong ba po long zhing lkugs par @22a * //
analyzed: mthong ba po long zhing lkugs par @22a * //
translated: For one who is a seer, there would be blindness and muteness,

original: 'gyur ba dang / sgra'i tha snyad chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gyur ba dang / sgra'i tha snyad chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: and the convention of sound would be severed.

original: ming la yang 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bshad pa ni thog ma med pa'i ma rig pa'i bag chags las der zhen pa nyid de'i shes pa de zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: ming la yang 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bshad pa ni thog ma med pa'i ma rig pa'i bag chags las der zhen pa nyid de'i shes pa de zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi 'dod pa yin no //
translated: The explanation ‚Äúit would engage names‚Äù is that the conception of that in that is due to the latent propensities of beginningless ignorance. That consciousness is called ‚Äúthat‚Äù in the assertion of others.

original: de nyid khas blangs nas brjod pa ni yul la 'khrul pa yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nyid khas blangs nas brjod pa ni yul la 'khrul pa yin par 'gyur te /
translated: Having accepted that, it is said that it would be an error with respect to the object,

original: yul 'dzin par nye bar mtshon pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yul 'dzin par nye bar mtshon pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is characterized as apprehending the object.

original: gzugs la 'khrul pa yang gzung ste /
analyzed: gzugs la 'khrul pa yang gzung ste /
translated: An error with respect to form is also apprehended,

original: mi 'dod kyang 'khrul pa 'thob po zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi 'dod kyang 'khrul pa 'thob po zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: because even if one does not assert it, one obtains an error. This is the meaning.

original: yul la 'khrul pa yod pa de ni yul la mi gnas pa'i phyir ming la mi 'gyur ro zhes 'chad pa ni ldog pa'i sgo nas yin la ;
analyzed: yul la 'khrul pa yod pa de ni yul la mi gnas pa'i phyir ming la mi 'gyur ro zhes 'chad pa ni ldog pa'i sgo nas yin la ;
translated: The explanation ‚Äúit would not engage names‚Äù is from the point of view of the reversal of the error with respect to the object, because it does not abide in the object.

original: rjes su 'gro ba'i sgo nas bstan pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba'i sgo nas bstan pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation from the point of view of the forward process is ‚Äúif it were an error with respect to the object.‚Äù

original: shes pa'i rnam par 'khrul pa nyid ni bag chags kyi rgyu yin par bstan pa ni shes pa la mtshungs min zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: shes pa'i rnam par 'khrul pa nyid ni bag chags kyi rgyu yin par bstan pa ni shes pa la mtshungs min zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The teaching that the error of consciousness itself is the cause of latent propensities is ‚Äúconsciousness is not the same.‚Äù

original: de 'dra ba'i blo zhes bya ba ni rang gi rnam pa la don nyid du zhen pa'i blo ni bdag la 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i blo zhes bya ba ni rang gi rnam pa la don nyid du zhen pa'i blo ni bdag la 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the statement ‚ÄúThe mind that is called ‚Äòsuch and such‚Äô is the mind that conceives the object itself in the aspect of itself‚Äù is that the mind is the self.

original: ming ni blo nyid de ltar dpyod pas 'jug par byed par ni mi rigs te khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni gzhan las te /
analyzed: ming ni blo nyid de ltar dpyod pas 'jug par byed par ni mi rigs te khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni gzhan las te /
translated: It is not reasonable to analyze the name in that way, because it is not accepted.

original: ming dang mtshan ma mthong ba la'o //
analyzed: ming dang mtshan ma mthong ba la'o //
translated: The name is seen as a sign.

original: shes par smra pas gang bstan pa de ni ma yin te khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes par smra pas gang bstan pa de ni ma yin te khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The name is not what the proponent of consciousness teaches, because it is not accepted.

original: phyir rol gyi don gyi rnam shes 'byung bar khas len pa la tshad ma can min pa ni rnam shes dang phyir rol gyi don las gzhan pa'i ming 'di la tshad ma med de /
analyzed: phyir rol gyi don gyi rnam shes 'byung bar khas len pa la tshad ma can min pa ni rnam shes dang phyir rol gyi don las gzhan pa'i ming 'di la tshad ma med de /
translated: For those who accept that external objects produce consciousness, the name is not a valid means of knowledge other than consciousness and external objects.

original: des bskyed pa'i khyad par grub pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des bskyed pa'i khyad par grub pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no valid means of knowledge that produces a difference in them.

original: ldog pa ni rjes su dpag pa ste /
analyzed: ldog pa ni rjes su dpag pa ste /
translated: The reverse is an inference.

original: grub pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grub pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not established.

original: lus can dang lus can ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lus can dang lus can ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The body and the non-body are

original: dbyibs can dang dbyibs can ma yin ba dag go //
analyzed: dbyibs can dang dbyibs can ma yin ba dag go //
translated: They are the possessor of shape and the non-possessor of shape.

original: yul de rdul gang gi yin pa de ni de'i yul yin pa de'i'o //
analyzed: yul de rdul gang gi yin pa de ni de'i yul yin pa de'i'o //
translated: The object of a particle is that which is its object.

original: yul med pa zhes bya ba na mi yin pa zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: yul med pa zhes bya ba na mi yin pa zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: The non-object is that which is not an object.

original: shes pa ste zhes bya ba 'dis ni smras pa dran par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: shes pa ste zhes bya ba 'dis ni smras pa dran par byed pa yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúcognition‚Äù is used to remind us of what was said earlier.

original: ming dang mtshan ma ma rtogs na tha snyad kyi yan lag ma yin gyi rtogs na shes pa kho na yin par bstan pa ni rtogs nas don gyi rnam pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ming dang mtshan ma ma rtogs na tha snyad kyi yan lag ma yin gyi rtogs na shes pa kho na yin par bstan pa ni rtogs nas don gyi rnam pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If the name and sign are not understood, they are not a part of the conventional. If they are understood, they are only cognition. This is shown by the words ‚Äúhaving understood, the aspect of the object.‚Äù

original: de mi 'thad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir dang / de'i ngo bo ma yin na mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de mi 'thad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir dang / de'i ngo bo ma yin na mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is not tenable, because it is not of the nature of understanding, and because it is not reasonable that it be of that nature.

original: da la yang zhes bya ba ni ming dang mtshan mar snang ba'i phyogs la yang ngo //
analyzed: da la yang zhes bya ba ni ming dang mtshan mar snang ba'i phyogs la yang ngo //
translated: Here also, in the case of the appearance as name and sign.

original: 'khrul pa nyid ni phyi rol la shes pa'i @22b rnam pa bzhin du khas blangs pa la tshad ma yin no zhes sbyar bas rgol ba yin no //
analyzed: 'khrul pa nyid ni phyi rol la shes pa'i @22b rnam pa bzhin du khas blangs pa la tshad ma yin no zhes sbyar bas rgol ba yin no //
translated: The opponent is one who maintains that error itself is valid in regard to external objects, as if they were the form of consciousness.

original: lan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni ma yin pa kho na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni ma yin pa kho na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The reply is ‚Äúno‚Äù ‚Äî the meaning is that it is not so.

original: gal te phyi rol gyi snang ba las phyi rol yin pa de nyid ni 'jug par byed pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: gal te phyi rol gyi snang ba las phyi rol yin pa de nyid ni 'jug par byed pa nyid yin la /
translated: If the external appearance is external, then that itself is the engaging cause.

original: de la yang kha cig tu don du gnyer ba nyid kyis skyes bu 'jug pa yin gyi /üîΩkha cig tu ni ma yin pa de dag tsam gyis 'khrul pa ni ma yin no snyam du sems pa la gal te shes pa thams cad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la yang kha cig tu don du gnyer ba nyid kyis skyes bu 'jug pa yin gyi / kha cig tu ni ma yin pa de dag tsam gyis 'khrul pa ni ma yin no snyam du sems pa la gal te shes pa thams cad ces bya ba'o //
translated: And in regard to that, a person engages in some places due to the desire for a goal, but not in others.üîΩThe mere fact that one engages in some places is not error.

original: phyi rol snang ba yin par ci las shes //
analyzed: phyi rol snang ba yin par ci las shes //
translated: If all consciousnesses are external appearances, how do you know?

original: zhes zer ba ni shes pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes zer ba ni shes pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning is that consciousness is not so.

original: shes pa thams cad la phyi rol zhes bya ba ni mi 'grub ste rmi lam gyi shes pa la phyi rol pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa thams cad la phyi rol zhes bya ba ni mi 'grub ste rmi lam gyi shes pa la phyi rol pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not established that all consciousnesses are external appearances, because external things do not exist in dream consciousness.

original: rmi lam na yang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed ming la sogs pa la brten nas mthong ba yin no snyam du sems pa la 'du byed las kyang min zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rmi lam na yang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed ming la sogs pa la brten nas mthong ba yin no snyam du sems pa la 'du byed las kyang min zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In a dream, one sees forms, etc. on the basis of non-associated formative forces such as names, etc.

original: 'gal ba dmigs pa yin par bstan pa ni de'i sngo la sogs par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'gal ba dmigs pa yin par bstan pa ni de'i sngo la sogs par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The demonstration of the perception of the contradictory is: ‚Äúthe perception of blue, etc.

original: rmi lam gyi nang gi ni sngon po la sogs pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: rmi lam gyi nang gi ni sngon po la sogs pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: In a dream, there is no real blue, etc.

original: thogs pa med pa'i phyir dang / dang ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: thogs pa med pa'i phyir dang / dang ba'i phyir te /
translated: because it is not obstructed and because it is clear.

original: thogs pa med pa'i bar ma do'i srid pa'i gzugs lta bu'o zhes 'di la bstan pa ni de'i shes pa yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: thogs pa med pa'i bar ma do'i srid pa'i gzugs lta bu'o zhes 'di la bstan pa ni de'i shes pa yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The demonstration of this is: ‚Äúthe perception of that.

original: bar ma do'i srid pa yang gzhan gyi sems bzhin te /
analyzed: bar ma do'i srid pa yang gzhan gyi sems bzhin te /
translated: ‚Äù Intermediate existence is like the form of an intermediate state being.

original: lha'i mig gis mthong ba nyid yin yang thun mong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: lha'i mig gis mthong ba nyid yin yang thun mong ba ma yin no //
translated: Even though it is seen by the divine eye, it is not common.

original: gzung bar bya ba nyid mi dmigs pa las kyang shes pa nyid yin par bstan pa ni ming sogs zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzung bar bya ba nyid mi dmigs pa las kyang shes pa nyid yin par bstan pa ni ming sogs zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The demonstration that consciousness is known from the non-perception of the state of being an object is: ‚Äúthe perception of names, etc.üîΩ‚Äù

original: thams cad du dmigs pa dang ldan pa yin yang /
analyzed: thams cad du dmigs pa dang ldan pa yin yang /
translated: Although it is associated with the observation of everything,

original: tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa'i dbye bas 'gyur ba bstan pa ni de lta na'o na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa'i dbye bas 'gyur ba bstan pa ni de lta na'o na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the distinction between valid cognition and invalid cognition is taught by the phrase ‚Äúbut it is not so.‚Äù

original: 'di la de kho na nyid ces bya ba thams cad dmigs pa dang bcas pa'am /
analyzed: 'di la de kho na nyid ces bya ba thams cad dmigs pa dang bcas pa'am /
translated: Here, what is this so-called reality? Is it associated with the observation of everything,

original: dmigs pa med pa'am /
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa'am /
translated: or is it devoid of observation?

original: ci zhig yin zhe na /üîΩdmigs pa med pa nyid kho na ste /
analyzed: ci zhig yin zhe na / dmigs pa med pa nyid kho na ste /
translated: What is it?üîΩIt is devoid of observation,

original: gzung bya nyid ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzung bya nyid ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the object of observation is not observed.

original: de bstan pa ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid ni grub pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bstan pa ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid ni grub pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The demonstration of that is ‚Äúbecause the observation of everything is not established.‚Äù

original: gar yang zhes bya ba ni sad pa'i gnas skabs na yang ngo //
analyzed: gar yang zhes bya ba ni sad pa'i gnas skabs na yang ngo //
translated: ‚Äú Anywhere‚Äù means even in the waking state.

original: 'o na ni zhes bya ba ni khas blangs nas brjod pa la'o //
analyzed: 'o na ni zhes bya ba ni khas blangs nas brjod pa la'o //
translated: ‚Äú But then‚Äù means having accepted.

original: sngon po la sogs pa nyid ces bya ba ni bden pa'i sngon po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa nyid ces bya ba ni bden pa'i sngon po la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Blue, etc.‚Äù means real blue, etc.

original: de las bzlog pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni thogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni thogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚Äú Because it is the opposite of that‚Äù means because it is unobstructed.

original: ci las shes she na de lta yang sa phyogs shin tu dog par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci las shes she na de lta yang sa phyogs shin tu dog par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: How is this known? It is said, ‚ÄúIn a very narrow place.‚Äù

original: thams cad kyis zhes bya ba ni gnyid @23a * //üîΩlog pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: thams cad kyis zhes bya ba ni gnyid @23a * // log pa nyid kyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúAll‚Äù refers to those who are asleep.

original: nang gi bag chags yongs su smin pa yang 'dzin pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir rgyu yin par bstan pa ni 'du byed kyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nang gi bag chags yongs su smin pa yang 'dzin pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir rgyu yin par bstan pa ni 'du byed kyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The ripening of internal latent impressions is also a cause of grasping. The cause is indicated by ‚Äúformations.‚Äù

original: 'du byed las skyes pa'i shes pa la yang rang la yod par khyad par med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'du byed las skyes pa'i shes pa la yang rang la yod par khyad par med pa'i phyir /
translated: Consciousness that arises from formations is also not distinguished as existing in oneself.

original: thams cad kyi shes pa thob par 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: thams cad kyi shes pa thob par 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
translated: It is taught that all consciousness would be obtained:

original: nye ba thams cad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: nye ba thams cad ces bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAll that is near.‚Äù

original: 'ga' zhig ces bya ba ni gzung bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ces bya ba ni gzung bar bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSome‚Äù refers to what is to be grasped.

original: 'du byed pa'i dang gis de skyed par byed pa mthong ba la rnam par dbye ba yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'du byed pa'i dang gis de skyed par byed pa mthong ba la rnam par dbye ba yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The distinction is taught in seeing that the one who forms causes that to arise:

original: sngon gyi rang bzhin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi rang bzhin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe previous nature.‚Äù

original: de'i dus nyid ni da ltar gyi dus nyid do //
analyzed: de'i dus nyid ni da ltar gyi dus nyid do //
translated: That very time is the present time.

original: de la phyin ci log yod min//
analyzed: de la phyin ci log yod min//
translated: There is no error there.

original: zhes bya ba ni sad pa na mthong ba la phyin ci log pa'i chos yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sad pa na mthong ba la phyin ci log pa'i chos yod pa ma yin no //
translated: In the waking state, there is no such thing as the existence of a false object of perception.

original: thams cad kyis zhes bya ba ni de mthong ba'i skyes bus so //
analyzed: thams cad kyis zhes bya ba ni de mthong ba'i skyes bus so //
translated: ‚ÄúEveryone‚Äù means the person who perceives that object.

original: de dag kyang zhes bya ba ni phyin ci log pa nyid kyis chos dang las dag la phyin ci log nyid du mthong ba'i skyes bu dag la'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang zhes bya ba ni phyin ci log pa nyid kyis chos dang las dag la phyin ci log nyid du mthong ba'i skyes bu dag la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThey‚Äù means the persons who perceive the object and action as false because of the falsity of the object.

original: thams cad ni skyes bu ste /
analyzed: thams cad ni skyes bu ste /
translated: ‚ÄúEveryone‚Äù means all persons.

original: gnyid log pa bzhin du sad pa la yang snang ba ni /
analyzed: gnyid log pa bzhin du sad pa la yang snang ba ni /
translated: Just as in a dream, so in the waking state, the appearance is consciousness.

original: shes pa yin pas shes pa thams cad 'khrul pa yin pa la dbye ba med do //
analyzed: shes pa yin pas shes pa thams cad 'khrul pa yin pa la dbye ba med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no distinction between all consciousnesses in that all are false.

original: snang ba kho na yin gyi zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gzhan du don rnam pa gzhan ltar 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: snang ba kho na yin gyi zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gzhan du don rnam pa gzhan ltar 'dzin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOnly the appearance‚Äù means that the form is apprehended in one way, but the object is actually of another nature.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni med pa'i don no //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni med pa'i don no //
translated: ‚ÄúMoreover‚Äù means that the object does not exist.

original: med pa'i don gyi ngo bo mthong ba las dmigs pa med par rtogs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: med pa'i don gyi ngo bo mthong ba las dmigs pa med par rtogs pa yin gyi /
translated: The understanding that there is no object of perception comes from seeing the nature of the nonexistence of the object.

original: phyin ci log tu snang ba ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni de lta na ni 'o na shes pa nyid de zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log tu snang ba ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni de lta na ni 'o na shes pa nyid de zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to that is: ‚ÄúIf that is so, then consciousness itself . . .‚Äù

original: re zhig gnod pa byed pa mi 'byung ba tsam ni gnod par byed pa ma yin te thal ches pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: re zhig gnod pa byed pa mi 'byung ba tsam ni gnod par byed pa ma yin te thal ches pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mere non-occurrence of an impairment is not an impairment, because that would be absurd.

original: 'on kyang gnod pa can las gzhan pa'i shes pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni gnod par byed pa nyid kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang gnod pa can las gzhan pa'i shes pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni gnod par byed pa nyid kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: However, it is not a consciousness that is different from an impairment. The response to that is: ‚ÄúAn impairment itself . . .‚Äù

original: phrad pa'i shes pa'i ngo bo ni gnod par byed pa med par smra ba ni don thob pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phrad pa'i shes pa'i ngo bo ni gnod par byed pa med par smra ba ni don thob pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The nature of a consciousness that has contact is not an impairment. The response to that is: ‚ÄúBecause the object is obtained . . .‚Äù

original: 'o na ji ltar zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi tshe med pa kho nas de la yang rjes su dpag pa yin zhes bya ba de kho na bstan pa ni dri za'i grong khyer zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi tshe med pa kho nas de la yang rjes su dpag pa yin zhes bya ba de kho na bstan pa ni dri za'i grong khyer zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWell then, how . . .‚Äù is the question: ‚ÄúAt another time, it is only non-existence. How is there an inference even in that case?‚Äù The response to that is: ‚ÄúA city of gandharvas . . .‚Äù

original: de la dri za'i grong khyer la sogs pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: de la dri za'i grong khyer la sogs pa rnams la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúA city of gandharvas‚Äù and so on are examples.

original: 'dis ni zhes bya ba ni shes pa thams cad phyin ci log par snang ba nyid du thal ches pas so //
analyzed: 'dis ni zhes bya ba ni shes pa thams cad phyin ci log par snang ba nyid du thal ches pas so //
translated: This is because it would follow, absurdly, that all cognitions would be mistaken appearances.

original: don ni don no zhes mthong ba las rtogs pa yang don nyid du rnam par rtog pas rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: don ni don no zhes mthong ba las rtogs pa yang don nyid du rnam par rtog pas rtogs pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of the passage is that the object is understood from seeing the object, and that the object is understood through the conceptual thought that conceives of it as an object.üîΩLet us set aside for the moment the question of whether or not the consciousnesses of dreams and so on are in error with regard to their objects.

original: rmi lam la sogs pa'i shes pa don dang ldan pa nyid ni re zhig zhog / sad pa @23b rnams kyis gzugs la sogs pa'i blo 'di gang yin pa de nyid don dan ldan par gang gis te /üîΩrgyu mtshan gang gis 'dod pa las gnyid kyi snang ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rmi lam la sogs pa'i shes pa don dang ldan pa nyid ni re zhig zhog / sad pa @23b rnams kyis gzugs la sogs pa'i blo 'di gang yin pa de nyid don dan ldan par gang gis te / rgyu mtshan gang gis 'dod pa las gnyid kyi snang ba ni ma yin te /
translated: The question is, why do you assert that the consciousnesses of form and so on of those who are awake are in error with regard to their objects?üîΩIt is not because of the appearance of objects in dreams and so on,

original: rmi lam la sogs pa dang thun mong ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rmi lam la sogs pa dang thun mong ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: for the reason is shared by the example and the object of the example.

original: gnod par byed pa med pa ni slu ba med pa ste /
analyzed: gnod par byed pa med pa ni slu ba med pa ste /
translated: The absence of a cause of error is nondeceptive.

original: mi slu ba kho na yin la de yang thab par bya ba'i rjes su 'gro ba yin na'o zhes zer ba ni gal te don nus mthong phyir na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi slu ba kho na yin la de yang thab par bya ba'i rjes su 'gro ba yin na'o zhes zer ba ni gal te don nus mthong phyir na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is only nondeceptive and it is only that which is in accordance with what is to be done.

original: gzhan pa ste rmi lam dang spyi la sogs pa ni don med pa can yin te rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan pa ste rmi lam dang spyi la sogs pa ni don med pa can yin te rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The other, i.e., dreams, universals, etc., are meaningless because they are without reason.

original: thug pa med par zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: thug pa med par zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúwithout end‚Äù means that they are not worldly.

original: 'jig rten pa nyid du rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni phyin ci log tu snang bas te /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa nyid du rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni phyin ci log tu snang bas te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúare understood as worldly‚Äù means that they appear as erroneous.

original: de yang 'jig rten pa ma yin pa la 'jig rten par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de yang 'jig rten pa ma yin pa la 'jig rten par rtogs pa'o //
translated: Moreover, they are understood as worldly even though they are not worldly.

original: 'dir don gzhan med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa ni 'di ni rtogs pa tsam nyid yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir don gzhan med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa ni 'di ni rtogs pa tsam nyid yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation ‚Äúhere there is no other meaning,‚Äù etc., is just an understanding.

original: 'brel pa can gyi ming brjod pas kyang don la 'jug pa ma yin na /
analyzed: 'brel pa can gyi ming brjod pas kyang don la 'jug pa ma yin na /
translated: If one does not engage the meaning by expressing a related name,üîΩwhat need is there to mention that one does not engage the meaning by expressing an unrelated name?

original: 'brel pa med pa la lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'brel pa med pa la lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: The text shows this:

original: 'brel med na yang 'jug mi 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'brel med na yang 'jug mi 'gyur // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: One does not engage even when there is a relation.

original: 'brel pa can gyi phyogs la skyon gzhan brjod pa ni 'das pa dang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'brel pa can gyi phyogs la skyon gzhan brjod pa ni 'das pa dang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The text states another error in the position that there is a relation:

original: don dang 'brel pa can gyi ming ni don zhig na 'jig par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don dang 'brel pa can gyi ming ni don zhig na 'jig par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The name that is related to the object is the object that is destroyed when the object is destroyed.

original: don dang 'brel pa can gyi ming ni /
analyzed: don dang 'brel pa can gyi ming ni /
translated: The name that is related to the object

original: don zhig na 'jig pa yin te /
analyzed: don zhig na 'jig pa yin te /
translated: is the object that is destroyed when the object is destroyed.

original: mi rtag pa nyid kyi phyir la spyi ni de lta ma yin ta /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid kyi phyir la spyi ni de lta ma yin ta /
translated: Because of impermanence, but the universal is not like that,üîΩbecause it is permanent.

original: rtag pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba ni sgra las spyi ni 'dzin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rtag pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba ni sgra las spyi ni 'dzin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The universal is grasped from the word,

original: ming dang mtshan ma la bstan pa'i thal bar 'gyur bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ming dang mtshan ma la bstan pa'i thal bar 'gyur bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: because the consequence of the teaching with regard to the name and the sign would not occur.

original: mtshungs pa rnams kyi dngos po ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba la ltos pa nyid kyis de 'dzin par nus pa'i 'dzin pa kho na yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshungs pa rnams kyi dngos po ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba la ltos pa nyid kyis de 'dzin par nus pa'i 'dzin pa kho na yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The thing of the similar ones is only the grasping that is able to grasp it in dependence on the arising,

original: de 'dzin pa la skyon du 'gyur bar bstan pa ni de min zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de 'dzin pa la skyon du 'gyur bar bstan pa ni de min zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The teaching of the fault in the grasping of that is ‚Äúit is not that.‚Äù

original: mtshungs pa rnams kyi ngo bo zhas bsgrub pa tsam gyi dngos po rang gi bdag nyid kyis yod bzhin pa'i spyi ni gsal ba rnams la 'jug pa yin gyi /üîΩde'i ngo bo ni ma yin no snyam du sems pa la 'dzin na yang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: mtshungs pa rnams kyi ngo bo zhas bsgrub pa tsam gyi dngos po rang gi bdag nyid kyis yod bzhin pa'i spyi ni gsal ba rnams la 'jug pa yin gyi / de'i ngo bo ni ma yin no snyam du sems pa la 'dzin na yang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúalso‚Äù is this: Even if one thinks that the universal of a thing that exists by way of its intrinsic reality is engaged in the manifestations, but that it is not their nature.üîΩEven if one thinks that the universal of a thing that exists by way of its intrinsic reality is engaged in the manifestations, but that it is not their nature.üîΩEven if one thinks that the universal of a thing that exists by way of its intrinsic reality is engaged in the manifestations, but that it is not their nature.

original: rang dbang gi gzung bya nam mkha' bzhin du 'dzin bzhin pa yang gsal ba de dag gi spyi ma yin zhing /üîΩde dag kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: rang dbang gi gzung bya nam mkha' bzhin du 'dzin bzhin pa yang gsal ba de dag gi spyi ma yin zhing / de dag kyang ma yin te /
translated: Even if one thinks that the universal of a thing that exists by way of its intrinsic reality is engaged in the manifestations, but that it is not their nature.üîΩEven if one thinks that the universal of a thing that exists by way of its intrinsic reality is engaged in the manifestations, but that it is not their nature.üîΩEven if one thinks that the universal of a thing that exists by way of its intrinsic reality is engaged in the manifestations, but that it is not their nature.üîΩEven if one thinks that the universal of a thing that exists by way of its intrinsic reality is engaged in the manifestations, but that it is not their nature.

original: gsal bar byed pa'i phyir gsal bar byed pa zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩde'i phyir nam mkha' bzhin du mig la sogs pa yod pa tsam gyis te /üîΩrtag tu ni gsal ba yod dam med na yang @24a * //
analyzed: gsal bar byed pa'i phyir gsal bar byed pa zhes bya ba'i don to // de'i phyir nam mkha' bzhin du mig la sogs pa yod pa tsam gyis te / rtag tu ni gsal ba yod dam med na yang @24a * //
translated: Even if one thinks that the universal of a thing that exists by way of its intrinsic reality is engaged in the manifestations, but that it is not their nature.üîΩEven if one thinks that the universal of a thing that exists by way of its intrinsic reality is engaged in the manifestations, but that it is not their nature.üîΩEven if one thinks that the universal of a thing that exists by way of its intrinsic reality is engaged in the manifestations, but that it is not their nature.üîΩEven if one thinks that the universal of a thing that exists by way of its intrinsic reality is engaged in the manifestations, but that it is not their nature.üîΩEven if one thinks that the universal of a thing that exists by way of its intrinsic reality is engaged in the manifestations, but that it is not their nature.üîΩEven if one thinks that the universal of a thing that exists by way of its intrinsic reality is engaged in the manifestations, but that it is not their nature.üîΩEven if one thinks that the universal of a thing that exists by way of its intrinsic reality is engaged in the manifestations, but that it is not their nature.

original: dmigs par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ni des na rtag tu mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dmigs par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ni des na rtag tu mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Even if one thinks that the universal of a thing that exists by way of its intrinsic reality is engaged in the manifestations, but that it is not their nature.üîΩEven if one thinks that the universal of

original: res 'ga' ba ni rtag tu dmigs pa ma yin pa ma yin no snyam du sems pa la rtag nyid phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: res 'ga' ba ni rtag tu dmigs pa ma yin pa ma yin no snyam du sems pa la rtag nyid phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Sometimes, however, it is not the case that the universal is not perceived.

original: nam mkha' rtag pa yin yang mig la sogs pa'i gsal ba la ltos nas ji ltar mngon sum ba de bzhin du spyi yang 'brel pa can gyi gsal ba mngon par gsal ba la ltos nas mngon sum du 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa ni /üîΩgal te yang gsal las mngon sum la gsal ba yin zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: nam mkha' rtag pa yin yang mig la sogs pa'i gsal ba la ltos nas ji ltar mngon sum ba de bzhin du spyi yang 'brel pa can gyi gsal ba mngon par gsal ba la ltos nas mngon sum du 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa ni / gal te yang gsal las mngon sum la gsal ba yin zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Even though space is permanent, it is perceived in dependence on the clarity of the eye, etc. In the same way, the universal is perceived in dependence on the clarity of the particulars that are related to it.

original: gang gi zhan gsal ba'i ste khyad par gyi'o //üîΩspyi'i mngon sum zhes bya ba ni rgyu mtshan yin no //
analyzed: gang gi zhan gsal ba'i ste khyad par gyi'o // spyi'i mngon sum zhes bya ba ni rgyu mtshan yin no //
translated: If the universal is perceived in dependence on the clarity of the particulars, then the universal is the clarity of the particulars.üîΩThe universal is the clarity of the particulars, i.e., the clarity of the particulars is the universal.

original: gsal ba las mngon par gsal ba mngon sum la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gsal ba las mngon par gsal ba mngon sum la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The universal is perceived in dependence on the clarity of the particulars.üîΩThe universal is perceived in dependence on the clarity of the particulars.

original: 'brel par dka' ba yin te /
analyzed: 'brel par dka' ba yin te /
translated: It is difficult to understand how the universal can be perceived in dependence on the clarity of the particulars,

original: gsal ba dang mngon sum pa dag pa khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal ba dang mngon sum pa dag pa khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no difference between the universal and the clarity of the particulars.

original: spyi'am nam mkha' yang rung mngon sum gyi ngo bo ni gsal bar byed pa la ltos pa ma yin te don med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi'am nam mkha' yang rung mngon sum gyi ngo bo ni gsal bar byed pa la ltos pa ma yin te don med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The nature of the manifest, whether it be a universal or space, does not depend on illumination, because that would be meaningless.

original: de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa yang ltos par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa yang ltos par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Nor does that which is not its nature depend on it.

original: khyad par du sgro gdags pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: khyad par du sgro gdags pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The non-superimposition of a distinction is taught:

original: bdag la shes pa skyed pa la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bdag la shes pa skyed pa la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äúin the production of cognition of itself.‚Äù

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni gsal bar gnas pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni gsal bar gnas pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOtherwise‚Äù means in the nature of the manifest.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba 'di la zhes zer ba ni gal te spyi zhes bya ba'o//üîΩde'i rang bzhin ni gsal ba'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba 'di la zhes zer ba ni gal te spyi zhes bya ba'o// de'i rang bzhin ni gsal ba'i ngo bo'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn this ‚Äòotherwise‚Äô ‚Äù means if it is called a universal.üîΩIts nature is the nature of the manifest.

original: de'i rang bzhin du ni gsal bar gnas pa nyid du'o //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin du ni gsal bar gnas pa nyid du'o //
translated: It is in the nature of that, in the nature of the manifest.

original: de zhes bya ba ni gsal ba'i ngo bo'i 'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni gsal ba'i ngo bo'i 'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the nature of the manifest.

original: gal te gsal ba rtogs pa med par yang //
analyzed: gal te gsal ba rtogs pa med par yang //
translated: ‚ÄúIf the manifest were not understood‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba'i sgra las byung ba'i phyogs kho na la'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i sgra las byung ba'i phyogs kho na la'o //
translated: refers to the position that arises from the word ‚Äúalso.‚Äù

original: gsal ba dang 'brel pa med na gsal ba kho na la gzhan du yang ji ltar zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa'i yul yin no //
analyzed: gsal ba dang 'brel pa med na gsal ba kho na la gzhan du yang ji ltar zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa'i yul yin no //
translated: If there is no connection with manifestation, then how can manifestation alone be the other? This is the point of contention.

original: ma grub pa'i sgrub bya dang sgrub byed dang 'brel pa la sogs pa dpe'i skyon de dag rnams ni skyon du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ma grub pa'i sgrub bya dang sgrub byed dang 'brel pa la sogs pa dpe'i skyon de dag rnams ni skyon du mi 'gyur te /
translated: The faults of the example, such as the probandum and probans not being established, and the connection not being established, do not become faults.

original: phyogs de'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni dpe'i skyon med par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyogs de'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni dpe'i skyon med par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because it is the nature of that position, it is taught that there is no fault in the example.

original: gong bur gsal ba yin yang spyi gsal bar ma yin par bstan pa ni //
analyzed: gong bur gsal ba yin yang spyi gsal bar ma yin par bstan pa ni //
translated: Even though the manifestation is a whole, it is not taught that the universal is manifested.

original: des na gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, if it is said,

original: de la mngon sum gyis rtogs pas ci bya zhes bya ba ni khas blangs pa ste /
analyzed: de la mngon sum gyis rtogs pas ci bya zhes bya ba ni khas blangs pa ste /
translated: What is the use of understanding through perception? this is an admission.

original: ma grub po zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ma grub po zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not established.

original: sgra las rtogs pa ni mngon sum gyis rtogs pa ma gtogs par mi 'byung zhes bya ba don gyis go ba yin no zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: sgra las rtogs pa ni mngon sum gyis rtogs pa ma gtogs par mi 'byung zhes bya ba don gyis go ba yin no zhes zer ba ni /
translated: The meaning is understood that understanding from words does not occur except through understanding through perception.

original: @24b gal te mngon sum zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: @24b gal te mngon sum zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is said, perception,

original: mngon sum gyis rtogs pa nyid sgra las rtogs par byed do zhes snang ba'i dbye ba las dgag par byed pa ni /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis rtogs pa nyid sgra las rtogs par byed do zhes snang ba'i dbye ba las dgag par byed pa ni /
translated: A universal is not a perceptible object, but it is the cause of a cognition that has the aspect of a perceptible object.

original: spyi'i rnam pa gang yin pa de nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: spyi'i rnam pa gang yin pa de nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúitself‚Äù in the verse refers to the universal.

original: spyi ni dmigs par bya ba yin yang rang bzhin gyis dmigs bya ma yin pas /
analyzed: spyi ni dmigs par bya ba yin yang rang bzhin gyis dmigs bya ma yin pas /
translated: A universal is an object of perception, but it is not a perceptible object by nature.

original: gzhan gyis gzhan du 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan gyis gzhan du 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: So, is it not the case that one thing is made into something else by something else?

original: de'i nus pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i nus pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The word ‚Äúcapacity‚Äù is stated in the verse.

original: gzhan gyis gzhan du byed na mi rtag par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan gyis gzhan du byed na mi rtag par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that if one thing is made into something else by something else, then it is impermanent.

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid la dmigs na byis pa'i thog ma med pa'i bag chags kyis bskyed pa'i sngon po la sogs pa'i shes pa mi gsal bar snang ba yin te /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid la dmigs na byis pa'i thog ma med pa'i bag chags kyis bskyed pa'i sngon po la sogs pa'i shes pa mi gsal bar snang ba yin te /
translated: When a specific characteristic, such as blue, is perceived, the cognition of blue, etc., that is generated by the beginningless predispositions of a child appears unclearly.

original: phyi rol du zhen pa'i snang ba de la brdar byas pas sgra las byung ba yin par snang ba yin na /
analyzed: phyi rol du zhen pa'i snang ba de la brdar byas pas sgra las byung ba yin par snang ba yin na /
translated: When that appearance, which is the conception of external objects, is designated by a word, it appears to be produced from a word.

original: de la mngon sum gyis rtogs pas ci zhig bya zhes sems pa la /
analyzed: de la mngon sum gyis rtogs pas ci zhig bya zhes sems pa la /
translated: What is the use of understanding it through perception?

original: spyi'i rnam par shes pa de yang zhes bstan ba la /
analyzed: spyi'i rnam par shes pa de yang zhes bstan ba la /
translated: In response to this, it is taught that even that cognition of the universalüîΩis also a cognition of an object.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni sgra las byung ba'i las te rjes 'brel ni rjes su 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni sgra las byung ba'i las te rjes 'brel ni rjes su 'gro ba'o //
translated: Also is a verbal root meaning action. Conjoined means connected.

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i cha ni mi gsal ba'o //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i cha ni mi gsal ba'o //
translated: The aspect of the form of blue, etc. is unclear.

original: gang gis sprul zhes bya ba ni sngon por mthong ba dang bag chags dag gis drangs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gis sprul zhes bya ba ni sngon por mthong ba dang bag chags dag gis drangs pa yin gyi /
translated: By what conjures it, it means that it is drawn by the perception of blue and so on and by predispositions.

original: spyi tsam mthong ba las ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: spyi tsam mthong ba las ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It does not mean that it is seen as a mere universal.

original: spyi med par thal ba'i phyir te zhes bya ba 'di bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: spyi med par thal ba'i phyir te zhes bya ba 'di bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the teaching that it follows that there would be no universal.

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa las tha dad pa'i spyi la mtshungs pa'i rnam pa yin na don gyir mi 'gyur ba bstan pa ni /üîΩde la yang zhes bya ba'i yang ni ni'i don to //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa las tha dad pa'i spyi la mtshungs pa'i rnam pa yin na don gyir mi 'gyur ba bstan pa ni / de la yang zhes bya ba'i yang ni ni'i don to //
translated: If the universal were a similar aspect to the aspects of blue, etc., it would not be an object.üîΩThe word also in in that also has the meaning of indeed.

original: gnyi ga yang zhes bya ba ni don dang spyi dag gi'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang zhes bya ba ni don dang spyi dag gi'o //
translated: Both means both the object and the universal.

original: dbang pos gzung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang pos gzung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: it is not apprehended by the sense faculties.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is because

original: sgra las byung ba kho nas khyad par yang rtogs pa yin na /
analyzed: sgra las byung ba kho nas khyad par yang rtogs pa yin na /
translated: if the distinction is understood only through language,

original: dbang po la don med pa'i phyir dbang pos gzung bar bya bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang po la don med pa'i phyir dbang pos gzung bar bya bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then the sense faculties would not be the apprehenders of the object, because they would be useless.

original: 'on te sgra las byung ba ni gnyi ga'i 'dzin pa yin la /
analyzed: 'on te sgra las byung ba ni gnyi ga'i 'dzin pa yin la /
translated: But if the distinction is apprehended by both,

original: dbang po ni khyad par tsam 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: dbang po ni khyad par tsam 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: and the sense faculties apprehend only the particular,üîΩthen the sense faculties would have a result,üîΩbecause the distinction is apprehended by both.üîΩThis is the argument.üîΩSince the sense faculties do not apprehend the universal, there is no convention.

original: de'i phyir 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin no zhes zer ba ni dbang pos zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin no zhes zer ba ni dbang pos zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the distinction is not understood through language.üîΩThis is the argument.üîΩSince the sense faculties do not apprehend the universal, there is no convention.üîΩTherefore, the distinction is not understood through language.üîΩThis is the argument.üîΩSince the sense faculties do not apprehend the universal, there is no convention.üîΩTherefore, the distinction is not understood through language.üîΩThis is the argument.üîΩSince the sense faculties do not apprehend the universal, there is no convention.üîΩTherefore, the distinction is not understood through language.üîΩThis is the argument.üîΩSince the sense faculties do not apprehend the universal, there is no convention.üîΩTherefore, the distinction is not understood through language.üîΩThis is the argument.üîΩSince the sense faculties do not apprehend the universal, there is no convention.üîΩTherefore, the distinction is not understood through language.üîΩThis is the argument.üîΩSince the sense faculties do not apprehend the universal, there is no convention.

original: dbang pos spyi mi 'dzin pas brda med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dbang pos spyi mi 'dzin pas brda med pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, the distinction is not understood through language.üîΩThis is the argument.üîΩSince the sense faculties do not apprehend the universal, there is no convention.üîΩTherefore, the distinction is not understood through language.üîΩThis is the argument.üîΩSince the sense faculties do not apprehend the universal, there is no convention.

original: sgra las byung bas 'di rig pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni sgra las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sgra las byung bas 'di rig pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni sgra las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the distinction is not understood through language.üîΩThis is the argument.

original: mngon sum gyis spyi rtogs pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis spyi rtogs pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: Since the sense faculties do not apprehend the universal, there is no convention.

original: snang ba tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: snang ba tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the distinction is not understood through language.

original: gal te sngon po la sogs pa nyid sgra las byung ba'i yul can gyi gzhan spyi'i ma yin na de dang 'dra bar dbang po la don med pa @25a * //
analyzed: gal te sngon po la sogs pa nyid sgra las byung ba'i yul can gyi gzhan spyi'i ma yin na de dang 'dra bar dbang po la don med pa @25a * //
translated: If blue and so on are not the objects of the other universals that arise from sound, then the absurd consequence is that they would be useless for the senses.

original: yin no zhes bya ba'i thal bar 'gyur ba'i don nye bar bsdu ba ni gsal ba nyid sgras zhes bya ba'o /
analyzed: yin no zhes bya ba'i thal bar 'gyur ba'i don nye bar bsdu ba ni gsal ba nyid sgras zhes bya ba'o /
translated: The meaning of the reductio is summarized in the words ‚Äúthe manifestation of blue and so on.‚Äù

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i ngo bo spyi yin par smra ba po nyid sngon po la sogs pa gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'i rnam par dbye ba las /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i ngo bo spyi yin par smra ba po nyid sngon po la sogs pa gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'i rnam par dbye ba las /
translated: The one who asserts that the universal is the nature of blue and so on must distinguish between the manifestation and nonmanifestation of blue and so on.

original: dbang po dang sgra las byung ba'i shes pa dag gi yul rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dbang po dang sgra las byung ba'i shes pa dag gi yul rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir /
translated: This is because the objects of the consciousnesses that arise from the senses and from sound are posited as being different.

original: dbang po 'bras bu med pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: dbang po 'bras bu med pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The demonstration that the senses are not useless is as follows.

original: gal te dbang po shes don nyid //
analyzed: gal te dbang po shes don nyid //
translated: If the object of the sense consciousnessüîΩis the manifestation of blue and so on, then the senses are not useless.

original: ces bya ba ste gsal bar shes pa'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ces bya ba ste gsal bar shes pa'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the object is the manifestation of blue and so on.

original: sgra sogs ni sgra dang gzugs la sogs pa las so //
analyzed: sgra sogs ni sgra dang gzugs la sogs pa las so //
translated: Sound and so on are from sound and form and so on.

original: gcig gi ngo bo la mngon sum du ngo bo nyid gnyis su mi snang ba'i phyir tha dad par snang ba ste /
analyzed: gcig gi ngo bo la mngon sum du ngo bo nyid gnyis su mi snang ba'i phyir tha dad par snang ba ste /
translated: Because two natures do not appear in the nature of one thing, they appear to be different.

original: gsal ba dang mi gsal ba gnyis su snang ba ga las te /
analyzed: gsal ba dang mi gsal ba gnyis su snang ba ga las te /
translated: How could they appear as clear and unclear?

original: mngon sum las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum las ni ma yin no //
translated: They do not appear in a direct perception.

original: de yod na zhes bya ba ni sgra las byung ba la yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yod na zhes bya ba ni sgra las byung ba la yod pa'i phyir /
translated: If they exist, they exist in what is derived from words.

original: da ltar ba dang nye ba la da ltar ba bzhin zhes bya ba'i rig pas so //üîΩgsal ba'i ngo bor gcig pa'i dngos po yin du zin kyang de yang da ltar ba'i nye ba yin pa ni /
analyzed: da ltar ba dang nye ba la da ltar ba bzhin zhes bya ba'i rig pas so // gsal ba'i ngo bor gcig pa'i dngos po yin du zin kyang de yang da ltar ba'i nye ba yin pa ni /
translated: The cognition that the present and the near are like the present applies to them.

original: mngon sum kho na'i yul yin gyi /
analyzed: mngon sum kho na'i yul yin gyi /
translated: Even if the entity is the same in terms of its clear nature, the nearness of the present is the object of direct perception alone.

original: sgra'i sbyor ba ni de la 'bras bu dang bcas pa ma yin la /
analyzed: sgra'i sbyor ba ni de la 'bras bu dang bcas pa ma yin la /
translated: The application of words does not have an effect on that.

original: gzhan du ni sgra yin no zhes bya ba'i rnam par dbye ba zer ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan du ni sgra yin no zhes bya ba'i rnam par dbye ba zer ba ni /
translated: But in other cases, the distinction is made that the present is a word.

original: de lta na yang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: de lta na yang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag ces bya ba ste /
translated: Even so, the past and future are said to be

original: mi snang ba med pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: mi snang ba med pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: nonexistent, that is, not appearing.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pas gzung ba'i phyir yul thag ring ba la sgra thos pa'i shes pas rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pas gzung ba'i phyir yul thag ring ba la sgra thos pa'i shes pas rtogs pa yin te /
translated: Because sound is perceived by auditory consciousness, it is understood by the consciousness that hears sound in a distant place.

original: gzhan du na gnas la ltos nas kyang ji ltar yul thag ring ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: gzhan du na gnas la ltos nas kyang ji ltar yul thag ring ba nyid yin te /
translated: Otherwise, how could sound be distant in relation to a location?

original: de yang rna bas ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de yang rna bas ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: To explain that sound is not perceived by the ear, it is said:

original: de ni rgyang ring yul nyid du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ni rgyang ring yul nyid du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is a distant object.

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i gsal ba la brten pa mtshungs pa nyid tsam gyi ngo bo sngon po la sogs pa'i cha dang ldan pa'i rigs nyid snang ba ma yin nam snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i gsal ba la brten pa mtshungs pa nyid tsam gyi ngo bo sngon po la sogs pa'i cha dang ldan pa'i rigs nyid snang ba ma yin nam snyam du sems pa la /
translated: Don‚Äôt you think that what appears is just the universal that possesses the aspect of blue, etc., which is the nature of mere similarity based on the manifestation of blue, etc.?üîΩTo explain that, it is said:

original: rigs ldan rigs min zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rigs ldan rigs min zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The universal is not the possessor of the universal.

original: gsal ba'i ngo bo ni so sor gcig la gcig ldog par grub pa rang rang gi rgyu las gyur pa yin zhes gzhan gyis kyang khas blangs pa bstan to //
analyzed: gsal ba'i ngo bo ni so sor gcig la gcig ldog par grub pa rang rang gi rgyu las gyur pa yin zhes gzhan gyis kyang khas blangs pa bstan to //
translated: The nature of the manifestation is established as individual and mutually exclusive, arising from its own cause, as accepted by others.

original: de 'di rigs dang ldan pa yin gyi rigs ni ma yin no zhes ci las shes she na /
analyzed: de 'di rigs dang ldan pa yin gyi rigs ni ma yin no zhes ci las shes she na /
translated: How do you know that this is the possessor of the universal, but the universal is not?

original: gang gis gzhan la brten pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gis gzhan la brten pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it depends on another.

original: gzhan la ltos pa ni gzhan la brten pa yin la /
analyzed: gzhan la ltos pa ni gzhan la brten pa yin la /
translated: That which depends on another is dependent on another.

original: khra bo la khu yu nyid du snang @25b ba ma yin te /
analyzed: khra bo la khu yu nyid du snang @25b ba ma yin te /
translated: A variegated color does not appear as a variegated color.

original: tha dad pa'i gzhan la ltos pa nyid ni 'bras bu nyid yin la /
analyzed: tha dad pa'i gzhan la ltos pa nyid ni 'bras bu nyid yin la /
translated: The very dependence on another that is different is the effect.

original: de khu yu la sogs pa la phan tshun med do //
analyzed: de khu yu la sogs pa la phan tshun med do //
translated: But a variegated color, etc. do not have mutual dependence.

original: de bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de bstan pa ni /
translated: This is demonstrated in the following:

original: ltos phyir 'bras bu nyid du brjod //
analyzed: ltos phyir 'bras bu nyid du brjod //
translated: Because it depends, it is called an effect.

original: ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is said.

original: rang gi rgyu la ltos nas 'bras bu nyid yod do zhe na /
analyzed: rang gi rgyu la ltos nas 'bras bu nyid yod do zhe na /
translated: If you say that an effect exists in dependence on its cause,

original: de lta na yang grub pa ni ltos pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta na yang grub pa ni ltos pa med pa yin te /
translated: even so, that which is established does not depend on another,

original: gzhan la rag ma las pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan la rag ma las pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: because it is not dependent on another. This is demonstrated in the following:üîΩBecause it is established, it is called an effect.

original: grub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is complete.

original: ma grub pa ni grub pa 'ba' zhig kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: ma grub pa ni grub pa 'ba' zhig kho na yin gyi /
translated: That which is not established is only established.

original: ltos pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ltos pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not dependent,

original: rang nyid pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: rang nyid pa nyid kyis so //
translated: because it is itself.

original: khra bo la sogs par grub bu ma yin pa ni ltos par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: khra bo la sogs par grub bu ma yin pa ni ltos par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: That which is not established as variegated, etc. does not cause dependence.

original: ltos pa med par dmigs pa'i phyir dang / rdzogs pa nyid kyis de la ltos nas 'bras bu ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: ltos pa med par dmigs pa'i phyir dang / rdzogs pa nyid kyis de la ltos nas 'bras bu ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: Because it is observed without dependence, and because it is not a result in relation to that, since it is complete.üîΩHow can it be a non-result?

original: 'bras min ji ltar yang ci zhig / ces bya ba rnam pa gnyis su'o //
analyzed: 'bras min ji ltar yang ci zhig / ces bya ba rnam pa gnyis su'o //
translated: In this way, it is shown in two ways.

original: de'i 'di zhes ji ltar 'bras bu yin pa de bzhin du de nyid 'di'o zhes 'bras bu ma yin par rtogs pa nyid do zhe na rtog pa 'ba' zhig gis 'brel par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i 'di zhes ji ltar 'bras bu yin pa de bzhin du de nyid 'di'o zhes 'bras bu ma yin par rtogs pa nyid do zhe na rtog pa 'ba' zhig gis 'brel par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: If one says that just as it is a result in the sense that ‚Äúthis is its,‚Äù so it is not a result in the sense that ‚Äúthis is just that,‚Äù it is only imagination that makes the connection.

original: mngon sum gyis ni ma yin te de las bzlog par dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis ni ma yin te de las bzlog par dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not perception, because it is observed in the opposite way.

original: gsal ba'i ngo bo las gzhan nyid yin na /
analyzed: gsal ba'i ngo bo las gzhan nyid yin na /
translated: If it were different from the nature of manifestation,

original: de ste gsal ba'i ngo bo rigs dang 'brel pa med do //
analyzed: de ste gsal ba'i ngo bo rigs dang 'brel pa med do //
translated: then manifestation would not be related to the universal.

original: gang gi phyir tha mi dad pa dang / cig shos kyis rnam par rtog pa med pa de'i phyir rigs ni rang bzhin med pa yin te tha dad pa dang cig shos nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir tha mi dad pa dang / cig shos kyis rnam par rtog pa med pa de'i phyir rigs ni rang bzhin med pa yin te tha dad pa dang cig shos nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: Since it is neither identical nor different, therefore the universal is essenceless. It cannot be said to be either different or non-different.

original: dngos po ma yin na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dngos po ma yin na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: if it is not an entity.

original: gal te tha dad grub ces bya //
analyzed: gal te tha dad grub ces bya //
translated: If you say that it is established as different,

original: zhe na dang / 'bras min nyid ces bya ba yang /
analyzed: zhe na dang / 'bras min nyid ces bya ba yang /
translated: and also that it is not an effect,

original: spyi yin zhes bya ba ni zhar las byung ba'o //
analyzed: spyi yin zhes bya ba ni zhar las byung ba'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúgenerally‚Äù is an aside.

original: ldog pa'i phyogs la brten nas bshad pa ni /
analyzed: ldog pa'i phyogs la brten nas bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation based on the opposite is:

original: gzhan nyid yin na de 'brel med //
analyzed: gzhan nyid yin na de 'brel med //
translated: If it were different, it would not be related to it.

original: ces bya ba 'dis rtogs pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: ces bya ba 'dis rtogs pa'i don yin no //
translated: This is the meaning of the statement.

original: gal te tha dad grub ce na //
analyzed: gal te tha dad grub ce na //
translated: If you say that it is established as different,

original: zhes bya ba 'dis 'bras bu ma yin pa'i gsal ba'i yul kho na la 'chad par byed pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis 'bras bu ma yin pa'i gsal ba'i yul kho na la 'chad par byed pa ni /
translated: this explains only with regard to the object of manifestation that is not an effect.

original: de bzhin du khra bo la sogs pa ni gzhan la ltos pa med par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du khra bo la sogs pa ni gzhan la ltos pa med par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Similarly, with regard to multicolored and so on, it is said that ‚Äúit does not depend on another.‚Äù

original: 'bras min ji ltar yang ci zhig / ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'bras min ji ltar yang ci zhig / ces bya ba ni /
translated: What is the point of saying that it is not an effect?

original: gsal ba'i yul kho nar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gsal ba'i yul kho nar bstan pa ni /
translated: The explanation is only with regard to the object of manifestation.

original: bzlog pa la smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba ste 'bras bu ma yin pa'i gsal ba'i ngo bo la'o //
analyzed: bzlog pa la smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba ste 'bras bu ma yin pa'i gsal ba'i ngo bo la'o //
translated: What is the point of mentioning the opposite? It is with regard to the nature of manifestation that is not an effect.

original: gzhan nam spyi yang rung zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'dod pa yin no //üîΩgsal @26a * //
analyzed: gzhan nam spyi yang rung zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'dod pa yin no // gsal @26a * //
translated: ‚ÄúAnother‚Äù or ‚Äúa universal‚Äù is what is intended.

original: ba las gsal ba gzhan nam zhes bya ba 'di ni snga ma las zlos pa yin la /
analyzed: ba las gsal ba gzhan nam zhes bya ba 'di ni snga ma las zlos pa yin la /
translated: ‚ÄúAnother clarity from clarity‚Äù is a repetition of the previous.

original: nyes pa bsu ba yang ma yin te bar chad med pa nyid kyis mi dran pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyes pa bsu ba yang ma yin te bar chad med pa nyid kyis mi dran pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not a fault, because there is no non-memory due to the absence of interruption.

original: de ltar na khro bo la sogs pa'i ba lang nyid ni spyi ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na khro bo la sogs pa'i ba lang nyid ni spyi ma yin te /
translated: Thus, the cowhood of the angry and so on is not a universal,

original: ri bong gi rva bzhin du 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: ri bong gi rva bzhin du 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro//
translated: because it is unrelated, like the horn of a rabbit.

original: gal te 'gyur na ri bong gi rva la yang 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa la /üîΩmed pa rigs su thal mi 'gyur //
