analyzed: gal te 'gyur na ri bong gi rva la yang 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa la / med pa rigs su thal mi 'gyur //
translated: If it were, it would be in the horn of a rabbit as well.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIt does not follow that a non-existent is a type.‚Äù

original: med pa ni ri bong gi rva'o //
analyzed: med pa ni ri bong gi rva'o //
translated: A non-existent is the horn of a rabbit.

original: ci las shes she na /
analyzed: ci las shes she na /
translated: How is it known?

original: ltos pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ltos pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is unrelated.

original: rtogs pas 'brel par byed ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtogs pas 'brel par byed ces bya ba'o //
translated: It is said that it is related by the understanding.

original: ltos pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa rtogs pas sprul pa'i rigs dang rigs dang ldan pa dag bstan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ltos pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa rtogs pas sprul pa'i rigs dang rigs dang ldan pa dag bstan pa ma yin no //
translated: The relation of dependence is not understood by the teaching of the species and the possessor of the species.

original: 'di ni ri bong gi rva dang ba khra mo dag la yod pa ma yin no //üîΩde la brten nas zhes bya ba ni ba khra mo la sogs pa la brten nas so //
analyzed: 'di ni ri bong gi rva dang ba khra mo dag la yod pa ma yin no // de la brten nas zhes bya ba ni ba khra mo la sogs pa la brten nas so //
translated: This is not the case with the horns of a rabbit and the color of a cow.üîΩIn that case, ‚Äúin dependence on‚Äù means in dependence on the color of a cow, etc.

original: de la yang ni ba khra mo la sogs pa la ba lang nyid kyi rtog pa 'jug par byed pa yin pa'i phyir te zhen pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la yang ni ba khra mo la sogs pa la ba lang nyid kyi rtog pa 'jug par byed pa yin pa'i phyir te zhen pa'i phyir /
translated: And in that case, the conception of cowness is engaged, because of adherence.

original: spyi de'i ngo bo yin gyi ba khra mo la sogs pa de dag gi 'brel pa can tha dad pa ni yod pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: spyi de'i ngo bo yin gyi ba khra mo la sogs pa de dag gi 'brel pa can tha dad pa ni yod pa ma yin zhing /
translated: The universal is the nature of that, but the difference of those, the color of a cow, etc., is not related to it,

original: tha mi dad pa yang ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: tha mi dad pa yang ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: and it is not non-different.

original: de'i bdag nyid kyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid kyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement that it is not different is ‚Äúin the nature of that.‚Äù

original: dngos su 'brel pa dang bral bar 'dod pa tsam las byung ba rnam par rtog pas byas pa'i 'brel pa ni /
analyzed: dngos su 'brel pa dang bral bar 'dod pa tsam las byung ba rnam par rtog pas byas pa'i 'brel pa ni /
translated: The relation that is made by the conception, which arises from the mere desire to relate, is actually without relation.

original: phyogs dang mthun phyogs pa bzhin du ri bong gi rva dang ba khra mo dag la yang cis mi 'gyur snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: phyogs dang mthun phyogs pa bzhin du ri bong gi rva dang ba khra mo dag la yang cis mi 'gyur snyam du sems pa la /
translated: Why wouldn‚Äôt the rabbit‚Äôs horn and the variegated cow be like that?

original: khyad par bstan pa ni de'i phyir ri bong la brten nas zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: khyad par bstan pa ni de'i phyir ri bong la brten nas zhes bya ba ste /
translated: To demonstrate the distinction, he says, ‚ÄúTherefore, in dependence on the rabbit‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: byis pa dang phyugs la sogs pa yang ba khra mo mthong nas /
analyzed: byis pa dang phyugs la sogs pa yang ba khra mo mthong nas /
translated: When children, cattle, and so on see the variegated cow,

original: thu yul la sogs pa mthong na de nyid la de nyid 'di yin no zhes rnam par dpyod kyi /
analyzed: thu yul la sogs pa mthong na de nyid la de nyid 'di yin no zhes rnam par dpyod kyi /
translated: when they see the horse, they analyze it, thinking, ‚ÄúThis is that very thing.‚Äù

original: rta ngang pa la sogs pa mthong ba la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rta ngang pa la sogs pa mthong ba la ni ma yin no //
translated: But when they see the horse, they do not think, ‚ÄúThis is the variegated cow.‚Äù

original: de yang don gyi khyad par mthong ba las byung ba rtogs pas byas pa'i rigs ni /
analyzed: de yang don gyi khyad par mthong ba las byung ba rtogs pas byas pa'i rigs ni /
translated: Moreover, the cognition that arises from seeing the particular object is produced by conceptualization.

original: brda yod na sgra rnams kyis brjod par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: brda yod na sgra rnams kyis brjod par bya ba yin te /
translated: If there is a convention, then words express it.

original: de'i phyir ri bong gi rva dang don mthong ba las byung ba'i rtogs pas go bar bya ba'i yul la sgra rnams rgyud nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir ri bong gi rva dang don mthong ba las byung ba'i rtogs pas go bar bya ba'i yul la sgra rnams rgyud nas /
translated: Therefore, in dependence on the words, the rabbit‚Äôs horn and the object that is the referent of the cognition that arises from seeing the object become the domain of the words.

original: don gyi yul can du 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ni de'i rigs kyi'o //
analyzed: don gyi yul can du 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ni de'i rigs kyi'o //
translated: Thus the words come to have the object as their domain.

original: khyad par ni gsal ba rnams so //
analyzed: khyad par ni gsal ba rnams so //
translated: The difference is that they are clear.

original: de la 'jug pa ni rab tu 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'jug pa ni rab tu 'jug pa'o //
translated: Among them, engagement is the process of engaging.

original: dgos pa gang dag gis yin pa de ni don can no //
analyzed: dgos pa gang dag gis yin pa de ni don can no //
translated: Those that have a purpose are purposeful.

original: rtog pa dang mtshungs pa'i yul can rnams @26b ji ltar gsal ba'i yul can yin zhe na /
analyzed: rtog pa dang mtshungs pa'i yul can rnams @26b ji ltar gsal ba'i yul can yin zhe na /
translated: How can those that have an object similar to conception have a clear object?

original: rtog pa yang zhen pa las de'i yul can kho na yin te /
analyzed: rtog pa yang zhen pa las de'i yul can kho na yin te /
translated: Conception is also from adherence. Its object is only that.

original: rtog pa dang mtshungs pa'i yul can rnams kyis so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rtog pa dang mtshungs pa'i yul can rnams kyis so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that those that have an object similar to conception have it.

original: ngo bo rnams ni rang bzhin rnams te phan tshun khyad par can rnams la brten nas skyes pa'i rtog pas sprul pa ni rigs yin no //
analyzed: ngo bo rnams ni rang bzhin rnams te phan tshun khyad par can rnams la brten nas skyes pa'i rtog pas sprul pa ni rigs yin no //
translated: The natures are the essences. The conception that arises in dependence on those that are mutually distinguished is the class.

original: 'di de yang yin la khyad par yang yin pa'i rnam par gcod pa yod do //
analyzed: 'di de yang yin la khyad par yang yin pa'i rnam par gcod pa yod do //
translated: This is a determinative statement that it is that and also distinguished.

original: de la 'jug pa ni rtogs par byed ba ste /
analyzed: de la 'jug pa ni rtogs par byed ba ste /
translated: Among them, engagement is the process of understanding.üîΩThose that have a purpose are purposeful.

original: gang dag gi dgos pa yin pa de dag gis so zhes kha cig 'chad do //
analyzed: gang dag gi dgos pa yin pa de dag gis so zhes kha cig 'chad do //
translated: Some explain it that way.

original: de las zhes bya ba ni khyad par las so //
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ni khyad par las so //
translated: From that means from the distinction.

original: der lhag par zhen pa zhes bya ba ni khyad par du zhen ba'o //
analyzed: der lhag par zhen pa zhes bya ba ni khyad par du zhen ba'o //
translated: The phrase attachment to that means attachment to a particular.

original: khyad par rtogs pa kho na las rigs rtogs pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa'i bya ba nyid khyad par gyi yul yin no //
analyzed: khyad par rtogs pa kho na las rigs rtogs pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa'i bya ba nyid khyad par gyi yul yin no //
translated: The activity of conceptualization is the object of a particular, because the understanding of a particular is due to the understanding of a particular.

original: de yang khyad par thams cad kyi thun mong yin pa'i phyir spyi zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de yang khyad par thams cad kyi thun mong yin pa'i phyir spyi zhes brjod do //
translated: And that is called a universal because it is common to all particulars.

original: gal te rnam par rtog pa'i bya ba kho na rigs yin na /
analyzed: gal te rnam par rtog pa'i bya ba kho na rigs yin na /
translated: If the activity of conceptualization is a universal,

original: mi gsal ba'i ngo bo rnam pa nyid ji ltar yin gang gi phyir ngo bo med pa la ni ngo bor rigs pa ma yin no snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: mi gsal ba'i ngo bo rnam pa nyid ji ltar yin gang gi phyir ngo bo med pa la ni ngo bor rigs pa ma yin no snyam du sems pa la /
translated: how can it be a form that is not clear? For it is not reasonable that what is formless be a form.üîΩTo this he says,

original: de la ngo bor snang ba'am zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de la ngo bor snang ba'am zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The appearance as form.

original: de la ngo bor snang ba ni gzung ba'i rnam pa ngo bor mthong bar sgro 'dogs pa rnam par rtog pa'i bdag nyid ni /
analyzed: de la ngo bor snang ba ni gzung ba'i rnam pa ngo bor mthong bar sgro 'dogs pa rnam par rtog pa'i bdag nyid ni /
translated: The appearance as form is the imputation of the perception of the form of an object. It is the nature of conceptualization.

original: de'i bya ba'i ngo bo'i rigs la yang 'khrul pas sbyar ba thog ma med pa'i bag chags kyis bskyed pa yin la /
analyzed: de'i bya ba'i ngo bo'i rigs la yang 'khrul pas sbyar ba thog ma med pa'i bag chags kyis bskyed pa yin la /
translated: It is applied to the activity of that, which is the universal of form, because of error. It is produced by beginningless predispositions.

original: nges kyang rigs su sbyar ba'i ngo bo'i rnam pas don la yang sbyor bar byed pa ni /
analyzed: nges kyang rigs su sbyar ba'i ngo bo'i rnam pas don la yang sbyor bar byed pa ni /
translated: Even if one were to apply the form of the nature to the object,

original: 'khrul pa kho na yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'khrul pa kho na yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: it is taught that this is only a mistake:

original: don la de nyid du 'dzin ba zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: don la de nyid du 'dzin ba zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚Äúgrasping the object as that itself.‚Äù

original: 'dzin pa ni sbyor ba ste gcig tu byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa ni sbyor ba ste gcig tu byed pa'o //
translated: Grasping is applying, making one.üîΩEven if one were to apply the form of the nature and the form of the object, since they become the identity of a single cognition, how could one conceive of them as one?

original: ngo bo'i rnam pa nyid do zhes gzung ba'i rnam pa dang / rigs sbyor yin pa nyid du zin kyang de dag shes pa gcig gi bdag nyid du gyur pa'i phyir gcig nyid du zhen pa ci las yin zhes dbye ba las dbye ba bstan pa ni /
analyzed: ngo bo'i rnam pa nyid do zhes gzung ba'i rnam pa dang / rigs sbyor yin pa nyid du zin kyang de dag shes pa gcig gi bdag nyid du gyur pa'i phyir gcig nyid du zhen pa ci las yin zhes dbye ba las dbye ba bstan pa ni /
translated: The differentiation of the differentiation is taught:

original: ngo bo nyid la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äúin the nature.‚Äù

original: ngo bo nyid ni gzung ba'i rnam pa'o //üîΩmthong ba zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa nyid do //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni gzung ba'i rnam pa'o // mthong ba zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa nyid do //
translated: The nature is the form of the apprehended.üîΩ‚ÄúSeeing‚Äù is the identity of the conceptual.

original: ma mthong ba zhes bya ba ni gsal ba dang rnam par rtog pa dag gi dbye ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ma mthong ba zhes bya ba ni gsal ba dang rnam par rtog pa dag gi dbye ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúNot seeing‚Äù means the differentiation of the clear and the conceptual.

original: de kho na mthong ba nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni dbye ba mthong ba nyid kyis so //
analyzed: de kho na mthong ba nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni dbye ba mthong ba nyid kyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy seeing that itself‚Äù means by seeing the division.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i dbye ba'i ngo bo'i spyi brjod nas /üîΩdon las ldog @27a * //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i dbye ba'i ngo bo'i spyi brjod nas / don las ldog @27a * //
translated: Having stated the universal that is the nature of the division of conceptualization,üîΩhe states the nature of the reversal from the object:

original: pa'i ngo bo bstan pa ni don rnams kyis ni spyi gang yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: pa'i ngo bo bstan pa ni don rnams kyis ni spyi gang yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhat is the universal of the objects?‚Äù

original: gzhan dag gi ldog pa ni ldog par byed pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: gzhan dag gi ldog pa ni ldog par byed pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid de /
translated: The reversal of others is the characteristic of the reversal itself.

original: ngo bo gang gi yin pa de ni gzhan las ldog pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos kho na spyi yin la /
analyzed: ngo bo gang gi yin pa de ni gzhan las ldog pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos kho na spyi yin la /
translated: That which has that nature is the universal that is the nature of the reversal from others.

original: de brjod pa'i sgra dag yin gyi tha dad pa'i spyi yin par smra ba bzhin du ni 'thad pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de brjod pa'i sgra dag yin gyi tha dad pa'i spyi yin par smra ba bzhin du ni 'thad pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The words that express that are the reversal itself, but it is not tenable that they are the universal of difference, as some maintain.

original: 'dir gzhi mthun pa nyid ma yin no //üîΩde las ldog par byed pa nyid ni shes par byed ba ste /
analyzed: 'dir gzhi mthun pa nyid ma yin no // de las ldog par byed pa nyid ni shes par byed ba ste /
translated: Therefore, there is no common locus.üîΩThe reversal from that is the revealer.

original: de las ldog par byed pa zhes bya ba dang sbyar ba ste /
analyzed: de las ldog par byed pa zhes bya ba dang sbyar ba ste /
translated: The reversal from that is to be connected with the revealer.

original: ldog par byed pa'i ngo bo'i don to //
analyzed: ldog par byed pa'i ngo bo'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the nature of the revealer is the reversal.

original: gal te 'jug par yang zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa yang ngo //
analyzed: gal te 'jug par yang zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa yang ngo //
translated: If you say ‚Äúalso‚Äù in the context of ‚Äúentering,‚Äù then it is also an affirmation.

original: 'gog pa zhes bya ba ni khyer nas mi 'ong ba ste 'gog par byed pa'i ngo bor rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'gog pa zhes bya ba ni khyer nas mi 'ong ba ste 'gog par byed pa'i ngo bor rtogs pa yin no //
translated: ‚Äú Stopping‚Äù means not bringing it, that is, it is understood to be the nature of stopping.

original: de 'gog pa zhes bya ba ni 'gog par byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: de 'gog pa zhes bya ba ni 'gog par byed pa nyid do //
translated: ‚Äú That stopping‚Äù is the very stopping.

original: dgag pa la zhes bya ba ni 'gog par byed pa nyid la'o //
analyzed: dgag pa la zhes bya ba ni 'gog par byed pa nyid la'o //
translated: ‚Äú In the context of stopping‚Äù is in the very stopping.

original: ba lang ngam ba lang ma yin zhes the tshom za ba /
analyzed: ba lang ngam ba lang ma yin zhes the tshom za ba /
translated: ‚Äú Is a cow or not a cow‚Äù is a doubt.

original: ba lang ma yin pa dang 'brel pa de la ba lang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ba lang ma yin pa dang 'brel pa de la ba lang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚Äú That which is connected to not a cow is a cow‚ÄùüîΩis the stopping of not a cow.

original: ba lang ma yin pa ldog par byed pa yin gyi gzhan la ni dang po nyid ba lang ngo zhes sbyor ba ni /
analyzed: ba lang ma yin pa ldog par byed pa yin gyi gzhan la ni dang po nyid ba lang ngo zhes sbyor ba ni /
translated: But in the first place, the application of ‚Äúcow‚Äù to something else

original: ba lang nyid sgrub pa'i ngo bo rtogs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: ba lang nyid sgrub pa'i ngo bo rtogs pa yin gyi /
translated: is the understanding of the nature of the affirmation of cowhood,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: but not of the specific property.

original: gzhan yang rig pa nyid kho na dngos po yang de yin la spyi yang de yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rig pa nyid kho na dngos po yang de yin la spyi yang de yin te /
translated: Moreover, awareness itself is a thing and also a universal.

original: de yang dkar por yang 'gyur srid pas /
analyzed: de yang dkar por yang 'gyur srid pas /
translated: And that can also be white,üîΩso it is not a specific property.

original: nag po zhes bya ba ni yang ldog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: nag po zhes bya ba ni yang ldog par byed pa'o //
translated: The word black is a term that excludes.

original: nag po yang ba lang ma yin ba srid pas de ldog par byed pa ni ba lang ngo zhes bya ba las phyi nas rtogs par 'gyur gyi sngar ni ma yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: nag po yang ba lang ma yin ba srid pas de ldog par byed pa ni ba lang ngo zhes bya ba las phyi nas rtogs par 'gyur gyi sngar ni ma yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: Since it is possible that what is black is not a cow, the term cow is a term that excludes that which is not a cow. Therefore, the meaning of the term cow is understood later, not earlier.

original: gal te sgra dang po'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te sgra dang po'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If you think this, then the response is: If the first sound...

original: ngag la ni byed pa'i tshig gtso bo yin te /
analyzed: ngag la ni byed pa'i tshig gtso bo yin te /
translated: In a sentence, the verbal form is primary,

original: bya ba ston pa'i phyir ro zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: bya ba ston pa'i phyir ro zhes ston pa ni /
translated: because it expresses the action. This is shown by the words not taking...here.

original: len par mi byed pa 'dir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: len par mi byed pa 'dir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The word here is a term that excludes.

original: gzhan ci yid ces bya ba ni mi len pa yin zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gzhan ci yid ces bya ba ni mi len pa yin zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: What else? refers to what is not taken.

original: ming la gzhan du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ni khyer nas 'ongs pa ni khyer nas ma 'ongs pa 'gog par byed pa dang po 'dzin pa la'o //
analyzed: ming la gzhan du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ni khyer nas 'ongs pa ni khyer nas ma 'ongs pa 'gog par byed pa dang po 'dzin pa la'o //
translated: The consequence that the name would be different is shown by the words having brought... Having brought is a term that excludes what has not been brought. It is used for the first apprehension.

original: de ni ba lang ma yin pa la yang thal bar 'gyur bas ba lang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ni ba lang ma yin pa la yang thal bar 'gyur bas ba lang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Since that would also be a consequence for what is not a cow, the word cow is used.

original: de las kyang nag po ma yin pa la yang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir /üîΩnag po'i zhes bya ba'i sel ba ni sgra'i don te /
analyzed: de las kyang nag po ma yin pa la yang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir / nag po'i zhes bya ba'i sel ba ni sgra'i don te /
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the word ‚Äúexclusion‚Äù is ‚Äúnon-black.‚Äù

original: sel ba kho na sgra'i don yin no zhes bya ba'i don to//
analyzed: sel ba kho na sgra'i don yin no zhes bya ba'i don to//
translated: The meaning of the statement ‚Äúexclusion alone is the meaning of the word‚Äù is that the meaning of the word is exclusion alone.

original: @27b ma yin par dgag pa kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: @27b ma yin par dgag pa kho na yin gyi /
translated: It is a nonimplicative negation,

original: med par dgag pa'i ngo bo ni ma yin te /
analyzed: med par dgag pa'i ngo bo ni ma yin te /
translated: but it is not the entity of an implicative negation,

original: dngos po de las gzhan pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po de las gzhan pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is nothing that is different from that entity.

original: yod bar zin kyang spyi la bstan pa'i gzhi mthun pa ma yin pa nyid la sogs pa'i spyi la bstan pa'i skyon rnams su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yod bar zin kyang spyi la bstan pa'i gzhi mthun pa ma yin pa nyid la sogs pa'i spyi la bstan pa'i skyon rnams su 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if it did exist, the faults of the generality that is taught in the statement ‚Äúthere is no common locus of being a generality and not being a universal‚Äù and so on would ensue.

original: ma yin par dgag pa bsgrub pa kho na yin no zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: ma yin par dgag pa bsgrub pa kho na yin no zhes zer ba ni /
translated: Those who say that it is an affirming negation alone

original: gal te de bkag pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te de bkag pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: say, ‚ÄúIf it is the negation of that,

original: bden te ma yin par dgag pa la yang de'i bdag nyid kho na gzhan dang thun mong ma yin pa'i ngo bos med par dgag pa brjod kyi dngos po las tha dad pas thun mong ma yin pa ma rtogs pa'i ngo bo bstan pa ni bkag pa ni
analyzed: bden te ma yin par dgag pa la yang de'i bdag nyid kho na gzhan dang thun mong ma yin pa'i ngo bos med par dgag pa brjod kyi dngos po las tha dad pas thun mong ma yin pa ma rtogs pa'i ngo bo bstan pa ni bkag pa ni
translated: True, but even in the case of a nonimplicative negation, it is the identity of that which is negated that is negated by the unique nature of the negation, and the nature of the negation itself is not taught as something that is not realized to be different from the negated entity.

original: 'gog par byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'gog par byed pa ste /
translated: The negation is the negating.

original: de'i rigs mi mthun pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rigs mi mthun pa'o //
translated: It is the opposite of that.

original: gzhan gyi rtog pa yin zhes bya ba ni thun mong ma yin pa'i ngo bo'i rtog pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rtog pa yin zhes bya ba ni thun mong ma yin pa'i ngo bo'i rtog pa'o //
translated: The thought of another is the thought of a unique nature.

original: gal te yang cha de las sgra las rtogs pa ma yin yang sel bar byed pa'i bdag nyid kyis ni de nyid rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir 'jug pa kho na yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gal te yang cha de las sgra las rtogs pa ma yin yang sel bar byed pa'i bdag nyid kyis ni de nyid rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir 'jug pa kho na yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: Even though the word is not understood from that part, it is engaged because it is understood by the nature of the exclusion.

original: sgra yi byed pa de la med //üîΩces bya ba ste /
analyzed: sgra yi byed pa de la med // ces bya ba ste /
translated: The word does not have that function.

original: de nyid de zhes don du gnyer ba nyid do //üîΩgal te rta la sogs pa gzhan med na /
analyzed: de nyid de zhes don du gnyer ba nyid do // gal te rta la sogs pa gzhan med na /
translated: That is the meaning of ‚Äúthat itself.‚ÄùüîΩIf there is no other, such as a horse,

original: gzhan ba lang gi ji ltar yin gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gzhan ba lang gi ji ltar yin gang gi phyir /
translated: how can it be different from an ox?

original: med pa sel bar byed pa'i ngo bo yang thun mong ma yin pa'i ngo bo dang bral ba med pa tsam kho na'o zhes zer ba ni gzhan yod pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: med pa sel bar byed pa'i ngo bo yang thun mong ma yin pa'i ngo bo dang bral ba med pa tsam kho na'o zhes zer ba ni gzhan yod pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: The nature of the exclusion of non-existence is also just the mere exclusion of the uncommon nature. This is called ‚Äúthe existence of another.‚Äù

original: gzhan rtogs na zhes bya ba ni yul gzhan rtogs na'o //
analyzed: gzhan rtogs na zhes bya ba ni yul gzhan rtogs na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhen the other is cognized‚Äù means when the other object is cognized.

original: de yang 'di yin la rtog pa yang yin pa de skye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang 'di yin la rtog pa yang yin pa de skye ba'i phyir /
translated: That is this and it is also a conception, because it arises.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kho na mthong ba ni gzhan las ldog par byed pa'i bdag nyid kyis rtog pa'i yul yin no //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kho na mthong ba ni gzhan las ldog par byed pa'i bdag nyid kyis rtog pa'i yul yin no //
translated: Only the specific characteristic is the object of conception by the nature of excluding the other.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid ni rang gi ngo bos rnam par rtog pa la mi snang ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid ni rang gi ngo bos rnam par rtog pa la mi snang ba ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt the specific characteristic not manifest to conception by its own nature?

original: ma yin du zin kyang rnam par rtog par 'gyur ba yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: ma yin du zin kyang rnam par rtog par 'gyur ba yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: Even if it is not, it is taught that it becomes manifest to conception.

original: rtog pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtog pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The nature of conception is the specific characteristic.

original: rtog pa gzhan las ldog par byed par ji ltar shes pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: rtog pa gzhan las ldog par byed par ji ltar shes pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as one knows that conception excludes other things,

original: de dang thun mong ma yin pa ldog par byed par yang ngo snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: de dang thun mong ma yin pa ldog par byed par yang ngo snyam du sems pa la /
translated: one thinks that it also excludes what is not uncommon with it.

original: ji ltar de gzhan med par rtogs pa de bzhin du de med pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: ji ltar de gzhan med par rtogs pa de bzhin du de med pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: Just as it is understood that it does not exist as something else, so it is shown that it is not nonexistent.

original: rang gi blo nyid de ste /
analyzed: rang gi blo nyid de ste /
translated: It is one‚Äôs own mind itself.

original: gzhan gyis dben pa kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: gzhan gyis dben pa kho na yin gyi /
translated: It is only devoid of something else.

original: thun mong ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rim pa gzhan no //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rim pa gzhan no //
translated: It is not common. This is another sequence.

original: thun mong ma yin pas med do zhes rtogs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩ@28a * // rigs ldan rigs min zhes bya ba la sogs pas spyi ni tha dad pa'am /
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pas med do zhes rtogs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to // @28a * // rigs ldan rigs min zhes bya ba la sogs pas spyi ni tha dad pa'am /
translated: It is not understood that it does not exist because it is not common.

original: tha mi dad par yod pa ma yin pa de lta mod kyi /
analyzed: tha mi dad par yod pa ma yin pa de lta mod kyi /
translated: As for the statement ‚Äúit is not a universal, etc.,‚Äù a universal does not exist either as different or as nondifferent.

original: ngo bo med can spyi blo la //
analyzed: ngo bo med can spyi blo la //
translated: However, in the case of a cognition of a universal that has no nature of its own,

original: spyi nyid du zhes bya ba rang gi ngo bor mthong ba las spyi ni ma yin te /
analyzed: spyi nyid du zhes bya ba rang gi ngo bor mthong ba las spyi ni ma yin te /
translated: a universal is seen as its own nature.

original: spyi med kyang spyir snang ba'i blo ni dngul med kyang dngul du snang ba'i blo bzhin du /
analyzed: spyi med kyang spyir snang ba'i blo ni dngul med kyang dngul du snang ba'i blo bzhin du /
translated: A universal is not a universal, but a cognition that appears as a universal, even though there is no universal, is like a cognition that appears as silver, even though there is no silver.

original: da ma yin ba la der 'dzin pas don la 'khrul pa yin te /
analyzed: da ma yin ba la der 'dzin pas don la 'khrul pa yin te /
translated: Since it apprehends what is not silver as silver, it is mistaken with regard to its object.

original: nya phyis la dngul bzhin du spyi yin par 'dod pa de yang bslad pa'i phyir te sgro btags pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nya phyis la dngul bzhin du spyi yin par 'dod pa de yang bslad pa'i phyir te sgro btags pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is adulterated, like a mother-of-pearl shell that is fancied to be silver, it is superimposed.

original: de 'ba' zhig las ni ma yin la /
analyzed: de 'ba' zhig las ni ma yin la /
translated: It is not just that.

original: ngo bo med pa'i don rnams gang dag yin pa de yang spyi yin te /
analyzed: ngo bo med pa'i don rnams gang dag yin pa de yang spyi yin te /
translated: And that which is the meaning of realitylessness is also a universal,

original: bslad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bslad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is adulterated.

original: 'di yang zhes bya ba'i don ni yang gi sgra'o //
analyzed: 'di yang zhes bya ba'i don ni yang gi sgra'o //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúalso‚Äù is the word ‚Äúalso.‚Äù

original: de 'di ni spyi med kyang ji ltar rang bzhin med par khas blangs pa nye bar sdud pa ni de nyid du na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de 'di ni spyi med kyang ji ltar rang bzhin med par khas blangs pa nye bar sdud pa ni de nyid du na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The summary of the acceptance of realitylessness without a universal is ‚Äútherefore.‚Äù

original: spyi nyid du ni mthong phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: spyi nyid du ni mthong phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because a universal is seen.

original: spyi blo la zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa'i don te /
analyzed: spyi blo la zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa'i don te /
translated: ‚ÄúIn the awareness of a universal‚Äù means in the awareness of a universal.

original: spyir snang ba'i blo ni spyi'i blo zhes brjod do //
analyzed: spyir snang ba'i blo ni spyi'i blo zhes brjod do //
translated: The awareness that appears as a universal is called the awareness of a universal.

original: 'brel par ni ngo bo med pa can la rnam pa med pa nyid du'o //üîΩspyi blo la /
analyzed: 'brel par ni ngo bo med pa can la rnam pa med pa nyid du'o // spyi blo la /
translated: The connection is that in the awareness of a universal, the universal is seen as a universal.üîΩBecause a universal is seen in the awareness of a universal.

original: spyi nyid du ni mthong phyir dang // zhes bya ba ni spyi nyid du snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi nyid du ni mthong phyir dang // zhes bya ba ni spyi nyid du snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because a universal appears in the awareness of a universal.

original: yang zhes bya ba ni srid pa'i don to //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba ni srid pa'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúAgain‚Äù means ‚Äúin the sense of existence.‚Äù

original: gal te rnam pa med pa nyid du 'gyur na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te rnam pa med pa nyid du 'gyur na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf it were to be without aspects‚Äù means ‚Äúif it were to be without aspects.‚Äù

original: kho bo'i bshad pa la ni rnam pa dang bcas pa dang rnam pa med pa nyid kyi dbye ba med pa yin la /
analyzed: kho bo'i bshad pa la ni rnam pa dang bcas pa dang rnam pa med pa nyid kyi dbye ba med pa yin la /
translated: In our explanation, there is no distinction between having aspects and not having aspects.

original: lhag ma ni mtshungs so //
analyzed: lhag ma ni mtshungs so //
translated: The rest is similar.

original: rigs ldan rigs min zhes bya ba la sogs pas brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rigs ldan rigs min zhes bya ba la sogs pas brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: ‚ÄúWhether it belongs to a class or not‚Äù and so on are not expressible,

original: rang bzhin med pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: and so are taught to be essenceless.

original: de'i phyir ngo bo med pa'i don med rnams kyi spyi blo la zhes bya ba'i gang yin pa de yang tshigs su bcad pa gsum gyis go rims bzhin du rnam par rtog pa'i bya ba tsam dang / ldog pa dang 'khrul pa nyid rnams kyis dngos po med pa nyid yin pas brjod bya ma yin pa nyid bstan pa ni ngo bo med pas brjod bya min zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir ngo bo med pa'i don med rnams kyi spyi blo la zhes bya ba'i gang yin pa de yang tshigs su bcad pa gsum gyis go rims bzhin du rnam par rtog pa'i bya ba tsam dang / ldog pa dang 'khrul pa nyid rnams kyis dngos po med pa nyid yin pas brjod bya ma yin pa nyid bstan pa ni ngo bo med pas brjod bya min zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of ‚Äúessenceless‚Äù is that the cognition of universals of things that do not exist is also, respectively, in three verses, taught to be inexpressible because it is mere conceptual activity, because it is a superimposition, and because it is a mistake. The teaching of inexpressibility is ‚Äúbecause of essencelessness.‚Äù

original: rigs ldan rigs min zhes bya ba 'dis brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid ni /
analyzed: rigs ldan rigs min zhes bya ba 'dis brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid ni /
translated: This is not so, because the reason is not established.

original: rang bzhin med pa nyid la gtan tshigs ma grub pa ma yin no snyam du sems pa la gal te brjod pa 'ga' zhig las zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa nyid la gtan tshigs ma grub pa ma yin no snyam du sems pa la gal te brjod pa 'ga' zhig las zhes bya ba ste /
translated: If you think that the absence of intrinsic reality is not established as the reason, then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains: If something is not expressed in some context,üîΩit is not established as not expressed.

original: gal te yang ba lang nyid rang gis gsal ba rnams las brjod par bya ba ma yin yang /
analyzed: gal te yang ba lang nyid rang gis gsal ba rnams las brjod par bya ba ma yin yang /
translated: If something is not expressed in some context,

original: rta'i gsal ba rnams las ldog pa ni brjod bya kho na yin pa'i phyir brjod bya @28b ma yin pa ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: rta'i gsal ba rnams las ldog pa ni brjod bya kho na yin pa'i phyir brjod bya @28b ma yin pa ma grub pa yin no //
translated: it is not established as not expressed.üîΩIf something is not expressed in some context, it is not established as not expressed.üîΩIf something is not expressed in some context, it is not established as not expressed.

original: gang zhig kha cig tu brjod bya'i dbye ba mthong ba rang gi gsal ba la gzhan du mi 'gyur ro //üîΩde'i phyir rang gi gsal ba la brjod bya ma yin pa ni /üîΩgsal ba gzhan la yang de kho na bzhin yin la /

original: 'ba' zhig ni mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i gsal bdag kho na de ltar tha dad pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'ba' zhig ni mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i gsal bdag kho na de ltar tha dad pa yin gyi /
translated: If something is not expressed in some context, it is not established as not expressed.

original: rigs dag la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rigs dag la ni ma yin te /
translated: If something is not expressed

original: ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not perceived.

original: gal te rigs dag la tha dad pa med na gsal bya dag ji ltar tha dad pa yin /
analyzed: gal te rigs dag la tha dad pa med na gsal bya dag ji ltar tha dad pa yin /
translated: If there is no difference in the universals, how can there be a difference in the particulars?

original: rigs nyid la rnam pa zhes zer te de gsal ba gsal bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs nyid la rnam pa zhes zer te de gsal ba gsal bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The universals themselves are called ‚Äúaspects,‚Äù because they manifest the particulars.

original: rigs dag kyang de'i ngo bo nyid la dbye ba med pas ji ltar de las kyang dbye ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: rigs dag kyang de'i ngo bo nyid la dbye ba med pas ji ltar de las kyang dbye ba yin zhe na /
translated: But since the universals themselves are undifferentiated in their nature, how can they be differentiated?

original: dbye bas dmigs pa ba khra mo dang / rta ngang pa la sogs pa'i gsal ba dag kho na'i dbye bas de'i rgyu can gyi rnam par rtog pa dag kyang yul gyi dbye ba la btags pa yin te de'i phyir rigs ni 'ga' zhig la brjod par bya ba ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: dbye bas dmigs pa ba khra mo dang / rta ngang pa la sogs pa'i gsal ba dag kho na'i dbye bas de'i rgyu can gyi rnam par rtog pa dag kyang yul gyi dbye ba la btags pa yin te de'i phyir rigs ni 'ga' zhig la brjod par bya ba ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The difference in the universals is imputed on the basis of the difference in their objects, because the conceptual thoughts that have the universals as their cause are imputed to be different on the basis of the difference in their objects, such as the color of a peacock‚Äôs neck, the color of a conch, a horse, a camel, and so on.

original: min pa nyid la yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: min pa nyid la yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the universals are not to be expressed.

original: 'grel par ni rang gi ngo bo nyid dang / khyab pa nyid kyis de brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid dang / brjod par bya ba zhes khyab pa la brten pas /
analyzed: 'grel par ni rang gi ngo bo nyid dang / khyab pa nyid kyis de brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid dang / brjod par bya ba zhes khyab pa la brten pas /
translated: The Commentary explains that they are not to be expressed because of their nature and because of their pervasiveness.

original: dag gcig gis bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: dag gcig gis bshad pa yin te /
translated: One of the two is explained.

original: khyab bya yod pa'i phyir khyab byed yod par bstan pa ni de nyid dang gzhan dag tu zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyab bya yod pa'i phyir khyab byed yod par bstan pa ni de nyid dang gzhan dag tu zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The teaching that the pervader exists because the pervaded exists is ‚Äúin that and others.‚Äù

original: brjod bya ma yin ba nyid ces zer ba ni ji ste spyi gzhan las zhes bya ba'o //üîΩtha dad par snang ba med pas brjod bya nyid ma yin na /
analyzed: brjod bya ma yin ba nyid ces zer ba ni ji ste spyi gzhan las zhes bya ba'o // tha dad par snang ba med pas brjod bya nyid ma yin na /
translated: The statement ‚Äúit is not the expressed‚Äù is ‚Äúif the universal is different from the other.‚ÄùüîΩSince there is no appearance of difference, it is not the expressed.

original: snang bar tha mi dad pa'i phyir de lta yin na dngos po ma yin te /
analyzed: snang bar tha mi dad pa'i phyir de lta yin na dngos po ma yin te /
translated: If it were so because of nondifference in appearance, it would not be a thing.

original: de bstan pa ni tha dad par mi snang na zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de bstan pa ni tha dad par mi snang na zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The teaching of that is ‚Äúif there is no appearance of difference.‚Äù

original: so sor snang ba tha dad pa med pa nyid ni de nyid la tha dad pa ni de nyid ma yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: so sor snang ba tha dad pa med pa nyid ni de nyid la tha dad pa ni de nyid ma yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ma yin te /
translated: The nonexistence of the appearance of difference is not an inference because of the nonexistence of difference in that itself.

original: de nyid dang gzhan nyid brjod du med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de nyid dang gzhan nyid brjod du med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúinexpressible as thatness and otherness‚Äù is that.

original: gal te de dag gi ni ri bong gi rva la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: gal te de dag gi ni ri bong gi rva la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: If they are of the horns of a rabbit, etc.,

original: rnam par rtog pa'i bya ba tsam gyi gzhan las ldog pa'i 'khrul ba ni /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i bya ba tsam gyi gzhan las ldog pa'i 'khrul ba ni /
translated: the error of the exclusion of other by the mere activity of conceptionüîΩis not a valid cognition.

original: mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i spyi brjod par bya ba yin na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa sgra sbyor bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i spyi brjod par bya ba yin na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa sgra sbyor bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: If it is a general term that is not synonymous with its referent, then the past and future would not be connected with the word sound.

original: spyi med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: spyi med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: Because there is no generality.

original: 'das pa dang ni ma 'ongs pa yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ni ma 'ongs pa yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is taught by ‚Äúthe past and future.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir spyi med ce na yod pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i spyi med pa gsal ba'i ngo bor ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: ci'i phyir spyi med ce na yod pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i spyi med pa gsal ba'i ngo bor ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: Why is there no generality? ‚Äú Existence‚Äù is the absence of a generality of things. How could it be the nature of an instance?

original: med pa'i chos nyid ni yod pa nyid du 'gal bas khyab @29a * //
analyzed: med pa'i chos nyid ni yod pa nyid du 'gal bas khyab @29a * //
translated: The nature of a nonexistent is pervaded by the contradiction of being existent.

original: pa yin par bstan pa ni med pa'i chos gang yin pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: pa yin par bstan pa ni med pa'i chos gang yin pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is taught by ‚Äúwhatever is the nature of a nonexistent.‚Äù

original: yod pa med pa'i chos nyid yin na med pa khyab par byed par 'gal ba yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: yod pa med pa'i chos nyid yin na med pa khyab par byed par 'gal ba yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: If existence is the nature of a nonexistent, it is contradictory that the nonexistent is a pervader.

original: yod pa min na yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yod pa min na yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is taught by ‚Äúif it does not exist.‚Äù

original: da ltar yod pa la ni bum pa'i sgra gtso bo yin la /
analyzed: da ltar yod pa la ni bum pa'i sgra gtso bo yin la /
translated: In the present, the word pot is primary.

original: med pa 'das pa la sogs pa tshad ma'i yul nyid thun mong ba'am /
analyzed: med pa 'das pa la sogs pa tshad ma'i yul nyid thun mong ba'am /
translated: In the nonexistent past and so on, the object of valid knowledge is common.

original: gzhan las nye bar btags par byed do snyam du sems pa ni gal te nye bar btags las de 'dod ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan las nye bar btags par byed do snyam du sems pa ni gal te nye bar btags las de 'dod ces bya ba ste /
translated: If you think that the past and so on are imputed to the present thing, then the past and so on would not be established as nonexistent things, because they are imputed to the present thing.

original: 'das pa la sogs pa spyi nye bar btags pa pa yin pa'i phyir med pa'i chos nyid mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: 'das pa la sogs pa spyi nye bar btags pa pa yin pa'i phyir med pa'i chos nyid mi 'grub ste /
translated: The meaning is that the pervasion of the contradiction is not established with respect to existence.üîΩThat is explained:üîΩIf the past and so on are imputed to the present thing, then the past and so on would not be established as nonexistent things.üîΩIf existence is a nonexistent thing,üîΩthen the pervader is contradictory, and so that is also taught to be not established.

original: yod pa nyid la 'gal ba khyab pa mi 'grub po zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yod pa nyid la 'gal ba khyab pa mi 'grub po zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: That is explained:üîΩIf the past and so on are imputed to the present thing, then the past and so on would not be established as nonexistent things.üîΩIf existence is a nonexistent thing, then the pervader is contradictory, and so that is also taught to be not established.

original: de bstan pa ni med pa zhes bya ba ni ma grub pa'o //
analyzed: de bstan pa ni med pa zhes bya ba ni ma grub pa'o //
translated: That is explained:

original: yod pa yang med pa'i chos yin na /
analyzed: yod pa yang med pa'i chos yin na /
translated: If the past and so on are imputed to the present thing, then the past and so on would not be established as nonexistent things.üîΩIf existence is a nonexistent thing, then the pervader is contradictory, and so that is also taught to be not established.

original: khyab par byed pa 'gal ba yin pa'i phyir de yang ma grub pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: khyab par byed pa 'gal ba yin pa'i phyir de yang ma grub pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: That is explained:üîΩIf the past and so on are imputed to the present thing, then the past and so on would not be established as nonexistent things.üîΩIf existence is a nonexistent thing, then the pervader is contradictory, and so that is also taught to be not established.üîΩThat is explained:üîΩIf the past and so on are imputed to the present thing, then the past and so on would not be established as nonexistent things.üîΩIf existence is a nonexistent thing, then the pervader is contradictory, and so that is also taught to be not established.

original: gang zhig nye bar btags pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gang zhig nye bar btags pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: That is explained:

original: gzhal bya nyid du 'dra ba'i phyir da ltar ba'i bum pa 'das pa la nye bar btags pa ni /üîΩsnam bu la yang khyad par med do //
analyzed: gzhal bya nyid du 'dra ba'i phyir da ltar ba'i bum pa 'das pa la nye bar btags pa ni / snam bu la yang khyad par med do //
translated: If the past and so on are imputed to the present thing, then the past and so on would not be established as nonexistent things.üîΩIf existence is a nonexistent thing, then the pervader is contradictory, and so that is also taught to be not established.üîΩThat is explained:üîΩIf the past and so on are imputed to the present thing, then the past and so on would not be established as nonexistent things.üîΩIf existence is a nonexistent thing, then the pervader is contradictory, and so that is also taught to be not established.üîΩThat is explained:

original: de'i phyir 'das pa'i bum pa'o zhes bya bas 'das pa'i snam bu'o zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'das pa'i bum pa'o zhes bya bas 'das pa'i snam bu'o zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the past and so on are imputed to the present thing, then the past and so on would not be established as nonexistent things.üîΩIf existence is a nonexistent thing

original: zhes bstan pa ni 'das pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa de la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bstan pa ni 'das pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa de la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThe past, etc.‚Äù is the one that begins with ‚Äúin that case.‚Äù

original: gzhal bya nyid du 'dra ba nyid kyis nye bar btags pa ni /
analyzed: gzhal bya nyid du 'dra ba nyid kyis nye bar btags pa ni /
translated: The statement ‚Äúbecause of the similarity of being objects of knowledge‚Äù is the one that begins with ‚Äúin that case.‚Äù

original: 'das pa'i snam bu la sogs pa la yang 'gyur bar bstan pa ni 'brel pa med par zhes bya ba'o //üîΩnye bar btags bas kyang med pa la 'jug pa'i sgra ni /üîΩmed pa'i yul can du 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /üîΩ'jug na ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'das pa'i snam bu la sogs pa la yang 'gyur bar bstan pa ni 'brel pa med par zhes bya ba'o // nye bar btags bas kyang med pa la 'jug pa'i sgra ni / med pa'i yul can du 'gyur bar bstan pa ni / 'jug na ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThe past, etc., would also be designations‚Äù is the one that begins with ‚Äúin that case.‚ÄùüîΩThe statement ‚ÄúThe word ‚Äònonexistent‚Äô is also used figuratively‚Äù is the one that begins with ‚Äúin that case.‚Äù

original: de yang zhes bya ba'i sgra'i brjod bya'o //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba'i sgra'i brjod bya'o //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThe word ‚Äònonexistent‚Äô would refer to a nonexistent object‚Äù is the one that begins with ‚Äúin that case.‚ÄùüîΩThe statement ‚ÄúIf it did, it would be a nonentity‚Äù is the one that begins with ‚Äúin that case.‚ÄùüîΩThe statement ‚ÄúIt would be a nonentity‚Äù is the one that begins with ‚Äúin that case.‚Äù

original: gcig yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni da ltar ba dang ngo //
analyzed: gcig yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni da ltar ba dang ngo //
translated: The statement ‚Äúbecause they are the same‚Äù is the one that begins with ‚Äúin that case.‚Äù

original: 'das pa la sogs pa'i dus kyi 'pho ba 'jug pa tsam mo zhes bya ba'i lta ba la ni 'das pa la sogs pa gcig pa nyid du rigs so //
analyzed: 'das pa la sogs pa'i dus kyi 'pho ba 'jug pa tsam mo zhes bya ba'i lta ba la ni 'das pa la sogs pa gcig pa nyid du rigs so //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThe view that the passage of time is merely the engagement of the present, past, etc., is reasonable if the past, etc., are the same.‚Äù

original: de nyid yin te zhes bya ba ni da ltar ba nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid yin te zhes bya ba ni da ltar ba nyid do //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúIt would be the present‚Äù is the one that begins with ‚Äúin that case.‚Äù

original: spyi lta bur zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo rtogs pa yang don byed pa dang bral ba nyid kyi spyi lta bu'o //
analyzed: spyi lta bur zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo rtogs pa yang don byed pa dang bral ba nyid kyi spyi lta bu'o //
translated: ‚ÄúLike a universal‚Äù means that the realization of the nature of a thing is like a universal, which is devoid of causal efficiency.

original: don gyi ngo bo ni da ltar ba bzhin du don byed pa med kyang spyi lta bu ma yin te /
analyzed: don gyi ngo bo ni da ltar ba bzhin du don byed pa med kyang spyi lta bu ma yin te /
translated: The nature of an object, even though it is not causally efficient like the present, is not like a universal.

original: snang ba tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni gal te de med na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: snang ba tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni gal te de med na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because of the difference in appearance. This is demonstrated by the words ‚ÄúIf it did not exist. ‚Äù

original: gal te 'das pa la sogs pa rtogs pa las tha dad pa kun rdzob yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'das pa la sogs pa rtogs pa las tha dad pa kun rdzob yin na /
translated: If the conventional were different from the realization of the past, etc.,

original: de rnam par dbye ba byed pa po ma yin te /
analyzed: de rnam par dbye ba byed pa po ma yin te /
translated: it would not be the differentiator,

original: rtogs pa thams cad don la dmigs pa nyid du bye brag med pa'i phyir ro zhes @29b bstan pa la /
analyzed: rtogs pa thams cad don la dmigs pa nyid du bye brag med pa'i phyir ro zhes @29b bstan pa la /
translated: because there would be no difference in all realizations in their observation of the object.

original: kun rdzob 'di ci zhes bya ba ni ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob 'di ci zhes bya ba ni ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: This is demonstrated by the words ‚ÄúThis conventional is not anything at all. ‚Äù

original: ci las shes she na don zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci las shes she na don zhes bya ba'o //
translated: How is this known? ‚ÄúFrom the object. ‚Äù

original: tha snyad kyi ngo bo ni kun rdzob yin pa la don go bas gnod pa yin par bstan pa ni kun rdzob bden pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tha snyad kyi ngo bo ni kun rdzob yin pa la don go bas gnod pa yin par bstan pa ni kun rdzob bden pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The nature of the conventional is the truth of the conventional. This is contradicted by the understanding of the object. This is demonstrated by the words ‚ÄúThe conventional truth. ‚Äù

original: dngos po brjod par bya ba yin na btags ba ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po brjod par bya ba yin na btags ba ma yin te /
translated: If it is an entity, it is not a designation,

original: gtso bo nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dngos po ma yin pa la yin no //
analyzed: gtso bo nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dngos po ma yin pa la yin no //
translated: because it would follow that it is the primary nature itself.üîΩTherefore, it is not an entity.

original: de'i phyir yang dngos po ma yin pa brjod byar thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ni de'i phyir dngos po zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang dngos po ma yin pa brjod byar thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ni de'i phyir dngos po zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it follows that it is not an entity that is expressed.

original: ba lang la ba lang ngo zhes bya ba bzhin du brjod pa tha dad pa can gtso bo ma yin nam /
analyzed: ba lang la ba lang ngo zhes bya ba bzhin du brjod pa tha dad pa can gtso bo ma yin nam /
translated: Is it not the case that the designation is different from the primary nature, like the statement ‚ÄúThis is a cow‚Äù in regard to a cow?

original: de med pa las ni btags pa yin ba ni khur bu ba la ba lang ngo zhes bya ba lta bu'o zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: de med pa las ni btags pa yin ba ni khur bu ba la ba lang ngo zhes bya ba lta bu'o zhes zer ba ni /
translated: In the absence of that, it is a designation, like the statement ‚ÄúThis is a cow‚Äù in regard to a calf.

original: 'on te med par rtogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te med par rtogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Or, is it the realization of non-existence?

original: yul med pa nyid du sgrub par byed pa ni gang zhig mthong ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yul med pa nyid du sgrub par byed pa ni gang zhig mthong ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The proof of the non-existence of the object is ‚Äúwhat is seen.‚Äù

original: ngo bo gang du zhes bya ba snang ba'i dbye bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo gang du zhes bya ba snang ba'i dbye bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the nature cannot be divided in the appearance.

original: gang gis de dngos zhes bya ba ni med pa'i yul can nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gis de dngos zhes bya ba ni med pa'i yul can nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that the object would be nonexistent.

original: 'das pa la de'i ngo bo rtogs pa nyid da ltar bar sgro 'dogs pa ji lta ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: 'das pa la de'i ngo bo rtogs pa nyid da ltar bar sgro 'dogs pa ji lta ba de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the form of the past is understood as the present through superimposition,

original: de'i dus can du yang bstan pa ni de lta na ni /
analyzed: de'i dus can du yang bstan pa ni de lta na ni /
translated: in the same way, it is taught that it exists at that time.üîΩIf that were so,

original: 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then,

original: de lta ma yin pa ni rang gi ngo bo ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin pa ni rang gi ngo bo ma yin pa'o //
translated: if it were not so, it would not be its own nature.

original: spyi zhes bya ba ni mthong bar sgro btags pa'i ngo bo'o //üîΩthams cad du zhes bya ba ni mngon sum ma ma rjes su dpag pa'o //
analyzed: spyi zhes bya ba ni mthong bar sgro btags pa'i ngo bo'o // thams cad du zhes bya ba ni mngon sum ma ma rjes su dpag pa'o //
translated: The so-called universal is the superimposed nature of what is seen.üîΩEverywhere means in direct perception and inference.

original: 'o na ni de zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'i yul lo //
analyzed: 'o na ni de zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'i yul lo //
translated: The object of inference is that which is not directly perceived.

original: mngon sum gyis rtogs pa'i gsal ba'i ngo bo ni rjes su dpag pa'i yul ma yin yang /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis rtogs pa'i gsal ba'i ngo bo ni rjes su dpag pa'i yul ma yin yang /
translated: The nature of the clear object that is understood by direct perception is not the object of inference.

original: mi gsal ba ni de nyid 'di zhes bya ba 'am thag ring ba yang rung ba yul kho na yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: mi gsal ba ni de nyid 'di zhes bya ba 'am thag ring ba yang rung ba yul kho na yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: However, the unclear object, whether it is that very thing or distant, is only the object of inference.

original: 'on te mngon sum gyis kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te mngon sum gyis kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Or, is it by direct perception?

original: de nyid 'di'o zhes bya ba ni mngon sum pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid 'di'o zhes bya ba ni mngon sum pa ma yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúThat itself is this‚Äù is not direct perception.

original: brtag par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtag par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not to be examined.

original: thag ring ba la yang rgyu'i skyon gyis rab rib can bzhin du yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: thag ring ba la yang rgyu'i skyon gyis rab rib can bzhin du yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: Even at a distance, due to a fault in the cause, like one with cataracts, it is taught.

original: spyi de la ni mngon sum nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: spyi de la ni mngon sum nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: That generality is called direct perception.

original: gnyi ga'i thun mong yin na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gnyi ga'i thun mong yin na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If it is common to both, it is taught.

original: de nyid 'di'o zhes bya ba'i 'das pa dang da ltar ba gnyi ga de dang thun mong pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid 'di'o zhes bya ba'i 'das pa dang da ltar ba gnyi ga de dang thun mong pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat itself is this‚Äù is common to both the past and present.

original: mngon sum gyis da ltar ba 'das pa'i snang ba dang lhan cig pa tha mi dad par ma rtogs pa yin par bstan pa ni da ltar bar snang ba ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis da ltar ba 'das pa'i snang ba dang lhan cig pa tha mi dad par ma rtogs pa yin par bstan pa ni da ltar bar snang ba ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is taught that direct perception does not realize the present as undifferentiated together with the appearance of the past. The appearance as present‚Ä¶

original: rnam par rtog pa la yang de'i bya ba las @30a * //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa la yang de'i bya ba las @30a * //
translated: Even in conceptual cognition, the activity of that is taught.

original: tha dad pa thun mong ba'i ngo bo med par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: tha dad pa thun mong ba'i ngo bo med par bstan pa ni /
translated: The absence of a common nature separate from that is taught.

original: du ma nyid du snang na yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: du ma nyid du snang na yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Even when appearing as manifold‚Ä¶

original: de'i sgrub pa rigs dang 'dra ba nyid 'brel pa la sogs pa nye bar byas pa kho na nye bar btags pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i sgrub pa rigs dang 'dra ba nyid 'brel pa la sogs pa nye bar byas pa kho na nye bar btags pa yin gyi /
translated: The proof of that is that only when the reason is similar to the object and is related to it, etc., is it designated as related.

original: rgyu mtshan med pa tsam gyi rgyu can ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan med pa tsam gyi rgyu can ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The statement that it is not causeless is

original: blo ni 'khrul pa med 'jug pa //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: blo ni 'khrul pa med 'jug pa // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The mind engages without error.

original: rgyu mtshan dang de dang 'brel pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid yin gyi rgyu mtshan med pa tsam gyi rgyu can ni nye bar btags pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan dang de dang 'brel pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid yin gyi rgyu mtshan med pa tsam gyi rgyu can ni nye bar btags pa ma yin te /
translated: The mind engages without error when it has a reason and is related to that reason. It is not designated as having a reason when it is causeless,

original: thal ches pas 'khrul ba'i phyir /
analyzed: thal ches pas 'khrul ba'i phyir /
translated: because it is erroneous due to being excessive.

original: rgyu mtshan dang de dang 'dra ba'i rgyu can nyid kyis gtso bo dang btags par yang bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du yul la ma 'khrul pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i 'dod pa gzhan yin no snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan dang de dang 'dra ba'i rgyu can nyid kyis gtso bo dang btags par yang bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du yul la ma 'khrul pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i 'dod pa gzhan yin no snyam du sems pa la /
translated: The other assertion is that the mind engages without error in relation to the object just as it is, due to having a reason and being related to that reason, and that it is the primary mind and the secondary mind.

original: gtso bo dang sgro btags pa'i rgyu mtshan yod pa kho na la blo 'jug gi / med na ni 'khrul pa med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gtso bo dang sgro btags pa'i rgyu mtshan yod pa kho na la blo 'jug gi / med na ni 'khrul pa med pa ma yin no //
translated: The mind engages only when there is a reason and a secondary reason, but it is not without error when there is no reason.

original: 'grel par ni 'khrul pa med pa'i blo'i yul gtso bo yin la /
analyzed: 'grel par ni 'khrul pa med pa'i blo'i yul gtso bo yin la /
translated: The Commentary states that the primary objects are those of nonerroneous awareness.

original: gzhan ni btags pa yin zhes khong nas 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: gzhan ni btags pa yin zhes khong nas 'byung ba yin te /
translated: The others are imputed.

original: de bstan pa ni cig shos zhes bya ba ni 'khrul pa'o /
analyzed: de bstan pa ni cig shos zhes bya ba ni 'khrul pa'o /
translated: The teaching of that is ‚Äúthe other‚Äù is the erroneous one.

original: bram ze'i khye'u la yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bram ze'i khye'u la yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe young brahmin‚Äù is the other.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni rgyu mtshan med pa tsam yul du btags pa la'o //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni rgyu mtshan med pa tsam yul du btags pa la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúElsewhere‚Äù refers to the mere absence of a reason being imputed as an object.

original: yul med pa ni btags pa pa yin te /
analyzed: yul med pa ni btags pa pa yin te /
translated: The objectless is the imputed.

original: 'dra pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid kyis gtso bo ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dra pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid kyis gtso bo ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the primary object being the mere cause of similarity.

original: 'khrul pa med pas 'jug pa bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'khrul pa med pas 'jug pa bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching of the engagement of nonerroneous awareness is:üîΩEven when there is no object, the world

original: don med na yang 'gro ba yis //üîΩzhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: don med na yang 'gro ba yis // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: If there is no object, there is no going.üîΩ

original: don med pa nyid ni btags pa ba ma yin te /
analyzed: don med pa nyid ni btags pa ba ma yin te /
translated: The world is not the nonimputed.üîΩThe meaning is that it is not the engagement of nonerroneous awareness.

original: 'khrul pa med par 'jug pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to yang na dngos dang btags pa bdag gi rgyu mtshan ni /
analyzed: 'khrul pa med par 'jug pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to yang na dngos dang btags pa bdag gi rgyu mtshan ni /
translated: The primary and the imputed are the causes of the self.

original: dngos la 'khrul pa med par 'jug pa nyid kho na'o zhes bya ba tshigs su bcad pa snga ma'i don la yang sbyor bar byed pa ni gang la zhes bya ba ste /üîΩgcig la 'khrul pas 'jug pa nyid /
analyzed: dngos la 'khrul pa med par 'jug pa nyid kho na'o zhes bya ba tshigs su bcad pa snga ma'i don la yang sbyor bar byed pa ni gang la zhes bya ba ste / gcig la 'khrul pas 'jug pa nyid /
translated: The word ‚Äúin‚Äù means that the one is engaged in without error,

original: gzhan la de las bzlog pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan la de las bzlog pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: and the other is just the opposite.

original: 'grel pa'i bshad pa ni gsal ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'grel pa'i bshad pa ni gsal ba kho na yin no //
translated: The commentary explains this very clearly.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni dgos pa dang bcas pa las so //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni dgos pa dang bcas pa las so //
translated: ‚ÄúOtherwise‚Äù means with a purpose.

original: mtshungs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'khrul pa med par rtogs pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: mtshungs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'khrul pa med par rtogs pa nyid kyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of similarity‚Äù means because of the very nonerroneous understanding.

original: yod pa dang med pa'i yul nyid kyis don sna tshogs pa ni ba lang gi sgra bzhin du gtso bo kho na yin no snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa'i yul nyid kyis don sna tshogs pa ni ba lang gi sgra bzhin du gtso bo kho na yin no snyam du sems pa la /
translated: The various objects are the principal one, like the word ‚Äúcow.‚Äù

original: gnyi ga la @30b rtogs bya gcig ba nyid du bstan pa ni dngos po med pa 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gnyi ga la @30b rtogs bya gcig ba nyid du bstan pa ni dngos po med pa 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The teaching that the two have the same object of understanding is ‚Äúgrasping the non-existent.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir bum pa'o zhes 'das pa'am /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bum pa'o zhes 'das pa'am /
translated: ‚ÄúVase‚Äù is past.

original: da ltar ba la tha dad par 'jug pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to /
analyzed: da ltar ba la tha dad par 'jug pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to /
translated: The meaning is that it does not engage the present as different.

original: rnam pa mtshungs pa can gyis zhes bya ba ni da ltar ba dang nge //
analyzed: rnam pa mtshungs pa can gyis zhes bya ba ni da ltar ba dang nge //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving a similar aspect‚Äù means that it has the same aspect as the present consciousness.

original: rtogs pa nyid las zhes bya ba ni rtogs bzhin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtogs pa nyid las zhes bya ba ni rtogs bzhin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom the mere realization‚Äù means that it does not exist at the time of the realization.

original: zhig par ma shes pa zhes bya ba ni 'das pa'i khyad par dang bral ba la'o //
analyzed: zhig par ma shes pa zhes bya ba ni 'das pa'i khyad par dang bral ba la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNot knowing that it has ceased‚Äù means that it is free from the distinction of the past.

original: 'di zhig go zhes bya ba ni 'das pa'i khyad par can la'o //
analyzed: 'di zhig go zhes bya ba ni 'das pa'i khyad par can la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThis has ceased‚Äù means that it has the distinction of the past.

original: the tshom zhes bya ba ni zhig pa la zhig pa 'am 'on te ma zhig pa zhes so //
analyzed: the tshom zhes bya ba ni zhig pa la zhig pa 'am 'on te ma zhig pa zhes so //
translated: ‚ÄúDoubt‚Äù means that one doubts whether it has ceased or not.

original: dngos po 'dzin pa'i rtog pa la 'das pa'i shes pa gnod pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: dngos po 'dzin pa'i rtog pa la 'das pa'i shes pa gnod pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The following shows that the consciousness of the past is undermined by the conception that apprehends things as present.

original: gal te dngos po zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te dngos po zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf it is called a thing‚Äù means that it is not the past.

original: de las de dang zhes bya ba ni dus tha dad pa la yang lha sbyin kho na'o zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: de las de dang zhes bya ba ni dus tha dad pa la yang lha sbyin kho na'o zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis 'dod pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom that, that‚Äù means that it is Devadatta himself, even though the times are different. This is what others believe.

original: yod pa'i rtags du ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: yod pa'i rtags du ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: The sign of existence is smoke, etc.

original: khyab par byed pa yod bzhin par rnam par gzhag pa byed pa yin par bstan pa ni 'o na te rjes su dpag pa las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyab par byed pa yod bzhin par rnam par gzhag pa byed pa yin par bstan pa ni 'o na te rjes su dpag pa las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement that it is posited as an existent pervader is ‚ÄúIf it is an inference.‚Äù

original: rtags kyi khyad par las zhes bya ba nyid 'chad pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtags kyi khyad par las zhes bya ba nyid 'chad pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of the phrase ‚Äúfrom the specific evidence‚Äù is ‚ÄúIt is like this.‚Äù

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni da ltar ba'i dngos po'i yul can yin no //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni da ltar ba'i dngos po'i yul can yin no //
translated: ‚Äú That‚Äù refers to the present object.

original: mngon sum bzhin du bzung ba la yang cha kha cig la ma nges pa'i phyir ma bzung bar mngon par sems pa yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: mngon sum bzhin du bzung ba la yang cha kha cig la ma nges pa'i phyir ma bzung bar mngon par sems pa yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: The thought that even though it is apprehended like a direct perception, it is not apprehended because it is not ascertained in some part is

original: rnam pa gzhan zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú another aspect.‚Äù

original: nges pa'i bdag nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa la mngon sum gyi rigs pa med par bstan pa ni de la rnam pa gzhan de ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nges pa'i bdag nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa la mngon sum gyi rigs pa med par bstan pa ni de la rnam pa gzhan de ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement that there is no reasoning of direct perception in a definite type of inference is ‚ÄúThat other aspect.‚Äù

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni ma gtogs pa nyid la'o //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni ma gtogs pa nyid la'o //
translated: ‚Äú Otherwise‚Äù means ‚Äúexcept.‚Äù

original: 'on te 'di la zhes bya ba ni snang bzhin pa la'o //
analyzed: 'on te 'di la zhes bya ba ni snang bzhin pa la'o //
translated: ‚Äú If it is this‚Äù means ‚Äúif it is appearing.‚Äù

original: gal te ma mthong ba tsam la the tshom za ba ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te ma mthong ba tsam la the tshom za ba ma yin na /
translated: If doubt does not arise merely from non-perception,

original: gang gis thal ches par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis thal ches par 'gyur /
translated: then what is the excess?

original: 'on kyang chos can spyir mthong la de'i khyad par rnams ma mthong ba mthong par 'dod pas the tshom gyi yul yin no zhes zer ba ni 'on te spyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang chos can spyir mthong la de'i khyad par rnams ma mthong ba mthong par 'dod pas the tshom gyi yul yin no zhes zer ba ni 'on te spyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But, if one maintains that doubt has an object that is not perceived, then it is not the case that doubt has an object that is not perceived, because one sees the general property of the subject, but one does not see its particularities.

original: mngon sum las gzhan pa mngon sum ma yin pa'i shes pa ni dran pa ste /
analyzed: mngon sum las gzhan pa mngon sum ma yin pa'i shes pa ni dran pa ste /
translated: Memory is a non-perceptual cognition that is different from perception.üîΩSince it is not perception, it is not perception.

original: mngon sum ma yin no zhes bkag pas khyad par gyi ngo bo la dmigs pa'i shes pa gzhan yang yod pa yin na ji ltar the tshom yin med par dgag pa yin na ni //
analyzed: mngon sum ma yin no zhes bkag pas khyad par gyi ngo bo la dmigs pa'i shes pa gzhan yang yod pa yin na ji ltar the tshom yin med par dgag pa yin na ni //
translated: If there is another cognition that has as its object the nature of a particular, then how can it be a doubt? If it is an implicative negation,

original: ma mthong ba la the tshom du 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: ma mthong ba la the tshom du 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: then it is taught that doubt arises from non-perception.

original: med dang ma yin pa dag las /
analyzed: med dang ma yin pa dag las /
translated: From non-existence and non-being,

original: @31a * // zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: @31a * // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: it is said.

original: rjes su byed pa yin pa'i phyir gnas ma yin pa la slar yang brjod pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: rjes su byed pa yin pa'i phyir gnas ma yin pa la slar yang brjod pa lta bu'o //
translated: Because it is a subsequent act, it is like saying again that which is not the case.

original: snang ba nyid don dang don ma yin pa la thun mong ba yin gyi /
analyzed: snang ba nyid don dang don ma yin pa la thun mong ba yin gyi /
translated: The response to this is that the appearance itself is common to both the object and the non-object.

original: don 'ba' zhig la ma yin par bstan pa ni 'o na ni snang ba tsam kho na la'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: don 'ba' zhig la ma yin par bstan pa ni 'o na ni snang ba tsam kho na la'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to this is that it is only the mere appearance.

original: ma yin par dgag pa dran pa the tshom gyi rgyu mtshan la spyi mngon sum mo zhes mngon sum gyi khyad par du mi rigs par bstan pa ni spyi mngon sum yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ma yin par dgag pa dran pa the tshom gyi rgyu mtshan la spyi mngon sum mo zhes mngon sum gyi khyad par du mi rigs par bstan pa ni spyi mngon sum yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The response to this is that it is not reasonable to call it a specific type of perception, because it is a perception of a universal.

original: de yang khyad par gyi ngo bo yin pas so //
analyzed: de yang khyad par gyi ngo bo yin pas so //
translated: Moreover, it is the nature of a distinction.

original: gal te khyed kyi 'dod pa la yang mthong ba la the tshom med na //
analyzed: gal te khyed kyi 'dod pa la yang mthong ba la the tshom med na //
translated: If you claim that there is no doubt about what is seen,

original: ma mthong pa yang the tshom med do zhes bya ba ji ltar skyon ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ma mthong pa yang the tshom med do zhes bya ba ji ltar skyon ma yin zhe na /
translated: then why is it not a fault to claim that there is no doubt about what is not seen?

original: bag chags las rtogs pa kha cig dmigs pa med par skye bzhin pa the tshom med par bstan pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bag chags las rtogs pa kha cig dmigs pa med par skye bzhin pa the tshom med par bstan pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The response to this is that some cognitions that arise from latent potentialities do so without an object, and they are taught to be without doubt.

original: ma mthong ba 'ga' zhig la zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ma mthong ba 'ga' zhig la zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of this is that some things that are not seen are not doubted.

original: gal te rjes su dpag pa mngon sum bzhin du dngos po 'dzin pa yin na gzhan nyid du rtog pa yin yang g-yo bar mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: gal te rjes su dpag pa mngon sum bzhin du dngos po 'dzin pa yin na gzhan nyid du rtog pa yin yang g-yo bar mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If inference were to apprehend a thing just as perception does, then even if one conceived of it as different, it would not move.

original: g-yo ba yin te sngar rtogs pa'i rgyun ldog cing rgyun gzhan yang 'dod pa las skye bar bstan pa ni gal te der ni dngos po dang reg pas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: g-yo ba yin te sngar rtogs pa'i rgyun ldog cing rgyun gzhan yang 'dod pa las skye bar bstan pa ni gal te der ni dngos po dang reg pas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But it does move, because it is taught that the stream of what was previously understood is stopped and another stream arises from desire.

original: de med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni g-yo ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni g-yo ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were so, then it would be in contact with a thing, but it is not, because it does not move.

original: rnam par rtog pa med pa yin yang rgyu la rang gi ngo bo 'dzin pa dang bral bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //üîΩma yin te rgyu med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'i rgyun yang phyir ci log pa yin na /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med pa yin yang rgyu la rang gi ngo bo 'dzin pa dang bral bar 'gyur ba ma yin no // ma yin te rgyu med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'i rgyun yang phyir ci log pa yin na /
translated: Even though it is without conceptualization, it is not free from apprehending its own nature in the cause.üîΩNo, because it has no cause.

original: rnam par gcod par 'gyur gyi mngon sum ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par gcod par 'gyur gyi mngon sum ni ma yin no //
translated: If the stream of inference is also reversed, then it is eliminated, but it is not perception.

original: de'i rgyu med na mi 'byung ba'i rgyun nyid du nges pa kho na rtags kyi bya ba ma yin no snyam du sems pa ni 'on te gzhan du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu med na mi 'byung ba'i rgyun nyid du nges pa kho na rtags kyi bya ba ma yin no snyam du sems pa ni 'on te gzhan du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If the cause of that does not exist, it is not produced. The mere ascertainment of the invariable concomitance is not the function of the reason.

original: rjes su dpag pas dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo mthong ba na /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo mthong ba na /
translated: When the nature of a thing is seen by means of inference,

original: med na mi 'byung ba nyid du nges pa kho nar bstan pa ni de mthong na zhes bya ba ste dngos po'i mthong na'o //
analyzed: med na mi 'byung ba nyid du nges pa kho nar bstan pa ni de mthong na zhes bya ba ste dngos po'i mthong na'o //
translated: it is ascertained as being invariably concomitant with the absence of that. This is taught by ‚Äúwhen that is seen.‚Äù

original: bstan pa yis zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pas so //üîΩde dang 'dra ba nyid las mngon sum pa'i gzugs 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa la mthong ba ni /
analyzed: bstan pa yis zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pas so // de dang 'dra ba nyid las mngon sum pa'i gzugs 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa la mthong ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúBy means of the teaching‚Äù refers to inference.üîΩThe form of the object that is grasped by perception is not the same as the form grasped by inference.

original: rang gi ngo bo 'dzin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo 'dzin pa ma yin no //
translated: The form grasped by inference is not the nature of the object that is seen.

original: mthong ba'i zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyis te de ni dpe yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba'i zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyis te de ni dpe yin no //
