translated: ‚ÄúBy means of the teaching‚Äù refers to inference.üîΩThe form grasped by perception is not the same as the form grasped by inference.üîΩThe form grasped by inference is not the nature of the object that is seen.üîΩThe form grasped by perception is not the same as the form grasped by inference.üîΩThe form grasped by inference is not the nature of the object that is seen.üîΩThe form grasped by perception is not the same as the form grasped by inference.üîΩThe form grasped by inference is not the nature of the object that is seen.üîΩThe form grasped by perception is not the same as the form grasped by inference.üîΩThe form grasped by inference is not the nature of the object that is seen.üîΩThe form grasped by perception is not the same as the form grasped by inference.üîΩThe form grasped by inference is not the nature of the object that is seen.üîΩThe form grasped by perception is not the same as the form grasped by inference.üîΩThe form grasped by inference is not the nature of the object that is seen.üîΩThe form grasped by perception is not the same as the form grasped by inference.üîΩThe form grasped by inference is not the nature of the object that is seen.üîΩThe form grasped by perception is not the same as the form grasped by inference.üîΩThe form grasped by inference is not the nature of the object that is seen.üîΩThe form grasped by perception is not the same as the form grasped by inference.üîΩThe form grasped by inference is not the nature of the object that is seen.üîΩThe form grasped by perception is not the same as the form grasped by inference.üîΩThe form grasped by inference is not the nature of the object that is seen.üîΩThe form grasped by perception is not the same as the form grasped by inference.

original: rang gi ngo bor ma mthong ba nyid g-yo ba yin par bstan pa ni reg bya reg ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bor ma mthong ba nyid g-yo ba yin par bstan pa ni reg bya reg ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The form grasped by inference is not the nature of the object that is seen.üîΩThe form grasped by perception

original: bshad pa yin no zhes @31b bya ba ni snang bzhin ba la mngon sum 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes ma mthong ba kho na zhes 'dis bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bshad pa yin no zhes @31b bya ba ni snang bzhin ba la mngon sum 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes ma mthong ba kho na zhes 'dis bstan pa yin no //
translated: The statement ‚Äúit is explained‚Äù indicates that direct perception is not seen to be contradictory with what appears.

original: rnam par rtog par rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni the tshom za bar ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog par rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni the tshom za bar ro //
translated: ‚Äú It is not reasonable to imagine‚Äù means to doubt.

original: rnam pa gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni skad cig pa nyid dam ma goms pa'am thag ring ba'i khyad par la'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni skad cig pa nyid dam ma goms pa'am thag ring ba'i khyad par la'o //
translated: ‚Äú In another way‚Äù means in terms of momentariness, lack of familiarity, or distance.

original: dpag bya la zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyis ma nges la /üîΩrjes su dpag pas nges pa'i khyad par gyi cha la yang rgyang ring po nas mthong ba'am /
analyzed: dpag bya la zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyis ma nges la / rjes su dpag pas nges pa'i khyad par gyi cha la yang rgyang ring po nas mthong ba'am /
translated: ‚Äú In regard to what is to be inferred‚Äù means that what is not ascertained by direct perception is ascertained by inference.üîΩEven in regard to the aspect of what is ascertained by inference, some things are inferred from what is seen from a distance,

original: ma mthong bas kha cig la yang rjes su dpag pa nyid yin te 'og gi cha la dbus kyi cha bzhin du dngos po gcig yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma mthong bas kha cig la yang rjes su dpag pa nyid yin te 'og gi cha la dbus kyi cha bzhin du dngos po gcig yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and some are inferred from what is not seen, like the lower part of a pillar from the upper part.

original: snang bzhin pa ni rjes su dpag pa la yang slu bas g-yo ba ma yin pa ma yin no snyam du sems pa la snang ba la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: snang bzhin pa ni rjes su dpag pa la yang slu bas g-yo ba ma yin pa ma yin no snyam du sems pa la snang ba la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But since even inference is deceived with respect to what appears, it is not nondeceptive.

original: phyi rol la ltos pa'i dbye ba ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag gis te /
analyzed: phyi rol la ltos pa'i dbye ba ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag gis te /
translated: The distinction in terms of external objects is by means of perception and inference.

original: mngon sum dang de'i snang ba dag gis yin gyi /
analyzed: mngon sum dang de'i snang ba dag gis yin gyi /
translated: It is by means of perception and its appearance,üîΩbut not in terms of autocognition.

original: rang rig pa la ltos pa ni ma yin no zhes lan du bstan pa ni tha dad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang rig pa la ltos pa ni ma yin no zhes lan du bstan pa ni tha dad ces bya ba'o //
translated: The reply is ‚Äúdifferent‚Äù .

original: 'ga' zhig ces bya ba ni rab rib las byung ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ces bya ba ni rab rib las byung ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSome‚Äù means those arising from cataracts, etc.

original: rjes su dpag pa nyid kyang zhes bya ba ni mngon sum ltar snang nyid ces bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa nyid kyang zhes bya ba ni mngon sum ltar snang nyid ces bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúInference itself‚Äù is connected with ‚Äúmere appearance of perception.‚Äù

original: da ltar ba'i dngos po'i ngo bor snang ba rjes su dpag pa yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: da ltar ba'i dngos po'i ngo bor snang ba rjes su dpag pa yin du zin kyang /
translated: Even though inference appears as the nature of a present thing,

original: de tsam gyis ni rab rib las byung ba bzhin du tshad ma ma yin te /
analyzed: de tsam gyis ni rab rib las byung ba bzhin du tshad ma ma yin te /
translated: it is not a valid cognition merely by that, like what arises from cataracts.

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i dngos po dang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i dngos po dang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: because it is not related to a future entity.

original: yang na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Or else,üîΩit is by another person,

original: de ni skyes bu gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i mngon sum nyid kyis yin te /
analyzed: de ni skyes bu gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i mngon sum nyid kyis yin te /
translated: by the direct perception of the future.

original: da ltar ba ni rab rib las byung ba la yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: da ltar ba ni rab rib las byung ba la yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But the present is also found in the case of what arises from cataracts.

original: rjes su dpag pa nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because it is inference itself,

original: dang po'i rjes su dpag pa dang ldan pa mtshungs par dngos po 'dzin pa ma yin yang /
analyzed: dang po'i rjes su dpag pa dang ldan pa mtshungs par dngos po 'dzin pa ma yin yang /
translated: even though it does not grasp an entity as does the initial inference,

original: dngos po med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir dngos po 'dzin pa yin no //üîΩdngos po'i yul la dngos por snang ba thams cad rjes su dpag par btags par 'gyur par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: dngos po med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir dngos po 'dzin pa yin no // dngos po'i yul la dngos por snang ba thams cad rjes su dpag par btags par 'gyur par bstan pa ni /
translated: it grasps an entity because it does not occur without an entity.üîΩAll appearances as entities in the domain of entities are designated as inference.

original: rjes su dpag pa thams cad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa thams cad ces bya ba'o //
translated: All inference,

original: yod pa yang med pa'i yul nyid du dngos dang btags pa'i mtshan nyid ma 'khrul pa dang / cig shos kyi shes pa'i yul nyid ma yin no zhes 'di ci las shes snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: yod pa yang med pa'i yul nyid du dngos dang btags pa'i mtshan nyid ma 'khrul pa dang / cig shos kyi shes pa'i yul nyid ma yin no zhes 'di ci las shes snyam du sems pa la /
translated: From what is this known?

original: 'jig rten gyi grags pa las so zhes bstan pa @32a * //üîΩni ; ji ltar dngos po nus med pa //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi grags pa las so zhes bstan pa @32a * // ni ; ji ltar dngos po nus med pa //
translated: It is taught:üîΩAs for the powerless thing,

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: it is said to be non-existent.

original: rab tu bstan pa la'o //
analyzed: rab tu bstan pa la'o //
translated: This is taught.

original: med par brjod pa'i phyir med ce'am zhes bya ba ni gtso bo la sogs pa'i mnyan pa yin no //
analyzed: med par brjod pa'i phyir med ce'am zhes bya ba ni gtso bo la sogs pa'i mnyan pa yin no //
translated: Because it is said to be non-existent, it is said to be non-existent. This is the hearing of the primary cause, etc.

original: gtso bo la sogs pa dngos po ma yin te /
analyzed: gtso bo la sogs pa dngos po ma yin te /
translated: The primary cause, etc. are not things.

original: tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir nus pa med pa'i dngos po la grangs can gyi skyes bu'i sgra de 'bras bu du ma'i nus pa can la yang gtso bo'i sgrar byed do //
analyzed: tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir nus pa med pa'i dngos po la grangs can gyi skyes bu'i sgra de 'bras bu du ma'i nus pa can la yang gtso bo'i sgrar byed do //
translated: Because they are not valid cognitions, the word of the SƒÅ·πÉkhya person is powerless with regard to things. That which has the power of many effects is also made into the word of the primary cause.

original: de yang gtso bo'i sgrar byed la /
analyzed: de yang gtso bo'i sgrar byed la /
translated: That is also made into the word of the primary cause.

original: de yang 'bras bu sna tshogs pa nyid khas blangs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de yang 'bras bu sna tshogs pa nyid khas blangs pa'i phyir //
translated: And that is also accepted as the diversity of effects.

original: yod pa'i yul yin yang btags pa yin te /
analyzed: yod pa'i yul yin yang btags pa yin te /
translated: Although the object exists, it is a designation.

original: med pa'i yul la yang gtso bor bstan pa ni rtog pa ci bzhin du zhes pa ste /
analyzed: med pa'i yul la yang gtso bor bstan pa ni rtog pa ci bzhin du zhes pa ste /
translated: The teaching that even the non-existent object is a designation is ‚Äújust as conceptualization.‚Äù

original: grangs can gyi rtog pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i dngos po med kyang /
analyzed: grangs can gyi rtog pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i dngos po med kyang /
translated: Although there is no entity that accords with the conceptualization of the SƒÅ·πÉkhya,

original: gtso bo la sogs pa'i sgra gtso bor byas pa yin zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: gtso bo la sogs pa'i sgra gtso bor byas pa yin zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: the term ‚Äúprimal substance‚Äù and so on is taken to be a primal substance.

original: khyed kyi 'dod pa ni 'jig rten las phyin ci log par dmigs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: khyed kyi 'dod pa ni 'jig rten las phyin ci log par dmigs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that your assertion is an observation that is erroneous in relation to the world.

original: med pa la yang gtso bo la sogs par sgro 'dogs pa yin te sgro gdags par bya ba med pa'i phyir med pa'i yul can btags par 'gyur bas zer ba ni ji ste gzhan zhes bya ba'o //üîΩ'das pa'i bum pa la sogs pa'i sgra 'khrul pa rtogs pa'i yul nyid btags pa pa nyid ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: med pa la yang gtso bo la sogs par sgro 'dogs pa yin te sgro gdags par bya ba med pa'i phyir med pa'i yul can btags par 'gyur bas zer ba ni ji ste gzhan zhes bya ba'o // 'das pa'i bum pa la sogs pa'i sgra 'khrul pa rtogs pa'i yul nyid btags pa pa nyid ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: It is a superimposition of a primal substance and so on even in the absence of that. Since there is nothing to be superimposed, it is said to be a designation that has a non-existent object.

original: sgra las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sgra las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The teaching that the object of the mistaken cognition of the sound of a past pot and so on is not a designation is ‚Äúfrom sound.‚Äù

original: zhig pa ste 'das pa la'o //
analyzed: zhig pa ste 'das pa la'o //
translated: It is in regard to the past, that is, the destroyed.

original: ma zhig pa ni da ltar ba la'o //
analyzed: ma zhig pa ni da ltar ba la'o //
translated: The non-disintegrated is the present.

original: de 'dra nyid ni khyad par med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de 'dra nyid ni khyad par med pa nyid do //
translated: The same is the absence of distinction.

original: yod pa dang med pas yang mtshungs par kho na yin gyi des byas pa'i khyad par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pas yang mtshungs par kho na yin gyi des byas pa'i khyad par ni ma yin no //
translated: It is the same in terms of existence and non-existence, but not in terms of the distinction made by that.

original: mngon sum ma la ni med pa la med pa kho na zhes khyad par yin par bstan pa ni don yod can zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mngon sum ma la ni med pa la med pa kho na zhes khyad par yin par bstan pa ni don yod can zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The non-existence of the non-disintegrated is the non-existence of the non-disintegrated. The distinction is taught as the non-existence of the non-existent.

original: 'das pa dang / da ltar ba la yang 'khrul pa med pa'i blo 'dzin pa nyid spyi tsam 'dzin pa yin te /
analyzed: 'das pa dang / da ltar ba la yang 'khrul pa med pa'i blo 'dzin pa nyid spyi tsam 'dzin pa yin te /
translated: The cognition of the past and present is also the apprehension of the mere universal, not the apprehension of the particular.

original: don yod pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don yod pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not because of the existence of the object.

original: gtso bo la sogs pa'i blo yang rtog pa ji lta ba bzhin du spyi'i yul can kho na ma yin nam snyam du sems pa ni spyi tsam zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gtso bo la sogs pa'i blo yang rtog pa ji lta ba bzhin du spyi'i yul can kho na ma yin nam snyam du sems pa ni spyi tsam zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The cognition of the principal and so on is also the cognition of the mere universal, not the cognition of the particular.

original: gsal ba'i mthar thug pa nyid med na de spyi ma yin zhing /
analyzed: gsal ba'i mthar thug pa nyid med na de spyi ma yin zhing /
translated: If there is no final particular, it is not a universal.

original: 'das pa la sogs pa yang ma yin par bstan pa ni de yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'das pa la sogs pa yang ma yin par bstan pa ni de yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is taught that it is not the past and so on.

original: gsal ba ma gtogs pa'i 'ba' zhig 'dzin pa ni spyi ma yin par 'gyur yang tha mi dad pa la ni skyon 'di ma yin pa ma yin nam zhes zer ba ni 'on te gsal pa de nyid @32b ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: gsal ba ma gtogs pa'i 'ba' zhig 'dzin pa ni spyi ma yin par 'gyur yang tha mi dad pa la ni skyon 'di ma yin pa ma yin nam zhes zer ba ni 'on te gsal pa de nyid @32b ces bya ba'o //
translated: If it were a universal, it would be apprehended as something separate from the manifestation, but this is not the case.

original: gsal ba rnams kyi ngo bo ni phan tshun ldog par 'dod pa yin la /
analyzed: gsal ba rnams kyi ngo bo ni phan tshun ldog par 'dod pa yin la /
translated: The nature of manifestations is held to be mutually exclusive.

original: tha mi dad par rtogs par mi nus pa'i phyir de la reg pa'i rtog pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: tha mi dad par rtogs par mi nus pa'i phyir de la reg pa'i rtog pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: Since they cannot be cognized as non-different, there is no cognition of them as in contact with each other.

original: phan tshun khyad par can rnams ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phan tshun khyad par can rnams ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is shown by the words ‚ÄúThose that have mutual differences. . . . ‚Äù

original: snang ba ni log pa yin la ma log pa ni brtag bya kho na ma yin nam zhes zer ba ni /üîΩngo bo gnyis ni yod na yang //
analyzed: snang ba ni log pa yin la ma log pa ni brtag bya kho na ma yin nam zhes zer ba ni / ngo bo gnyis ni yod na yang //
translated: But isn‚Äôt the appearance of the object unreal, and isn‚Äôt the object of investigation only what is not unreal?

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is answered by the words ‚ÄúEven though there are two natures. . . . ‚Äù

original: de'i rjes su 'gro ba ste spyi'i'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes su 'gro ba ste spyi'i'o //
translated: The universal is that which is common to all.

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid ni rjes su 'gro ba'i ngo ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid ni rjes su 'gro ba'i ngo ba'o //
translated: The nature that is common is the universal nature.

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyis shes pa'i mngon sum yin no /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyis shes pa'i mngon sum yin no /
translated: The words ‚Äúby its own nature‚Äù mean that it is directly perceived by direct perception.

original: gal te gsal ba'i ngo bo ma log cing gcig yin na /
analyzed: gal te gsal ba'i ngo bo ma log cing gcig yin na /
translated: If the nature of manifestation were not reversed and were one,

original: gsal ba'i ngo bor mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gsal ba'i ngo bor mi 'gyur te /
translated: it would not be the nature of manifestation,

original: de ldog pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de ldog pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: because it is the nature of the reversal of that.

original: gsal ba tha dad pa med par 'gyur te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gsal ba tha dad pa med par 'gyur te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The manifestation would not be different.

original: de lta na yang zhes bya ba ni gsal ba'i mthar thug pa med pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta na yang zhes bya ba ni gsal ba'i mthar thug pa med pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even so, because the manifestation would not be endless.

original: dmigs pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyis so //
analyzed: dmigs pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyis so //
translated: It is only an object, because of direct perception.

original: rjes su song ba'i rnam pa can gyis shes pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su song ba'i rnam pa can gyis shes pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The cognition that has the aspect of the manifestation is conceptual.

original: 'di ltar sngon po zhes bya ba ba zhin du 'di spyi'o zhes ji ltar sor mos ston pa ma yin zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar sngon po zhes bya ba ba zhin du 'di spyi'o zhes ji ltar sor mos ston pa ma yin zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: Just as one says ‚Äúblue,‚Äù how can one point out ‚Äúthis is a universal‚Äù with one‚Äôs finger?

original: de nyid de ltar zhes bya ba'o //üîΩbag chags las byung ba'i rjes su song ba'i shes pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid de ltar zhes bya ba'o // bag chags las byung ba'i rjes su song ba'i shes pa ni /
translated: That is what is shown by ‚ÄúIt is not like that.‚ÄùüîΩThe cognition that has the aspect of the manifestation is not a cognition that is induced by a universal.üîΩThe cognition that arises from latent impressions is not a cognition that is induced by a universal.üîΩThe cognition that arises from latent impressions is not a cognition that is induced by a universal.

original: don shugs kyis 'phangs pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: don shugs kyis 'phangs pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The cognition that arises from latent impressions is not a cognition that is induced by a universal.üîΩThe cognition that arises from latent impressions is not a cognition that is induced by a universal.üîΩThe cognition that arises from latent impressions is not a cognition that is induced by a universal.üîΩThe cognition that arises from latent impressions is not a cognition that is induced by a universal.üîΩThe cognition that arises from latent impressions is not a cognition that is induced by a universal.üîΩThe cognition that arises from latent impressions is not a cognition that is induced by a universal.üîΩThe cognition that arises from latent impressions is not a cognition that is induced by a universal.üîΩThe cognition that arises from latent impressions is not a cognition that is induced by a universal.üîΩThe cognition that arises from latent impressions is not a cognition that is induced by a universal.üîΩThe cognition that arises from latent impressions is not a cognition that is induced by a universal.üîΩThe cognition that arises from latent impressions is not a cognition that is induced by a universal.üîΩThe cognition that arises from latent impressions is not a cognition that is induced by a universal.üîΩThe cognition that arises from latent impressions is not a cognition that is induced by a universal.üîΩThe cognition that arises from latent impressions is not a cognition that is induced by a universal.üîΩThe cognition that arises from latent impressions is not a cognition that is induced by a universal.üîΩThe cognition that arises from latent impressions is not a cognition that is induced by a universal.üîΩThe cognition that arises from latent impressions is not a cognition that is induced by a universal.

original: tha snyad kyi bag chags kyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tha snyad kyi bag chags kyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The cognition that arises from latent impressions is not a cognition

original: gnas skabs kyi bsu ba ni spyi gzhan nyid ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnas skabs kyi bsu ba ni spyi gzhan nyid ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The temporary welcome is the other general.

original: rnam gzhan zhes bya ba ni snang ba gzhan no //
analyzed: rnam gzhan zhes bya ba ni snang ba gzhan no //
translated: The other aspect is the other appearance.

original: snang ba gzhan te de ni de nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: snang ba gzhan te de ni de nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i rim pa'o //
translated: The other appearance is not that. This is the sequence.

original: de ltar na ci 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na ci 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the point of this?

original: gzhan du'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan du'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In another way.

original: ci las shen mngon sum las so //
analyzed: ci las shen mngon sum las so //
translated: How is it known? From perception.

original: bag chags las byung ba'i rtog pa ni don gyis 'phen ba ma yin par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: bag chags las byung ba'i rtog pa ni don gyis 'phen ba ma yin par bstan pa ste /
translated: The conceptual thought that arises from latent impressions is shown not to be projected by the object.

original: rjes 'gro'i rtog pa las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rjes 'gro'i rtog pa las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: From the conceptual thought that follows.

original: gsal ba las log pa yang spyi'i 'brel pa med par bstan pa ni de dag las te /
analyzed: gsal ba las log pa yang spyi'i 'brel pa med par bstan pa ni de dag las te /
translated: The connection of the general with the particular is also shown to be non-existent. From them.

original: gsal ba dag las so //
analyzed: gsal ba dag las so //
translated: From the particulars.

original: mtshungs pa'i dngos ni gzhan nyid du gal te 'gyur na zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: mtshungs pa'i dngos ni gzhan nyid du gal te 'gyur na zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: If the universal were to become different from the particulars, this is what is to be connected.

original: rta nyid khra mo la sogs pa dang 'phrel pa med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir khyad par du byed pa ni de dag ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: rta nyid khra mo la sogs pa dang 'phrel pa med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir khyad par du byed pa ni de dag ces bya ba'o //
translated: The distinction is made by the word them, because the universal horse is not connected with the white horse and so on.

original: lan ni de dag gi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni de dag gi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is ‚Äúbecause of them.‚Äù

original: gzhan las log pa ni spyi yin pas dngos po ma yin te /üîΩlog pa dang ma log pa'i @33a * //
analyzed: gzhan las log pa ni spyi yin pas dngos po ma yin te / log pa dang ma log pa'i @33a * //
translated: Since the opposite of the other is the universal, it is not a thing.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i gzhi ma yin par bstan pa ni ldog pa la ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i gzhi ma yin par bstan pa ni ldog pa la ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The teaching that it is not the basis of the conception of the opposite or the non-opposite is ‚ÄúFor, the opposite . . .‚Äù

original: log pa ni de ma yin pa las log pas dngos po mtshungs pa bzhin du rtog par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: log pa ni de ma yin pa las log pas dngos po mtshungs pa bzhin du rtog par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The opposite is the opposite of that which is not it. It is conceived as similar to a thing.

original: gal te de dag nyid mtshungs pa'i ngo bor 'dod na de dag las gzhan du 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar du yang rung ngo //
analyzed: gal te de dag nyid mtshungs pa'i ngo bor 'dod na de dag las gzhan du 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar du yang rung ngo //
translated: If one maintains that they are the same in nature, it is also correct to add ‚Äúthey are different from that.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir dngos po'i ngo bo ni /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dngos po'i ngo bo ni /
translated: Because the nature of a thing

original: de nyid dang gzhan nyid dag gis brjod par bya ba ma yin pa de nyid kyi phyir //üîΩdngos po ma yin par bstan pa ni /üîΩde phyir mtshungs nyid spyi 'di la //
analyzed: de nyid dang gzhan nyid dag gis brjod par bya ba ma yin pa de nyid kyi phyir // dngos po ma yin par bstan pa ni / de phyir mtshungs nyid spyi 'di la //
translated: cannot be expressed as either the same as or different from itself,üîΩthe teaching that it is not a thing is ‚ÄúTherefore, this . . .‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The universal is not a thing.üîΩThe teaching that it is not the object of a single conception is ‚ÄúTherefore, this . . .‚Äù

original: rtog pa gcig gi rtogs par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rtog pa gcig gi rtogs par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The universal is not the object of a single conception.

original: de nyid dam gzhan nyid dag tu mngon sum gyi yul ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de nyid dam gzhan nyid dag tu mngon sum gyi yul ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not the object of direct perception, either as the same or as different.

original: dngos pos yod pa'i spyi ni 'bras bu'am cig shos kyang rung ba de ni cig shos ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos pos yod pa'i spyi ni 'bras bu'am cig shos kyang rung ba de ni cig shos ma yin te /
translated: The universal that exists as a real entity is either the effect or the other, but it is not the other,üîΩbecause it would follow, absurdly, that it is not a universal.

original: spyi ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ni de 'bras yin zhe na yang zhes bya ba'o //üîΩ'bras bu nyid yin na yang gsal ba bzhin du 'jig pa can du 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: spyi ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ni de 'bras yin zhe na yang zhes bya ba'o // 'bras bu nyid yin na yang gsal ba bzhin du 'jig pa can du 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
translated: The point is presented in the line ‚ÄúIf you say it is the effect. . . . ‚Äù

original: 'jig 'gyur de yang 'dod ma yin //
analyzed: 'jig 'gyur de yang 'dod ma yin //
translated: Even if it were the effect, it would be subject to destruction, just like the manifest. This is presented in the line ‚ÄúIt would be subject to destruction. ‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is unacceptable.

original: 'bras bu yang yin la rtag pa yang yin na 'gal ba ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: 'bras bu yang yin la rtag pa yang yin na 'gal ba ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: If it were both an effect and permanent, what contradiction would there be?

original: dngos po tsam dang ni bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dngos po tsam dang ni bya ba smos te /
translated: The word ‚Äúmere‚Äù refers to an entity.

original: dngos po nyi dam 'bras bu nyid kyang rung mi rtag pa nyid kyis khyab pa pa yin la /
analyzed: dngos po nyi dam 'bras bu nyid kyang rung mi rtag pa nyid kyis khyab pa pa yin la /
translated: The point is that an entity, or even an effect, is necessarily impermanent,

original: mi rtag pa dang 'gal bas khyab pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang 'gal bas khyab pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: and being permanent is necessarily incompatible with being impermanent.

original: 'bras bu nyid ma yin na yang //
analyzed: 'bras bu nyid ma yin na yang //
translated: Even if it were not an effect,

original: yod na thams cad la ltos min /üîΩzhes bya ba'i rigs pas gsal ba rnams dang 'brel pa can ma yin pa'i spyi ni /
analyzed: yod na thams cad la ltos min / zhes bya ba'i rigs pas gsal ba rnams dang 'brel pa can ma yin pa'i spyi ni /
translated: If it does exist, then it is not related to all things.üîΩThe argument that it is not related to all things is stated in the verse:üîΩ‚ÄúA universal that is not related to the particulars

original: nam mkha' lta bur 'gyur zhes bstan pa ni ma 'brel ba dang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: nam mkha' lta bur 'gyur zhes bstan pa ni ma 'brel ba dang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: would be like space.‚Äù

original: gsal ba rnams dang ngo //
analyzed: gsal ba rnams dang ngo //
translated: The universal is not related to the particulars.

original: dngos med ni rang bzhin med pa nyid de ri bong gi rva bzhin du 'bras bu ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos med ni rang bzhin med pa nyid de ri bong gi rva bzhin du 'bras bu ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: A nonentity is just the absence of intrinsic nature, like the horn of an ass, because it is not an effect.

original: 'khrul pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi rnam pa la don gyi bdag nyid du mngon par zhen pa las rtogs pa'i 'bras bu yin no zhe na zhes bya bas /
analyzed: 'khrul pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi rnam pa la don gyi bdag nyid du mngon par zhen pa las rtogs pa'i 'bras bu yin no zhe na zhes bya bas /
translated: ‚ÄúDelusion‚Äù is the effect of the understanding that arises from the manifest adherence to the nature of an object in one‚Äôs own mental image.

original: rnam rtog skye ba'i sa bon no //üîΩzhes zer ba'o //
analyzed: rnam rtog skye ba'i sa bon no // zhes zer ba'o //
translated: The seed of the arising of conceptual thought.

original: ba lang ngo ba lang ngo zhes sngar mthong ba ngo shes pa ni gsal ba la spyi sgrub pa ma yin nam snyam sems pa la ngo shes pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ba lang ngo ba lang ngo zhes sngar mthong ba ngo shes pa ni gsal ba la spyi sgrub pa ma yin nam snyam sems pa la ngo shes pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúRecognition‚Äù is the recognition of what was previously seen, such as ‚ÄúThis is a cow,‚Äù ‚ÄúThis is a cow.‚Äù

original: ma nges pa zhes bya ba ni nges pa med pa'o //
analyzed: ma nges pa zhes bya ba ni nges pa med pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIndeterminacy‚Äù is the absence of determination.

original: spyi rnams la gcig pa'i sgra'i rgyu mtshan sngar mthong ba ngo shes pa ni gsal ba rnams la yang khyad par can ma yin te /
analyzed: spyi rnams la gcig pa'i sgra'i rgyu mtshan sngar mthong ba ngo shes pa ni gsal ba rnams la yang khyad par can ma yin te /
translated: The reason for the word ‚Äúone‚Äù in the general is the recognition of what was seen before, and this is not different in the case of the particulars.

original: ngo bo @33b gzhan ma mthong ba la sogs pa'i khyad par yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo @33b gzhan ma mthong ba la sogs pa'i khyad par yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the difference is in not seeing another nature, etc.üîΩIf there is no object,

original: yul med na ni blo rnams kyi //
analyzed: yul med na ni blo rnams kyi //
translated: there is no arising of the cognitions.

original: skye ba med ces zer ba ni spyi ni rtogs pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skye ba med ces zer ba ni spyi ni rtogs pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is said. The general is the realization.

original: thams cad mtshungs so zhes bya ba ni gsal ba rnams la yang brtags pa'i spyi ni mngon sum gyis rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: thams cad mtshungs so zhes bya ba ni gsal ba rnams la yang brtags pa'i spyi ni mngon sum gyis rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúAll are the same‚Äù means that even in the case of the particulars, the imagined general is not realized by perception.

original: brda dang mtshungs pa'i yul nyid ni bzlog pa dang 'gal ba can yin te /
analyzed: brda dang mtshungs pa'i yul nyid ni bzlog pa dang 'gal ba can yin te /
translated: The object that is similar to the sign is contradictory to the opposite.

original: dngos po'i yul nyid la 'gal bas khyab pa yin par bstan te /
analyzed: dngos po'i yul nyid la 'gal bas khyab pa yin par bstan te /
translated: It is taught that the pervasion is by contradiction to the object that is a thing.

original: 'di brda la ma ltos par rtogs pa ma yin gyi 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'di brda la ma ltos par rtogs pa ma yin gyi 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: This is not realized without depending on the sign. What then?

original: de la ltos pa yin no //
analyzed: de la ltos pa yin no //
translated: It is dependent on that.

original: 'dis ni yul gang la brda yin pa'i yul de la de'i shes pa yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni yul gang la brda yin pa'i yul de la de'i shes pa yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: This teaches that the object of the cognition is that object in regard to which there is the sign.

original: dngos po'i yul can nyid ni brda med pa dang mtshungs pa ma yin pa'i yul can ma yin pa nyid kyis khyab pa ni /
analyzed: dngos po'i yul can nyid ni brda med pa dang mtshungs pa ma yin pa'i yul can ma yin pa nyid kyis khyab pa ni /
translated: The pervasion is: that which has a real object is not a subject that is not similar to a conventional symbol.üîΩThe pervasion is: that which has an object that is similar to a conventional symbol is contradictory to that which is not.

original: brda dang mtshungs pa'i yul nyid la 'gal ba khyab pa yin no zhes bstan pa ni dngos po'i stobs kyis skyes pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: brda dang mtshungs pa'i yul nyid la 'gal ba khyab pa yin no zhes bstan pa ni dngos po'i stobs kyis skyes pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúarisen from the power of real entities‚Äù teaches this.

original: sgro 'dogs pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni yul la'o //
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni yul la'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúsuperimposition‚Äù refers to the object.

original: gal te spyi'i shes pa brda la ltos pa yin zhes ci las shes snyam du sems pa la brda med par zhes bya ba ste /üîΩdang po bsring ngo zhes bya ba bzhin du goo zhes bya ba'i brda yin na /
analyzed: gal te spyi'i shes pa brda la ltos pa yin zhes ci las shes snyam du sems pa la brda med par zhes bya ba ste / dang po bsring ngo zhes bya ba bzhin du goo zhes bya ba'i brda yin na /
translated: If you wonder, ‚ÄúHow do you know that a cognition of a universal depends on a conventional symbol?‚ÄùüîΩThe phrase ‚Äúwithout a conventional symbol‚Äù is stated.üîΩIf the conventional symbol for ‚Äúcow‚Äù is ‚Äúgo,‚Äù then the meaning is that this is what is expressed by the word ‚Äúgo.‚Äù

original: 'di ni go'i sgras brjod par bya ba yin zhes bya ba'i don yin pa'i phyir brda med na gar yang sgra rjod byed ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩgsal ba gzhan mthong ba las zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di ni go'i sgras brjod par bya ba yin zhes bya ba'i don yin pa'i phyir brda med na gar yang sgra rjod byed ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to // gsal ba gzhan mthong ba las zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Therefore, without a conventional symbol, there is no meaning that is expressed by a word.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúfrom seeing another instance‚Äù means

original: mthong ba'i gsal ba gzhan la de nyid do //
analyzed: mthong ba'i gsal ba gzhan la de nyid do //
translated: that it is the same as seeing another instance.

original: zhes gsal ba gzhan mthong ba'o //
analyzed: zhes gsal ba gzhan mthong ba'o //
translated: This is the other clear example.üîΩJust as the universal, such as cowness, is to be understood through the knowledge of the sign, the convention, etc.,

original: ji ltar ba lang nyid la sogs pa rigs ni rtags dang brda la sogs pa'i shes pas rtogs par bya ba de bzhin du skye ba gnyis pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang zhes bya ba bstan pa ni de bzhin du gsal byed la sogs pa'i zhes
analyzed: ji ltar ba lang nyid la sogs pa rigs ni rtags dang brda la sogs pa'i shes pas rtogs par bya ba de bzhin du skye ba gnyis pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang zhes bya ba bstan pa ni de bzhin du gsal byed la sogs pa'i zhes
translated: so also the second moment, etc., are to be understood through the knowledge of the second moment, etc.

original: bya ba'o // nges pa'i bdag nyid kyi mngon sum la nges par byed pa po'i nye bar bstan pa don med par bstan pa ni /üîΩmngon sum gyis ni gzung zhe na //
analyzed: bya ba'o // nges pa'i bdag nyid kyi mngon sum la nges par byed pa po'i nye bar bstan pa don med par bstan pa ni / mngon sum gyis ni gzung zhe na //
translated: The statement that the demonstration of the ascertainment of the nature of perception is pointless is:

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is said that it is apprehended by perception,

original: nges pa'i bdag nyid la yang nye bar bstan pa 'thad pa ma yin pas don med pa can nyid yin te /
analyzed: nges pa'i bdag nyid la yang nye bar bstan pa 'thad pa ma yin pas don med pa can nyid yin te /
translated: The demonstration is not tenable with regard to the ascertainment of the nature of perception, and so it is pointless.

original: rang nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rang nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: Because it does not exist in itself, as is taught:

original: mngon sum gyis ni ma bzung ba'ang //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis ni ma bzung ba'ang // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Even if it is not apprehended by perception,

original: brda ma bzung ba yang be'u ma tshol ba dang ma he la sogs pa'i tshogs mang po yongs su 'dor nas /
analyzed: brda ma bzung ba yang be'u ma tshol ba dang ma he la sogs pa'i tshogs mang po yongs su 'dor nas /
translated: Even if the convention is not apprehended, one would not seek the calf and would abandon the herd of buffaloes, etc.

original: rang @34a * //
analyzed: rang @34a * //
translated: The sense faculties do not apprehend the universal by way of the reasoning that goes ‚Äúit goes to the collection of cows.‚Äù

original: gi spyis ba lang gi tshogs dang nye bar 'gro'o zhes bya ba'i rigs pas dbang pos lhag par rtogs pa ma yin no snyam du sems pa ni ji ste yang dngos po zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gi spyis ba lang gi tshogs dang nye bar 'gro'o zhes bya ba'i rigs pas dbang pos lhag par rtogs pa ma yin no snyam du sems pa ni ji ste yang dngos po zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If you think that, then:

original: de ni de ltar ma rtogs phyir //
analyzed: de ni de ltar ma rtogs phyir //
translated: Because it is not apprehended in that way,

original: zhes bya ba ni brda med na'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni brda med na'o //
translated: if there is no convention.üîΩThe universal of cow,

original: ba lang nyid ni zhes bya ba ni brda med pa'o//
analyzed: ba lang nyid ni zhes bya ba ni brda med pa'o//
translated: if there is no convention.

original: gzhan gyi zhes bya ba ni rje rigs la sogs pas so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi zhes bya ba ni rje rigs la sogs pas so //
translated: Another,

original: gsal ba ni mngon par gsal ba ste de kho na nyid kyi ngo ba'o //
analyzed: gsal ba ni mngon par gsal ba ste de kho na nyid kyi ngo ba'o //
translated: the manifestation, the nature of reality.

original: ba khra mo la sogs pa'i gsal ba rnams mtha' yas pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: ba khra mo la sogs pa'i gsal ba rnams mtha' yas pa ma yin nam /
translated: Aren‚Äôt the manifestations of the cow, etc. infinite?

original: rigs gcig med na gcig gi sgra nges par sbyor ro //
analyzed: rigs gcig med na gcig gi sgra nges par sbyor ro //
translated: If there is no single universal, the word ‚Äúone‚Äù is applied.

original: dbye ba rnams ni /
analyzed: dbye ba rnams ni /
translated: The divisions

original: mtha' yas phyir na 'khrul pa nyid //
analyzed: mtha' yas phyir na 'khrul pa nyid //
translated: are infinite, therefore they are mistaken.

original: ces bya ba'i rigs pas zer ba ni mtha' yas gsal ldan zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba'i rigs pas zer ba ni mtha' yas gsal ldan zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The reasoning that goes ‚Äúbecause they are infinite‚Äù is stated in the line ‚Äúhaving infinite manifestations.‚Äù

original: 'on te brda ma bzung yang gsal byed la sogs pa rnams la de nyid 'di'o zhes rjes su 'brel bas brdar byed pa ni /
analyzed: 'on te brda ma bzung yang gsal byed la sogs pa rnams la de nyid 'di'o zhes rjes su 'brel bas brdar byed pa ni /
translated: But even if the sign is not apprehended, the signifier is related to the signified by the statement ‚Äúthis is that‚Äù with respect to the consonants and so on.

original: ba lang nyid la yang mtshungs par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: ba lang nyid la yang mtshungs par bstan pa ni /
translated: The statement that this is similar for the nature of an ox is

original: ngo shes pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ngo shes pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the so-called recognition.

original: nga ro rtsub pa la sogs pa ni sgra dang ldan pa nyid la sogs pa'o /üîΩgal te rta ngag pa la sogs pa las /
analyzed: nga ro rtsub pa la sogs pa ni sgra dang ldan pa nyid la sogs pa'o / gal te rta ngag pa la sogs pa las /
translated: The rough sound and so on is the possession of sound and so on.

original: ba khra mo la sogs pa la ngo bo gcig med na /
analyzed: ba khra mo la sogs pa la ngo bo gcig med na /
translated: If the nature of a cow and so on is not one,

original: dbye ba med par 'di kho na de'i zhes gcig tu 'dzin pa sgra med par ji ltar skyed par byed snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: dbye ba med par 'di kho na de'i zhes gcig tu 'dzin pa sgra med par ji ltar skyed par byed snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: then how could the signifier be generated without sound, such as in the case of a mute, by apprehending it as one, thinking ‚Äúthis is just that‚Äù without differentiation?

original: ji ltar rigs med shes pa'i zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ji ltar rigs med shes pa'i zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The response to the thought that this is so is stated in the line ‚Äújust as the cognition of a nonentity.‚Äù

original: ji ltar ba khra mo la sogs pa rnams la rgyu mtshan med kyang ba lang nyid yin gyi rta ngag pa la sogs pa rnams la ni ma yin pa de bzhin du mthong ba las de la de ltar 'dzin pa yang de lta bu'i ngo bo'i shes paüîΩmig la sogs pa rnams kho na la yin gyi /
analyzed: ji ltar ba khra mo la sogs pa rnams la rgyu mtshan med kyang ba lang nyid yin gyi rta ngag pa la sogs pa rnams la ni ma yin pa de bzhin du mthong ba las de la de ltar 'dzin pa yang de lta bu'i ngo bo'i shes pa mig la sogs pa rnams kho na la yin gyi /
translated: Just as a cow is a cow for someone who sees a cow, but not for someone who sees a horse, in the same way, the cognition of that object is a cognition of that nature for someone who sees that object,

original: rna ba la sogs pa rnams la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rna ba la sogs pa rnams la ni ma yin te /
translated: but not for someone who hears it, smells it, tastes it, or touches it.üîΩIt is not that the cognition of that object is a cognition of that nature for someone who hears it, smells it, tastes it, or touches it.

original: rgyu mtshan gzhan med kyang rang bzhin gyi yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan gzhan med kyang rang bzhin gyi yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Even though there is no other reason, it is due to their natures.

original: blo gcig tu 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'di gcig bya ba yin blo yang yin pa'o //
analyzed: blo gcig tu 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'di gcig bya ba yin blo yang yin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúA single cognition‚Äù means that it is a single action and a single cognition.

original: mtshungs pa'i rnam pa nyid ces bya ba ni gzhal bya'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: mtshungs pa'i rnam pa nyid ces bya ba ni gzhal bya'i ngo bo'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving the same aspect‚Äù means having the nature of the object of cognition.

original: blo skyed pa nyid ces bya ba ni de'i rnam pa'i blo skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: blo skyed pa nyid ces bya ba ni de'i rnam pa'i blo skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúCausing the arising of cognition‚Äù means causing the arising of a cognition that has that aspect.

original: tha dad pa'i bdag nyid kyi blo skyed pa 'gog par mi byed pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: tha dad pa'i bdag nyid kyi blo skyed pa 'gog par mi byed pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt it the case that the arising of a cognition with a different nature is not refuted?

original: 'on kyang gcig tu snang ba nyid yin no zhes bdag smra'o snyam du sems pa la /üîΩrnam pa 'gas kyang ni mngon sum la sngon po bzhin du gcig tu snang ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang gcig tu snang ba nyid yin no zhes bdag smra'o snyam du sems pa la / rnam pa 'gas kyang ni mngon sum la sngon po bzhin du gcig tu snang ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: But I maintain that it is just one thing that appears.üîΩBut it does not appear as one in any way, like blue.

original: mig la sogs pa'i shes pas gzhan du mi 'thad @34b pas brtags pa yang yod pa kho na ma yin nam /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i shes pas gzhan du mi 'thad @34b pas brtags pa yang yod pa kho na ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it just the case that the cognition of a cow, etc. is imputed to the collection of form, etc. because it is not tenable that it is different from the cognition of form, etc.?

original: de bzhin du ba lang nyid kyang yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du ba lang nyid kyang yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: To demonstrate that the cognition of a cow, etc. is also like that, he says:

original: gal te zhes bya ba ste ba lang nyid la sogs pa'i blo bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa'i blo ni ba khra mo la sogs pa tsam las 'byung ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ste ba lang nyid la sogs pa'i blo bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa'i blo ni ba khra mo la sogs pa tsam las 'byung ba ni ma yin te /
translated: The cognition of form, etc. is not like the cognition of a cow, etc. because it does not arise from a mere variegated cow, etc.

original: mig la sogs pa med na med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa med na med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not tenable that it is different from the cognition of form, etc. because it does not exist without the eye, etc.

original: de'i gzugs bzhin du dbang po las 'das pa mthong ba po la de'i ngo bor snang bar 'gyur bar srid do snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: de'i gzugs bzhin du dbang po las 'das pa mthong ba po la de'i ngo bor snang bar 'gyur bar srid do snyam du sems pa la /
translated: It is possible that the seer would perceive the form of that, like its form, as transcending the senses.

original: gal te lta ba po'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te lta ba po'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: To this he says: If the seer, etc.

original: de bzhin du rigs ni dbang po las 'das pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du rigs ni dbang po las 'das pa ma yin te /
translated: In the same way, the elements are not beyond the senses.

original: khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not accepted.

original: khas len na ni don gyis go ba nyams par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: khas len na ni don gyis go ba nyams par bstan pa ni /
translated: If they are accepted, the implication of the meaning is lost.

original: rigs rnams ni ma yin zhes bya ba ni gzugs can nyid ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rigs rnams ni ma yin zhes bya ba ni gzugs can nyid ma yin pa'o //
translated: The elements are not, i.e., they are not material.

original: yan 'gar pa rnams ni gsal bya 'dzin pa dang bral ba rnams so //
analyzed: yan 'gar pa rnams ni gsal bya 'dzin pa dang bral ba rnams so //
translated: The Vai≈õe·π£ikas are those who hold the doctrine of the manifest and the unmanifest.

original: de dag 'dzin na de rnams kho na de lta bu'i shes pa skyed par byed pa'i phyir don gyis go ba nyams pa yin par bstan pa ni gsal ba 'dzin tshe na 'ang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de dag 'dzin na de rnams kho na de lta bu'i shes pa skyed par byed pa'i phyir don gyis go ba nyams pa yin par bstan pa ni gsal ba 'dzin tshe na 'ang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If they are grasped, the implication of the meaning is lost, because those very elements produce such a consciousness. The implication of the meaning is lost when the manifest is grasped.

original: lugs kyi ni dbye ba zhes bya ba ni gsum mo //
analyzed: lugs kyi ni dbye ba zhes bya ba ni gsum mo //
translated: The system is threefold.

original: bag chags kyi khyad par la mig tu smra ba'i 'dod pa bstan pa ni /
analyzed: bag chags kyi khyad par la mig tu smra ba'i 'dod pa bstan pa ni /
translated: The assertion of the eye, etc. as the special seeds is taught.

original: gang zhig 'bras bu ldog pas zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gang zhig 'bras bu ldog pas zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The one who asserts the result as the seed,

original: ldog pa las 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i rigs pas /
analyzed: ldog pa las 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i rigs pas /
translated: is established by the reasoning of the cessation.

original: gang gi phyir gsal ba rnams nyid la rnam pa 'gas gcig gi blor 'gyur ba dang / rang gi ngo bor snang ba yang rigs la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gsal ba rnams nyid la rnam pa 'gas gcig gi blor 'gyur ba dang / rang gi ngo bor snang ba yang rigs la ni ma yin no //
translated: Because in some way or other, the cognitions of the manifestations are not of the nature of the manifestation itself.

original: de'i phyir phyi'i don byed pa yin par lta zhog gi //
analyzed: de'i phyir phyi'i don byed pa yin par lta zhog gi //
translated: Therefore, let alone the external object being the cause,

original: rtog pa dang cig shos kyi ngo bo'i shes pa tsam gyi byed pa yang nus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtog pa dang cig shos kyi ngo bo'i shes pa tsam gyi byed pa yang nus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: even the mere cognition of the form of the manifestation and the other is not capable of being the cause.

original: nus pa nye bar brjod pa thams cad dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid nye bar brjod pa med par 'thob po zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: nus pa nye bar brjod pa thams cad dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid nye bar brjod pa med par 'thob po zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: The statement that the absence of the characteristic of being devoid of all expression of capability is obtained without expression is:

original: shes pa tsam gyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: shes pa tsam gyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äúmere cognition‚Äù

original: rang bzhin med pa zhes bya bya yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa zhes bya bya yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is without intrinsic nature.

original: shes pa tsam gyi don byed par yang mi pa yin gyi gzhan gyi ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: shes pa tsam gyi don byed par yang mi pa yin gyi gzhan gyi ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: The statement that the object of mere cognition is not capable of causal efficiency, but not the other is:

original: gang dang gang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gang dang gang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚Äúwhatever‚Äù

original: de dngos po med pa yin te /
analyzed: de dngos po med pa yin te /
translated: because it is a non-entity.

original: brjod bya nyid dang gzhan nyid dag tu brjod bya yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brjod bya nyid dang gzhan nyid dag tu brjod bya yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is expressed as the expressed and as other than the expressed.

original: shes pa tsam gyi don byed par yang mi rung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji skad du bstan pa'i spyi'i mtshan nyin yin la /üîΩde las bzlog pa rang gi ngo bor snang ba'i brjod bya nyid ni brjod bya ma yin pa nyid @35a * //
analyzed: shes pa tsam gyi don byed par yang mi rung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji skad du bstan pa'i spyi'i mtshan nyin yin la / de las bzlog pa rang gi ngo bor snang ba'i brjod bya nyid ni brjod bya ma yin pa nyid @35a * //
translated: and it is not suitable to be a meaning-generality because it is not suitable to be a meaning-generality that performs a function of mere consciousness.üîΩThe opposite of that is the expressed meaning that appears as its own entity, which has the characteristic of being the expressed meaning that is not an expressed meaning.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can rang gi mtshan nyid yin par bstan pa ni /üîΩji skad bshad las bzlog gang yin //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can rang gi mtshan nyid yin par bstan pa ni / ji skad bshad las bzlog gang yin //
translated: The teaching that this is an individual characteristic is

original: zhes bya ba'o //üîΩrang gi ngo bo nyid la mtshan nyid ces bya bar ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o // rang gi ngo bo nyid la mtshan nyid ces bya bar ni mi rigs te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe opposite of what was just explained.‚Äù

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid la rang gi ngo bo med pas khyab par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid la rang gi ngo bo med pas khyab par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: It is not logical for the individual entity itself to be a characteristic because a universal characteristic does not pervade that which lacks an individual entity.

original: gang zhig rang gi gsal ba rnams la khyab par mi byed pa de ni mtshan nyid ma yin par 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: gang zhig rang gi gsal ba rnams la khyab par mi byed pa de ni mtshan nyid ma yin par 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: One might think, ‚ÄúThat which does not pervade its own instances is not a characteristic.‚Äù

original: 'o na ji ltar zhes bya pa'o //
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar zhes bya pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWell then, what is it?‚Äù

original: yang na gsal ba ma khyab pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni spyi ni khyad par la khyab par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na gsal ba ma khyab pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni spyi ni khyad par la khyab par byed pa yin te /
translated: because the universal is that which pervades the particular,

original: mtshungs pa rnams kyi dngos po ni spyi yin no zhes bya ba'i nges pa'i tshig las so //
analyzed: mtshungs pa rnams kyi dngos po ni spyi yin no zhes bya ba'i nges pa'i tshig las so //
translated: as the etymological explanation of ‚Äúuniversal‚Äù (sƒÅmƒÅnya) as ‚Äúthat which is common to many things‚Äù (sƒÅmƒÅnyam bhƒÅvƒÅnƒÅm) shows.

original: dngos po med par smra ba la ni de med pa'i phyir spyi ni rnam par rtog pa'i bya ba yin no //
analyzed: dngos po med par smra ba la ni de med pa'i phyir spyi ni rnam par rtog pa'i bya ba yin no //
translated: But for the nihilists, the universal is a conceptual activity, because it does not exist.

original: de yang dngos po la brten pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang dngos po la brten pa yin te /
translated: And that is based on things,

original: rjes su dpag pa nges pa'i tshul gsum pa'i rtags yod na yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa nges pa'i tshul gsum pa'i rtags yod na yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because inference is a means of valid cognition when the trimodal conditions are present.

original: ma grub pa dang 'gal ba las byung ba ni dngos po med pa la ba rten pa yin te 'brel ba med pa las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma grub pa dang 'gal ba las byung ba ni dngos po med pa la ba rten pa yin te 'brel ba med pa las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The nonestablished and the contradictory arise from nonthings, because they arise from a lack of relation.

original: ma nges pa yin pas gnyi ga la brten pa yin te /
analyzed: ma nges pa yin pas gnyi ga la brten pa yin te /
translated: The uncertain arises from both,üîΩbecause it is not ascertained as one or the other.

original: gcig tu yang nges pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni spyi de yang rnam pa gsum zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gcig tu yang nges pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni spyi de yang rnam pa gsum zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is taught by ‚ÄúThat universal is also threefold.‚Äù

original: 'grel par bshad pa ni gsal ba kho na'o //
analyzed: 'grel par bshad pa ni gsal ba kho na'o //
translated: The commentary explains it clearly.

original: dngos po dang / dngos po med las zhes bya ba ni grub pa dang bde ba tha dad pa nyid kyi snang ba tha dad pa'i ming can nyid kyis so //
analyzed: dngos po dang / dngos po med las zhes bya ba ni grub pa dang bde ba tha dad pa nyid kyi snang ba tha dad pa'i ming can nyid kyis so //
translated: The phrase from entity and non-entity refers to the appearance of the difference of the established and the non-established, which is the name of the difference.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa nye bar len pa zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa la sgrub byed du rung ba nyid kyi mi dmigs pa dag bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa nye bar len pa zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa la sgrub byed du rung ba nyid kyi mi dmigs pa dag bstan pa yin no //
translated: The phrase the appropriation of entity and non-entity indicates the non-apprehension of the suitability of the proof in the probandum.

original: gnyi ga la brten phyir zhes bya ba snang ba dmigs pa la ltos pa yin par bstan pa ni gnyi ga'i nye bar len pa'i khyad par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga la brten phyir zhes bya ba snang ba dmigs pa la ltos pa yin par bstan pa ni gnyi ga'i nye bar len pa'i khyad par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase because of the dependence on both indicates the dependence on the apprehension of the appearance. The phrase the difference in the appropriation of both indicates that.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis dngos po la brten pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis dngos po la brten pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not based on an entity by way of its own nature,üîΩbecause it does not appear. If it were to appear, then it would follow that it would be a general entity.

original: mi snang ba'i phyir la snang bzhin pa la ni 'gyur ba de lta na spyi'i dngos por thal bar 'gyur ba ma yin na ma zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: mi snang ba'i phyir la snang bzhin pa la ni 'gyur ba de lta na spyi'i dngos por thal bar 'gyur ba ma yin na ma zhes zer ba ni /
translated: If you say, No, then the following verse is addressed to you:

original: gal te dngos rten dngos 'brel phyir //üîΩzhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gal te dngos rten dngos 'brel phyir //üîΩzhes bya ba ste /
translated: If it is not based on an entity,üîΩhow can it be based on non-entity?

original: dngos po la 'gyur gyi med pa dngos po ma yin pa spyi la ni mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: dngos po la 'gyur gyi med pa dngos po ma yin pa spyi la ni mi 'gyur te /
translated: But it is not so for a universal, which is not a real entity.

original: dngos po kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dngos po kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is only a real entity that is a cause.

original: dngos po 'dzin pa nyid kyi phyir dngos po'i 'bras bu yang yin no zhes zer ba ni dngos 'brel phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po 'dzin pa nyid kyi phyir dngos po'i 'bras bu yang yin no zhes zer ba ni dngos 'brel phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: And because it is the cause of the apprehension of a real entity, it is also the result of a real entity. This is the meaning of the phrase ‚Äúbecause of the connection with a real entity.‚ÄùüîΩThe reply is:

original: lan ni / rnam pa 'gas kyang @35b rnam shes la //üîΩde dngos snang ba med phyir ro //
analyzed: lan ni / rnam pa 'gas kyang @35b rnam shes la // de dngos snang ba med phyir ro //
translated: Because the form of an object does not appear in consciousness in any way,üîΩand because of that, it is not tenable that consciousness is the experience of objects.üîΩThe reply is:üîΩBecause of that, it is not tenable that consciousness is the experience of objects.üîΩThe reply is:üîΩBecause the form of an object does not appear in consciousness in any way,

original: zhes bya ba dang / de'i phyir de ni shes tsam gyis //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / de'i phyir de ni shes tsam gyis //
translated: and because of that, it is not tenable that consciousness is the experience of objects.üîΩThe reply is:üîΩBecause of that, it is not tenable that consciousness is the experience of objects.üîΩThe reply is:

original: don byed par yang mi rung nyid //
analyzed: don byed par yang mi rung nyid //
translated: Because the form of an object does not appear in consciousness in any way,üîΩand because of that, it is not tenable that consciousness is the experience of objects.üîΩThe reply is:üîΩBecause of that, it is not tenable that consciousness is the experience of objects.

original: ces bya bas lan rgyas par btab pa yin no //
analyzed: ces bya bas lan rgyas par btab pa yin no //
translated: The reply is:üîΩBecause the form of an object does not appear in consciousness in any way,üîΩand because of that, it is not tenable that consciousness is the experience of objects.üîΩThe reply is:

original: byung bar gyur pa dang 'byung bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba de'i shes pa spyi la ma dmigs par snang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: byung bar gyur pa dang 'byung bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba de'i shes pa spyi la ma dmigs par snang ba'i phyir /
translated: Because of that, it is not tenable that consciousness is the experience of objects.üîΩThe reply is:üîΩBecause the form of an object does not appear in consciousness in any way,üîΩand because of that, it is not tenable that consciousness is the experience of objects.üîΩThe reply is:üîΩBecause of that, it is not tenable that consciousness is the experience of objects.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa ni spyi ma yin par bstan pa ni mthong phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa ni spyi ma yin par bstan pa ni mthong phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The reply is:üîΩBecause the form of an object does not appear in consciousness in any way,üîΩand because of that, it is not tenable that consciousness is the experience of objects.üîΩThe reply is:üîΩBecause of that, it is not tenable that consciousness is the experience of objects.üîΩThe reply is:

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni spyi med kyang ngo //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni spyi med kyang ngo //
translated: Because the form of an object does not appear in consciousness in any way,üîΩand because of that, it is not tenable that consciousness is the experience of objects.üîΩThe reply is:üîΩBecause of that, it is not tenable that consciousness is the experience

original: shes pa dngos po la brten pa zhes bya ba 'grel pa ni /
analyzed: shes pa dngos po la brten pa zhes bya ba 'grel pa ni /
translated: The Commentary says:

original: gal te dngos rten dngos 'brel phyir //üîΩzhes bya ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyi dngos po khas blangs nas bkod pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te dngos rten dngos 'brel phyir // zhes bya ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyi dngos po khas blangs nas bkod pa yin no //
translated: If you accept that the object is a real entity,üîΩthen you have set forth the position that consciousness is based on a real entity, because it is related to a real entity.

original: gal te shes pa de spyi la yin nam zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni spyi yod par ro //
analyzed: gal te shes pa de spyi la yin nam zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni spyi yod par ro //
translated: If you say that consciousness is of a universal, etc.

original: bzlog pa la zhes bya ba ni spyi med pa la'o //
analyzed: bzlog pa la zhes bya ba ni spyi med pa la'o //
translated: The opposite is the absence of a universal.

original: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po 'dzin pa'i spyi'i shes pa dngos po la brten pa ji ltar brjod ces zer ba ni /
analyzed: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po 'dzin pa'i spyi'i shes pa dngos po la brten pa ji ltar brjod ces zer ba ni /
translated: How can you say that a consciousness of a universal that apprehends a real entity that is characterized by a universal and an individual characteristic is based on a real entity?

original: gal te dngos chos nyid nyams na //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //üîΩbrgyud pas rang gi mtshan nyid kyi ngo bo dngos po la brten par bstan pa yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gal te dngos chos nyid nyams na // zhes bya ba'o // brgyud pas rang gi mtshan nyid kyi ngo bo dngos po la brten par bstan pa yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: If you say that the object is not a real entity,üîΩthen you have violated your own tenets.

original: dngos por 'dzin pa sdon 'gro can //
analyzed: dngos por 'dzin pa sdon 'gro can //
translated: The Commentary explains that it is taught that consciousness is based on a real entity by way of an indirect relationship.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It says:üîΩThe consciousness that apprehends a real entity that is characterized by a universal and an individual characteristic is based on a real entity.

original: lkog tu gyur pa zhes bya ba ni gtso bo la sogs pa bzhin du tshad ma'i yul ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa zhes bya ba ni gtso bo la sogs pa bzhin du tshad ma'i yul ma yin pa'o //
translated: The so-called ‚Äúnon-evident‚Äù is not the object of a means of valid knowledge, like the primal nature, etc.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kho na tshad ma'i yul yin pa'i phyir gzhal bya yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kho na tshad ma'i yul yin pa'i phyir gzhal bya yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The demonstration that the object of comprehension is only one‚Äôs own character, because only one‚Äôs own character is the object of a means of valid knowledge, is:

original: rang gi mtshan nyid gcig gzhal bya //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid gcig gzhal bya // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: One‚Äôs own character is the only object of comprehension.

original: dngos po la rang gi mtshan nyid snang ba'i mngon sum dang / spyi snang ba'i rjes su dpag pa ste shes pa gnyis ma yin nam /üîΩgzhal bya gnyis phyir tshad ma gnyis //
analyzed: dngos po la rang gi mtshan nyid snang ba'i mngon sum dang / spyi snang ba'i rjes su dpag pa ste shes pa gnyis ma yin nam / gzhal bya gnyis phyir tshad ma gnyis //
translated: Are not the two, direct perception and inference, the two cognitions, the one perceiving only one‚Äôs own character in a thing, the other perceiving a universal?

original: zhes bya ba yin na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba yin na /
translated: And is it not the case that there are two means of valid knowledge, because there are two objects of comprehension?

original: de ji ltar gcig nyid yin snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: de ji ltar gcig nyid yin snyam du sems pa la /
translated: How can it be that there is only one?

original: yod pa dang med pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is: ‚ÄúBecause of existence and non-existence.‚Äù

original: rjes su dpag pa la yang rang gi mtshan nyid kho na rnam par dpyod kyi spyi tsam ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa la yang rang gi mtshan nyid kho na rnam par dpyod kyi spyi tsam ni ma yin no //
translated: And in inference, too, it is only one‚Äôs own character that is investigated, not a mere universal.

original: ci las she na don bya de las zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid las te spyis mtshon bzhin pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid yin te /
analyzed: ci las she na don bya de las zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid las te spyis mtshon bzhin pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid yin te /
translated: What is the object? The object is the referent, which is the particular that is indicated by the universal.

original: de ltar yang snang ba'i dbye ba las /
analyzed: de ltar yang snang ba'i dbye ba las /
translated: Thus, the Analysis of Apparent Difference says:

original: gzhal bya gnyis zhes bstan to //
analyzed: gzhal bya gnyis zhes bstan to //
translated: The two kinds of objects of comprehension are taught.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kho na yod pa'am med pa nyid du rjes su dpag pas dpyod pa yin te /üîΩrnam par dpyod par byed pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kho na yod pa'am med pa nyid du rjes su dpag pas dpyod pa yin te / rnam par dpyod par byed pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir //
translated: It is an inference that analyzes whether the particular itself exists or does not exist.

original: 'dzin pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩrang gi mtshan nyid yod pa dang med @36a * //
analyzed: 'dzin pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to // rang gi mtshan nyid yod pa dang med @36a * //
translated: It is not a conception that apprehends, because it has the nature of analyzing.

original: pa'i don du tshad mas rnam par dpyod pa rtogs pa dang ldan pa'i bstan bcos yin par bstan pa ni 'grel pa ni don gyi bya ba byed pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: pa'i don du tshad mas rnam par dpyod pa rtogs pa dang ldan pa'i bstan bcos yin par bstan pa ni 'grel pa ni don gyi bya ba byed pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúit is not an apprehension‚Äù is that it is a treatise that has the realization that analyzes with valid knowledge whether the particular exists or does not exist. The commentary explains the meaning of ‚Äúit performs the function of an object‚Äù as follows.

original: gang gi phyir rang gi mtshan nyid kyi don du bstan bcos yin pa de'i phyir des rtogs par byed pa'i tshad ma gnyis kyang rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can du bstan par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rang gi mtshan nyid kyi don du bstan bcos yin pa de'i phyir des rtogs par byed pa'i tshad ma gnyis kyang rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can du bstan par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: Since the treatise is for the sake of intrinsic identity, therefore the two valid cognitions which cause its understanding are also taught as having objects with intrinsic identity.

original: des na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is indicated by ‚Äútherefore.‚Äù

original: mngon sum gyi dbang po las byung ba nyid ni rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi dbang po las byung ba nyid ni rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan ma yin te /
translated: The fact that it arises from a sense-faculty of direct perception is not a reason for distinguishing it from inference, etc.,

original: de med kyang rang rig pa la sogs pa mngon sum yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni ma yin te /üîΩdbang po skyed pa nyid ces bya'o //üîΩsgra las byung ba dang nye bar 'jal ba la sogs pa ni rjes su dpag pa las gzhan pa'i tshogs pa'i bskyed bya ni tshad ma ma yin te /
analyzed: de med kyang rang rig pa la sogs pa mngon sum yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni ma yin te / dbang po skyed pa nyid ces bya'o // sgra las byung ba dang nye bar 'jal ba la sogs pa ni rjes su dpag pa las gzhan pa'i tshogs pa'i bskyed bya ni tshad ma ma yin te /
translated: because even without that, such things as reflexive awareness are direct perception. This is indicated by ‚Äúnot being a sense-faculty.‚ÄùüîΩThe fact that it arises from a collection is not a reason for distinguishing it from inference, etc., because even without that, such things as verbal testimony and comparison are direct perception. This is indicated by ‚Äúnot being a collection.‚ÄùüîΩThe fact that it arises from a collection is not a reason for distinguishing it from inference, etc., because even without that, such things as verbal testimony and comparison are direct perception. original: de bzhin du don dang 'brel pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du don dang 'brel pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The fact that it arises from a collection is not a reason for distinguishing it from inference, etc., because even without that, such things as verbal testimony and comparison are direct perception.
