original: 'grub na yang rjes su dpag pa kho na yin no zhes bstan pa ni de'i phyir gzhal bya rnam pa gnyis zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'grub na yang rjes su dpag pa kho na yin no zhes bstan pa ni de'i phyir gzhal bya rnam pa gnyis zhes bya ba ste /
translated: If it were established, it would be inference alone.

original: snang bzhin pa'i rnam pa gnyis kho nas so //
analyzed: snang bzhin pa'i rnam pa gnyis kho nas so //
translated: The two kinds of objects of comprehension are just the two aspects that appear.

original: de lta yin dang ma khyab pa la sogs pa'i skyon yang med do //
analyzed: de lta yin dang ma khyab pa la sogs pa'i skyon yang med do //
translated: If that were so, there would be no fault of overextension, etc.

original: gal te rjes su dpag pa yang rang gi mtshan nyid kho na ston par byed pa ni gzhal bya rnam pa gnyis su mi 'gyur ba zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: gal te rjes su dpag pa yang rang gi mtshan nyid kho na ston par byed pa ni gzhal bya rnam pa gnyis su mi 'gyur ba zhes zer ba la /
translated: If it is said that inference also reveals only its own character, then the two kinds of objects of comprehension would not be established.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyi ste /
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyi ste /
translated: ‚Äú That‚Äù refers to its own character.

original: mngon sum dang cig shos kyi tshad ma'i bya ba'i dbye bas gcig nyid rnam pa gnyis su rnam par gzhag pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mngon sum dang cig shos kyi tshad ma'i bya ba'i dbye bas gcig nyid rnam pa gnyis su rnam par gzhag pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the one is posited as two by the division of the activity of direct perception and inference.

original: gal te gzhal bya ni tshad ma'i bya bas nye bar mtshon pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te gzhal bya ni tshad ma'i bya bas nye bar mtshon pa yin na /
translated: If the object of comprehension is characterized by the activity of valid knowledge,

original: gnyi ga la yang tha dad par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gnyi ga la yang tha dad par mi 'gyur te /
translated: then it would not be different in both cases.

original: 'on te de'i bya ba dang bcas pa yin na don dam pa ma yin la /
analyzed: 'on te de'i bya ba dang bcas pa yin na don dam pa ma yin la /
translated: But if it has that activity, it is not ultimate.

original: gzhan dang gzhan du nye bar bzhag pas gzhan dang gzhan yin pas mtha' yas par 'gyur ro zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan dang gzhan du nye bar bzhag pas gzhan dang gzhan yin pas mtha' yas par 'gyur ro zhes zer ba ni /
translated: Since it is posited as other and other, it is infinite because of being other and other.

original: gal te rtogs pa'i dbye bas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te rtogs pa'i dbye bas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is said that it is because of the differentiation of the realization,

original: de'i phyir 'di ni de'i rang dang gzhan gyi ngo bo dag gis zhes bya ba'i dbye ba'i mtshan nyid ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni de'i rang dang gzhan gyi ngo bo dag gis zhes bya ba'i dbye ba'i mtshan nyid ni mi rung ngo //
translated: then this is not the correct definition of the differentiation of its own and other natures.

original: ci las shen don dam zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ci las shen don dam zhes bya ba ste /
translated: What is it? The ultimate.

original: de dag gis nye bar mtshon pa ni gcig nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dag gis nye bar mtshon pa ni gcig nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is indicated by those as being one.

original: mtha' med pa nyid ni de nye bar gnas kyang de nyid kyi nang gi dbye ba las so zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: mtha' med pa nyid ni de nye bar gnas kyang de nyid kyi nang gi dbye ba las so zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: Even though it abides as that, it is taught that it is infinite because of the internal differentiation of that.

original: ltos pas byas pas zhes bya ba @36b ste /
analyzed: ltos pas byas pas zhes bya ba @36b ste /
translated: It is said that it is made by dependence.

original: nye bar dmigs pas so //
analyzed: nye bar dmigs pas so //
translated: It is observed as near.

original: don dam pa ni mngon sum du snang ba yin te /
analyzed: don dam pa ni mngon sum du snang ba yin te /
translated: The ultimate is the appearance of direct perception,

original: de las don byed par dmigs pa'i phyir 'dis ni de'i bya ba nye bar mtshon par brjod do //
analyzed: de las don byed par dmigs pa'i phyir 'dis ni de'i bya ba nye bar mtshon par brjod do //
translated: because it is observed to function. This indicates the activity of that.

original: rjes su dpag pa la ni de ltar mtshon pa ma yin la /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa la ni de ltar mtshon pa ma yin la /
translated: But inference is not like that.

original: mngon sum bya ba bcas par yang don dam dang kho na'o zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: mngon sum bya ba bcas par yang don dam dang kho na'o zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: And the direct perception of the object is also taught by the words ‚Äúultimately‚Äù and ‚Äúonly.‚Äù

original: yod pa yin zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe dmigs pas 'di bshad pa ni rang gi ngo bos zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yod pa yin zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe dmigs pas 'di bshad pa ni rang gi ngo bos zhes bya'o //
translated: ‚Äú Exists‚Äù means that when it is perceived, it is said to exist by way of its own nature.

original: gal te dmigs pas zhes bya bas ni yod pa yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'phen pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te dmigs pas zhes bya bas ni yod pa yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'phen pa yin no //
translated: ‚Äú Is perceived‚Äù implies ‚Äúexists,‚Äù etc.

original: gang gi tshe mi dmigs pa'i med pa yin la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe mi dmigs pa'i med pa yin la /
translated: When it is not perceived, it does not exist.

original: de las bzlog pas dmigs pa nyid ni yod pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de las bzlog pas dmigs pa nyid ni yod pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: The opposite of that is that when it is perceived, it exists, and not otherwise.

original: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa ma dmigs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa ma dmigs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is taught by the words ‚Äúthe nonperception of the rabbit‚Äôs horns, etc.‚Äù

original: dmigs par bya ba med par ji ltar mi dmigs pa nyid yin pa de bzhin du dmigs pa yang dmigs pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: dmigs par bya ba med par ji ltar mi dmigs pa nyid yin pa de bzhin du dmigs pa yang dmigs pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: Just as the nonexistence of the object of nonperception is nonperception, so the existence of the object of perception is perception.

original: dngos po med pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is taught by the words ‚Äúthe nonexistence of a thing.‚Äù

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa med pa ste /
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa med pa ste /
translated: ‚Äú That‚Äù refers to the nonexistence of the object of perception.

original: dmigs par bya ba bzhin du gzhan gyis rtogs par bya ba yin na'o //
analyzed: dmigs par bya ba bzhin du gzhan gyis rtogs par bya ba yin na'o //
translated: If it is to be understood by another, like the object of observation.

original: blo'i mi dmigs pa med par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir don gyis go bar nye bar 'jog pa yin na /
analyzed: blo'i mi dmigs pa med par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir don gyis go bar nye bar 'jog pa yin na /
translated: If it is posited as an object of understanding by the non-observation of awareness,

original: thug pa med par 'gyur la gang gi phyir gang kho na la nye bar gzhag pa ma byas pa de kho na la med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thug pa med par 'gyur la gang gi phyir gang kho na la nye bar gzhag pa ma byas pa de kho na la med par 'gyur ro //
translated: then there would be an infinite regress, because that which is not posited would not be observed.

original: de bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de bstan pa ni /
translated: The explanation of that is:

original: thug pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: thug pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Because there would be an infinite regress.

original: blo ma dmigs pas med pa yin na thug pa med par brjod do //
analyzed: blo ma dmigs pas med pa yin na thug pa med par brjod do //
translated: If non-existence is by the non-observation of awareness, then there would be an infinite regress.

original: dngos po dang dmigs pa dag gcig nyid yin na /
analyzed: dngos po dang dmigs pa dag gcig nyid yin na /
translated: If the object and the observation are the same,

original: mi dmigs pa dang dngos po ji lta mi 'gal bas dngos po yod pa de bzhin du dmigs pa la yang 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa dang dngos po ji lta mi 'gal bas dngos po yod pa de bzhin du dmigs pa la yang 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: then how could non-observation and existence not be contradictory? Therefore, just as the object exists, so too would the observation.üîΩThe explanation of that is:

original: de lta yin na zhes bya ba ste shes pa gcig la 'dre ba dmigs pa na de las gzhan pa dmigs pa med pa nges par byed pa yin te ma 'dres pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta yin na zhes bya ba ste shes pa gcig la 'dre ba dmigs pa na de las gzhan pa dmigs pa med pa nges par byed pa yin te ma 'dres pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were like that, then when one consciousness is observed to be mixed with another, it would definitely be ascertained that the other is not observed, because they are not mixed.

original: de'i phyir thug pa med pa dang / med pa rtogs pa zhes bya ba'i skyon yang med do zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir thug pa med pa dang / med pa rtogs pa zhes bya ba'i skyon yang med do zhes zer ba ni /
translated: Therefore, there is no fault of infinite regress or of the understanding of nonexistence.

original: 'on te gzhan dmigs pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te gzhan dmigs pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: Or, it is the very observation of something else.

original: 'di la lan btab zin zhes bya ba ni dngos po med par ni rtogs pa ma yin no zhes bya bas so //
analyzed: 'di la lan btab zin zhes bya ba ni dngos po med par ni rtogs pa ma yin no zhes bya bas so //
translated: The response to this is that it has already been explained that it is not the understanding of nonexistence.

original: gzhan dmigs pa nyid ni de las gzhan ba dmigs pa med par nges pa khongs su gtogs par byed pa 'di yang tshad ma ma yin par brjod de /
analyzed: gzhan dmigs pa nyid ni de las gzhan ba dmigs pa med par nges pa khongs su gtogs par byed pa 'di yang tshad ma ma yin par brjod de /
translated: We also say that the very observation of something else is not a valid cognition, because it is included in the ascertainment of the nonobservation of something else.

original: @37a * // gang gi phyir tshad ma can ma yin pa'i nges pa ni tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: @37a * // gang gi phyir tshad ma can ma yin pa'i nges pa ni tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: Because ascertainment that is not based on valid cognition is not valid cognition.

original: gzhan rtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid de las gzhan pa mi rtogs pa'i ngo bor rang rig pa yin pas /
analyzed: gzhan rtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid de las gzhan pa mi rtogs pa'i ngo bor rang rig pa yin pas /
translated: The very nature of the understanding of something else is the self-awareness of the nature of the nonunderstanding of something else.

original: thug pa med pa ma yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: thug pa med pa ma yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that there is an infinite regress.

original: gzhan dmigs pa de nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan dmigs pa de nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: This is the very observation of something else.

original: rang rig pa gzhan las dben pa de las mi dmigs pa gzhan dmigs pa med pa'i ngo bor mi 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rang rig pa gzhan las dben pa de las mi dmigs pa gzhan dmigs pa med pa'i ngo bor mi 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
translated: The following verse shows that self-awareness, being isolated from other, does not become the nature of non-apprehension of other, which is non-apprehension.

original: de lta na yang de med do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta na yang de med do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Even so, it does not exist.

original: gcig rig pa kho na gzhan rig par byed pa ma yin pa ni gzhan du mi dmigs pa yin gyi med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gcig rig pa kho na gzhan rig par byed pa ma yin pa ni gzhan du mi dmigs pa yin gyi med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that the awareness of one thing is the awareness of another, but rather that the other is not apprehended, not that it does not exist.

original: de lta yin na de dmigs pa kho na dngos po yin pa'i phyir de las gzhan pa dmigs pa dag kho na yod pa dang med pa dag go //üîΩde bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de lta yin na de dmigs pa kho na dngos po yin pa'i phyir de las gzhan pa dmigs pa dag kho na yod pa dang med pa dag go // de bstan pa ni /
translated: If that were so, then since the apprehension of that is a thing, the other, which is apprehended, would be both existent and non-existent.üîΩThis is shown in the following verse.

original: de lta na ni 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If that is so, then.

original: so sor nges pa'i ngo bo gzhal bya snga ma ma yin nam /
analyzed: so sor nges pa'i ngo bo gzhal bya snga ma ma yin nam /
translated: Is not the previous object of apprehension of a specific nature?

original: de la de'i dmigs pa gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la de'i dmigs pa gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Since the apprehension of that is another,üîΩhow can the apprehension exist?

original: ji ltar dmigs pa yod pa yin snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: ji ltar dmigs pa yod pa yin snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: If you think this,

original: gal te so sor nges pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te so sor nges pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: then it is said that it is a specific nature.

original: 'ga' la yang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'ga' la yang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: In any case,

original: rjes su dpag pa la de bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩdmigs par bya ba nyid kyi ngo bo rjes su dpag par bya ba nye ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa la de bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to // dmigs par bya ba nyid kyi ngo bo rjes su dpag par bya ba nye ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The meaning is that it is the same for inference.

original: mngon sum la mi snang bar ci las shes she na gal te 'gas kyang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mngon sum la mi snang bar ci las shes she na gal te 'gas kyang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: How do you know that the nature of the object of perception does not appear in perception because it is not present to be inferred?

original: dmigs par bya ba ma yin pa'i yul la rjes su dpag pa tshad ma ma yin pa yin te 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs par bya ba ma yin pa'i yul la rjes su dpag pa tshad ma ma yin pa yin te 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If no one has ever perceived it, then inference is not a valid means of knowledge with regard to an object that is not perceived, because there is no relation.

original: 'gas kyang zhes bya ba ni rang gis sam gzhan gyis ma dmigs pa'i ngo bo ste /
analyzed: 'gas kyang zhes bya ba ni rang gis sam gzhan gyis ma dmigs pa'i ngo bo ste /
translated: No one has ever perceived it means that no one has perceived its nature.

original: rjes su dpag pa la yang ma rtogs bzhin pa ni de ltar yin pa'i phyir dmigs par bya ba ma yin par mi rigs par zer ba ni /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa la yang ma rtogs bzhin pa ni de ltar yin pa'i phyir dmigs par bya ba ma yin par mi rigs par zer ba ni /
translated: If it is not perceived, then it is not reasonable to say that it is not an object of perception, because it is not understood by inference.

original: de'i tshe zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That is the meaning of ‚Äúat that time.‚Äù

original: de lta ma yin no zhes bya ba yang zhes bya ba ni dmigs par bya ba ma yin pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: de lta ma yin no zhes bya ba yang zhes bya ba ni dmigs par bya ba ma yin pa la yang ngo //
translated: If you say that it is not so, then it is not so with regard to what is not an object of perception.

original: dmigs pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because it is not an object of perception.

original: rang gi ngo bo dmigs pa med kyang ngo zhes bya ba ste snang ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo dmigs pa med kyang ngo zhes bya ba ste snang ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIts own nature is not perceived, but it is perceived as an appearance.‚Äù

original: phyis zhes bya ba ni thob pa'i dus su'o //
analyzed: phyis zhes bya ba ni thob pa'i dus su'o //
translated: ‚ÄúLater‚Äù means at the time of the attainment of the object.

original: sngar zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa 'jug pa'i dus su'o //
analyzed: sngar zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa 'jug pa'i dus su'o //
translated: ‚ÄúPreviously‚Äù means at the time of the operation of inference.

original: yod pa nyid ji ltar yin zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'i dus na'o //
analyzed: yod pa nyid ji ltar yin zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'i dus na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHow can it exist?‚Äù means at the time of inference.

original: phyis nyid ces bya ba ni thob pa'i dus su'o //
analyzed: phyis nyid ces bya ba ni thob pa'i dus su'o //
translated: ‚ÄúLater‚Äù means at the time of the attainment of the object.

original: dmigs par bya ba nyid du rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni tshad mas rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs par bya ba nyid du rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni tshad mas rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is understood as an object of perception‚Äù means that it is understood by a valid cognition.

original: @37b rjes su dpag pa'i dus su de ltar rtogs pa ni mi snang ba nyid du 'gyur ro zhes zer ba ni dmigs par bya ba nyid du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: @37b rjes su dpag pa'i dus su de ltar rtogs pa ni mi snang ba nyid du 'gyur ro zhes zer ba ni dmigs par bya ba nyid du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAt the time of inference, it would not be understood as non-appearing‚Äù means that it would not be understood as an object of perception.

original: gzhan gyi tshe yang zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'i dus su yang ngo //
analyzed: gzhan gyi tshe yang zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'i dus su yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúAt another time‚Äù means at the time of inference.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni dmigs bya ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni dmigs bya ma yin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúElsewhere‚Äù means not as an object of perception.

original: gzhan du rtogs zhes bya ba ni rtogs bzhin pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: gzhan du rtogs zhes bya ba ni rtogs bzhin pa nyid kyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúUnderstood elsewhere‚Äù means understood as being understood.

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i yod pa la zhes bya ba ni thob pa'i shes pas yul la yin gyi /
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i yod pa la zhes bya ba ni thob pa'i shes pas yul la yin gyi /
translated: ‚ÄúThe existence of what is to be‚Äù means that the object is known through attainment,

original: rjes su dpag pa'i dus su 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i dmigs bya ma yin pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i dus su 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i dmigs bya ma yin pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: but not at the time of inference.

original: dmigs par bya ba de nyid gzhan gyi ngo bos zhes bya ba ni sngar mthong ba'i ngo bos sam zhes pa'i rnam pa'i ngo bos so //
analyzed: dmigs par bya ba de nyid gzhan gyi ngo bos zhes bya ba ni sngar mthong ba'i ngo bos sam zhes pa'i rnam pa'i ngo bos so //
translated: ‚ÄúThat very object of perception is by the nature of another‚Äù means by the nature of the aspect that was previously seen.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid don dam pa yin du zin kyang rjes su dpag pa'i yul don dam pa ma yin par zer ba ni /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid don dam pa yin du zin kyang rjes su dpag pa'i yul don dam pa ma yin par zer ba ni /
translated: Even if the ultimate is the intrinsic identity, the object of inference is not the ultimate.

original: ltos pa byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ltos pa byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is because it is a dependent designation.

original: de ltar rjes su dpag pas sgro btags pa'i ngo bo ni dngos po ma yin pa des na gnyi ga'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir dngos po'i mtshan nyid 'dres par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar rjes su dpag pas sgro btags pa'i ngo bo ni dngos po ma yin pa des na gnyi ga'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir dngos po'i mtshan nyid 'dres par bstan pa ni /
translated: Thus, the nature that is imputed by inference is not a thing. Therefore, because there is no intrinsic reality of either, the defining characteristic of a thing is taught to be confused.

original: tshad ma gcig gis gnyi ga'i rang bzhin du zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: tshad ma gcig gis gnyi ga'i rang bzhin du zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúBy one valid cognition, both natures‚Äù means

original: spyi ni ltos pa can yin pa'i phyir dngos po ma yin no //
analyzed: spyi ni ltos pa can yin pa'i phyir dngos po ma yin no //
translated: The universal is not a real entity because it is dependent.

original: yang na zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyang don dam pa pa ma yin te /üîΩshes pas bstan pa nye bar mtshon pa'i sngon po la sogs pa ni bden pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang na zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyang don dam pa pa ma yin te / shes pas bstan pa nye bar mtshon pa'i sngon po la sogs pa ni bden pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Or else, the specific property also is not ultimate,üîΩthe meaning is that the blue, etc. which are indicated by the cognition, are real.

original: tshad ma nyid du zhes bya ba ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag go //
analyzed: tshad ma nyid du zhes bya ba ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag go //
translated: As a means of valid cognition means as direct perception and inference.

original: thob bya gang zhes bya ba ni gnyi ga yang ngo //
analyzed: thob bya gang zhes bya ba ni gnyi ga yang ngo //
translated: What is to be attained means both.

original: gal te gzhan gyi ngo bos de rtogs pa ji ltar yin /
analyzed: gal te gzhan gyi ngo bos de rtogs pa ji ltar yin /
translated: If it is understood by means of another nature, how is it?

original: gang gi phyir dkar po ni ser po nyid kyis rtogs pa ma yin no snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dkar po ni ser po nyid kyis rtogs pa ma yin no snyam du sems pa la /
translated: Because white is not understood by yellow.üîΩBecause there is no adherence to it as it is.

original: ji lta ba bzhin mngon zhen min pa'i phyir //üîΩzhes bya ba ste /üîΩ'khrul pas ni dkar po yang ser po nyid du rtogs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin mngon zhen min pa'i phyir // zhes bya ba ste / 'khrul pas ni dkar po yang ser po nyid du rtogs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because there is no adherence to it as it is.üîΩThe meaning is that by error, white is understood as yellow.

original: 'khrul pa yin yang dkar po nyid ser po zhes ci las shes she na /
analyzed: 'khrul pa yin yang dkar po nyid ser po zhes ci las shes she na /
translated: Even though there is error, how is it known that white is not yellow?

original: de ltar mngon par zhen pa kho nas so //
analyzed: de ltar mngon par zhen pa kho nas so //
translated: In this way, it is only by such manifest clingingüîΩthat one says, ‚ÄúThe object is non-existent and mistaken.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir med pa'i yul 'khrul pa nyid yin no zhes zer ba ni ma dpyad pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir med pa'i yul 'khrul pa nyid yin no zhes zer ba ni ma dpyad pa kho na'o //
translated: But this is only when there is no analysis.

original: rtogs nas zhes bya ba 'dis 'khrul pa nyid rjes su brjod nas tshad ma min zhes bya ba la sogs par sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rtogs nas zhes bya ba 'dis 'khrul pa nyid rjes su brjod nas tshad ma min zhes bya ba la sogs par sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving understood‚Äù this, he explains that it is mistaken and then proves that it is not a valid cognition.

original: gal te yang rang gi rnam pa mthong ba thob bya nyid du sgro 'dogs par byed la /üîΩthob bya ni mngon par @38a * //
analyzed: gal te yang rang gi rnam pa mthong ba thob bya nyid du sgro 'dogs par byed la / thob bya ni mngon par @38a * //
translated: If one superimposes the attainment of the obtained object,üîΩthen the obtained object is apprehended by the desire to manifest it.

original: 'dod pa'i bsam bas 'dzin pa ste bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'thob par byed cing mi slu bar byed pa ni tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i bsam bas 'dzin pa ste bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'thob par byed cing mi slu bar byed pa ni tshad ma yin te /
translated: That which attains it in accordance with the thought and functions without deception is a valid cognition,

original: mngon sum bzhin no zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: mngon sum bzhin no zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: just like direct perception.

original: bsam pa la ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bsam pa la ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is explained by ‚Äúin accordance with the thought.‚Äù

original: ji ltar bsam pa thob pa yin na /
analyzed: ji ltar bsam pa thob pa yin na /
translated: If it is asked how one attains what one thinks,

original: gzhan ni gzhan gyi rnam pas rtogs ba'am 'khrul pa nyid ji ltar yin zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan ni gzhan gyi rnam pas rtogs ba'am 'khrul pa nyid ji ltar yin zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: how is it that another is understood or mistaken by the aspect of another?

original: rnam pa gzhan gyis kyang rtogs pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan gyis kyang rtogs pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúAlso by another aspect, it is called ‚Äòrealization.‚Äô

original: rang gi rnam pa mthong nas sems la phyi rol du sgro 'dogs par mthong ba'i phyir 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: rang gi rnam pa mthong nas sems la phyi rol du sgro 'dogs par mthong ba'i phyir 'gal ba med do //
translated: Because, having seen its own aspect, it is seen as superimposing external objects on the mind, there is no contradiction.‚Äù

original: gal te bsam pa thob na thob par bya ba kho na snang ngo zhes ci'i phyir ma rtogs zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: gal te bsam pa thob na thob par bya ba kho na snang ngo zhes ci'i phyir ma rtogs zhes zer ba la /
translated: If one obtains the intention, then only what is to be obtained appears. Why is it not understood?

original: phyogs 'di la zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: phyogs 'di la zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIn this regard,‚Äù

original: ji bzhin mngon zhe na min pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas dngos por 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa bkag pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ji bzhin mngon zhe na min pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas dngos por 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa bkag pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: means that the conception of apprehending things as real is refuted by such passages as ‚Äúbecause it is not as it is manifestly desired.‚Äù

original: bsam pa ni rtogs pa ma yin nam ji ltar bsam pa thob pa ni mi slu ba yin la /
analyzed: bsam pa ni rtogs pa ma yin nam ji ltar bsam pa thob pa ni mi slu ba yin la /
translated: Isn‚Äôt the intention a realization? How is it that when the intention is obtained, it is nondeceptive?

original: de yod na ji bzhin ma yin pa'i don du mngon par zhen pa ji ltar yin snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: de yod na ji bzhin ma yin pa'i don du mngon par zhen pa ji ltar yin snyam du sems pa la /
translated: If it exists, how can there be adherence to a meaning that is not as it is?

original: gzhan du yang zhes bya ba nas rigs pa ma yin gyi zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: gzhan du yang zhes bya ba nas rigs pa ma yin gyi zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOtherwise,‚Äù up to ‚Äúit is not reasonable.‚Äù

original: lan ni 'di ni 'chad par byed pa rnams kyis rtogs pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: lan ni 'di ni 'chad par byed pa rnams kyis rtogs pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The answer is: this is understood only by the expounders.

original: de kho na nyid sems pa po ni snang ba'i dbye ba las shes pa'i snang ba dang phyi rol dag gi dbye ba mthong nas de ngag la gcig pa nyid du zhen pa ni ji bzhin ma yin pa'i don du mngon par zhen pa rig go zhes bya
analyzed: de kho na nyid sems pa po ni snang ba'i dbye ba las shes pa'i snang ba dang phyi rol dag gi dbye ba mthong nas de ngag la gcig pa nyid du zhen pa ni ji bzhin ma yin pa'i don du mngon par zhen pa rig go zhes bya
translated: The one who reflects on reality sees the difference in appearance, and having seen the difference between the appearance of consciousness and external things, he understands that the conception of their identity is the conception of a meaning that does not exist.

original: ba'i don to //
analyzed: ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: de la ltos nas phyi rol las gzhan pa rang gi rnam pa mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la ltos nas phyi rol las gzhan pa rang gi rnam pa mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: In that case, in dependence on that, because he sees his own image as different from the external thing,

original: ji ltar bsam pa de rtogs pa'i ngo bo zhes zer ba ni de nyid du zhes bya ba smos so //üîΩtha snyad byed pa po'i skye bo la ltos nas bsam pa la mi slu ba yin par bstan pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar bsam pa de rtogs pa'i ngo bo zhes zer ba ni de nyid du zhes bya ba smos so // tha snyad byed pa po'i skye bo la ltos nas bsam pa la mi slu ba yin par bstan pa ni ma yin te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúI see the form of the object of knowledge as it is.‚ÄùüîΩHe does not say this in terms of the person who uses conventions, but in terms of the one who reflects.

original: rnam par rtog pa rnams zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa rnams zhes bya ba ste /
translated: He is not teaching that the reflection is nondeceptive in terms of the one who reflects,üîΩbut rather in terms of the one who conceives of the reflection as an external thing.

original: de kho na nyid rig pa po la ltos nas 'khrul pa yin gyi cig shos la ni bsams pa la mi slu ba yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de kho na nyid rig pa po la ltos nas 'khrul pa yin gyi cig shos la ni bsams pa la mi slu ba yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In relation to the one who knows reality, it is error; in relation to the other, it is nondeceptive with respect to what is thought.

original: gnyis na zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa rtog pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gnyis na zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa rtog pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The second is inference, because it is conceptual.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i thob bya la reg pa can yin gyi mngon sum ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i thob bya la reg pa can yin gyi mngon sum ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not direct perception, because it is connected with the object to be attained in the future.

original: rang gi nus pa 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang gi nus pa 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it holds its own potentiality.üîΩThe third is direct perception, because it is nonconceptual.üîΩThe fourth is inference, because it is conceptual.üîΩThe fifth is scripture, because it is nondeceptive with respect to the object to be known.

original: rjes su dpag pas gsal bar ni //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //üîΩyul rung can gyis mi shes pa'i ste /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas gsal bar ni // zhes bya ba'o // yul rung can gyis mi shes pa'i ste /
translated: The sixth is analogy, because it is nondeceptive with respect to the object to be known.üîΩThe seventh is the attainment of the result, because it is nondeceptive with respect to the object to be known.üîΩThe eighth is the absence of conceptualization, because it is nondeceptive with respect to the object to be known.

original: mi gsal @38b ba'i rnam pa /
analyzed: mi gsal @38b ba'i rnam pa /
translated: The ninth is the absence of error, because it is nondeceptive with respect to the object to be known.üîΩThe tenth is the absence of conceptualization, because it is nondeceptive with respect to the object to be known.üîΩThe eleventh is the absence of error, because it is nondeceptive with respect to the object to be known.üîΩThe twelfth is the absence of conceptualization, because it is nondeceptive with respect to the object to be known.üîΩThe thirteenth is the absence of error, because it is nondeceptive with respect to the object to be known.üîΩThe fourteenth is the absence of conceptualization, because it is nondeceptive with respect to the object to be known.

original: rang gis shes phyir de shes yin //üîΩzhes bya ba'i rigs pas rang gi ngo bo nye bar gnas pa zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: rang gis shes phyir de shes yin // zhes bya ba'i rigs pas rang gi ngo bo nye bar gnas pa zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: The fifteenth is the absence of error, because it is nondeceptive with respect to the object to be known.üîΩThe sixteenth is the absence of conceptualization, because it is nondeceptive with respect to the object to be known.üîΩThe seventeenth is the absence of error, because it is nondeceptive with respect to the object to be known.üîΩThe eighteenth is the absence of conceptualization, because it is nondeceptive with respect to the object to be known.

original: nye bar gnas pa dang nye bar gnas pa ma yin pa gang la yod pa de'o //
analyzed: nye bar gnas pa dang nye bar gnas pa ma yin pa gang la yod pa de'o //
translated: The nineteenth is the absence of error, because it is nondeceptive with respect to the object to be known.

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa'i rtog pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa'i rtog pa med pa'o //
translated: The twentieth is the absence of conceptualization, because it is nondeceptive with respect to the object to be known.üîΩThe twenty-first is the absence of error, because it is nondeceptive with respect to the object to be known.

original: rnam par brtag pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam par brtag pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase arising from thorough analysis refers toüîΩthe fact that the Buddha's teachings are not given in a haphazard way.

original: snga ma dang phyi mar gyur pa'i dngos po rnams kyi rgyun gyi brtag bya ba'o //
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi mar gyur pa'i dngos po rnams kyi rgyun gyi brtag bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe occurrence of the conceptual differentiation of that‚Äù is the conceptual differentiation of the continuum of entities that have occurred previously and will occur subsequently.

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni mngon sum la'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni mngon sum la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOf that‚Äù refers to direct perception.

original: rgyun zhes bya ba ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rgyun skad cig ma gzhan la'o //
analyzed: rgyun zhes bya ba ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rgyun skad cig ma gzhan la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe continuum‚Äù is the occurrence of the continuum of moments that will occur.

original: de 'di mngon sum las 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rnam par rtog pa la rgyun dang de'i rigs la 'jug pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /üîΩ'gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de 'di mngon sum las 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rnam par rtog pa la rgyun dang de'i rigs la 'jug pa ma yin par bstan pa ni / 'gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In order to demonstrate that the conceptual differentiation that occurs from direct perception does not engage the continuum and its type, he says:üîΩ‚ÄúIf it were the case that the continuum of that . . .‚Äù

original: skad cig gang gzung ba de'i rgyun la mngon sum las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pas lhag par zhen par byed do //
analyzed: skad cig gang gzung ba de'i rgyun la mngon sum las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pas lhag par zhen par byed do //
translated: The conceptual differentiation that occurs from direct perception adheres to the continuum of that moment that is grasped.
